resource.name: Resource
resource.description: This is the base resource type for everything.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

resource.name: Account
resource.description: A financial tool for tracking value accrued for a particular purpose. In the healthcare field, used to track charges for a patient, cost centers, etc.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Unique identifier used to reference the account. Might or might not be intended for human use (e.g. credit card number).

property.name: status
property.description: Indicates whether the account is presently used/usable or not.

property.name: billingStatus
property.description: The BillingStatus tracks the lifecycle of the account through the billing process. It indicates how transactions are treated when they are allocated to the account.

property.name: type
property.description: Categorizes the account for reporting and searching purposes.

property.name: name
property.description: Name used for the account when displaying it to humans in reports, etc.

property.name: subject
property.description: Identifies the entity which incurs the expenses. While the immediate recipients of services or goods might be entities related to the subject, the expenses were ultimately incurred by the subject of the Account.

property.name: servicePeriod
property.description: The date range of services associated with this account.

property.name: coverage
property.description: The party(s) that are responsible for covering the payment of this account, and what order should they be applied to the account.

property.name: owner
property.description: Indicates the service area, hospital, department, etc. with responsibility for managing the Account.

property.name: description
property.description: Provides additional information about what the account tracks and how it is used.

property.name: guarantor
property.description: The parties responsible for balancing the account if other payment options fall short.

property.name: diagnosis
property.description: When using an account for billing a specific Encounter the set of diagnoses that are relevant for billing are stored here on the account where they are able to be sequenced appropriately prior to processing to produce claim(s).

property.name: procedure
property.description: When using an account for billing a specific Encounter the set of procedures that are relevant for billing are stored here on the account where they are able to be sequenced appropriately prior to processing to produce claim(s).

property.name: relatedAccount
property.description: Other associated accounts related to this account.

property.name: currency
property.description: The default currency for the account.

property.name: balance
property.description: The calculated account balances - these are calculated and processed by the finance system. The balances with a `term` that is not current are usually generated/updated by an invoicing or similar process.

property.name: calculatedAt
property.description: Time the balance amount was calculated.

element.name: Coverage
element.description: The party(s) that are responsible for covering the payment of this account, and what order should they be applied to the account.

property.name: coverage
property.description: The party(s) that contribute to payment (or part of) of the charges applied to this account (including self-pay). A coverage may only be responsible for specific types of charges, and the sequence of the coverages in the account could be important when processing billing.

property.name: priority
property.description: The priority of the coverage in the context of this account.

element.name: Guarantor
element.description: The parties responsible for balancing the account if other payment options fall short.

property.name: party
property.description: The entity who is responsible.

property.name: onHold
property.description: A guarantor may be placed on credit hold or otherwise have their role temporarily suspended.

property.name: period
property.description: The timeframe during which the guarantor accepts responsibility for the account.

element.name: Diagnosis
element.description: When using an account for billing a specific Encounter the set of diagnoses that are relevant for billing are stored here on the account where they are able to be sequenced appropriately prior to processing to produce claim(s).

property.name: sequence
property.description: Ranking of the diagnosis (for each type).

property.name: condition
property.description: The diagnosis relevant to the account.

property.name: dateOfDiagnosis
property.description: Ranking of the diagnosis (for each type).

property.name: type
property.description: Type that this diagnosis has relevant to the account (e.g. admission, billing, discharge ...).

property.name: onAdmission
property.description: Was the Diagnosis present on Admission in the related Encounter.

property.name: packageCode
property.description: The package code can be used to group diagnoses that may be priced or delivered as a single product. Such as DRGs.

element.name: Procedure
element.description: When using an account for billing a specific Encounter the set of procedures that are relevant for billing are stored here on the account where they are able to be sequenced appropriately prior to processing to produce claim(s).

property.name: sequence
property.description: Ranking of the procedure (for each type).

property.name: code
property.description: The procedure relevant to the account.

property.name: dateOfService
property.description: Date of the procedure when using a coded procedure. If using a reference to a procedure, then the date on the procedure should be used.

property.name: type
property.description: How this procedure value should be used in charging the account.

property.name: packageCode
property.description: The package code can be used to group procedures that may be priced or delivered as a single product. Such as DRGs.

property.name: device
property.description: Any devices that were associated with the procedure relevant to the account.

element.name: RelatedAccount
element.description: Other associated accounts related to this account.

property.name: relationship
property.description: Relationship of the associated Account.

property.name: account
property.description: Reference to an associated Account.

element.name: Balance
element.description: The calculated account balances - these are calculated and processed by the finance system. The balances with a `term` that is not current are usually generated/updated by an invoicing or similar process.

property.name: aggregate
property.description: Who is expected to pay this part of the balance.

property.name: term
property.description: The term of the account balances - The balance value is the amount that was outstanding for this age.

property.name: estimate
property.description: The amount is only an estimated value - this is likely common for `current` term balances, but not with known terms (that were generated by a backend process).

property.name: amount
property.description: The actual balance value calculated for the age defined in the term property.

resource.name: ActivityDefinition
resource.description: This resource allows for the definition of some activity to be performed, independent of a particular patient, practitioner, or other performance context.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this activity definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this activity definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the activity definition is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this activity definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the activity definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the activity definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. To provide a version consistent with the Decision Support Service specification, use the format Major.Minor.Revision (e.g. 1.0.0). For more information on versioning knowledge assets, refer to the Decision Support Service specification. Note that a version is required for non-experimental active assets.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the activity definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the activity definition.

property.name: subtitle
property.description: An explanatory or alternate title for the activity definition giving additional information about its content.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this activity definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this activity definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: subject
property.description: A code, group definition, or canonical reference that describes or identifies the intended subject of the activity being defined. Canonical references are allowed to support the definition of protocols for drug and substance quality specifications, and is allowed to reference a MedicinalProductDefinition, SubstanceDefinition, AdministrableProductDefinition, ManufacturedItemDefinition, or PackagedProductDefinition resource.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the activity definition was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the activity definition changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the activity definition.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the activity definition from a consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate activity definition instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the activity definition is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this activity definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: usage
property.description: A detailed description of how the activity definition is used from a clinical perspective.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the activity definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the activity definition.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: approvalDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

property.name: lastReviewDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.

property.name: effectivePeriod
property.description: The period during which the activity definition content was or is planned to be in active use.

property.name: topic
property.description: Descriptive topics related to the content of the activity. Topics provide a high-level categorization of the activity that can be useful for filtering and searching.

property.name: author
property.description: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.

property.name: editor
property.description: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.

property.name: reviewer
property.description: An individual or organization asserted by the publisher to be primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.

property.name: endorser
property.description: An individual or organization asserted by the publisher to be responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.

property.name: relatedArtifact
property.description: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.

property.name: library
property.description: A reference to a Library resource containing any formal logic used by the activity definition.

property.name: kind
property.description: A description of the kind of resource the activity definition is representing. For example, a MedicationRequest, a ServiceRequest, or a CommunicationRequest.

property.name: profile
property.description: A profile to which the target of the activity definition is expected to conform.

property.name: code
property.description: Detailed description of the type of activity; e.g. What lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.

property.name: intent
property.description: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the activity and where the request should fit into the workflow chain.

property.name: priority
property.description: Indicates how quickly the activity should be addressed with respect to other requests.

property.name: doNotPerform
property.description: Set this to true if the definition is to indicate that a particular activity should NOT be performed. If true, this element should be interpreted to reinforce a negative coding. For example NPO as a code with a doNotPerform of true would still indicate to NOT perform the action.

property.name: timing
property.description: The timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

property.name: asNeeded
property.description: If a CodeableConcept is present, it indicates the pre-condition for performing the service. For example "pain", "on flare-up", etc.

property.name: location
property.description: Identifies the facility where the activity will occur; e.g. home, hospital, specific clinic, etc.

property.name: participant
property.description: Indicates who should participate in performing the action described.

property.name: product
property.description: Identifies the food, drug or other product being consumed or supplied in the activity.

property.name: quantity
property.description: Identifies the quantity expected to be consumed at once (per dose, per meal, etc.).

property.name: dosage
property.description: Provides detailed dosage instructions in the same way that they are described for MedicationRequest resources.

property.name: bodySite
property.description: Indicates the sites on the subject's body where the procedure should be performed (I.e. the target sites).

property.name: specimenRequirement
property.description: Defines specimen requirements for the action to be performed, such as required specimens for a lab test.

property.name: observationRequirement
property.description: Defines observation requirements for the action to be performed, such as body weight or surface area.

property.name: observationResultRequirement
property.description: Defines the observations that are expected to be produced by the action.

property.name: transform
property.description: A reference to a StructureMap resource that defines a transform that can be executed to produce the intent resource using the ActivityDefinition instance as the input.

property.name: dynamicValue
property.description: Dynamic values that will be evaluated to produce values for elements of the resulting resource. For example, if the dosage of a medication must be computed based on the patient's weight, a dynamic value would be used to specify an expression that calculated the weight, and the path on the request resource that would contain the result.

element.name: Participant
element.description: Indicates who should participate in performing the action described.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of participant in the action.

property.name: typeCanonical
property.description: The type of participant in the action.

property.name: typeReference
property.description: The type of participant in the action.

property.name: role
property.description: The role the participant should play in performing the described action.

property.name: function
property.description: Indicates how the actor will be involved in the action - author, reviewer, witness, etc.

element.name: DynamicValue
element.description: Dynamic values that will be evaluated to produce values for elements of the resulting resource. For example, if the dosage of a medication must be computed based on the patient's weight, a dynamic value would be used to specify an expression that calculated the weight, and the path on the request resource that would contain the result.

property.name: path
property.description: The path to the element to be customized. This is the path on the resource that will hold the result of the calculation defined by the expression. The specified path SHALL be a FHIRPath resolvable on the specified target type of the ActivityDefinition, and SHALL consist only of identifiers, constant indexers, and a restricted subset of functions. The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements (see the [Simple FHIRPath Profile](fhirpath.html#simple) for full details).

property.name: expression
property.description: An expression specifying the value of the customized element.

resource.name: ActorDefinition
resource.description: The ActorDefinition resource is used to describe an actor - a human or an application that plays a role in data exchange, and that may have obligations associated with the role the actor plays.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this actor definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this actor definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the actor definition is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this actor definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the actor definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the actor definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the actor definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the actor definition.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this actor definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this actor definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the actor definition was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the actor definition changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the actor definition.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the actor.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate actor definition instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the actor definition is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this actor definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the actor definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the actor definition.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: type
property.description: Whether the actor represents a human or an appliction.

property.name: documentation
property.description: Documentation about the functionality of the actor.

property.name: reference
property.description: A reference to additional documentation about the actor, but description and documentation.

property.name: capabilities
property.description: The capability statement for the actor (if the concept is applicable).

property.name: derivedFrom
property.description: A url that identifies the definition of this actor in another IG (which IG must be listed in the dependencies). This actor inherits all the obligations etc. as defined in the other IG.

resource.name: AdministrableProductDefinition
resource.description: A medicinal product in the final form which is suitable for administering to a patient (after any mixing of multiple components, dissolution etc. has been performed).

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: An identifier for the administrable product.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this administrable product. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: formOf
property.description: References a product from which one or more of the constituent parts of that product can be prepared and used as described by this administrable product. If this administrable product describes the administration of a crushed tablet, the 'formOf' would be the product representing a distribution containing tablets and possibly also a cream. This is distinct from the 'producedFrom' which refers to the specific components of the product that are used in this preparation, rather than the product as a whole.

property.name: administrableDoseForm
property.description: The dose form of the final product after necessary reconstitution or processing. Contrasts to the manufactured dose form (see ManufacturedItemDefinition). If the manufactured form was 'powder for solution for injection', the administrable dose form could be 'solution for injection' (once mixed with another item having manufactured form 'solvent for solution for injection').

property.name: unitOfPresentation
property.description: The presentation type in which this item is given to a patient. e.g. for a spray - 'puff' (as in 'contains 100 mcg per puff'), or for a liquid - 'vial' (as in 'contains 5 ml per vial').

property.name: producedFrom
property.description: Indicates the specific manufactured items that are part of the 'formOf' product that are used in the preparation of this specific administrable form. In some cases, an administrable form might use all of the items from the overall product (or there might only be one item), while in other cases, an administrable form might use only a subset of the items available in the overall product. For example, an administrable form might involve combining a liquid and a powder available as part of an overall product, but not involve applying the also supplied cream.

property.name: ingredient
property.description: The ingredients of this administrable medicinal product. This is only needed if the ingredients are not specified either using ManufacturedItemDefiniton (via AdministrableProductDefinition.producedFrom) to state which component items are used to make this, or using by incoming references from the Ingredient resource, to state in detail which substances exist within this. This element allows a basic coded ingredient to be used.

property.name: device
property.description: A device that is integral to the medicinal product, in effect being considered as an "ingredient" of the medicinal product. This is not intended for devices that are just co-packaged.

property.name: description
property.description: A general description of the product, when in its final form, suitable for administration e.g. effervescent blue liquid, to be swallowed. Intended to be used when the other structured properties of this resource are insufficient or cannot be supported. It is not intended to duplicate information already carried elswehere.

property.name: property
property.description: Characteristics e.g. a product's onset of action.

property.name: routeOfAdministration
property.description: The path by which the product is taken into or makes contact with the body. In some regions this is referred to as the licenced or approved route. RouteOfAdministration cannot be used when the 'formOf' product already uses MedicinalProductDefinition.route (and vice versa).

element.name: Property
element.description: Characteristics e.g. a product's onset of action.

property.name: type
property.description: A code expressing the type of characteristic.

property.name: value
property.description: A value for the characteristic.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of characteristic e.g. assigned or pending.

element.name: RouteOfAdministration
element.description: The path by which the product is taken into or makes contact with the body. In some regions this is referred to as the licenced or approved route. RouteOfAdministration cannot be used when the 'formOf' product already uses MedicinalProductDefinition.route (and vice versa).

property.name: code
property.description: Coded expression for the route.

property.name: firstDose
property.description: The first dose (dose quantity) administered can be specified for the product, using a numerical value and its unit of measurement.

property.name: maxSingleDose
property.description: The maximum single dose that can be administered, specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement.

property.name: maxDosePerDay
property.description: The maximum dose per day (maximum dose quantity to be administered in any one 24-h period) that can be administered.

property.name: maxDosePerTreatmentPeriod
property.description: The maximum dose per treatment period that can be administered.

property.name: maxTreatmentPeriod
property.description: The maximum treatment period during which the product can be administered.

property.name: targetSpecies
property.description: A species for which this route applies.

resource.name: AdverseEvent
resource.description: An event (i.e. any change to current patient status) that may be related to unintended effects on a patient or research participant. The unintended effects may require additional monitoring, treatment, hospitalization, or may result in death. The AdverseEvent resource also extends to potential or avoided events that could have had such effects. There are two major domains where the AdverseEvent resource is expected to be used. One is in clinical care reported adverse events and the other is in reporting adverse events in clinical research trial management. Adverse events can be reported by healthcare providers, patients, caregivers or by medical products manufacturers. Given the differences between these two concepts, we recommend consulting the domain specific implementation guides when implementing the AdverseEvent Resource. The implementation guides include specific extensions, value sets and constraints.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this adverse event by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of the adverse event or potential adverse event.

property.name: actuality
property.description: Whether the event actually happened or was a near miss. Note that this is independent of whether anyone was affected or harmed or how severely.

property.name: category
property.description: The overall type of event, intended for search and filtering purposes.

property.name: code
property.description: Specific event that occurred or that was averted, such as patient fall, wrong organ removed, or wrong blood transfused.

property.name: subject
property.description: This subject or group impacted by the event.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The Encounter associated with the start of the AdverseEvent.

property.name: occurrence
property.description: The date (and perhaps time) when the adverse event occurred.

property.name: detected
property.description: Estimated or actual date the AdverseEvent began, in the opinion of the reporter.

property.name: recordedDate
property.description: The date on which the existence of the AdverseEvent was first recorded.

property.name: resultingEffect
property.description: Information about the condition that occurred as a result of the adverse event, such as hives due to the exposure to a substance (for example, a drug or a chemical) or a broken leg as a result of the fall.

property.name: location
property.description: The information about where the adverse event occurred.

property.name: seriousness
property.description: Assessment whether this event, or averted event, was of clinical importance.

property.name: outcome
property.description: Describes the type of outcome from the adverse event, such as resolved, recovering, ongoing, resolved-with-sequelae, or fatal.

property.name: recorder
property.description: Information on who recorded the adverse event. May be the patient or a practitioner.

property.name: participant
property.description: Indicates who or what participated in the adverse event and how they were involved.

property.name: study
property.description: The research study that the subject is enrolled in.

property.name: expectedInResearchStudy
property.description: Considered likely or probable or anticipated in the research study. Whether the reported event matches any of the outcomes for the patient that are considered by the study as known or likely.

property.name: suspectEntity
property.description: Describes the entity that is suspected to have caused the adverse event.

property.name: contributingFactor
property.description: The contributing factors suspected to have increased the probability or severity of the adverse event.

property.name: preventiveAction
property.description: Preventive actions that contributed to avoiding the adverse event.

property.name: mitigatingAction
property.description: The ameliorating action taken after the adverse event occured in order to reduce the extent of harm.

property.name: supportingInfo
property.description: Supporting information relevant to the event.

property.name: note
property.description: Comments made about the adverse event by the performer, subject or other participants.

element.name: Participant
element.description: Indicates who or what participated in the adverse event and how they were involved.

property.name: function
property.description: Distinguishes the type of involvement of the actor in the adverse event, such as contributor or informant.

property.name: actor
property.description: Indicates who or what participated in the event.

element.name: SuspectEntity
element.description: Describes the entity that is suspected to have caused the adverse event.

property.name: instance
property.description: Identifies the actual instance of what caused the adverse event. May be a substance, medication, medication administration, medication statement or a device.

property.name: causality
property.description: Information on the possible cause of the event.

element.name: ContributingFactor
element.description: The contributing factors suspected to have increased the probability or severity of the adverse event.

property.name: item
property.description: The item that is suspected to have increased the probability or severity of the adverse event.

element.name: PreventiveAction
element.description: Preventive actions that contributed to avoiding the adverse event.

property.name: item
property.description: The action that contributed to avoiding the adverse event.

element.name: MitigatingAction
element.description: The ameliorating action taken after the adverse event occured in order to reduce the extent of harm.

property.name: item
property.description: The ameliorating action taken after the adverse event occured in order to reduce the extent of harm.

element.name: SupportingInfo
element.description: Supporting information relevant to the event.

property.name: item
property.description: Relevant past history for the subject. In a clinical care context, an example being a patient had an adverse event following a pencillin administration and the patient had a previously documented penicillin allergy. In a clinical trials context, an example is a bunion or rash that was present prior to the study. Additionally, the supporting item can be a document that is relevant to this instance of the adverse event that is not part of the subject's medical history. For example, a clinical note, staff list, or material safety data sheet (MSDS). Supporting information is not a contributing factor, preventive action, or mitigating action.

resource.name: AllergyIntolerance
resource.description: Risk of harmful or undesirable, physiological response which is unique to an individual and associated with exposure to a substance.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this AllergyIntolerance by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: clinicalStatus
property.description: The clinical status of the allergy or intolerance.

property.name: verificationStatus
property.description: Assertion about certainty associated with the propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance (including pharmaceutical product). The verification status pertains to the allergy or intolerance, itself, not to any specific AllergyIntolerance attribute.

property.name: type
property.description: Identification of the underlying physiological mechanism for the reaction risk.

property.name: category
property.description: Category of the identified substance.

property.name: criticality
property.description: Estimate of the potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of the reaction to the identified substance.

property.name: code
property.description: Code for an allergy or intolerance statement (either a positive or a negated/excluded statement). This may be a code for a substance or pharmaceutical product that is considered to be responsible for the adverse reaction risk (e.g., "Latex"), an allergy or intolerance condition (e.g., "Latex allergy"), or a negated/excluded code for a specific substance or class (e.g., "No latex allergy") or a general or categorical negated statement (e.g., "No known allergy", "No known drug allergies"). Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different from the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but it must be consistent with it. For instance, it may be a more specific substance (e.g. a brand medication) or a composite product that includes the identified substance. It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'. If a receiving system is unable to confirm that AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance falls within the semantic scope of AllergyIntolerance.code, then the receiving system should ignore AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance.

property.name: patient
property.description: The patient who has the allergy or intolerance.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The encounter when the allergy or intolerance was asserted.

property.name: onset
property.description: Estimated or actual date, date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

property.name: recordedDate
property.description: The recordedDate represents when this particular AllergyIntolerance record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

property.name: participant
property.description: Indicates who or what participated in the activities related to the allergy or intolerance and how they were involved.

property.name: lastOccurrence
property.description: Represents the date and/or time of the last known occurrence of a reaction event.

property.name: note
property.description: Additional narrative about the propensity for the Adverse Reaction, not captured in other fields.

property.name: reaction
property.description: Details about each adverse reaction event linked to exposure to the identified substance.

element.name: Participant
element.description: Indicates who or what participated in the activities related to the allergy or intolerance and how they were involved.

property.name: function
property.description: Distinguishes the type of involvement of the actor in the activities related to the allergy or intolerance.

property.name: actor
property.description: Indicates who or what participated in the activities related to the allergy or intolerance.

element.name: Reaction
element.description: Details about each adverse reaction event linked to exposure to the identified substance.

property.name: substance
property.description: Identification of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) considered to be responsible for the Adverse Reaction event. Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different from the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but it must be consistent with it. For instance, it may be a more specific substance (e.g. a brand medication) or a composite product that includes the identified substance. It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'. If a receiving system is unable to confirm that AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance falls within the semantic scope of AllergyIntolerance.code, then the receiving system should ignore AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance.

property.name: manifestation
property.description: Clinical symptoms and/or signs that are observed or associated with the adverse reaction event.

property.name: description
property.description: Text description about the reaction as a whole, including details of the manifestation if required.

property.name: onset
property.description: Record of the date and/or time of the onset of the Reaction.

property.name: severity
property.description: Clinical assessment of the severity of the reaction event as a whole, potentially considering multiple different manifestations.

property.name: exposureRoute
property.description: Identification of the route by which the subject was exposed to the substance.

property.name: note
property.description: Additional text about the adverse reaction event not captured in other fields.

resource.name: Appointment
resource.description: A booking of a healthcare event among patient(s), practitioner(s), related person(s) and/or device(s) for a specific date/time. This may result in one or more Encounter(s).

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: This records identifiers associated with this appointment concern that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).

property.name: status
property.description: The overall status of the Appointment. Each of the participants has their own participation status which indicates their involvement in the process, however this status indicates the shared status.

property.name: cancellationReason
property.description: The coded reason for the appointment being cancelled. This is often used in reporting/billing/futher processing to determine if further actions are required, or specific fees apply.

property.name: class
property.description: Concepts representing classification of patient encounter such as ambulatory (outpatient), inpatient, emergency, home health or others due to local variations.

property.name: serviceCategory
property.description: A broad categorization of the service that is to be performed during this appointment.

property.name: serviceType
property.description: The specific service that is to be performed during this appointment.

property.name: specialty
property.description: The specialty of a practitioner that would be required to perform the service requested in this appointment.

property.name: appointmentType
property.description: The style of appointment or patient that has been booked in the slot (not service type).

property.name: reason
property.description: The reason that this appointment is being scheduled. This is more clinical than administrative. This can be coded, or as specified using information from another resource. When the patient arrives and the encounter begins it may be used as the admission diagnosis. The indication will typically be a Condition (with other resources referenced in the evidence.detail), or a Procedure.

property.name: priority
property.description: The priority of the appointment. Can be used to make informed decisions if needing to re-prioritize appointments. (The iCal Standard specifies 0 as undefined, 1 as highest, 9 as lowest priority).

property.name: description
property.description: The brief description of the appointment as would be shown on a subject line in a meeting request, or appointment list. Detailed or expanded information should be put in the note field.

property.name: replaces
property.description: Appointment replaced by this Appointment in cases where there is a cancellation, the details of the cancellation can be found in the cancellationReason property (on the referenced resource).

property.name: virtualService
property.description: Connection details of a virtual service (e.g. conference call).

property.name: supportingInformation
property.description: Additional information to support the appointment provided when making the appointment.

property.name: previousAppointment
property.description: The previous appointment in a series of related appointments.

property.name: originatingAppointment
property.description: The originating appointment in a recurring set of related appointments.

property.name: start
property.description: Date/Time that the appointment is to take place.

property.name: end
property.description: Date/Time that the appointment is to conclude.

property.name: minutesDuration
property.description: Number of minutes that the appointment is to take. This can be less than the duration between the start and end times. For example, where the actual time of appointment is only an estimate or if a 30 minute appointment is being requested, but any time would work. Also, if there is, for example, a planned 15 minute break in the middle of a long appointment, the duration may be 15 minutes less than the difference between the start and end.

property.name: requestedPeriod
property.description: A set of date ranges (potentially including times) that the appointment is preferred to be scheduled within. The duration (usually in minutes) could also be provided to indicate the length of the appointment to fill and populate the start/end times for the actual allocated time. However, in other situations the duration may be calculated by the scheduling system.

property.name: slot
property.description: The slots from the participants' schedules that will be filled by the appointment.

property.name: account
property.description: The set of accounts that is expected to be used for billing the activities that result from this Appointment.

property.name: created
property.description: The date that this appointment was initially created. This could be different to the meta.lastModified value on the initial entry, as this could have been before the resource was created on the FHIR server, and should remain unchanged over the lifespan of the appointment.

property.name: cancellationDate
property.description: The date/time describing when the appointment was cancelled.

property.name: note
property.description: Additional notes/comments about the appointment.

property.name: patientInstruction
property.description: While Appointment.note contains information for internal use, Appointment.patientInstructions is used to capture patient facing information about the Appointment (e.g. please bring your referral or fast from 8pm night before).

property.name: basedOn
property.description: The request this appointment is allocated to assess (e.g. incoming referral or procedure request).

property.name: subject
property.description: The patient or group associated with the appointment, if they are to be present (usually) then they should also be included in the participant backbone element.

property.name: participant
property.description: List of participants involved in the appointment.

property.name: recurrenceId
property.description: The sequence number that identifies a specific appointment in a recurring pattern.

property.name: occurrenceChanged
property.description: This appointment varies from the recurring pattern.

property.name: recurrenceTemplate
property.description: The details of the recurrence pattern or template that is used to generate recurring appointments.

element.name: Participant
element.description: List of participants involved in the appointment.

property.name: type
property.description: Role of participant in the appointment.

property.name: period
property.description: Participation period of the actor.

property.name: actor
property.description: The individual, device, location, or service participating in the appointment.

property.name: required
property.description: Whether this participant is required to be present at the meeting. If false, the participant is optional.

property.name: status
property.description: Participation status of the actor.

element.name: RecurrenceTemplate
element.description: The details of the recurrence pattern or template that is used to generate recurring appointments.

property.name: timezone
property.description: The timezone of the recurring appointment occurrences.

property.name: recurrenceType
property.description: How often the appointment series should recur.

property.name: lastOccurrenceDate
property.description: Recurring appointments will not occur after this date.

property.name: occurrenceCount
property.description: How many appointments are planned in the recurrence.

property.name: occurrenceDate
property.description: The list of specific dates that will have appointments generated.

property.name: weeklyTemplate
property.description: Information about weekly recurring appointments.

property.name: monthlyTemplate
property.description: Information about monthly recurring appointments.

property.name: yearlyTemplate
property.description: Information about yearly recurring appointments.

property.name: excludingDate
property.description: Any dates, such as holidays, that should be excluded from the recurrence.

property.name: excludingRecurrenceId
property.description: Any dates, such as holidays, that should be excluded from the recurrence.

resource.name: AppointmentResponse
resource.description: A reply to an appointment request for a patient and/or practitioner(s), such as a confirmation or rejection.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: identifier
property.description: This records identifiers associated with this appointment response concern that are defined by business processes and/ or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate.

property.name: appointment
property.description: Appointment that this response is replying to.

property.name: proposedNewTime
property.description: Indicates that the response is proposing a different time that was initially requested. The new proposed time will be indicated in the start and end properties.

property.name: start
property.description: Date/Time that the appointment is to take place, or requested new start time.

property.name: end
property.description: This may be either the same as the appointment request to confirm the details of the appointment, or alternately a new time to request a re-negotiation of the end time.

property.name: participantType
property.description: Role of participant in the appointment.

property.name: actor
property.description: A Person, Location, HealthcareService, or Device that is participating in the appointment.

property.name: participantStatus
property.description: Participation status of the participant. When the status is declined or tentative if the start/end times are different to the appointment, then these times should be interpreted as a requested time change. When the status is accepted, the times can either be the time of the appointment (as a confirmation of the time) or can be empty.

property.name: comment
property.description: Additional comments about the appointment.

property.name: recurring
property.description: Indicates that this AppointmentResponse applies to all occurrences in a recurring request.

property.name: occurrenceDate
property.description: The original date within a recurring request. This could be used in place of the recurrenceId to be more direct (or where the template is provided through the simple list of dates in `Appointment.occurrenceDate`).

property.name: recurrenceId
property.description: The recurrence ID (sequence number) of the specific appointment when responding to a recurring request.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this artifact assessment when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: title
property.description: A short title for the assessment for use in displaying and selecting.

property.name: citeAs
property.description: Display of or reference to the bibliographic citation of the comment, classifier, or rating.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the artifact assessment was published. The date must change when the disposition changes and it must change if the workflow status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the artifact assessment changes.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the artifact assessment and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the artifact assessment.

property.name: approvalDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

property.name: lastReviewDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.

property.name: artifact
property.description: A reference to a resource, canonical resource, or non-FHIR resource which the comment or assessment is about.

property.name: content
property.description: A component comment, classifier, or rating of the artifact.

property.name: workflowStatus
property.description: Indicates the workflow status of the comment or change request.

property.name: disposition
property.description: Indicates the disposition of the responsible party to the comment or change request.

element.name: Content
element.description: A component comment, classifier, or rating of the artifact.

property.name: informationType
property.description: The type of information this component of the content represents.

property.name: summary
property.description: A brief summary of the content of this component.

property.name: type
property.description: Indicates what type of content this component represents.

property.name: classifier
property.description: Represents a rating, classifier, or assessment of the artifact.

property.name: quantity
property.description: A quantitative rating of the artifact.

property.name: author
property.description: Indicates who or what authored the content.

property.name: path
property.description: A URI that points to what the comment is about, such as a line of text in the CQL, or a specific element in a resource.

property.name: relatedArtifact
property.description: Additional related artifacts that provide supporting documentation, additional evidence, or further information related to the content.

property.name: freeToShare
property.description: Acceptable to publicly share the comment, classifier or rating.

property.name: component
property.description: If the informationType is container, the components of the content.

resource.name: AuditEvent
resource.description: A record of an event relevant for purposes such as operations, privacy, security, maintenance, and performance analysis.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
