property.name: category
property.description: Classification of the type of event.

property.name: code
property.description: Describes what happened. The most specific code for the event.

property.name: action
property.description: Indicator for type of action performed during the event that generated the audit.

property.name: severity
property.description: Indicates and enables segmentation of various severity including debugging from critical.

property.name: occurred
property.description: The time or period during which the activity occurred.

property.name: recorded
property.description: The time when the event was recorded.

property.name: outcome
property.description: Indicates whether the event succeeded or failed. A free text descripiton can be given in outcome.text.

property.name: authorization
property.description: The authorization (e.g., PurposeOfUse) that was used during the event being recorded.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: Allows tracing of authorizatino for the events and tracking whether proposals/recommendations were acted upon.

property.name: patient
property.description: The patient element is available to enable deterministic tracking of activities that involve the patient as the subject of the data used in an activity.

property.name: encounter
property.description: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred, but some events may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter (e.g. pre-admission lab tests).

property.name: agent
property.description: An actor taking an active role in the event or activity that is logged.

property.name: source
property.description: The actor that is reporting the event.

property.name: entity
property.description: Specific instances of data or objects that have been accessed.

element.name: Outcome
element.description: Indicates whether the event succeeded or failed. A free text descripiton can be given in outcome.text.

property.name: code
property.description: Indicates whether the event succeeded or failed.

property.name: detail
property.description: Additional details about the error. This may be a text description of the error or a system code that identifies the error.

element.name: Agent
element.description: An actor taking an active role in the event or activity that is logged.

property.name: type
property.description: The Functional Role of the user when performing the event.

property.name: role
property.description: The structural roles of the agent indicating the agent's competency. The security role enabling the agent with respect to the activity.

property.name: who
property.description: Reference to who this agent is that was involved in the event.

property.name: requestor
property.description: Indicator that the user is or is not the requestor, or initiator, for the event being audited.

property.name: location
property.description: Where the agent location is known, the agent location when the event occurred.

property.name: policy
property.description: Where the policy(ies) are known that authorized the agent participation in the event. Typically, a single activity may have multiple applicable policies, such as patient consent, guarantor funding, etc. The policy would also indicate the security token used.

property.name: network
property.description: When the event utilizes a network there should be an agent describing the local system, and an agent describing remote system, with the network interface details.

property.name: authorization
property.description: The authorization (e.g., PurposeOfUse) that was used during the event being recorded.

element.name: Source
element.description: The actor that is reporting the event.

property.name: site
property.description: Logical source location within the healthcare enterprise network. For example, a hospital or other provider location within a multi-entity provider group.

property.name: observer
property.description: Identifier of the source where the event was detected.

property.name: type
property.description: Code specifying the type of source where event originated.

element.name: Entity
element.description: Specific instances of data or objects that have been accessed.

property.name: what
property.description: Identifies a specific instance of the entity. The reference should be version specific. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource.

property.name: role
property.description: Code representing the role the entity played in the event being audited.

property.name: securityLabel
property.description: Security labels for the identified entity.

property.name: query
property.description: The query parameters for a query-type entities.

property.name: detail
property.description: Tagged value pairs for conveying additional information about the entity.

property.name: agent
property.description: The entity is attributed to an agent to express the agent's responsibility for that entity in the activity. This is most used to indicate when persistence media (the entity) are used by an agent. For example when importing data from a device, the device would be described in an entity, and the user importing data from that media would be indicated as the entity.agent.

property.description: Identifies the 'type' of resource - equivalent to the resource name for other resources.

property.name: subject
property.description: Identifies the patient, practitioner, device or any other resource that is the "focus" of this resource.

property.name: created

property.name: author

resource.name: Binary
resource.description: A resource that represents the data of a single raw artifact as digital content accessible in its native format. A Binary resource can contain any content, whether text, image, pdf, zip archive, etc.

property.name: id

property.name: contentType
property.description: MimeType of the binary content represented as a standard MimeType (BCP 13).

property.name: securityContext
property.description: This element identifies another resource that can be used as a proxy of the security sensitivity to use when deciding and enforcing access control rules for the Binary resource. Given that the Binary resource contains very few elements that can be used to determine the sensitivity of the data and relationships to individuals, the referenced resource stands in as a proxy equivalent for this purpose. This referenced resource may be related to the Binary (e.g. DocumentReference), or may be some non-related Resource purely as a security proxy. E.g. to identify that the binary resource relates to a patient, and access should only be granted to applications that have access to the patient.

property.name: data
property.description: The actual content, base64 encoded.

property.name: productCategory
property.description: Broad category of this product.

property.name: productCode
property.description: A codified value that systematically supports characterization and classification of medical products of human origin inclusive of processing conditions such as additives, volumes and handling conditions.

property.name: parent
property.description: Parent product (if any) for this biologically-derived product.

property.name: request
property.description: Request to obtain and/or infuse this biologically derived product.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Unique instance identifiers assigned to a biologically derived product. Note: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier.

property.name: biologicalSourceEvent
property.description: An identifier that supports traceability to the event during which material in this product from one or more biological entities was obtained or pooled.

property.name: processingFacility
property.description: Processing facilities responsible for the labeling and distribution of this biologically derived product.

property.name: division
property.description: A unique identifier for an aliquot of a product. Used to distinguish individual aliquots of a product carrying the same biologicalSource and productCode identifiers.

property.name: productStatus
property.description: Whether the product is currently available.

property.name: expirationDate
property.description: Date, and where relevant time, of expiration.

property.name: collection
property.description: How this product was collected.

property.name: storageTempRequirements
property.description: The temperature requirements for storage of the biologically-derived product.

property.name: property
property.description: A property that is specific to this BiologicallyDerviedProduct instance.

element.name: Collection
element.description: How this product was collected.

property.name: collector
property.description: Healthcare professional who is performing the collection.

property.name: source
property.description: The patient or entity, such as a hospital or vendor in the case of a processed/manipulated/manufactured product, providing the product.

property.name: collected
property.description: Time of product collection.

element.name: Property
element.description: A property that is specific to this BiologicallyDerviedProduct instance.

property.name: type
property.description: Code that specifies the property. It should reference an established coding system.

property.name: value
property.description: Property values.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Unique instance identifiers assigned to a biologically derived product dispense. Note: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: The order or request that the dispense is fulfilling. This is a reference to a ServiceRequest resource.

property.name: partOf
property.description: A larger event of which this particular event is a component.

property.name: status
property.description: A code specifying the state of the dispense event.

property.name: originRelationshipType
property.description: Indicates the relationship between the donor of the biologically derived product and the intended recipient.

property.name: product
property.description: A link to a resource identifying the biologically derived product that is being dispensed.

property.name: patient
property.description: A link to a resource representing the patient that the product is dispensed for.

property.name: matchStatus
property.description: Indicates the type of matching associated with the dispense.

property.name: performer
property.description: Indicates who or what performed an action.

property.name: location
property.description: The physical location where the dispense was performed.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The amount of product in the dispense. Quantity will depend on the product being dispensed. Examples are: volume; cell count; concentration.

property.name: preparedDate
property.description: When the product was selected/ matched.

property.name: whenHandedOver
property.description: When the product was dispatched for clinical use.

property.name: destination
property.description: Link to a resource identifying the physical location that the product was dispatched to.

property.name: note
property.description: Additional notes.

property.name: usageInstruction
property.description: Specific instructions for use.

element.name: Performer
element.description: Indicates who or what performed an action.

property.name: function
property.description: Identifies the function of the performer during the dispense.

property.name: actor
property.description: Identifies the person responsible for the action.

property.name: identifier

property.name: active

property.name: morphology

property.name: excludedStructure

property.name: patient

element.name: IncludedStructure

property.name: structure
property.description: Code that represents the included structure.

property.name: laterality
property.description: Code that represents the included structure laterality.

property.name: bodyLandmarkOrientation

property.name: spatialReference

property.name: qualifier

property.name: total

property.description: A series of links that provide context to this bundle.

property.name: entry
property.description: An entry in a bundle resource - will either contain a resource or information about a resource (transactions and history only).

property.name: signature
property.description: Digital Signature - base64 encoded. XML-DSig or a JWS.

property.name: issues
property.description: Captures issues and warnings that relate to the construction of the Bundle and the content within it.

element.name: Link
element.description: A series of links that provide context to this bundle.

property.name: relation
property.description: A name which details the functional use for this link - see [http://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml#link-relations-1](http://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml#link-relations-1).

property.name: url
property.description: The reference details for the link.

element.name: Entry
element.description: An entry in a bundle resource - will either contain a resource or information about a resource (transactions and history only).

property.name: link
property.description: A series of links that provide context to this entry.

property.name: fullUrl
property.description: The Absolute URL for the resource. Except for transactions and batches, each entry in a Bundle must have a fullUrl. The fullUrl SHALL NOT disagree with the id in the resource - i.e. if the fullUrl is not a urn:uuid, the URL shall be version-independent URL consistent with the Resource.id. The fullUrl is a version independent reference to the resource. Even when not required, fullUrl MAY be set to a urn:uuid to allow referencing entries in a transaction. The fullUrl can be an arbitrary URI and is not limited to urn:uuid, urn:oid, http, and https. The fullUrl element SHALL have a value except when: * invoking a create * invoking or responding to an operation where the body is not a single identified resource * invoking or returning the results of a search or history operation.

property.name: resource
property.description: The Resource for the entry. The purpose/meaning of the resource is determined by the Bundle.type. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by something else within the Bundle that provides context/meaning.

property.name: search
property.description: Information about the search process that lead to the creation of this entry.

property.name: request
property.description: Additional information about how this entry should be processed as part of a transaction or batch. For history, it shows how the entry was processed to create the version contained in the entry.

property.name: response
property.description: Indicates the results of processing the corresponding 'request' entry in the batch or transaction being responded to or what the results of an operation where when returning history.

resource.name: CanonicalResource

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this {{title}} when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the {{title}} when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the {{title}} author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence without additional knowledge. (See the versionAlgorithm element.)

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the {{title}}. This name should be usable as an identifier for the resource by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the {{title}}.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of this {{title}}.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this {{title}} is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the {{title}} was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the {{title}} changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the {{title}}.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the {{title}} from a consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate {{title}}s.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the {{title}} is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this {{title}} is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the {{title}} and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the {{title}}.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this capability statement when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this capability statement is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the capability statement is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this CapabilityStatement when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the capability statement when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the capability statement author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the capability statement. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the capability statement.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this capability statement. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this capability statement is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the capability statement was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the capability statement changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the capability statement.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the capability statement from a consumer's perspective. Typically, this is used when the capability statement describes a desired rather than an actual solution, for example as a formal expression of requirements as part of an RFP.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate capability statement instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the capability statement is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this capability statement is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the capability statement and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the capability statement.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: kind
property.description: The way that this statement is intended to be used, to describe an actual running instance of software, a particular product (kind, not instance of software) or a class of implementation (e.g. a desired purchase).

property.name: instantiates
property.description: Reference to a canonical URL of another CapabilityStatement that this software implements. This capability statement is a published API description that corresponds to a business service. The server may actually implement a subset of the capability statement it claims to implement, so the capability statement must specify the full capability details.

property.name: imports
property.description: Reference to a canonical URL of another CapabilityStatement that this software adds to. The capability statement automatically includes everything in the other statement, and it is not duplicated, though the server may repeat the same resources, interactions and operations to add additional details to them.

property.name: software
property.description: Software that is covered by this capability statement. It is used when the capability statement describes the capabilities of a particular software version, independent of an installation.

property.name: implementation
property.description: Identifies a specific implementation instance that is described by the capability statement - i.e. a particular installation, rather than the capabilities of a software program.

property.name: fhirVersion
property.description: The version of the FHIR specification that this CapabilityStatement describes (which SHALL be the same as the FHIR version of the CapabilityStatement itself). There is no default value.

property.name: format
property.description: A list of the formats supported by this implementation using their content types.

property.name: patchFormat
property.description: A list of the patch formats supported by this implementation using their content types.

property.name: acceptLanguage
property.description: A list of the languages supported by this implementation that are usefully supported in the ```Accept-Language``` header.

property.name: implementationGuide
property.description: A list of implementation guides that the server does (or should) support in their entirety.

property.name: rest
property.description: A definition of the restful capabilities of the solution, if any.

property.name: messaging
property.description: A description of the messaging capabilities of the solution.

property.name: document
property.description: A document definition.

element.name: Software
element.description: Software that is covered by this capability statement. It is used when the capability statement describes the capabilities of a particular software version, independent of an installation.

property.name: name
property.description: Name the software is known by.

property.name: version
property.description: The version identifier for the software covered by this statement.

property.name: releaseDate
property.description: Date this version of the software was released.

element.name: Implementation
element.description: Identifies a specific implementation instance that is described by the capability statement - i.e. a particular installation, rather than the capabilities of a software program.

property.name: description
property.description: Information about the specific installation that this capability statement relates to.

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute base URL for the implementation. This forms the base for REST interfaces as well as the mailbox and document interfaces.

property.name: custodian
property.description: The organization responsible for the management of the instance and oversight of the data on the server at the specified URL.

element.name: Rest
element.description: A definition of the restful capabilities of the solution, if any.

property.name: mode
property.description: Identifies whether this portion of the statement is describing the ability to initiate or receive restful operations.

property.name: documentation
property.description: Information about the system's restful capabilities that apply across all applications, such as security.

property.name: security
property.description: Information about security implementation from an interface perspective - what a client needs to know.

property.name: resource
property.description: A specification of the restful capabilities of the solution for a specific resource type.

property.name: interaction
property.description: A specification of restful operations supported by the system.

property.name: searchParam
property.description: Search parameters that are supported for searching all resources for implementations to support and/or make use of - either references to ones defined in the specification, or additional ones defined for/by the implementation. This is only for searches executed against the system-level endpoint.

property.name: operation
property.description: Definition of an operation or a named query together with its parameters and their meaning and type.

property.name: compartment
property.description: An absolute URI which is a reference to the definition of a compartment that the system supports. The reference is to a CompartmentDefinition resource by its canonical URL .

element.name: Messaging
element.description: A description of the messaging capabilities of the solution.

property.name: endpoint
property.description: An endpoint (network accessible address) to which messages and/or replies are to be sent.

property.name: reliableCache
property.description: Length if the receiver's reliable messaging cache in minutes (if a receiver) or how long the cache length on the receiver should be (if a sender).

property.name: documentation
property.description: Documentation about the system's messaging capabilities for this endpoint not otherwise documented by the capability statement. For example, the process for becoming an authorized messaging exchange partner.

property.name: supportedMessage
property.description: References to message definitions for messages this system can send or receive.

element.name: Document
element.description: A document definition.

property.name: mode
property.description: Mode of this document declaration - whether an application is a producer or consumer.

property.name: documentation
property.description: A description of how the application supports or uses the specified document profile. For example, when documents are created, what action is taken with consumed documents, etc.

property.name: profile
property.description: A profile on the document Bundle that constrains which resources are present, and their contents.

resource.name: CarePlan
resource.description: Describes the intention of how one or more practitioners intend to deliver care for a particular patient, group or community for a period of time, possibly limited to care for a specific condition or set of conditions.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this care plan by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: instantiatesCanonical
property.description: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan.

property.name: instantiatesUri
property.description: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A higher-level request resource (i.e. a plan, proposal or order) that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this care plan.

property.name: replaces
property.description: Completed or terminated care plan whose function is taken by this new care plan.

property.name: partOf
property.description: A larger care plan of which this particular care plan is a component or step.

property.name: status
property.description: Indicates whether the plan is currently being acted upon, represents future intentions or is now a historical record.

property.name: intent
property.description: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the care plan and where the care plan fits into the workflow chain.

property.name: category
property.description: Identifies what "kind" of plan this is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing plans; e.g. "Home health", "psychiatric", "asthma", "disease management", "wellness plan", etc.

property.name: title
property.description: Human-friendly name for the care plan.

property.name: description
property.description: A description of the scope and nature of the plan.

property.name: subject
property.description: Identifies the patient or group whose intended care is described by the plan.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The Encounter during which this CarePlan was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

property.name: period
property.description: Indicates when the plan did (or is intended to) come into effect and end.

property.name: created
property.description: Represents when this particular CarePlan record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

property.name: custodian
property.description: When populated, the custodian is responsible for the care plan. The care plan is attributed to the custodian.

property.name: contributor
property.description: Identifies the individual(s), organization or device who provided the contents of the care plan.

property.name: careTeam
property.description: Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care envisioned by this plan.

property.name: addresses
property.description: Identifies the conditions/problems/concerns/diagnoses/etc. whose management and/or mitigation are handled by this plan.

property.name: supportingInfo
property.description: Identifies portions of the patient's record that specifically influenced the formation of the plan. These might include comorbidities, recent procedures, limitations, recent assessments, etc.

property.name: goal
property.description: Describes the intended objective(s) of carrying out the care plan.

property.name: activity
property.description: Identifies an action that has occurred or is a planned action to occur as part of the plan. For example, a medication to be used, lab tests to perform, self-monitoring that has occurred, education etc.

property.name: note
property.description: General notes about the care plan not covered elsewhere.

element.name: Activity
element.description: Identifies an action that has occurred or is a planned action to occur as part of the plan. For example, a medication to be used, lab tests to perform, self-monitoring that has occurred, education etc.

property.name: performedActivity
property.description: Identifies the activity that was performed. For example, an activity could be patient education, exercise, or a medication administration. The reference to an "event" resource, such as Procedure or Encounter or Observation, represents the activity that was performed. The requested activity can be conveyed using the CarePlan.activity.plannedActivityReference (a reference to a "request" resource).

property.name: progress
property.description: Notes about the adherence/status/progress of the activity.

property.name: plannedActivityReference
property.description: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

resource.name: CareTeam
resource.description: The Care Team includes all the people and organizations who plan to participate in the coordination and delivery of care.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this care team by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: status
property.description: Indicates the current state of the care team.

property.name: category
property.description: Identifies what kind of team. This is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing teams, such as care plan team, episode of care team, longitudinal care team.

property.name: name
property.description: A label for human use intended to distinguish like teams. E.g. the "red" vs. "green" trauma teams.

property.name: subject
property.description: Identifies the patient or group whose intended care is handled by the team.

property.name: period
property.description: Indicates when the team did (or is intended to) come into effect and end.

property.name: participant
property.description: Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care team.

property.name: reason
property.description: Describes why the care team exists.

property.name: managingOrganization
property.description: The organization responsible for the care team.

property.name: telecom
property.description: A central contact detail for the care team (that applies to all members).

property.name: note
property.description: Comments made about the CareTeam.

element.name: Participant
element.description: Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care team.

property.name: role
property.description: Indicates specific responsibility of an individual within the care team, such as "Primary care physician", "Trained social worker counselor", "Caregiver", etc.

property.name: member
property.description: The specific person or organization who is participating/expected to participate in the care team.

property.name: onBehalfOf
property.description: The organization of the practitioner.

property.name: coverage
property.description: When the member is generally available within this care team.

resource.name: ChargeItem
resource.description: The resource ChargeItem describes the provision of healthcare provider products for a certain patient, therefore referring not only to the product, but containing in addition details of the provision, like date, time, amounts and participating organizations and persons. Main Usage of the ChargeItem is to enable the billing process and internal cost allocation.

The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifiers assigned to this event performer or other systems.

property.name: definitionUri
property.description: References the (external) source of pricing information, rules of application for the code this ChargeItem uses.

property.name: definitionCanonical
property.description: References the source of pricing information, rules of application for the code this ChargeItem uses.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of the ChargeItem.

property.name: partOf
property.description: ChargeItems can be grouped to larger ChargeItems covering the whole set.

property.name: code
property.description: A code that identifies the charge, like a billing code.

property.name: subject
property.description: The individual or set of individuals the action is being or was performed on.

property.name: encounter
property.description: This ChargeItem has the details of how the associated Encounter should be billed or otherwise be handled by finance systems.

property.name: occurrence
property.description: Date/time(s) or duration when the charged service was applied.

property.name: performer
property.description: Indicates who or what performed or participated in the charged service.

property.name: performingOrganization
property.description: The organization performing the service.

property.name: requestingOrganization
property.description: The organization requesting the service.

property.name: costCenter
property.description: The financial cost center permits the tracking of charge attribution.

property.name: quantity
property.description: Quantity of which the charge item has been serviced.

property.name: bodysite
property.description: The anatomical location where the related service has been applied.

property.name: unitPriceComponent
property.description: The unit price of the chargable item.

property.name: totalPriceComponent
property.description: The total price for the chargable item, accounting for the quantity.

property.name: overrideReason
property.description: If the list price or the rule-based factor associated with the code is overridden, this attribute can capture a text to indicate the reason for this action.

property.name: enterer
property.description: The device, practitioner, etc. who entered the charge item.

property.name: enteredDate
property.description: Date the charge item was entered.

property.name: reason
property.description: Describes why the event occurred in coded or textual form.

property.name: service
property.description: Indicated the rendered service that caused this charge.

property.name: product
property.description: Identifies the device, food, drug or other product being charged either by type code or reference to an instance.

property.name: account
property.description: Account into which this ChargeItems belongs.

property.name: note
property.description: Comments made about the event by the performer, subject or other participants.

property.name: supportingInformation
property.description: Further information supporting this charge.

element.name: Performer
element.description: Indicates who or what performed or participated in the charged service.

property.name: function
property.description: Describes the type of performance or participation(e.g. primary surgeon, anesthesiologiest, etc.).

property.name: actor
property.description: The device, practitioner, etc. who performed or participated in the service.

resource.name: ChargeItemDefinition
resource.description: The ChargeItemDefinition resource provides the properties that apply to the (billing) codes necessary to calculate costs and prices. The properties may differ largely depending on type and realm, therefore this resource gives only a rough structure and requires profiling for each type of billing code system.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this charge item definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this charge item definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the charge item definition is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this charge item definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the charge item definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the charge item definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. To provide a version consistent with the Decision Support Service specification, use the format Major.Minor.Revision (e.g. 1.0.0). For more information on versioning knowledge assets, refer to the Decision Support Service specification. Note that a version is required for non-experimental active assets.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the ChargeItemDefinition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the charge item definition.

property.name: derivedFromUri
property.description: The URL pointing to an externally-defined charge item definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this definition.

property.name: partOf
property.description: A larger definition of which this particular definition is a component or step.

property.name: replaces
property.description: As new versions of a protocol or guideline are defined, allows identification of what versions are replaced by a new instance.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of the ChargeItemDefinition.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this charge item definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the charge item definition was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the charge item definition changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the charge item definition.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the charge item definition from a consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate charge item definition instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the charge item definition is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this charge item definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the charge item definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the charge item definition.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: approvalDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

property.name: lastReviewDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.

property.name: code
property.description: The defined billing details in this resource pertain to the given billing code.

property.name: instance
property.description: The defined billing details in this resource pertain to the given product instance(s).

property.name: applicability
property.description: Expressions that describe applicability criteria for the billing code.

property.name: propertyGroup
property.description: Group of properties which are applicable under the same conditions. If no applicability rules are established for the group, then all properties always apply.

element.name: Applicability
element.description: Expressions that describe applicability criteria for the billing code.

property.name: condition
property.description: An expression that returns true or false, indicating whether the condition is satisfied. When using FHIRPath expressions, the %context environment variable must be replaced at runtime with the ChargeItem resource to which this definition is applied.

property.name: effectivePeriod
property.description: The period during which the charge item definition content was or is planned to be in active use.

property.name: relatedArtifact
property.description: Reference to / quotation of the external source of the group of properties.

element.name: PropertyGroup
element.description: Group of properties which are applicable under the same conditions. If no applicability rules are established for the group, then all properties always apply.

property.name: applicability
property.description: Expressions that describe applicability criteria for the priceComponent.

property.name: priceComponent
property.description: The price for a ChargeItem may be calculated as a base price with surcharges/deductions that apply in certain conditions. A ChargeItemDefinition resource that defines the prices, factors and conditions that apply to a billing code is currently under development. The priceComponent element can be used to offer transparency to the recipient of the Invoice of how the prices have been calculated.

The Citation Resource supports existing reference structures and developing publication practices such as versioning, expressing complex contributorship roles, and referencing computable resources.

property.name: title

property.name: status

property.name: description

property.name: jurisdiction

property.name: copyright

property.name: author

property.name: editor

property.name: reviewer

property.name: endorser

property.name: summary
property.description: A human-readable display of key concepts to represent the citation.

property.name: classification
property.description: The assignment to an organizing scheme.

property.name: note
property.description: Used for general notes and annotations not coded elsewhere.

property.name: currentState
property.description: The status of the citation record.

property.name: statusDate
property.description: The state or status of the citation record paired with an effective date or period for that state.

property.name: relatedArtifact
property.description: Artifact related to the citation record.

property.name: citedArtifact
property.description: The article or artifact being described.

element.name: Summary
element.description: A human-readable display of key concepts to represent the citation.

property.name: style
property.description: Format for display of the citation summary.

property.name: text
property.description: The human-readable display of the citation summary.

element.name: Classification
element.description: The assignment to an organizing scheme.

property.name: type
property.description: The kind of classifier (e.g. publication type, keyword).

property.name: classifier
property.description: The specific classification value.

element.name: StatusDate
element.description: The state or status of the citation record paired with an effective date or period for that state.

property.name: activity
property.description: The state or status of the citation record (that will be paired with the period).

property.name: actual
property.description: Whether the status date is actual (has occurred) or expected (estimated or anticipated).

property.name: period
property.description: When the status started and/or ended.

element.name: CitedArtifact
element.description: The article or artifact being described.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify the cited artifact when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: relatedIdentifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify things closely related to the cited artifact.

property.name: dateAccessed
property.description: When the cited artifact was accessed.

property.name: version
property.description: The defined version of the cited artifact.

property.name: currentState
property.description: The status of the cited artifact.

property.name: statusDate
property.description: An effective date or period, historical or future, actual or expected, for a status of the cited artifact.

property.name: title
property.description: The title details of the article or artifact.

property.name: abstract
property.description: The abstract may be used to convey article-contained abstracts, externally-created abstracts, or other descriptive summaries.

property.name: part
property.description: The component of the article or artifact.

property.name: relatesTo
property.description: The artifact related to the cited artifact.

property.name: publicationForm
property.description: If multiple, used to represent alternative forms of the article that are not separate citations.

property.name: webLocation
property.description: Used for any URL for the article or artifact cited.

property.name: classification
property.description: The assignment to an organizing scheme.

property.name: contributorship
property.description: This element is used to list authors and other contributors, their contact information, specific contributions, and summary statements.

property.name: note
property.description: Any additional information or content for the article or artifact.

resource.name: Claim
resource.description: A provider issued list of professional services and products which have been provided, or are to be provided, to a patient which is sent to an insurer for reimbursement.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
