property.name: identifier
property.description: A unique identifier assigned to this claim.

property.name: traceNumber
property.description: Trace number for tracking purposes. May be defined at the jurisdiction level or between trading partners.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the resource instance.

property.name: type
property.description: The category of claim, e.g. oral, pharmacy, vision, institutional, professional.

property.name: subType
property.description: A finer grained suite of claim type codes which may convey additional information such as Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service.

property.name: use
property.description: A code to indicate whether the nature of the request is: Claim - A request to an Insurer to adjudicate the supplied charges for health care goods and services under the identified policy and to pay the determined Benefit amount, if any; Preauthorization - A request to an Insurer to adjudicate the supplied proposed future charges for health care goods and services under the identified policy and to approve the services and provide the expected benefit amounts and potentially to reserve funds to pay the benefits when Claims for the indicated services are later submitted; or, Pre-determination - A request to an Insurer to adjudicate the supplied 'what if' charges for health care goods and services under the identified policy and report back what the Benefit payable would be had the services actually been provided.

property.name: patient
property.description: The party to whom the professional services and/or products have been supplied or are being considered and for whom actual or forecast reimbursement is sought.

property.name: billablePeriod
property.description: The period for which charges are being submitted.

property.name: created
property.description: The date this resource was created.

property.name: enterer
property.description: Individual who created the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.

property.name: insurer
property.description: The Insurer who is target of the request.

property.name: provider
property.description: The provider which is responsible for the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.

property.name: priority
property.description: The provider-required urgency of processing the request. Typical values include: stat, normal, deferred.

property.name: fundsReserve
property.description: A code to indicate whether and for whom funds are to be reserved for future claims.

property.name: related
property.description: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior submissions or claims for related services or for the same event.

property.name: prescription
property.description: Prescription is the document/authorization given to the claim author for them to provide products and services for which consideration (reimbursement) is sought. Could be a RX for medications, an 'order' for oxygen or wheelchair or physiotherapy treatments.

property.name: originalPrescription
property.description: Original prescription which has been superseded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products.

property.name: payee
property.description: The party to be reimbursed for cost of the products and services according to the terms of the policy.

property.name: referral
property.description: The referral information received by the claim author, it is not to be used when the author generates a referral for a patient. A copy of that referral may be provided as supporting information. Some insurers require proof of referral to pay for services or to pay specialist rates for services.

property.name: encounter
property.description: Healthcare encounters related to this claim.

property.name: facility
property.description: Facility where the services were provided.

property.name: diagnosisRelatedGroup
property.description: A package billing code or bundle code used to group products and services to a particular health condition (such as heart attack) which is based on a predetermined grouping code system.

property.name: event
property.description: Information code for an event with a corresponding date or period.

property.name: careTeam
property.description: The members of the team who provided the products and services.

property.name: supportingInfo
property.description: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues.

property.name: diagnosis
property.description: Information about diagnoses relevant to the claim items.

property.name: procedure
property.description: Procedures performed on the patient relevant to the billing items with the claim.

property.name: insurance
property.description: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services specified on the claim.

property.name: accident
property.description: Details of an accident which resulted in injuries which required the products and services listed in the claim.

property.name: patientPaid
property.description: The amount paid by the patient, in total at the claim claim level or specifically for the item and detail level, to the provider for goods and services.

property.name: item
property.description: A claim line. Either a simple product or service or a 'group' of details which can each be a simple items or groups of sub-details.

property.name: total
property.description: The total value of the all the items in the claim.

element.name: Related
element.description: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior submissions or claims for related services or for the same event.

property.name: claim
property.description: Reference to a related claim.

property.name: relationship
property.description: A code to convey how the claims are related.

property.name: reference
property.description: An alternate organizational reference to the case or file to which this particular claim pertains.

element.name: Payee
element.description: The party to be reimbursed for cost of the products and services according to the terms of the policy.

property.name: type
property.description: Type of Party to be reimbursed: subscriber, provider, other.

property.name: party
property.description: Reference to the individual or organization to whom any payment will be made.

element.name: Event
element.description: Information code for an event with a corresponding date or period.

property.name: type
property.description: A coded event such as when a service is expected or a card printed.

property.name: when
property.description: A date or period in the past or future indicating when the event occurred or is expectd to occur.

element.name: CareTeam
element.description: The members of the team who provided the products and services.

property.name: sequence
property.description: A number to uniquely identify care team entries.

property.name: provider
property.description: Member of the team who provided the product or service.

property.name: responsible
property.description: The party who is billing and/or responsible for the claimed products or services.

property.name: role
property.description: The lead, assisting or supervising practitioner and their discipline if a multidisciplinary team.

property.name: specialty
property.description: The specialization of the practitioner or provider which is applicable for this service.

element.name: SupportingInfo
element.description: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues.

property.name: sequence
property.description: A number to uniquely identify supporting information entries.

property.name: category
property.description: The general class of the information supplied: information; exception; accident, employment; onset, etc.

property.name: code
property.description: System and code pertaining to the specific information regarding special conditions relating to the setting, treatment or patient for which care is sought.

property.name: timing
property.description: The date when or period to which this information refers.

property.name: value
property.description: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

property.name: reason
property.description: Provides the reason in the situation where a reason code is required in addition to the content.

element.name: Diagnosis
element.description: Information about diagnoses relevant to the claim items.

property.name: sequence
property.description: A number to uniquely identify diagnosis entries.

property.name: diagnosis
property.description: The nature of illness or problem in a coded form or as a reference to an external defined Condition.

property.name: type
property.description: When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.

property.name: onAdmission
property.description: Indication of whether the diagnosis was present on admission to a facility.

element.name: Procedure
element.description: Procedures performed on the patient relevant to the billing items with the claim.

property.name: sequence
property.description: A number to uniquely identify procedure entries.

property.name: type
property.description: When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.

property.name: date
property.description: Date and optionally time the procedure was performed.

property.name: procedure
property.description: The code or reference to a Procedure resource which identifies the clinical intervention performed.

property.name: udi
property.description: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

element.name: Insurance
element.description: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services specified on the claim.

property.name: sequence
property.description: A number to uniquely identify insurance entries and provide a sequence of coverages to convey coordination of benefit order.

property.name: focal
property.description: A flag to indicate that this Coverage is to be used for adjudication of this claim when set to true.

property.name: identifier
property.description: The business identifier to be used when the claim is sent for adjudication against this insurance policy.

property.name: coverage
property.description: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.

property.name: businessArrangement
property.description: A business agreement number established between the provider and the insurer for special business processing purposes.

property.name: preAuthRef
property.description: Reference numbers previously provided by the insurer to the provider to be quoted on subsequent claims containing services or products related to the prior authorization.

property.name: claimResponse
property.description: The result of the adjudication of the line items for the Coverage specified in this insurance.

element.name: Accident
element.description: Details of an accident which resulted in injuries which required the products and services listed in the claim.

property.name: date
property.description: Date of an accident event related to the products and services contained in the claim.

property.name: type
property.description: The type or context of the accident event for the purposes of selection of potential insurance coverages and determination of coordination between insurers.

property.name: location
property.description: The physical location of the accident event.

element.name: Item
element.description: A claim line. Either a simple product or service or a 'group' of details which can each be a simple items or groups of sub-details.

property.name: sequence
property.description: A number to uniquely identify item entries.

property.name: traceNumber
property.description: Trace number for tracking purposes. May be defined at the jurisdiction level or between trading partners.

property.name: careTeamSequence
property.description: CareTeam members related to this service or product.

property.name: diagnosisSequence
property.description: Diagnosis applicable for this service or product.

property.name: procedureSequence
property.description: Procedures applicable for this service or product.

property.name: informationSequence
property.description: Exceptions, special conditions and supporting information applicable for this service or product.

property.name: revenue
property.description: The type of revenue or cost center providing the product and/or service.

property.name: category
property.description: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.

property.name: productOrService
property.description: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related item details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item. This element may be the start of a range of .productOrService codes used in conjunction with .productOrServiceEnd or it may be a solo element where .productOrServiceEnd is not used.

property.name: productOrServiceEnd
property.description: This contains the end of a range of product, service, drug or other billing codes for the item. This element is not used when the .productOrService is a group code. This value may only be present when a .productOfService code has been provided to convey the start of the range. Typically this value may be used only with preauthorizations and not with claims.

property.name: request
property.description: Request or Referral for Goods or Service to be rendered.

property.name: modifier
property.description: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.

property.name: programCode
property.description: Identifies the program under which this may be recovered.

property.name: serviced
property.description: The date or dates when the service or product was supplied, performed or completed.

property.name: location
property.description: Where the product or service was provided.

property.name: patientPaid
property.description: The amount paid by the patient, in total at the claim claim level or specifically for the item and detail level, to the provider for goods and services.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

property.name: unitPrice
property.description: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

property.name: factor
property.description: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

property.name: tax
property.description: The total of taxes applicable for this product or service.

property.name: net
property.description: The total amount claimed for the group (if a grouper) or the line item. Net = unit price * quantity * factor.

property.name: udi
property.description: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

property.name: bodySite
property.description: Physical location where the service is performed or applies.

property.name: encounter
property.description: Healthcare encounters related to this claim.

property.name: detail
property.description: A claim detail line. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of sub-details which are simple items.

resource.name: ClaimResponse
resource.description: This resource provides the adjudication details from the processing of a Claim resource.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: A unique identifier assigned to this claim response.

property.name: traceNumber
property.description: Trace number for tracking purposes. May be defined at the jurisdiction level or between trading partners.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the resource instance.

property.name: type
property.description: A finer grained suite of claim type codes which may convey additional information such as Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service.

property.name: subType
property.description: A finer grained suite of claim type codes which may convey additional information such as Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service.

property.name: use
property.description: A code to indicate whether the nature of the request is: Claim - A request to an Insurer to adjudicate the supplied charges for health care goods and services under the identified policy and to pay the determined Benefit amount, if any; Preauthorization - A request to an Insurer to adjudicate the supplied proposed future charges for health care goods and services under the identified policy and to approve the services and provide the expected benefit amounts and potentially to reserve funds to pay the benefits when Claims for the indicated services are later submitted; or, Pre-determination - A request to an Insurer to adjudicate the supplied 'what if' charges for health care goods and services under the identified policy and report back what the Benefit payable would be had the services actually been provided.

property.name: patient
property.description: The party to whom the professional services and/or products have been supplied or are being considered and for whom actual for facast reimbursement is sought.

property.name: created
property.description: The date this resource was created.

property.name: insurer
property.description: The party responsible for authorization, adjudication and reimbursement.

property.name: requestor
property.description: The provider which is responsible for the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.

property.name: request
property.description: Original request resource reference.

property.name: outcome
property.description: The outcome of the claim, predetermination, or preauthorization processing.

property.name: decision
property.description: The result of the claim, predetermination, or preauthorization adjudication.

property.name: disposition
property.description: A human readable description of the status of the adjudication.

property.name: preAuthRef
property.description: Reference from the Insurer which is used in later communications which refers to this adjudication.

property.name: preAuthPeriod
property.description: The time frame during which this authorization is effective.

property.name: event
property.description: Information code for an event with a corresponding date or period.

property.name: payeeType
property.description: Type of Party to be reimbursed: subscriber, provider, other.

property.name: encounter
property.description: Healthcare encounters related to this claim.

property.name: diagnosisRelatedGroup
property.description: A package billing code or bundle code used to group products and services to a particular health condition (such as heart attack) which is based on a predetermined grouping code system.

property.name: item
property.description: A claim line. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of details which can also be a simple items or groups of sub-details.

property.name: addItem
property.description: The first-tier service adjudications for payor added product or service lines.

property.name: adjudication
property.description: The adjudication results which are presented at the header level rather than at the line-item or add-item levels.

property.name: total
property.description: Categorized monetary totals for the adjudication.

property.name: payment
property.description: Payment details for the adjudication of the claim.

property.name: fundsReserve
property.description: A code, used only on a response to a preauthorization, to indicate whether the benefits payable have been reserved and for whom.

property.name: formCode
property.description: A code for the form to be used for printing the content.

property.name: form
property.description: The actual form, by reference or inclusion, for printing the content or an EOB.

property.name: processNote
property.description: A note that describes or explains adjudication results in a human readable form.

property.name: communicationRequest
property.description: Request for additional supporting or authorizing information.

property.name: insurance
property.description: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services specified on the claim.

property.name: error
property.description: Errors encountered during the processing of the adjudication.

element.name: Event
element.description: Information code for an event with a corresponding date or period.

property.name: type
property.description: A coded event such as when a service is expected or a card printed.

property.name: when
property.description: A date or period in the past or future indicating when the event occurred or is expectd to occur.

element.name: Item
element.description: A claim line. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of details which can also be a simple items or groups of sub-details.

property.name: itemSequence
property.description: A number to uniquely reference the claim item entries.

property.name: traceNumber
property.description: Trace number for tracking purposes. May be defined at the jurisdiction level or between trading partners.

property.name: noteNumber
property.description: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

property.name: reviewOutcome
property.description: The high-level results of the adjudication if adjudication has been performed.

property.name: adjudication
property.description: If this item is a group then the values here are a summary of the adjudication of the detail items. If this item is a simple product or service then this is the result of the adjudication of this item.

property.name: detail
property.description: A claim detail. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of sub-details which are simple items.

element.name: AddItem
element.description: The first-tier service adjudications for payor added product or service lines.

property.name: itemSequence
property.description: Claim items which this service line is intended to replace.

property.name: detailSequence
property.description: The sequence number of the details within the claim item which this line is intended to replace.

property.name: subdetailSequence
property.description: The sequence number of the sub-details within the details within the claim item which this line is intended to replace.

property.name: traceNumber
property.description: Trace number for tracking purposes. May be defined at the jurisdiction level or between trading partners.

property.name: provider
property.description: The providers who are authorized for the services rendered to the patient.

property.name: revenue
property.description: The type of revenue or cost center providing the product and/or service.

property.name: productOrService
property.description: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related item details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item. This element may be the start of a range of .productOrService codes used in conjunction with .productOrServiceEnd or it may be a solo element where .productOrServiceEnd is not used.

property.name: productOrServiceEnd
property.description: This contains the end of a range of product, service, drug or other billing codes for the item. This element is not used when the .productOrService is a group code. This value may only be present when a .productOfService code has been provided to convey the start of the range. Typically this value may be used only with preauthorizations and not with claims.

property.name: request
property.description: Request or Referral for Goods or Service to be rendered.

property.name: modifier
property.description: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.

property.name: programCode
property.description: Identifies the program under which this may be recovered.

property.name: serviced
property.description: The date or dates when the service or product was supplied, performed or completed.

property.name: location
property.description: Where the product or service was provided.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

property.name: unitPrice
property.description: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

property.name: factor
property.description: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

property.name: tax
property.description: The total of taxes applicable for this product or service.

property.name: net
property.description: The total amount claimed for the group (if a grouper) or the addItem. Net = unit price * quantity * factor.

property.name: bodySite
property.description: Physical location where the service is performed or applies.

property.name: noteNumber
property.description: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

property.name: reviewOutcome
property.description: The high-level results of the adjudication if adjudication has been performed.

property.name: adjudication
property.description: The adjudication results.

property.name: detail
property.description: The second-tier service adjudications for payor added services.

element.name: Total
element.description: Categorized monetary totals for the adjudication.

property.name: category
property.description: A code to indicate the information type of this adjudication record. Information types may include: the value submitted, maximum values or percentages allowed or payable under the plan, amounts that the patient is responsible for in aggregate or pertaining to this item, amounts paid by other coverages, and the benefit payable for this item.

property.name: amount
property.description: Monetary total amount associated with the category.

element.name: Payment
element.description: Payment details for the adjudication of the claim.

property.name: type
property.description: Whether this represents partial or complete payment of the benefits payable.

property.name: adjustment
property.description: Total amount of all adjustments to this payment included in this transaction which are not related to this claim's adjudication.

property.name: adjustmentReason
property.description: Reason for the payment adjustment.

property.name: date
property.description: Estimated date the payment will be issued or the actual issue date of payment.

property.name: amount
property.description: Benefits payable less any payment adjustment.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Issuer's unique identifier for the payment instrument.

element.name: ProcessNote
element.description: A note that describes or explains adjudication results in a human readable form.

property.name: number
property.description: A number to uniquely identify a note entry.

property.name: type
property.description: The business purpose of the note text.

property.name: text
property.description: The explanation or description associated with the processing.

property.name: language
property.description: A code to define the language used in the text of the note.

element.name: Insurance
element.description: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services specified on the claim.

property.name: sequence
property.description: A number to uniquely identify insurance entries and provide a sequence of coverages to convey coordination of benefit order.

property.name: focal
property.description: A flag to indicate that this Coverage is to be used for adjudication of this claim when set to true.

property.name: coverage
property.description: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.

property.name: businessArrangement
property.description: A business agreement number established between the provider and the insurer for special business processing purposes.

property.name: claimResponse
property.description: The result of the adjudication of the line items for the Coverage specified in this insurance.

element.name: Error
element.description: Errors encountered during the processing of the adjudication.

property.name: itemSequence
property.description: The sequence number of the line item submitted which contains the error. This value is omitted when the error occurs outside of the item structure.

property.name: detailSequence
property.description: The sequence number of the detail within the line item submitted which contains the error. This value is omitted when the error occurs outside of the item structure.

property.name: subDetailSequence
property.description: The sequence number of the sub-detail within the detail within the line item submitted which contains the error. This value is omitted when the error occurs outside of the item structure.

property.name: code
property.description: An error code, from a specified code system, which details why the claim could not be adjudicated.

property.name: expression
property.description: A [simple subset of FHIRPath](fhirpath.html#simple) limited to element names, repetition indicators and the default child accessor that identifies one of the elements in the resource that caused this issue to be raised.

resource.name: ClinicalImpression
resource.description: A record of a clinical assessment performed to determine what problem(s) may affect the patient and before planning the treatments or management strategies that are best to manage a patient's condition. Assessments are often 1:1 with a clinical consultation / encounter, but this varies greatly depending on the clinical workflow. This resource is called "ClinicalImpression" rather than "ClinicalAssessment" to avoid confusion with the recording of assessment tools such as Apgar score.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules

property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this clinical impression by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: status
property.description: Identifies the workflow status of the assessment.

property.name: statusReason
property.description: Captures the reason for the current state of the ClinicalImpression.

property.name: description
property.description: A summary of the context and/or cause of the assessment - why / where it was performed, and what patient events/status prompted it.

property.name: subject
property.description: The patient or group of individuals assessed as part of this record.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The Encounter during which this ClinicalImpression was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

property.name: effective
property.description: The point in time or period over which the subject was assessed.

property.name: date
property.description: Indicates when the documentation of the assessment was complete.

property.name: performer
property.description: The clinician performing the assessment.

property.name: previous
property.description: A reference to the last assessment that was conducted on this patient. Assessments are often/usually ongoing in nature; a care provider (practitioner or team) will make new assessments on an ongoing basis as new data arises or the patient's conditions changes.

property.name: problem
property.description: A list of the relevant problems/conditions for a patient.

property.name: changePattern
property.description: Change in the status/pattern of a subject's condition since previously assessed, such as worsening, improving, or no change. It is a subjective assessment of the direction of the change.

property.name: protocol
property.description: Reference to a specific published clinical protocol that was followed during this assessment, and/or that provides evidence in support of the diagnosis.

property.name: summary
property.description: A text summary of the investigations and the diagnosis.

property.name: finding
property.description: Specific findings or diagnoses that were considered likely or relevant to ongoing treatment.

property.name: prognosisCodeableConcept
property.description: Estimate of likely outcome.

property.name: prognosisReference
property.description: RiskAssessment expressing likely outcome.

property.name: supportingInfo
property.description: Information supporting the clinical impression, which can contain investigation results.

property.name: note
property.description: Commentary about the impression, typically recorded after the impression itself was made, though supplemental notes by the original author could also appear.

element.name: Finding
element.description: Specific findings or diagnoses that were considered likely or relevant to ongoing treatment.

property.name: item
property.description: Specific text, code or reference for finding or diagnosis, which may include ruled-out or resolved conditions.

property.name: basis
property.description: Which investigations support finding or diagnosis.

resource.name: ClinicalUseDefinition
resource.description: A single issue - either an indication, contraindication, interaction or an undesirable effect for a medicinal product, medication, device or procedure.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifier for this issue.

property.name: type
property.description: indication | contraindication | interaction | undesirable-effect | warning.

property.name: category
property.description: A categorisation of the issue, primarily for dividing warnings into subject heading areas such as "Pregnancy and Lactation", "Overdose", "Effects on Ability to Drive and Use Machines".

property.name: subject
property.description: The medication, product, substance, device, procedure etc. for which this is an indication.

property.name: status
property.description: Whether this is a current issue or one that has been retired etc.

property.name: contraindication
property.description: Specifics for when this is a contraindication.

property.name: indication
property.description: Specifics for when this is an indication.

property.name: interaction
property.description: Specifics for when this is an interaction.

property.name: population
property.description: The population group to which this applies.

property.name: library
property.description: Logic used by the clinical use definition.

property.name: undesirableEffect
property.description: Describe the possible undesirable effects (negative outcomes) from the use of the medicinal product as treatment.

property.name: warning
property.description: A critical piece of information about environmental, health or physical risks or hazards that serve as caution to the user. For example 'Do not operate heavy machinery', 'May cause drowsiness', or 'Get medical advice/attention if you feel unwell'.

element.name: Contraindication
element.description: Specifics for when this is a contraindication.

property.name: diseaseSymptomProcedure
property.description: The situation that is being documented as contraindicating against this item.

property.name: diseaseStatus
property.description: The status of the disease or symptom for the contraindication, for example "chronic" or "metastatic".

property.name: comorbidity
property.description: A comorbidity (concurrent condition) or coinfection.

property.name: indication
property.description: The indication which this is a contraidication for.

property.name: applicability
property.description: An expression that returns true or false, indicating whether the indication is applicable or not, after having applied its other elements.

property.name: otherTherapy
property.description: Information about the use of the medicinal product in relation to other therapies described as part of the contraindication.

element.name: Indication
element.description: Specifics for when this is an indication.

property.name: diseaseSymptomProcedure
property.description: The situation that is being documented as an indicaton for this item.

property.name: diseaseStatus
property.description: The status of the disease or symptom for the indication, for example "chronic" or "metastatic".

property.name: comorbidity
property.description: A comorbidity (concurrent condition) or coinfection as part of the indication.

property.name: intendedEffect
property.description: The intended effect, aim or strategy to be achieved.

property.name: duration
property.description: Timing or duration information, that may be associated with use with the indicated condition e.g. Adult patients suffering from myocardial infarction (from a few days until less than 35 days), ischaemic stroke (from 7 days until less than 6 months).

property.name: undesirableEffect
property.description: An unwanted side effect or negative outcome that may happen if you use the drug (or other subject of this resource) for this indication.

property.name: applicability
property.description: An expression that returns true or false, indicating whether the indication is applicable or not, after having applied its other elements.

property.name: otherTherapy
property.description: Information about the use of the medicinal product in relation to other therapies described as part of the indication.

element.name: Interaction
element.description: Specifics for when this is an interaction.

property.name: interactant
property.description: The specific medication, product, food, substance etc. or laboratory test that interacts.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of the interaction e.g. drug-drug interaction, drug-food interaction, drug-lab test interaction.

property.name: effect
property.description: The effect of the interaction, for example "reduced gastric absorption of primary medication".

property.name: incidence
property.description: The incidence of the interaction, e.g. theoretical, observed.

property.name: management
property.description: Actions for managing the interaction.

element.name: UndesirableEffect
element.description: Describe the possible undesirable effects (negative outcomes) from the use of the medicinal product as treatment.

property.name: symptomConditionEffect
property.description: The situation in which the undesirable effect may manifest.

property.name: classification
property.description: High level classification of the effect.

property.name: frequencyOfOccurrence
property.description: How often the effect is seen.

element.name: Warning
element.description: A critical piece of information about environmental, health or physical risks or hazards that serve as caution to the user. For example 'Do not operate heavy machinery', 'May cause drowsiness', or 'Get medical advice/attention if you feel unwell'.

property.name: description
property.description: A textual definition of this warning, with formatting.

property.name: code
property.description: A coded or unformatted textual definition of this warning.

resource.name: CodeSystem
resource.description: The CodeSystem resource is used to declare the existence of and describe a code system or code system supplement and its key properties, and optionally define a part or all of its content.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this code system when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this code system is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the code system is stored on different servers. This is used in [Coding](datatypes.html#Coding).system.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this code system when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the code system when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the code system author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. This is used in [Coding](datatypes.html#Coding).version.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which CodeSystem is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the code system. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the code system.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this code system. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this code system is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the code system was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the code system changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the code system.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the code system from a consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate code system instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the code system is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this code system is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the code system and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the code system.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: approvalDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

property.name: lastReviewDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.

property.name: effectivePeriod
property.description: The period during which the CodeSystem content was or is planned to be in active use.

property.name: topic
property.description: Descriptions related to the content of the CodeSystem. Topics provide a high-level categorization as well as keywords for the CodeSystem that can be useful for filtering and searching.

property.name: author
property.description: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the CodeSystem.

property.name: editor
property.description: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the CodeSystem.

property.name: reviewer
property.description: An individual or organization asserted by the publisher to be primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the CodeSystem.

property.name: endorser
property.description: An individual or organization asserted by the publisher to be responsible for officially endorsing the CodeSystem for use in some setting.

property.name: relatedArtifact
property.description: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, dependencies, bibliographic references, and predecessor and successor artifacts.

property.name: caseSensitive
property.description: If code comparison is case sensitive when codes within this system are compared to each other.

property.name: valueSet
property.description: Canonical reference to the value set that contains all codes in the code system independent of code status.

property.name: hierarchyMeaning
property.description: The meaning of the hierarchy of concepts as represented in this resource.

property.name: compositional
property.description: The code system defines a compositional (post-coordination) grammar.

property.name: versionNeeded
property.description: This flag is used to signify that the code system does not commit to concept permanence across versions. If true, a version must be specified when referencing this code system.

property.name: content
property.description: The extent of the content of the code system (the concepts and codes it defines) are represented in this resource instance.

property.name: supplements
property.description: The canonical URL of the code system that this code system supplement is adding designations and properties to.

property.name: count
property.description: The total number of concepts defined by the code system. Where the code system has a compositional grammar, the basis of this count is defined by the system steward.

property.name: filter
property.description: A filter that can be used in a value set compose statement when selecting concepts using a filter.

property.name: property
property.description: A property defines an additional slot through which additional information can be provided about a concept.

property.name: concept
property.description: Concepts that are in the code system. The concept definitions are inherently hierarchical, but the definitions must be consulted to determine what the meanings of the hierarchical relationships are.

element.name: Filter
element.description: A filter that can be used in a value set compose statement when selecting concepts using a filter.

property.name: code
property.description: The code that identifies this filter when it is used as a filter in [ValueSet](valueset.html#).compose.include.filter.

property.name: description
property.description: A description of how or why the filter is used.

property.name: operator
property.description: A list of operators that can be used with the filter.

property.name: value
property.description: A description of what the value for the filter should be.

element.name: Property
element.description: A property defines an additional slot through which additional information can be provided about a concept.

property.name: code
property.description: A code that is used to identify the property. The code is used internally (in CodeSystem.concept.property.code) and also externally, such as in property filters.

property.name: uri
property.description: Reference to the formal meaning of the property. One possible source of meaning is the [Concept Properties](codesystem-concept-properties.html) code system.

property.name: description
property.description: A description of the property- why it is defined, and how its value might be used.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of the property value. Properties of type "code" contain a code defined by the code system (e.g. a reference to another defined concept).

element.name: Concept
element.description: Concepts that are in the code system. The concept definitions are inherently hierarchical, but the definitions must be consulted to determine what the meanings of the hierarchical relationships are.

property.name: code
property.description: A code - a text symbol - that uniquely identifies the concept within the code system.

property.name: display
property.description: A human readable string that is the recommended default way to present this concept to a user.

property.name: definition
property.description: The formal definition of the concept. The code system resource does not make formal definitions required, because of the prevalence of legacy systems. However, they are highly recommended, as without them there is no formal meaning associated with the concept.

property.name: designation
property.description: Additional representations for the concept - other languages, aliases, specialized purposes, used for particular purposes, etc.

property.name: property
property.description: A property value for this concept.

property.name: concept
property.description: Defines children of a concept to produce a hierarchy of concepts. The nature of the relationships is variable (is-a/contains/categorizes) - see hierarchyMeaning.

resource.name: Communication
resource.description: A clinical or business level record of information being transmitted or shared; e.g. an alert that was sent to a responsible provider, a public health agency communication to a provider/reporter in response to a case report for a reportable condition.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this communication by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: instantiatesCanonical
property.description: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Communication.

property.name: instantiatesUri
property.description: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Communication.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: An order, proposal or plan fulfilled in whole or in part by this Communication.

property.name: partOf
property.description: A larger event (e.g. Communication, Procedure) of which this particular communication is a component or step.

property.name: inResponseTo
property.description: Prior communication that this communication is in response to.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the transmission.

property.name: statusReason
property.description: Captures the reason for the current state of the Communication.

property.name: category
property.description: The type of message conveyed such as alert, notification, reminder, instruction, etc.

property.name: priority
property.description: Characterizes how quickly the planned or in progress communication must be addressed. Includes concepts such as stat, urgent, routine.

property.name: medium
property.description: A channel that was used for this communication (e.g. email, fax).

property.name: subject
property.description: The patient or group that was the focus of this communication.

property.name: topic
property.description: Description of the purpose/content, similar to a subject line in an email.

property.name: about
property.description: Other resources that pertain to this communication and to which this communication should be associated.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The Encounter during which this Communication was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

property.name: sent
property.description: The time when this communication was sent.

property.name: received
property.description: The time when this communication arrived at the destination.

property.name: recipient
property.description: The entity (e.g. person, organization, clinical information system, care team or device) which is the target of the communication.

property.name: sender
property.description: The entity (e.g. person, organization, clinical information system, or device) which is the source of the communication.

property.name: reason
property.description: The reason or justification for the communication.

property.name: payload
property.description: Text, attachment(s), or resource(s) that was communicated to the recipient.

property.name: note
property.description: Additional notes or commentary about the communication by the sender, receiver or other interested parties.

element.name: Payload
element.description: Text, attachment(s), or resource(s) that was communicated to the recipient.

property.name: content
property.description: A communicated content (or for multi-part communications, one portion of the communication).

resource.name: CommunicationRequest
resource.description: A request to convey information; e.g. the CDS system proposes that an alert be sent to a responsible provider, the CDS system proposes that the public health agency be notified about a reportable condition.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this communication request by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A plan or proposal that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this request.

property.name: replaces
property.description: Completed or terminated request(s) whose function is taken by this new request.

property.name: groupIdentifier
property.description: A shared identifier common to multiple independent Request instances that were activated/authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author. The presence of the same identifier on each request ties those requests together and may have business ramifications in terms of reporting of results, billing, etc. E.g. a requisition number shared by a set of lab tests ordered together, or a prescription number shared by all meds ordered at one time.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the proposal or order.

property.name: statusReason
property.description: Captures the reason for the current state of the CommunicationRequest.

property.name: intent
property.description: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the CommunicationRequest and where the request fits into the workflow chain.

property.name: category
property.description: The type of message to be sent such as alert, notification, reminder, instruction, etc.

property.name: priority
property.description: Characterizes how quickly the proposed act must be initiated. Includes concepts such as stat, urgent, routine.

property.name: doNotPerform
property.description: If true indicates that the CommunicationRequest is asking for the specified action to *not* occur.

property.name: medium
property.description: A channel that was used for this communication (e.g. email, fax).

property.name: subject
property.description: The patient or group that is the focus of this communication request.

property.name: about
property.description: Other resources that pertain to this communication request and to which this communication request should be associated.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The Encounter during which this CommunicationRequest was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

property.name: payload
property.description: Text, attachment(s), or resource(s) to be communicated to the recipient.

property.name: occurrence
property.description: The time when this communication is to occur.

property.name: authoredOn
property.description: For draft requests, indicates the date of initial creation. For requests with other statuses, indicates the date of activation.

property.name: requester
property.description: The device, individual, or organization who asks for the information to be shared.

property.name: recipient
property.description: The entity (e.g. person, organization, clinical information system, device, group, or care team) which is the intended target of the communication.

property.name: informationProvider
property.description: The entity (e.g. person, organization, clinical information system, or device) which is to be the source of the communication.

property.name: reason
property.description: Describes why the request is being made in coded or textual form.

property.name: note
property.description: Comments made about the request by the requester, sender, recipient, subject or other participants.

element.name: Payload
element.description: Text, attachment(s), or resource(s) to be communicated to the recipient.

property.name: content
property.description: The communicated content (or for multi-part communications, one portion of the communication).

resource.name: CompartmentDefinition

property.name: name

property.name: title

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this compartment definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this compartment definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date

property.name: publisher

property.name: contact

property.name: description

property.name: useContext

property.name: purpose

property.name: code
property.description: Which compartment this definition describes.

property.name: search
property.description: Whether the search syntax is supported,.

property.name: resource
property.description: Information about how a resource is related to the compartment.

element.name: Resource
element.description: Information about how a resource is related to the compartment.

property.name: code
property.description: The name of a resource supported by the server.

property.name: param
property.description: The name of a search parameter that represents the link to the compartment. More than one may be listed because a resource may be linked to a compartment in more than one way,.

property.name: documentation
property.description: Additional documentation about the resource and compartment.

property.name: startParam
