property.name: endParam
property.description: Search Parameter for mapping requests made with $everything.end (e.g. on [Patient.$everything](patient-operation-everything.html)).

resource.name: Composition
resource.description: A set of healthcare-related information that is assembled together into a single logical package that provides a single coherent statement of meaning, establishes its own context and that has clinical attestation with regard to who is making the statement. A Composition defines the structure and narrative content necessary for a document. However, a Composition alone does not constitute a document. Rather, the Composition must be the first entry in a Bundle where Bundle.type=document, and any other resources referenced from Composition must be included as subsequent entries in the Bundle (for example Patient, Practitioner, Encounter, etc.).

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this Composition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this Composition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the Composition is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A version-independent identifier for the Composition. This identifier stays constant as the composition is changed over time.

property.name: version
property.description: An explicitly assigned identifer of a variation of the content in the Composition.

property.name: status
property.description: The workflow/clinical status of this composition. The status is a marker for the clinical standing of the document.

property.name: type
property.description: Specifies the particular kind of composition (e.g. History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Progress Note). This usually equates to the purpose of making the composition.

property.name: category
property.description: A categorization for the type of the composition - helps for indexing and searching. This may be implied by or derived from the code specified in the Composition Type.

property.name: subject
property.description: Who or what the composition is about. The composition can be about a person, (patient or healthcare practitioner), a device (e.g. a machine) or even a group of subjects (such as a document about a herd of livestock, or a set of patients that share a common exposure).

property.name: encounter
property.description: Describes the clinical encounter or type of care this documentation is associated with.

property.name: date
property.description: The composition editing time, when the composition was last logically changed by the author.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate Composition instances.

property.name: author
property.description: Identifies who is responsible for the information in the composition, not necessarily who typed it in.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the {{title}}. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: Official human-readable label for the composition.

property.name: note
property.description: For any additional notes.

property.name: attester
property.description: A participant who has attested to the accuracy of the composition/document.

property.name: custodian
property.description: Identifies the organization or group who is responsible for ongoing maintenance of and access to the composition/document information.

property.name: relatesTo
property.description: Relationships that this composition has with other compositions or documents that already exist.

property.name: event
property.description: The clinical service, such as a colonoscopy or an appendectomy, being documented.

property.name: section
property.description: The root of the sections that make up the composition.

element.name: Attester
element.description: A participant who has attested to the accuracy of the composition/document.

property.name: mode
property.description: The type of attestation the authenticator offers.

property.name: time
property.description: When the composition was attested by the party.

property.name: party
property.description: Who attested the composition in the specified way.

element.name: Event
element.description: The clinical service, such as a colonoscopy or an appendectomy, being documented.

property.name: period
property.description: The period of time covered by the documentation. There is no assertion that the documentation is a complete representation for this period, only that it documents events during this time.

property.name: detail
property.description: Represents the main clinical acts, such as a colonoscopy or an appendectomy, being documented. In some cases, the event is inherent in the typeCode, such as a "History and Physical Report" in which case the procedure being documented is necessarily a "History and Physical" act. The events may be included as a code or as a reference to an other resource.

element.name: Section
element.description: The root of the sections that make up the composition.

property.name: title
property.description: The label for this particular section. This will be part of the rendered content for the document, and is often used to build a table of contents.

property.name: code
property.description: A code identifying the kind of content contained within the section. This must be consistent with the section title.

property.name: author
property.description: Identifies who is responsible for the information in this section, not necessarily who typed it in.

property.name: focus
property.description: The actual focus of the section when it is not the subject of the composition, but instead represents something or someone associated with the subject such as (for a patient subject) a spouse, parent, fetus, or donor. If not focus is specified, the focus is assumed to be focus of the parent section, or, for a section in the Composition itself, the subject of the composition. Sections with a focus SHALL only include resources where the logical subject (patient, subject, focus, etc.) matches the section focus, or the resources have no logical subject (few resources).

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains the attested content of the section, used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative.

property.name: orderedBy
property.description: Specifies the order applied to the items in the section entries.

property.name: entry
property.description: A reference to the actual resource from which the narrative in the section is derived.

property.name: emptyReason
property.description: If the section is empty, why the list is empty. An empty section typically has some text explaining the empty reason.

property.name: section
property.description: A nested sub-section within this section.

resource.name: ConceptMap
resource.description: A statement of relationships from one set of concepts to one or more other concepts - either concepts in code systems, or data element/data element concepts, or classes in class models.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this concept map when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this concept map is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the concept map is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this concept map when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the concept map when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the concept map author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which ConceptMap is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the concept map. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the concept map.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this concept map. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this concept map is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the concept map was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the concept map changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the concept map.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the concept map from a consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate concept map instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the concept map is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this concept map is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the concept map and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the concept map.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: approvalDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

property.name: lastReviewDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.

property.name: effectivePeriod
property.description: The period during which the ConceptMap content was or is planned to be in active use.

property.name: topic
property.description: Descriptions related to the content of the ConceptMap. Topics provide a high-level categorization as well as keywords for the ConceptMap that can be useful for filtering and searching.

property.name: author
property.description: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the ConceptMap.

property.name: editor
property.description: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the ConceptMap.

property.name: reviewer
property.description: An individual or organization asserted by the publisher to be primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the ConceptMap.

property.name: endorser
property.description: An individual or organization asserted by the publisher to be responsible for officially endorsing the ConceptMap for use in some setting.

property.name: relatedArtifact
property.description: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, dependencies, bibliographic references, and predecessor and successor artifacts.

property.name: property
property.description: A property defines a slot through which additional information can be provided about a map from source -> target.

property.name: additionalAttribute
property.description: An additionalAttribute defines an additional data element found in the source or target data model where the data will come from or be mapped to. Some mappings are based on data in addition to the source data element, where codes in multiple fields are combined to a single field (or vice versa).

property.name: sourceScope
property.description: Identifier for the source value set that contains the concepts that are being mapped and provides context for the mappings. Limits the scope of the map to source codes (ConceptMap.group.element code or valueSet) that are members of this value set.

property.name: targetScope
property.description: Identifier for the target value set that provides important context about how the mapping choices are made. Limits the scope of the map to target codes (ConceptMap.group.element.target code or valueSet) that are members of this value set.

property.name: group
property.description: A group of mappings that all have the same source and target system.

element.name: Property
element.description: A property defines a slot through which additional information can be provided about a map from source -> target.

property.name: code
property.description: A code that is used to identify the property. The code is used internally (in ConceptMap.group.element.target.property.code) and also in the $translate operation.

property.name: uri
property.description: Reference to the formal meaning of the property.

property.name: description
property.description: A description of the property - why it is defined, and how its value might be used.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of the property value.

property.name: system
property.description: The CodeSystem that defines the codes from which values of type ```code``` in property values.

element.name: AdditionalAttribute
element.description: An additionalAttribute defines an additional data element found in the source or target data model where the data will come from or be mapped to. Some mappings are based on data in addition to the source data element, where codes in multiple fields are combined to a single field (or vice versa).

property.name: code
property.description: A code that is used to identify this additional data attribute. The code is used internally in ConceptMap.group.element.target.dependsOn.attribute and ConceptMap.group.element.target.product.attribute.

property.name: uri
property.description: Reference to the formal definition of the source/target data element. For elements defined by the FHIR specification, or using a FHIR logical model, the correct format is {canonical-url}#{element-id}.

property.name: description
property.description: A description of the additional attribute and/or the data element it refers to - why it is defined, and how the value might be used in mappings, and a discussion of issues associated with the use of the data element.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of the source data contained in this concept map for this data element.

element.name: Group
element.description: A group of mappings that all have the same source and target system.

property.name: source
property.description: An absolute URI that identifies the source system where the concepts to be mapped are defined.

property.name: target
property.description: An absolute URI that identifies the target system that the concepts will be mapped to.

property.name: element
property.description: Mappings for an individual concept in the source to one or more concepts in the target.

property.name: unmapped
property.description: What to do when there is no mapping to a target concept from the source concept and ConceptMap.group.element.noMap is not true. This provides the "default" to be applied when there is no target concept mapping specified or the expansion of ConceptMap.group.element.target.valueSet is empty.

resource.name: Condition
resource.description: A clinical condition, problem, diagnosis, or other event, situation, issue, or clinical concept that has risen to a level of concern.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this condition by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: clinicalStatus
property.description: The clinical status of the condition.

property.name: verificationStatus
property.description: The verification status to support the clinical status of the condition. The verification status pertains to the condition, itself, not to any specific condition attribute.

property.name: category
property.description: A category assigned to the condition.

property.name: severity
property.description: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

property.name: code
property.description: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

property.name: bodySite
property.description: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.

property.name: subject
property.description: Indicates the patient or group who the condition record is associated with.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The Encounter during which this Condition was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

property.name: onset
property.description: Estimated or actual date or date-time the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

property.name: abatement
property.description: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Some conditions, such as chronic conditions, are never really resolved, but they can abate.

property.name: recordedDate
property.description: The recordedDate represents when this particular Condition record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

property.name: participant
property.description: Indicates who or what participated in the activities related to the condition and how they were involved.

property.name: stage
property.description: A simple summary of the stage such as "Stage 3" or "Early Onset". The determination of the stage is disease-specific, such as cancer, retinopathy of prematurity, kidney diseases, Alzheimer's, or Parkinson disease.

property.name: evidence
property.description: Supporting evidence / manifestations that are the basis of the Condition's verification status, such as evidence that confirmed or refuted the condition.

property.name: note
property.description: Additional information about the Condition. This is a general notes/comments entry for description of the Condition, its diagnosis and prognosis.

element.name: Participant
element.description: Indicates who or what participated in the activities related to the condition and how they were involved.

property.name: function
property.description: Distinguishes the type of involvement of the actor in the activities related to the condition.

property.name: actor
property.description: Indicates who or what participated in the activities related to the condition.

element.name: Stage
element.description: A simple summary of the stage such as "Stage 3" or "Early Onset". The determination of the stage is disease-specific, such as cancer, retinopathy of prematurity, kidney diseases, Alzheimer's, or Parkinson disease.

property.name: summary
property.description: A simple summary of the stage such as "Stage 3" or "Early Onset". The determination of the stage is disease-specific, such as cancer, retinopathy of prematurity, kidney diseases, Alzheimer's, or Parkinson disease.

property.name: assessment
property.description: Reference to a formal record of the evidence on which the staging assessment is based.

property.name: type
property.description: The kind of staging, such as pathological or clinical staging.

property.name: title

property.name: subtitle
property.description: An explanatory or alternate title for the event definition giving additional information about its content.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this condition definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental

property.name: description

property.name: useContext

property.name: code
property.description: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

property.name: severity
property.description: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

property.name: bodySite
property.description: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.

property.name: stage
property.description: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments.

property.name: hasSeverity
property.description: Whether Severity is appropriate to collect for this condition.

property.name: hasBodySite
property.description: Whether bodySite is appropriate to collect for this condition.

property.name: hasStage
property.description: Whether stage is appropriate to collect for this condition.

property.name: definition
property.description: Formal definitions of the condition. These may be references to ontologies, published clinical protocols or research papers.

property.name: observation
property.description: Observations particularly relevant to this condition.

property.name: medication
property.description: Medications particularly relevant for this condition.

property.name: precondition
property.description: An observation that suggests that this condition applies.

property.name: team
property.description: Appropriate team for this condition.

property.name: questionnaire
property.description: Questionnaire for this condition.

property.name: plan
property.description: Plan that is appropriate.

element.name: Observation
element.description: Observations particularly relevant to this condition.

property.name: category
property.description: Category that is relevant.

property.name: code
property.description: Code for relevant Observation.

element.name: Medication
element.description: Medications particularly relevant for this condition.

property.name: category
property.description: Category that is relevant.

property.name: code
property.description: Code for relevant Medication.

element.name: Precondition
element.description: An observation that suggests that this condition applies.

property.name: type
property.description: Kind of pre-condition.

property.name: code
property.description: Code for relevant Observation.

property.name: value
property.description: Value of Observation.

element.name: Questionnaire
element.description: Questionnaire for this condition.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Use of the questionnaire.

property.name: reference
property.description: Specific Questionnaire.

element.name: Plan
element.description: Plan that is appropriate.

property.name: role
property.description: Use for the plan.

property.name: reference
property.description: The actual plan.

resource.name: Consent
resource.description: A record of a healthcare consumer's choices or choices made on their behalf by a third party, which permits or denies identified recipient(s) or recipient role(s) to perform one or more actions within a given policy context, for specific purposes and periods of time.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. property.name: identifier
property.description: Unique identifier for this copy of the Consent Statement.

property.name: status
property.description: Indicates the current state of this Consent resource.

property.name: category
property.description: A classification of the type of consents found in the statement. This element supports indexing and retrieval of consent statements.

property.name: subject
property.description: The patient/healthcare practitioner or group of persons to whom this consent applies.

property.name: date
property.description: Date the consent instance was agreed to.

property.name: period
property.description: Effective period for this Consent Resource and all provisions unless specified in that provision.

property.name: grantor
property.description: The entity responsible for granting the rights listed in a Consent Directive.

property.name: grantee
property.description: The entity responsible for complying with the Consent Directive, including any obligations or limitations on authorizations and enforcement of prohibitions.

property.name: manager
property.description: The actor that manages the consent through its lifecycle.

property.name: controller
property.description: The actor that controls/enforces the access according to the consent.

property.name: sourceAttachment
property.description: The source on which this consent statement is based. The source might be a scanned original paper form.

property.name: sourceReference
property.description: A reference to a consent that links back to such a source, a reference to a document repository (e.g. XDS) that stores the original consent document.

property.name: regulatoryBasis
property.description: A set of codes that indicate the regulatory basis (if any) that this consent supports.

property.name: policyBasis
property.description: A Reference or URL used to uniquely identify the policy the organization will enforce for this Consent. This Reference or URL should be specific to the version of the policy and should be dereferencable to a computable policy of some form.

property.name: policyText
property.description: A Reference to the human readable policy explaining the basis for the Consent.

property.name: verification
property.description: Whether a treatment instruction (e.g. artificial respiration: yes or no) was verified with the patient, his/her family or another authorized person.

property.name: decision
property.description: Action to take - permit or deny - as default.

property.name: provision
property.description: An exception to the base policy of this consent. An exception can be an addition or removal of access permissions.

element.name: PolicyBasis
element.description: A Reference or URL used to uniquely identify the policy the organization will enforce for this Consent. This Reference or URL should be specific to the version of the policy and should be dereferencable to a computable policy of some form.

property.name: reference
property.description: A Reference that identifies the policy the organization will enforce for this Consent.

property.name: url
property.description: A URL that links to a computable version of the policy the organization will enforce for this Consent.

element.name: Verification
element.description: Whether a treatment instruction (e.g. artificial respiration: yes or no) was verified with the patient, his/her family or another authorized person.

property.name: verified
property.description: Has the instruction been verified.

property.name: verificationType
property.description: Extensible list of verification type starting with verification and re-validation.

property.name: verifiedBy
property.description: The person who conducted the verification/validation of the Grantor decision.

property.name: verifiedWith
property.description: Who verified the instruction (Patient, Relative or other Authorized Person).

property.name: verificationDate
property.description: Date(s) verification was collected.

element.name: Provision
element.description: An exception to the base policy of this consent. An exception can be an addition or removal of access permissions.

property.name: period
property.description: Timeframe for this provision.

property.name: actor
property.description: Who or what is controlled by this provision. Use group to identify a set of actors by some property they share (e.g. 'admitting officers').

property.name: action
property.description: Actions controlled by this provision.

property.name: securityLabel
property.description: A security label, comprised of 0..* security label fields (Privacy tags), which define which resources are controlled by this exception.

property.name: purpose
property.description: The context of the activities a user is taking - why the user is accessing the data - that are controlled by this provision.

property.name: documentType
property.description: The documentType(s) covered by this provision. The type can be a CDA document, or some other type that indicates what sort of information the consent relates to.

property.name: resourceType
property.description: The resourceType(s) covered by this provision. The type can be a FHIR resource type or a profile on a type that indicates what information the consent relates to.

property.name: code
property.description: If this code is found in an instance, then the provision applies.

property.name: dataPeriod
property.description: Clinical or Operational Relevant period of time that bounds the data controlled by this provision.

property.name: data
property.description: The resources controlled by this provision if specific resources are referenced.

property.name: expression
property.description: A computable (FHIRPath or other) definition of what is controlled by this consent.

property.name: provision
property.description: Provisions which provide exceptions to the base provision or subprovisions.

property.name: identifier
property.description: The identifier of the coverage as issued by the insurer.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the resource instance.

property.name: kind
property.description: The nature of the coverage be it insurance, or cash payment such as self-pay.

property.name: paymentBy
property.description: Link to the paying party and optionally what specifically they will be responsible to pay.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of coverage: social program, medical plan, accident coverage (workers compensation, auto), group health or payment by an individual or organization.

property.name: policyHolder
property.description: The party who 'owns' the insurance policy.

property.name: subscriber
property.description: The party who has signed-up for or 'owns' the contractual relationship to the policy or to whom the benefit of the policy for services rendered to them or their family is due.

property.name: subscriberId
property.description: The insurer assigned ID for the Subscriber.

property.name: beneficiary
property.description: The party who benefits from the insurance coverage; the patient when products and/or services are provided.

property.name: dependent
property.description: A designator for a dependent under the coverage.

property.name: relationship
property.description: The relationship of beneficiary (patient) to the subscriber.

property.name: period
property.description: Time period during which the coverage is in force. A missing start date indicates the start date isn't known, a missing end date means the coverage is continuing to be in force.

property.name: insurer
property.description: The program or plan underwriter, payor, insurance company.

property.name: class
property.description: A suite of underwriter specific classifiers.

property.name: order
property.description: The order of applicability of this coverage relative to other coverages which are currently in force. Note, there may be gaps in the numbering and this does not imply primary, secondary etc. as the specific positioning of coverages depends upon the episode of care. For example; a patient might have (0) auto insurance (1) their own health insurance and (2) spouse's health insurance. When claiming for treatments which were not the result of an auto accident then only coverages (1) and (2) above would be applicatble and would apply in the order specified in parenthesis.

property.name: network
property.description: The insurer-specific identifier for the insurer-defined network of providers to which the beneficiary may seek treatment which will be covered at the 'in-network' rate, otherwise 'out of network' terms and conditions apply.

property.name: costToBeneficiary
property.description: A suite of codes indicating the cost category and associated amount which have been detailed in the policy and may have been included on the health card.

property.name: subrogation
property.description: When 'subrogation=true' this insurance instance has been included not for adjudication but to provide insurers with the details to recover costs.

property.name: contract
property.description: The policy(s) which constitute this insurance coverage.

property.name: insurancePlan
property.description: The insurance plan details, benefits and costs, which constitute this insurance coverage.

element.name: PaymentBy
element.description: Link to the paying party and optionally what specifically they will be responsible to pay.

property.name: party
property.description: The list of parties providing non-insurance payment for the treatment costs.

property.name: responsibility
property.description: Description of the financial responsibility.

element.name: Class
element.description: A suite of underwriter specific classifiers.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of classification for which an insurer-specific class label or number and optional name is provided. For example, type may be used to identify a class of coverage or employer group, policy, or plan.

property.name: value
property.description: The alphanumeric identifier associated with the insurer issued label.

property.name: name
property.description: A short description for the class.

element.name: CostToBeneficiary
element.description: A suite of codes indicating the cost category and associated amount which have been detailed in the policy and may have been included on the health card.

property.name: type
property.description: The category of patient centric costs associated with treatment.

property.name: category
property.description: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.

property.name: network
property.description: Is a flag to indicate whether the benefits refer to in-network providers or out-of-network providers.

property.name: unit
property.description: Indicates if the benefits apply to an individual or to the family.

property.name: term
property.description: The term or period of the values such as 'maximum lifetime benefit' or 'maximum annual visits'.

property.name: value
property.description: The amount due from the patient for the cost category.

property.name: exception
property.description: A suite of codes indicating exceptions or reductions to patient costs and their effective periods.

resource.name: CoverageEligibilityRequest
resource.description: The CoverageEligibilityRequest provides patient and insurance coverage information to an insurer for them to respond, in the form of an CoverageEligibilityResponse, with information regarding whether the stated coverage is valid and in-force and optionally to provide the insurance details of the policy.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A unique identifier assigned to this coverage eligiblity request.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the resource instance.

property.name: priority
property.description: When the requestor expects the processor to complete processing.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Code to specify whether requesting: prior authorization requirements for some service categories or billing codes; benefits for coverages specified or discovered; discovery and return of coverages for the patient; and/or validation that the specified coverage is in-force at the date/period specified or 'now' if not specified.

property.name: patient
property.description: The party who is the beneficiary of the supplied coverage and for whom eligibility is sought.

property.name: event
property.description: Information code for an event with a corresponding date or period.

property.name: serviced
property.description: The date or dates when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.

property.name: created
property.description: The date when this resource was created.

property.name: enterer
property.description: Person who created the request.

property.name: provider
property.description: The provider which is responsible for the request.

property.name: insurer
property.description: The Insurer who issued the coverage in question and is the recipient of the request.

property.name: facility
property.description: Facility where the services are intended to be provided.

property.name: supportingInfo
property.description: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues.

property.name: insurance
property.description: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services.

property.name: item
property.description: Service categories or billable services for which benefit details and/or an authorization prior to service delivery may be required by the payor.

element.name: Event
element.description: Information code for an event with a corresponding date or period.

property.name: type
property.description: A coded event such as when a service is expected or a card printed.

property.name: when
property.description: A date or period in the past or future indicating when the event occurred or is expectd to occur.

element.name: SupportingInfo
element.description: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues.

property.name: sequence
property.description: A number to uniquely identify supporting information entries.

property.name: information
property.description: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

property.name: appliesToAll
property.description: The supporting materials are applicable for all detail items, product/servce categories and specific billing codes.

element.name: Insurance
element.description: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services.

property.name: focal
property.description: A flag to indicate that this Coverage is to be used for evaluation of this request when set to true.

property.name: coverage
property.description: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.

property.name: businessArrangement
property.description: A business agreement number established between the provider and the insurer for special business processing purposes.

element.name: Item
element.description: Service categories or billable services for which benefit details and/or an authorization prior to service delivery may be required by the payor.

property.name: supportingInfoSequence
property.description: Exceptions, special conditions and supporting information applicable for this service or product line.

property.name: category
property.description: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.

property.name: productOrService
property.description: This contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.

property.name: modifier
property.description: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.

property.name: provider
property.description: The practitioner who is responsible for the product or service to be rendered to the patient.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

property.name: unitPrice
property.description: The amount charged to the patient by the provider for a single unit.

property.name: facility
property.description: Facility where the services will be provided.

property.name: diagnosis
property.description: Patient diagnosis for which care is sought.

property.name: detail
property.description: The plan/proposal/order describing the proposed service in detail.

resource.name: CoverageEligibilityResponse
resource.description: This resource provides eligibility and plan details from the processing of an CoverageEligibilityRequest resource.

property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A unique identifier assigned to this coverage eligiblity request.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the resource instance.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Code to specify whether requesting: prior authorization requirements for some service categories or billing codes; benefits for coverages specified or discovered; discovery and return of coverages for the patient; and/or validation that the specified coverage is in-force at the date/period specified or 'now' if not specified.

property.name: patient
property.description: The party who is the beneficiary of the supplied coverage and for whom eligibility is sought.

property.name: event
property.description: Information code for an event with a corresponding date or period.

property.name: serviced
property.description: The date or dates when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.

property.name: created
property.description: The date this resource was created.

property.name: requestor
property.description: The provider which is responsible for the request.

property.name: request
property.description: Reference to the original request resource.

property.name: outcome
property.description: The outcome of the request processing.

property.name: disposition
property.description: A human readable description of the status of the adjudication.

property.name: insurer
property.description: The Insurer who issued the coverage in question and is the author of the response.

property.name: insurance
property.description: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services.

property.name: preAuthRef
property.description: A reference from the Insurer to which these services pertain to be used on further communication and as proof that the request occurred.

property.name: form
property.description: A code for the form to be used for printing the content.

property.name: error
property.description: Errors encountered during the processing of the request.

element.name: Event
element.description: Information code for an event with a corresponding date or period.

property.name: type
property.description: A coded event such as when a service is expected or a card printed.

property.name: when
property.description: A date or period in the past or future indicating when the event occurred or is expectd to occur.

element.name: Insurance
element.description: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services.

property.name: coverage
property.description: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.

property.name: inforce
property.description: Flag indicating if the coverage provided is inforce currently if no service date(s) specified or for the whole duration of the service dates.

property.name: benefitPeriod
property.description: The term of the benefits documented in this response.

property.name: item
property.description: Benefits and optionally current balances, and authorization details by category or service.

element.name: Error
element.description: Errors encountered during the processing of the request.

property.name: code
property.description: An error code,from a specified code system, which details why the eligibility check could not be performed.

property.name: expression
property.description: A [simple subset of FHIRPath](fhirpath.html#simple) limited to element names, repetition indicators and the default child accessor that identifies one of the elements in the resource that caused this issue to be raised.

resource.name: DetectedIssue
resource.description: Indicates an actual or potential clinical issue with or between one or more active or proposed clinical actions for a patient; e.g. Drug-drug interaction, Ineffective treatment frequency, Procedure-condition conflict, gaps in care, etc.

property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifier associated with the detected issue record.

property.name: status
property.description: Indicates the status of the detected issue.

property.name: category
property.description: A code that classifies the general type of detected issue.

property.name: code
property.description: Identifies the specific type of issue identified.

property.name: severity
property.description: Indicates the degree of importance associated with the identified issue based on the potential impact on the patient.

property.name: subject
property.description: Indicates the subject whose record the detected issue is associated with.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The encounter during which this issue was detected.

property.name: identified
property.description: The date or period when the detected issue was initially identified.

property.name: author
property.description: Individual or device responsible for the issue being raised. For example, a decision support application or a pharmacist conducting a medication review.

property.name: implicated
property.description: Indicates the resource representing the current activity or proposed activity that is potentially problematic.

property.name: evidence
property.description: Supporting evidence or manifestations that provide the basis for identifying the detected issue such as a GuidanceResponse or MeasureReport.

property.name: detail
property.description: A textual explanation of the detected issue.

property.name: reference
property.description: The literature, knowledge-base or similar reference that describes the propensity for the detected issue identified.

property.name: mitigation
property.description: Indicates an action that has been taken or is committed to reduce or eliminate the likelihood of the risk identified by the detected issue from manifesting. Can also reflect an observation of known mitigating factors that may reduce/eliminate the need for any action.

element.name: Evidence
element.description: Supporting evidence or manifestations that provide the basis for identifying the detected issue such as a GuidanceResponse or MeasureReport.

property.name: code
property.description: A manifestation that led to the recording of this detected issue.

property.name: detail
property.description: Links to resources that constitute evidence for the detected issue such as a GuidanceResponse or MeasureReport.

element.name: Mitigation
element.description: Indicates an action that has been taken or is committed to reduce or eliminate the likelihood of the risk identified by the detected issue from manifesting. Can also reflect an observation of known mitigating factors that may reduce/eliminate the need for any action.

property.name: action
property.description: Describes the action that was taken or the observation that was made that reduces/eliminates the risk associated with the identified issue.

property.name: date
property.description: Indicates when the mitigating action was documented.

property.name: author
property.description: Identifies the practitioner who determined the mitigation and takes responsibility for the mitigation step occurring.

property.name: note
property.description: Clinicians may add additional notes or justifications about the mitigation action. For example, patient can have this drug because they have had it before without any issues. Multiple justifications may be provided.

resource.name: Device
resource.description: This resource describes the properties (regulated, has real time clock, etc.), adminstrative (manufacturer name, model number, serial number, firmware, etc.), and type (knee replacement, blood pressure cuff, MRI, etc.) of a physical unit (these values do not change much within a given module, for example the serail number, manufacturer name, and model number). An actual unit may consist of several modules in a distinct hierarchy and these are represented by multiple Device resources and bound through the 'parent' element.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Unique instance identifiers assigned to a device by manufacturers other organizations or owners.

property.name: displayName
property.description: The name used to display by default when the device is referenced. Based on intent of use by the resource creator, this may reflect one of the names in Device.name, or may be another simple name.

property.name: definition
property.description: The reference to the definition for the device.

property.name: udiCarrier
property.description: Unique device identifier (UDI) assigned to device label or package. Note that the Device may include multiple udiCarriers as it either may include just the udiCarrier for the jurisdiction it is sold, or for multiple jurisdictions it could have been sold.

property.name: status
property.description: The Device record status. This is not the status of the device like availability.

property.name: availabilityStatus
property.description: The availability of the device.

property.name: biologicalSourceEvent
property.description: An identifier that supports traceability to the event during which material in this product from one or more biological entities was obtained or pooled.

property.name: manufacturer
property.description: A name of the manufacturer or entity legally responsible for the device.

property.name: manufactureDate
property.description: The date and time when the device was manufactured.

property.name: expirationDate
property.description: The date and time beyond which this device is no longer valid or should not be used (if applicable).

property.name: lotNumber
property.description: Lot number assigned by the manufacturer.

property.name: serialNumber
property.description: The serial number assigned by the organization when the device was manufactured.

property.name: name
property.description: This represents the manufacturer's name of the device as provided by the device, from a UDI label, or by a person describing the Device. This typically would be used when a person provides the name(s) or when the device represents one of the names available from DeviceDefinition.

property.name: modelNumber
property.description: The manufacturer's model number for the device.

property.name: partNumber
property.description: The part number or catalog number of the device.

property.name: category
property.description: Devices may be associated with one or more categories.

property.name: type
property.description: The kind or type of device. A device instance may have more than one type - in which case those are the types that apply to the specific instance of the device.

property.name: version
property.description: The actual design of the device or software version running on the device.

property.name: conformsTo
property.description: Identifies the standards, specifications, or formal guidances for the capabilities supported by the device. The device may be certified as conformant to these specifications e.g., communication, performance, process, measurement, or specialization standards.

property.name: property
property.description: Static or essentially fixed characteristics or features of the device (e.g., time or timing attributes, resolution, accuracy, intended use or instructions for use, and physical attributes) that are not otherwise captured in more specific attributes.

property.name: mode
property.description: The designated condition for performing a task with the device.

property.name: cycle
property.description: The series of occurrences that repeats during the operation of the device.

property.name: duration
property.description: A measurement of time during the device's operation (e.g., days, hours, mins, etc.).

property.name: owner
property.description: An organization that is responsible for the provision and ongoing maintenance of the device.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details for an organization or a particular human that is responsible for the device.

property.name: location
property.description: The place where the device can be found.

property.name: url
property.description: A network address on which the device may be contacted directly.

property.name: endpoint
property.description: Technical endpoints providing access to services provided by the device defined at this resource.

property.name: gateway
property.description: The linked device acting as a communication controller, data collector, translator, or concentrator for the current device (e.g., mobile phone application that relays a blood pressure device's data).

property.name: note
property.description: Descriptive information, usage information or implantation information that is not captured in an existing element.

property.name: safety
property.description: Provides additional safety characteristics about a medical device. For example devices containing latex.

property.name: parent
property.description: The higher level or encompassing device that this device is a logical part of.

element.name: UdiCarrier
element.description: Unique device identifier (UDI) assigned to device label or package. Note that the Device may include multiple udiCarriers as it either may include just the udiCarrier for the jurisdiction it is sold, or for multiple jurisdictions it could have been sold.

property.name: deviceIdentifier
property.description: The device identifier (DI) is a mandatory, fixed portion of a UDI that identifies the labeler and the specific version or model of a device.

property.name: issuer
property.description: Organization that is charged with issuing UDIs for devices. For example, the US FDA issuers include: 1) GS1: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/gs1-di, 2) HIBCC: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/hibcc-diI, 3) ICCBBA for blood containers: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-blood-di, 4) ICCBA for other devices: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-other-di # Informationsstelle fr Arzneispezialitten (IFA GmbH) (EU only): http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/ifa-gmbh-di.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: The identity of the authoritative source for UDI generation within a jurisdiction. All UDIs are globally unique within a single namespace with the appropriate repository uri as the system. For example, UDIs of devices managed in the U.S. by the FDA, the value is http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/us-fda-udi or in the European Union by the European Commission http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/eu-ec-udi.

property.name: carrierAIDC
property.description: The full UDI carrier of the Automatic Identification and Data Capture (AIDC) technology representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device - e.g., a barcode or RFID. Because of limitations on character sets in XML and the need to round-trip JSON data through XML, AIDC Formats *SHALL* be base64 encoded.

property.name: carrierHRF
property.description: The full UDI carrier as the human readable form (HRF) representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device.

property.name: entryType
property.description: A coded entry to indicate how the data was entered.

element.name: Name
element.description: This represents the manufacturer's name of the device as provided by the device, from a UDI label, or by a person describing the Device. This typically would be used when a person provides the name(s) or when the device represents one of the names available from DeviceDefinition.

property.name: value
property.description: The actual name that identifies the device.

property.name: type
property.description: Indicates the kind of name. RegisteredName | UserFriendlyName | PatientReportedName.

property.name: display
property.description: Indicates the default or preferred name to be displayed.

element.name: Version
element.description: The actual design of the device or software version running on the device.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of the device version, e.g. manufacturer, approved, internal.

property.name: component
property.description: The hardware or software module of the device to which the version applies.

property.name: installDate
property.description: The date the version was installed on the device.

property.name: value
property.description: The version text.

element.name: ConformsTo
element.description: Identifies the standards, specifications, or formal guidances for the capabilities supported by the device. The device may be certified as conformant to these specifications e.g., communication, performance, process, measurement, or specialization standards.

property.name: category
property.description: Describes the type of the standard, specification, or formal guidance.

property.name: specification
property.description: Code that identifies the specific standard, specification, protocol, formal guidance, regulation, legislation, or certification scheme to which the device adheres.

property.name: version
property.description: Identifies the specific form or variant of the standard, specification, or formal guidance. This may be a 'version number', release, document edition, publication year, or other label.

element.name: Property
element.description: Static or essentially fixed characteristics or features of the device (e.g., time or timing attributes, resolution, accuracy, intended use or instructions for use, and physical attributes) that are not otherwise captured in more specific attributes.

property.name: type
property.description: Code that specifies the property, such as resolution, color, size, being represented.

property.name: value
property.description: The value of the property specified by the associated property.type code.

resource.name: DeviceAssociation
resource.description: A record of association of a device.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Instance identifier.

property.name: device
property.description: Reference to the devices associated with the patient or group.

property.name: category
property.description: Describes the relationship between the device and subject.

property.name: status
property.description: Indicates the state of the Device association.

property.name: statusReason
property.description: The reasons given for the current association status.

property.name: subject
property.description: The individual, group of individuals or device that the device is on or associated with.

property.name: bodyStructure
property.description: Current anatomical location of the device in/on subject.

property.name: period
property.description: Begin and end dates and times for the device association.

property.name: operation
property.description: The details about the device when it is in use to describe its operation.

element.name: Operation
element.description: The details about the device when it is in use to describe its operation.

property.name: status
property.description: Device operational condition corresponding to the association.

property.name: operator
property.description: The individual performing the action enabled by the device.

property.name: period
property.description: Begin and end dates and times for the device's operation.
