property.name: identifier
property.description: Unique instance identifiers assigned to a device by the software, manufacturers, other organizations or owners. For example: handle ID. The identifier is typically valued if the udiDeviceIdentifier, partNumber or modelNumber is not valued and represents a different type of identifier. However, it is permissible to still include those identifiers in DeviceDefinition.identifier with the appropriate identifier.type.

property.name: udiDeviceIdentifier
property.description: Unique device identifier (UDI) assigned to device label or package. Note that the Device may include multiple udiCarriers as it either may include just the udiCarrier for the jurisdiction it is sold, or for multiple jurisdictions it could have been sold.

property.name: regulatoryIdentifier
property.description: Identifier associated with the regulatory documentation (certificates, technical documentation, post-market surveillance documentation and reports) of a set of device models sharing the same intended purpose, risk class and essential design and manufacturing characteristics. One example is the Basic UDI-DI in Europe.

property.name: partNumber
property.description: The part number or catalog number of the device.

property.name: manufacturer
property.description: A name of the manufacturer or legal representative e.g. labeler. Whether this is the actual manufacturer or the labeler or responsible depends on implementation and jurisdiction.

property.name: deviceName
property.description: The name or names of the device as given by the manufacturer.

property.name: modelNumber
property.description: The model number for the device for example as defined by the manufacturer or labeler, or other agency.

property.name: classification
property.description: What kind of device or device system this is.

property.name: conformsTo
property.description: Identifies the standards, specifications, or formal guidances for the capabilities supported by the device. The device may be certified as conformant to these specifications e.g., communication, performance, process, measurement, or specialization standards.

property.name: hasPart
property.description: A device that is part (for example a component) of the present device.

property.name: packaging
property.description: Information about the packaging of the device, i.e. how the device is packaged.

property.name: version
property.description: The version of the device or software.

property.name: safety
property.description: Safety characteristics of the device.

property.name: shelfLifeStorage
property.description: Shelf Life and storage information.

property.name: languageCode
property.description: Language code for the human-readable text strings produced by the device (all supported).

property.name: property
property.description: Static or essentially fixed characteristics or features of this kind of device that are otherwise not captured in more specific attributes, e.g., time or timing attributes, resolution, accuracy, and physical attributes.

property.name: owner
property.description: An organization that is responsible for the provision and ongoing maintenance of the device.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details for an organization or a particular human that is responsible for the device.

property.name: link
property.description: An associated device, attached to, used with, communicating with or linking a previous or new device model to the focal device.

property.name: note
property.description: Descriptive information, usage information or implantation information that is not captured in an existing element.

property.name: material
property.description: A substance used to create the material(s) of which the device is made.

property.name: productionIdentifierInUDI
property.description: Indicates the production identifier(s) that are expected to appear in the UDI carrier on the device label.

property.name: guideline
property.description: Information aimed at providing directions for the usage of this model of device.

property.name: correctiveAction
property.description: Tracking of latest field safety corrective action.

property.name: chargeItem
property.description: Billing code or reference associated with the device.

element.name: UdiDeviceIdentifier
element.description: Unique device identifier (UDI) assigned to device label or package. Note that the Device may include multiple udiCarriers as it either may include just the udiCarrier for the jurisdiction it is sold, or for multiple jurisdictions it could have been sold.

property.name: deviceIdentifier
property.description: The identifier that is to be associated with every Device that references this DeviceDefintiion for the issuer and jurisdiction provided in the DeviceDefinition.udiDeviceIdentifier.

property.name: issuer
property.description: The organization that assigns the identifier algorithm.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: The jurisdiction to which the deviceIdentifier applies.

property.name: marketDistribution
property.description: Indicates where and when the device is available on the market.

element.name: RegulatoryIdentifier
element.description: Identifier associated with the regulatory documentation (certificates, technical documentation, post-market surveillance documentation and reports) of a set of device models sharing the same intended purpose, risk class and essential design and manufacturing characteristics. One example is the Basic UDI-DI in Europe.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of identifier itself.

property.name: deviceIdentifier
property.description: The identifier itself.

property.name: issuer
property.description: The organization that issued this identifier.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: The jurisdiction to which the deviceIdentifier applies.

element.name: DeviceName
element.description: The name or names of the device as given by the manufacturer.

property.name: name
property.description: A human-friendly name that is used to refer to the device - depending on the type, it can be the brand name, the common name or alias, or other.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of deviceName. RegisteredName | UserFriendlyName | PatientReportedName.

element.name: Classification
element.description: What kind of device or device system this is.

property.name: type
property.description: A classification or risk class of the device model.

property.name: justification
property.description: Further information qualifying this classification of the device model.

element.name: ConformsTo
element.description: Identifies the standards, specifications, or formal guidances for the capabilities supported by the device. The device may be certified as conformant to these specifications e.g., communication, performance, process, measurement, or specialization standards.

property.name: category
property.description: Describes the type of the standard, specification, or formal guidance.

property.name: specification
property.description: Code that identifies the specific standard, specification, protocol, formal guidance, regulation, legislation, or certification scheme to which the device adheres.

property.name: version
property.description: Identifies the specific form or variant of the standard, specification, or formal guidance. This may be a 'version number', release, document edition, publication year, or other label.

property.name: source
property.description: Standard, regulation, certification, or guidance website, document, or other publication, or similar, supporting the conformance.

element.name: HasPart
element.description: A device that is part (for example a component) of the present device.

property.name: reference
property.description: Reference to the device that is part of the current device.

property.name: count
property.description: Number of instances of the component device in the current device.

element.name: Packaging
element.description: Information about the packaging of the device, i.e. how the device is packaged.

property.name: identifier
property.description: The business identifier of the packaged medication.

property.name: type
property.description: A code that defines the specific type of packaging.

property.name: count
property.description: The number of items contained in the package (devices or sub-packages).

property.name: distributor
property.description: An organization that distributes the packaged device.

property.name: udiDeviceIdentifier
property.description: Unique Device Identifier (UDI) Barcode string on the packaging.

property.name: packaging
property.description: Allows packages within packages.

element.name: Version
element.description: The version of the device or software.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of the device version, e.g. manufacturer, approved, internal.

property.name: component
property.description: The hardware or software module of the device to which the version applies.

property.name: value
property.description: The version text.

element.name: Property
element.description: Static or essentially fixed characteristics or features of this kind of device that are otherwise not captured in more specific attributes, e.g., time or timing attributes, resolution, accuracy, and physical attributes.

property.name: type
property.description: Code that specifies the property such as a resolution or color being represented.

property.name: value
property.description: The value of the property specified by the associated property.type code.

element.name: Link
element.description: An associated device, attached to, used with, communicating with or linking a previous or new device model to the focal device.

property.name: relation
property.description: The type indicates the relationship of the related device to the device instance.

property.name: relatedDevice
property.description: A reference to the linked device.

element.name: Material
element.description: A substance used to create the material(s) of which the device is made.

property.name: substance
property.description: A substance that the device contains, may contain, or is made of - for example latex - to be used to determine patient compatibility. This is not intended to represent the composition of the device, only the clinically relevant materials.

property.name: alternate
property.description: Indicates an alternative material of the device.

property.name: allergenicIndicator
property.description: Whether the substance is a known or suspected allergen.

element.name: Guideline
element.description: Information aimed at providing directions for the usage of this model of device.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The circumstances that form the setting for using the device.

property.name: usageInstruction
property.description: Detailed written and visual directions for the user on how to use the device.

property.name: relatedArtifact
property.description: A source of information or reference for this guideline.

property.name: indication
property.description: A clinical condition for which the device was designed to be used.

property.name: contraindication
property.description: A specific situation when a device should not be used because it may cause harm.

property.name: warning
property.description: Specific hazard alert information that a user needs to know before using the device.

property.name: intendedUse
property.description: A description of the general purpose or medical use of the device or its function.

element.name: CorrectiveAction
element.description: Tracking of latest field safety corrective action.

property.name: recall
property.description: Whether the last corrective action known for this device was a recall.

property.name: scope
property.description: The scope of the corrective action - whether the action targeted all units of a given device model, or only a specific set of batches identified by lot numbers, or individually identified devices identified by the serial name.

property.name: period
property.description: Start and end dates of the corrective action.

element.name: ChargeItem
element.description: Billing code or reference associated with the device.

property.name: chargeItemCode
property.description: The code or reference for the charge item.

property.name: count
property.description: Coefficient applicable to the billing code.

property.name: effectivePeriod
property.description: A specific time period in which this charge item applies.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The context to which this charge item applies.

resource.name: DeviceDispense
resource.description: Indicates that a device is to be or has been dispensed for a named person/patient. This includes a description of the product (supply) provided and the instructions for using the device.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifier for this dispensation.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: The order or request that this dispense is fulfilling.

property.name: partOf
property.description: The bigger event that this dispense is a part of.

property.name: status
property.description: A code specifying the state of the set of dispense events.

property.name: statusReason
property.description: Indicates the reason why a dispense was or was not performed.

property.name: category
property.description: Indicates the type of device dispense.

property.name: device
property.description: Identifies the device being dispensed. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the device or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the device from a known list of devices.

property.name: subject
property.description: A link to a resource representing the person to whom the device is intended.

property.name: receiver
property.description: Identifies the person who picked up the device or the person or location where the device was delivered. This may be a patient or their caregiver, but some cases exist where it can be a healthcare professional or a location.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The encounter that establishes the context for this event.

property.name: supportingInformation
property.description: Additional information that supports the device being dispensed.

property.name: performer
property.description: Indicates who or what performed the event.

property.name: location
property.description: The principal physical location where the dispense was performed.

property.name: type
property.description: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The number of devices that have been dispensed.

property.name: preparedDate
property.description: The time when the dispensed product was packaged and reviewed.

property.name: whenHandedOver
property.description: The time the dispensed product was made available to the patient or their representative.

property.name: destination
property.description: Identification of the facility/location where the device was /should be shipped to, as part of the dispense process.

property.name: note
property.description: Extra information about the dispense that could not be conveyed in the other attributes.

property.name: usageInstruction
property.description: The full representation of the instructions.

property.name: eventHistory
property.description: A summary of the events of interest that have occurred, such as when the dispense was verified.

element.name: Performer
element.description: Indicates who or what performed the event.

property.name: function
property.description: Distinguishes the type of performer in the dispense. For example, date enterer, packager, final checker.

property.name: actor
property.description: The device, practitioner, etc. who performed the action. It should be assumed that the actor is the dispenser of the device.

resource.name: DeviceMetric
resource.description: Describes a measurement, calculation or setting capability of a device. The DeviceMetric resource is derived from the ISO/IEEE 11073-10201 Domain Information Model standard, but is more widely applicable.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Instance identifiers assigned to a device, by the device or gateway software, manufacturers, other organizations or owners. For example, handle ID.

property.name: type
property.description: Describes the type of the metric. For example: Heart Rate, PEEP Setting, etc.

property.name: unit
property.description: Describes the unit that an observed value determined for this metric will have. For example: Percent, Seconds, etc.

property.name: device
property.description: Describes the link to the Device. This is also known as a channel device.

property.name: operationalStatus
property.description: Indicates current operational state of the device. For example: On, Off, Standby, etc.

property.name: color
property.description: The preferred color associated with the metric (e.g., display color). This is often used to aid clinicians to track and identify parameter types by color. In practice, consider a Patient Monitor that has ECG/HR and Pleth; the metrics are displayed in different characteristic colors, such as HR in blue, BP in green, and PR and SpO2 in magenta.

property.name: category
property.description: Indicates the category of the observation generation process. A DeviceMetric can be for example a setting, measurement, or calculation.

property.name: measurementFrequency
property.description: The frequency at which the metric is taken or recorded. Devices measure metrics at a wide range of frequencies; for example, an ECG might sample measurements in the millisecond range, while an NIBP might trigger only once an hour. Less often, the measurementFrequency may be based on a unit other than time, such as distance (e.g. for a measuring wheel). The update period may be different than the measurement frequency, if the device does not update the published observed value with the same frequency as it was measured.

property.name: calibration
property.description: Describes the calibrations that have been performed or that are required to be performed.

element.name: Calibration
element.description: Describes the calibrations that have been performed or that are required to be performed.

property.name: type
property.description: Describes the type of the calibration method.

property.name: state
property.description: Describes the state of the calibration.

property.name: time
property.description: Describes the time last calibration has been performed.

resource.name: DeviceRequest
resource.description: Represents a request a device to be provided to a specific patient. The device may be an implantable device to be subsequently implanted, or an external assistive device, such as a walker, to be delivered and subsequently be used.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifiers assigned to this order by the orderer or by the receiver.

property.name: instantiatesCanonical
property.description: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this DeviceRequest.

property.name: instantiatesUri
property.description: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this DeviceRequest.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: Plan/proposal/order fulfilled by this request.

property.name: replaces
property.description: The request takes the place of the referenced completed or terminated request(s).

property.name: groupIdentifier
property.description: A shared identifier common to multiple independent Request instances that were activated/authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author. The presence of the same identifier on each request ties those requests together and may have business ramifications in terms of reporting of results, billing, etc. E.g. a requisition number shared by a set of lab tests ordered together, or a prescription number shared by all meds ordered at one time.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the request.

property.name: intent
property.description: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, an original order or a reflex order.

property.name: priority
property.description: Indicates how quickly the request should be addressed with respect to other requests.

property.name: doNotPerform
property.description: If true, indicates that the provider is asking for the patient to either stop using or to not start using the specified device or category of devices. For example, the patient has undergone surgery and the provider is indicating that the patient should not wear contact lenses.

property.name: code
property.description: The details of the device to be used.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The number of devices to be provided.

property.name: parameter
property.description: Specific parameters for the ordered item. For example, the prism value for lenses.

property.name: subject
property.description: The patient who will use the device.

property.name: encounter
property.description: An encounter that provides additional context in which this request is made.

property.name: occurrence
property.description: The timing schedule for the use of the device. The Schedule data type allows many different expressions, for example. "Every 8 hours"; "Three times a day"; "1/2 an hour before breakfast for 10 days from 23-Dec 2011:"; "15 Oct 2013, 17 Oct 2013 and 1 Nov 2013".

property.name: authoredOn
property.description: When the request transitioned to being actionable.

property.name: requester
property.description: The individual or entity who initiated the request and has responsibility for its activation.

property.name: performer
property.description: The desired individual or entity to provide the device to the subject of the request (e.g., patient, location).

property.name: reason
property.description: Reason or justification for the use of this device.

property.name: asNeeded
property.description: This status is to indicate whether the request is a PRN or may be given as needed.

property.name: asNeededFor
property.description: The reason for using the device.

property.name: insurance
property.description: Insurance plans, coverage extensions, pre-authorizations and/or pre-determinations that may be required for delivering the requested service.

property.name: supportingInfo
property.description: Additional clinical information about the patient that may influence the request fulfilment. For example, this may include where on the subject's body the device will be used (i.e. the target site).

property.name: note
property.description: Details about this request that were not represented at all or sufficiently in one of the attributes provided in a class. These may include for example a comment, an instruction, or a note associated with the statement.

property.name: relevantHistory
property.description: Key events in the history of the request.

element.name: Parameter
element.description: Specific parameters for the ordered item. For example, the prism value for lenses.

property.name: code
property.description: A code or string that identifies the device detail being asserted.

property.name: value
property.description: The value of the device detail.

resource.name: DeviceUsage
resource.description: A record of a device being used by a patient where the record is the result of a report from the patient or a clinician.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: identifier
property.description: An external identifier for this statement such as an IRI.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this DeviceUsage.

property.name: status
property.description: A code representing the patient or other source's judgment about the state of the device used that this statement is about. Generally this will be active or completed.

property.name: category
property.description: This attribute indicates a category for the statement - The device statement may be made in an inpatient or outpatient settting (inpatient | outpatient | community | patientspecified).

property.name: patient
property.description: The patient who used the device.

property.name: derivedFrom
property.description: Allows linking the DeviceUsage to the underlying Request, or to other information that supports or is used to derive the DeviceUsage.

property.name: context
property.description: The encounter or episode of care that establishes the context for this device use statement.

property.name: timing
property.description: How often the device was used.

property.name: dateAsserted
property.description: The time at which the statement was recorded by informationSource.

property.name: usageStatus
property.description: The status of the device usage, for example always, sometimes, never. This is not the same as the status of the statement.

property.name: usageReason
property.description: The reason for asserting the usage status - for example forgot, lost, stolen, broken.

property.name: adherence
property.description: This indicates how or if the device is being used.

property.name: informationSource
property.description: Who reported the device was being used by the patient.

property.name: device
property.description: Code or Reference to device used.

property.name: reason
property.description: Reason or justification for the use of the device. A coded concept, or another resource whose existence justifies this DeviceUsage.

property.name: bodySite
property.description: Indicates the anotomic location on the subject's body where the device was used ( i.e. the target).

property.name: note
property.description: Details about the device statement that were not represented at all or sufficiently in one of the attributes provided in a class. These may include for example a comment, an instruction, or a note associated with the statement.

element.name: Adherence
element.description: This indicates how or if the device is being used.

property.name: code
property.description: Type of adherence.

property.name: reason
property.description: Reason for adherence type.

resource.name: DiagnosticReport
resource.description: The findings and interpretation of diagnostic tests performed on patients, groups of patients, products, substances, devices, and locations, and/or specimens derived from these. The report includes clinical context such as requesting provider information, and some mix of atomic results, images, textual and coded interpretations, and formatted representation of diagnostic reports. The report also includes non-clinical context such as batch analysis and stability reporting of products and substances.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifiers assigned to this report by the performer or other systems.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: Details concerning a service requested.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the diagnostic report.

property.name: category
property.description: A code that classifies the clinical discipline, department or diagnostic service that created the report (e.g. cardiology, biochemistry, hematology, MRI). This is used for searching, sorting and display purposes.

property.name: code
property.description: A code or name that describes this diagnostic report.

property.name: subject
property.description: The subject of the report. Usually, but not always, this is a patient. However, diagnostic services also perform analyses on specimens collected from a variety of other sources.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The healthcare event (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) which this DiagnosticReport is about.

property.name: effective
property.description: The time or time-period the observed values are related to. When the subject of the report is a patient, this is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection(s), but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

property.name: issued
property.description: The date and time that this version of the report was made available to providers, typically after the report was reviewed and verified.

property.name: performer
property.description: The diagnostic service that is responsible for issuing the report.

property.name: resultsInterpreter
property.description: The practitioner or organization that is responsible for the report's conclusions and interpretations.

property.name: specimen
property.description: Details about the specimens on which this diagnostic report is based.

property.name: result
property.description: [Observations](observation.html) that are part of this diagnostic report.

property.name: note
property.description: Comments about the diagnostic report.

property.name: study
property.description: One or more links to full details of any study performed during the diagnostic investigation. An ImagingStudy might comprise a set of radiologic images obtained via a procedure that are analyzed as a group. Typically, this is imaging performed by DICOM enabled modalities, but this is not required. A fully enabled PACS viewer can use this information to provide views of the source images. A GenomicStudy might comprise one or more analyses, each serving a specific purpose. These analyses may vary in method (e.g., karyotyping, CNV, or SNV detection), performer, software, devices used, or regions targeted.

property.name: supportingInfo
property.description: This backbone element contains supporting information that was used in the creation of the report not included in the results already included in the report.

property.name: media
property.description: A list of key images or data associated with this report. The images or data are generally created during the diagnostic process, and may be directly of the patient, or of treated specimens (i.e. slides of interest).

property.name: composition
property.description: Reference to a Composition resource instance that provides structure for organizing the contents of the DiagnosticReport.

property.name: conclusion
property.description: Concise and clinically contextualized summary conclusion (interpretation/impression) of the diagnostic report.

property.name: conclusionCode
property.description: One or more codes that represent the summary conclusion (interpretation/impression) of the diagnostic report.

property.name: presentedForm
property.description: Rich text representation of the entire result as issued by the diagnostic service. Multiple formats are allowed but they SHALL be semantically equivalent.

element.name: SupportingInfo
element.description: This backbone element contains supporting information that was used in the creation of the report not included in the results already included in the report.

property.name: type
property.description: The code value for the role of the supporting information in the diagnostic report.

property.name: reference
property.description: The reference for the supporting information in the diagnostic report.

element.name: Media
element.description: A list of key images or data associated with this report. The images or data are generally created during the diagnostic process, and may be directly of the patient, or of treated specimens (i.e. slides of interest).

property.name: comment
property.description: A comment about the image or data. Typically, this is used to provide an explanation for why the image or data is included, or to draw the viewer's attention to important features.

property.name: link
property.description: Reference to the image or data source.

resource.name: DocumentReference
resource.description: A reference to a document of any kind for any purpose. While the term "document" implies a more narrow focus, for this resource this "document" encompasses *any* serialized object with a mime-type, it includes formal patient-centric documents (CDA), clinical notes, scanned paper, non-patient specific documents like policy text, as well as a photo, video, or audio recording acquired or used in healthcare. The DocumentReference resource provides metadata about the document so that the document can be discovered and managed. The actual content may be inline base64 encoded data or provided by direct reference.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Other business identifiers associated with the document, including version independent identifiers.

property.name: version
property.description: An explicitly assigned identifer of a variation of the content in the DocumentReference.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A procedure that is fulfilled in whole or in part by the creation of this media.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this document reference.

property.name: docStatus
property.description: The status of the underlying document.

property.name: modality
property.description: Imaging modality used. This may include both acquisition and non-acquisition modalities.

property.name: type
property.description: Specifies the particular kind of document referenced (e.g. History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Progress Note). This usually equates to the purpose of making the document referenced.

property.name: category
property.description: A categorization for the type of document referenced - helps for indexing and searching. This may be implied by or derived from the code specified in the DocumentReference.type.

property.name: subject
property.description: Who or what the document is about. The document can be about a person, (patient or healthcare practitioner), a device (e.g. a machine) or even a group of subjects (such as a document about a herd of farm animals, or a set of patients that share a common exposure).

property.name: context
property.description: Describes the clinical encounter or type of care that the document content is associated with.

property.name: event
property.description: This list of codes represents the main clinical acts, such as a colonoscopy or an appendectomy, being documented. In some cases, the event is inherent in the type Code, such as a "History and Physical Report" in which the procedure being documented is necessarily a "History and Physical" act.

property.name: bodySite
property.description: The anatomic structures included in the document.

property.name: facilityType
property.description: The kind of facility where the patient was seen.

property.name: practiceSetting
property.description: This property may convey specifics about the practice setting where the content was created, often reflecting the clinical specialty.

property.name: period
property.description: The time period over which the service that is described by the document was provided.

property.name: date
property.description: When the document reference was created.

property.name: author
property.description: Identifies who is responsible for adding the information to the document.

property.name: attester
property.description: A participant who has authenticated the accuracy of the document.

property.name: custodian
property.description: Identifies the organization or group who is responsible for ongoing maintenance of and access to the document.

property.name: relatesTo
property.description: Relationships that this document has with other document references that already exist.

property.name: description
property.description: Human-readable description of the source document.

property.name: securityLabel
property.description: A set of Security-Tag codes specifying the level of privacy/security of the Document found at DocumentReference.content.attachment.url. Note that DocumentReference.meta.security contains the security labels of the data elements in DocumentReference, while DocumentReference.securityLabel contains the security labels for the document the reference refers to. The distinction recognizes that the document may contain sensitive information, while the DocumentReference is metadata about the document and thus might not be as sensitive as the document. For example: a psychotherapy episode may contain highly sensitive information, while the metadata may simply indicate that some episode happened.

property.name: content
property.description: The document and format referenced. If there are multiple content element repetitions, these must all represent the same document in different format, or attachment metadata.

element.name: Attester
element.description: A participant who has authenticated the accuracy of the document.

property.name: mode
property.description: The type of attestation the authenticator offers.

property.name: time
property.description: When the document was attested by the party.

property.name: party
property.description: Who attested the document in the specified way.

element.name: RelatesTo
element.description: Relationships that this document has with other document references that already exist.

property.name: code
property.description: The type of relationship that this document has with anther document.

property.name: target
property.description: The target document of this relationship.

element.name: Content
element.description: The document and format referenced. If there are multiple content element repetitions, these must all represent the same document in different format, or attachment metadata.

property.name: attachment
property.description: The document or URL of the document along with critical metadata to prove content has integrity.

property.name: profile
property.description: An identifier of the document constraints, encoding, structure, and template that the document conforms to beyond the base format indicated in the mimeType.

resource.name: Encounter
resource.description: An interaction between healthcare provider(s), and/or patient(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of patient(s).

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language

property.name: text

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of the encounter (not the state of the patient within the encounter - that is subjectState).

property.name: class
property.description: Concepts representing classification of patient encounter such as ambulatory (outpatient), inpatient, emergency, home health or others due to local variations.

property.name: priority
property.description: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

property.name: type
property.description: Specific type of encounter (e.g. e-mail consultation, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation).

property.name: serviceType
property.description: Broad categorization of the service that is to be provided (e.g. cardiology).

property.name: subject
property.description: The patient or group related to this encounter. In some use-cases the patient MAY not be present, such as a case meeting about a patient between several practitioners or a careteam.

property.name: subjectStatus
property.description: The subjectStatus value can be used to track the patient's status within the encounter. It details whether the patient has arrived or departed, has been triaged or is currently in a waiting status.

property.name: episodeOfCare
property.description: Where a specific encounter should be classified as a part of a specific episode(s) of care this field should be used. This association can facilitate grouping of related encounters together for a specific purpose, such as government reporting, issue tracking, association via a common problem. The association is recorded on the encounter as these are typically created after the episode of care and grouped on entry rather than editing the episode of care to append another encounter to it (the episode of care could span years).

property.name: basedOn
property.description: The request this encounter satisfies (e.g. incoming referral or procedure request).

property.name: careTeam
property.description: The group(s) of individuals, organizations that are allocated to participate in this encounter. The participants backbone will record the actuals of when these individuals participated during the encounter.

property.name: partOf
property.description: Another Encounter of which this encounter is a part of (administratively or in time).

property.name: serviceProvider
property.description: The organization that is primarily responsible for this Encounter's services. This MAY be the same as the organization on the Patient record, however it could be different, such as if the actor performing the services was from an external organization (which may be billed seperately) for an external consultation. Refer to the colonoscopy example on the Encounter examples tab.

property.name: participant
property.description: The list of people responsible for providing the service.

property.name: appointment
property.description: The appointment that scheduled this encounter.

property.name: virtualService
property.description: Connection details of a virtual service (e.g. conference call).

property.name: actualPeriod
property.description: The actual start and end time of the encounter.

property.name: plannedStartDate
property.description: The planned start date/time (or admission date) of the encounter.

property.name: plannedEndDate
property.description: The planned end date/time (or discharge date) of the encounter.

property.name: length
property.description: Actual quantity of time the encounter lasted. This excludes the time during leaves of absence. When missing it is the time in between the start and end values.

property.name: reason
property.description: The list of medical reasons that are expected to be addressed during the episode of care.

property.name: diagnosis
property.description: The list of diagnosis relevant to this encounter.

property.name: account
property.description: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter.

property.name: dietPreference
property.description: Diet preferences reported by the patient.

property.name: specialArrangement
property.description: Any special requests that have been made for this encounter, such as the provision of specific equipment or other things.

property.name: specialCourtesy
property.description: Special courtesies that may be provided to the patient during the encounter (VIP, board member, professional courtesy).

property.name: admission
property.description: Details about the stay during which a healthcare service is provided. This does not describe the event of admitting the patient, but rather any information that is relevant from the time of admittance until the time of discharge.

property.name: location
property.description: List of locations where the patient has been during this encounter.

element.name: Participant
element.description: The list of people responsible for providing the service.

property.name: type
property.description: Role of participant in encounter.

property.name: period
property.description: The period of time that the specified participant participated in the encounter. These can overlap or be sub-sets of the overall encounter's period.

property.name: actor
property.description: Person involved in the encounter, the patient/group is also included here to indicate that the patient was actually participating in the encounter. Not including the patient here covers use cases such as a case meeting between practitioners about a patient - non contact times.

element.name: Reason
element.description: The list of medical reasons that are expected to be addressed during the episode of care.

property.name: use
property.description: What the reason value should be used as e.g. Chief Complaint, Health Concern, Health Maintenance (including screening).

property.name: value
property.description: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code or a reference to another resource. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

element.name: Diagnosis
element.description: The list of diagnosis relevant to this encounter.

property.name: condition
property.description: The coded diagnosis or a reference to a Condition (with other resources referenced in the evidence.detail), the use property will indicate the purpose of this specific diagnosis.

property.name: use
property.description: Role that this diagnosis has within the encounter (e.g. admission, billing, discharge ...).

element.name: Admission
element.description: Details about the stay during which a healthcare service is provided. This does not describe the event of admitting the patient, but rather any information that is relevant from the time of admittance until the time of discharge.

property.name: preAdmissionIdentifier
property.description: Pre-admission identifier.

property.name: origin
property.description: The location/organization from which the patient came before admission.

property.name: admitSource
property.description: From where patient was admitted (physician referral, transfer).

property.name: reAdmission
property.description: Indicates that this encounter is directly related to a prior admission, often because the conditions addressed in the prior admission were not fully addressed.

property.name: destination
property.description: Location/organization to which the patient is discharged.

property.name: dischargeDisposition
property.description: Category or kind of location after discharge.

element.name: Location
element.description: List of locations where the patient has been during this encounter.

property.name: location
property.description: The location where the encounter takes place.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the participants' presence at the specified location during the period specified. If the participant is no longer at the location, then the period will have an end date/time.

property.name: form
property.description: This will be used to specify the required levels (bed/ward/room/etc.) desired to be recorded to simplify either messaging or query.

property.name: period
property.description: Time period during which the patient was present at the location.

resource.name: EncounterHistory
resource.description: A record of significant events/milestones key data throughout the history of an Encounter

property.name: encounter
property.description: The Encounter associated with this set of historic values.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known.

property.name: status
property.description: planned | in-progress | on-hold | discharged | completed | cancelled | discontinued | entered-in-error | unknown.

property.name: class
property.description: Concepts representing classification of patient encounter such as ambulatory (outpatient), inpatient, emergency, home health or others due to local variations.

property.name: type
property.description: Specific type of encounter (e.g. e-mail consultation, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation).

property.name: serviceType
property.description: Broad categorization of the service that is to be provided (e.g. cardiology).

property.name: subject
property.description: The patient or group related to this encounter. In some use-cases the patient MAY not be present, such as a case meeting about a patient between several practitioners or a careteam.

property.name: subjectStatus
property.description: The subjectStatus value can be used to track the patient's status within the encounter. It details whether the patient has arrived or departed, has been triaged or is currently in a waiting status.

property.name: actualPeriod
property.description: The start and end time associated with this set of values associated with the encounter, may be different to the planned times for various reasons.

property.name: plannedStartDate
property.description: The planned start date/time (or admission date) of the encounter.

property.name: plannedEndDate
property.description: The planned end date/time (or discharge date) of the encounter.

property.name: length
property.description: Actual quantity of time the encounter lasted. This excludes the time during leaves of absence. When missing it is the time in between the start and end values.

property.name: location
property.description: The location of the patient at this point in the encounter, the multiple cardinality permits de-normalizing the levels of the location hierarchy, such as site/ward/room/bed.

element.name: Location
element.description: The location of the patient at this point in the encounter, the multiple cardinality permits de-normalizing the levels of the location hierarchy, such as site/ward/room/bed.

property.name: location
property.description: The location where the encounter takes place.

property.name: form
property.description: This will be used to specify the required levels (bed/ward/room/etc.) desired to be recorded to simplify either messaging or query.

resource.name: Endpoint

property.description: A coded value that represents the technical details of the usage of this endpoint, such as what WSDLs should be used in what way. (e.g. XDS.b/DICOM/cds-hook).

property.description: A friendly name that this endpoint can be referred to with.

property.name: managingOrganization
property.description: The organization that manages this endpoint (even if technically another organization is hosting this in the cloud, it is the organization associated with the data).

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details for a human to contact about the endpoint. The primary use of this for system administrator troubleshooting.

property.name: period
property.description: The interval during which the endpoint is expected to be operational.

property.description: The set of payloads that are provided/available at this endpoint.

property.description: The uri that describes the actual end-point to connect to.

property.name: header
property.description: Additional headers / information to send as part of the notification.

element.name: Payload

property.name: type
property.description: The payload type describes the acceptable content that can be communicated on the endpoint.

property.name: mimeType
property.description: The mime type to send the payload in - e.g. application/fhir+xml, application/fhir+json. If the mime type is not specified, then the sender could send any content (including no content depending on the connectionType).

property.name: status
property.description: planned | waitlist | active | onhold | finished | cancelled.

property.name: statusHistory
property.description: The history of statuses that the EpisodeOfCare has been through (without requiring processing the history of the resource).

property.name: type
property.description: A classification of the type of episode of care; e.g. specialist referral, disease management, type of funded care.

property.name: reason

property.name: diagnosis
property.description: The list of medical conditions that were addressed during the episode of care.

property.name: patient
property.description: The patient who is the focus of this episode of care.

property.name: managingOrganization
property.description: The organization that has assumed the specific responsibilities for care coordination, care delivery, or other services for the specified duration.

property.name: period
property.description: The interval during which the managing organization assumes the defined responsibility.

property.name: referralRequest
property.description: Referral Request(s) that are fulfilled by this EpisodeOfCare, incoming referrals.

property.name: careManager
property.description: The practitioner that is the care manager/care coordinator for this patient.

property.name: careTeam
property.description: The list of practitioners that may be facilitating this episode of care for specific purposes.

property.name: account
property.description: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this EpisodeOfCare.

property.name: use

This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this event definition is (or will be) published. property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this event definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the event definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the event definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the event definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the event definition.

property.name: subtitle
property.description: An explanatory or alternate title for the event definition giving additional information about its content.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this event definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this event definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: subject
property.description: A code or group definition that describes the intended subject of the event definition.

property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the event definition was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the event definition changes.

property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the event definition.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the event definition from a consumer's perspective.

property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the event definition is intended to be used.

property.description: Explanation of why this event definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: usage
property.description: A detailed description of how the event definition is used from a clinical perspective.

property.description: Type of statistic, e.g., relative risk.

property.name: category
property.description: When the measured variable is handled categorically, the category element is used to define which category the statistic is reporting.

property.name: quantity
property.description: Statistic value.

property.name: numberOfEvents
property.description: The number of events associated with the statistic, where the unit of analysis is different from numberAffected, sampleSize.knownDataCount and sampleSize.numberOfParticipants.

property.name: numberAffected
property.description: The number of participants affected where the unit of analysis is the same as sampleSize.knownDataCount and sampleSize.numberOfParticipants.

property.name: sampleSize
property.description: Number of samples in the statistic.

property.name: attributeEstimate
property.description: A statistical attribute of the statistic such as a measure of heterogeneity.

property.name: modelCharacteristic
property.description: A component of the method to generate the statistic.

element.name: Certainty
element.description: Assessment of certainty, confidence in the estimates, or quality of the evidence.

property.name: description
property.description: Textual description of certainty.

property.name: note
property.description: Footnotes and/or explanatory notes.

property.name: type
property.description: Aspect of certainty being rated.

property.name: rating
property.description: Assessment or judgement of the aspect.

property.name: rater
property.description: Individual or group who did the rating.

property.name: subcomponent
property.description: A domain or subdomain of certainty.

property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the evidence report.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: author
property.description: An individiual, organization, or device primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.

property.name: editor
property.description: An individiual, organization, or device primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.

property.name: reviewer
property.description: An individiual, organization, or device primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.

property.name: endorser
property.description: An individiual, organization, or device responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.

property.name: relatesTo
property.description: Relationships that this composition has with other compositions or documents that already exist.

property.name: section
property.description: The root of the sections that make up the composition.

property.name: characteristic
property.description: Characteristic.

property.name: note
property.description: Used for general notes and annotations not coded elsewhere.

element.name: RelatesTo
element.description: Relationships that this composition has with other compositions or documents that already exist.

property.name: code
property.description: The type of relationship that this composition has with anther composition or document.

property.name: target
property.description: The target composition/document of this relationship.

element.name: Section
element.description: The root of the sections that make up the composition.

property.name: title
property.description: The label for this particular section. This will be part of the rendered content for the document, and is often used to build a table of contents.

property.name: focus
property.description: A code identifying the kind of content contained within the section. This should be consistent with the section title.

property.name: focusReference
property.description: A definitional Resource identifying the kind of content contained within the section. This should be consistent with the section title.

property.description: Identifies who is responsible for the information in this section, not necessarily who typed it in.

property.name: mode
property.description: How the entry list was prepared - whether it is a working list that is suitable for being maintained on an ongoing basis, or if it represents a snapshot of a list of items from another source, or whether it is a prepared list where items may be marked as added, modified or deleted.

property.name: orderedBy
property.description: Specifies the order applied to the items in the section entries.

property.name: entryClassifier
property.description: Specifies any type of classification of the evidence report.

property.name: entryReference
property.description: A reference to the actual resource from which the narrative in the section is derived.

property.name: entryQuantity
property.description: Quantity as content.

property.name: emptyReason
property.description: If the section is empty, why the list is empty. An empty section typically has some text explaining the empty reason.

property.name: section
property.description: A nested sub-section within this section.

property.name: status

property.description: A defining factor of the EvidenceVariable. Multiple characteristics are applied with "and" semantics.

property.name: handling
property.description: The method of handling in statistical analysis.

property.description: A grouping for ordinal or polychotomous variables.

element.description: A defining factor of the EvidenceVariable. Multiple characteristics are applied with "and" semantics.

property.name: note
property.description: A human-readable string to clarify or explain concepts about the characteristic.

property.description: Defines the characteristic using Expression.

property.name: definitionByCombination
property.description: Defines the characteristic as a combination of two or more characteristics.

property.name: instances
property.description: Number of occurrences meeting the characteristic.

property.name: duration
property.description: Length of time in which the characteristic is met.

property.name: timeFromEvent
property.description: Timing in which the characteristic is determined.

element.name: Category
element.description: A grouping for ordinal or polychotomous variables.

property.name: name
property.description: Description of the grouping.

property.name: value
property.description: Definition of the grouping.

property.description: A system or person who shares or receives an instance within the scenario.

property.name: instance
property.description: A single data collection that is shared as part of the scenario.

property.name: process
property.description: A group of operations that represents a significant step within a scenario.

element.name: Actor
element.description: A system or person who shares or receives an instance within the scenario.

property.name: key
property.description: A unique string within the scenario that is used to reference the actor.

property.name: type
property.description: The category of actor - person or system.

property.name: title
property.description: The human-readable name for the actor used when rendering the scenario.

property.name: description
property.description: An explanation of who/what the actor is and its role in the scenario.

element.name: Instance
element.description: A single data collection that is shared as part of the scenario.

property.name: key
property.description: A unique string within the scenario that is used to reference the instance.

property.name: structureType
property.description: A code indicating the kind of data structure (FHIR resource or some other standard) this is an instance of.

property.name: structureVersion
property.description: Conveys the version of the data structure instantiated. I.e. what release of FHIR, X12, OpenEHR, etc. is instance compliant with.

property.name: structureProfile
property.description: Refers to a profile, template or other ruleset the instance adheres to.

property.name: title
property.description: A short descriptive label the instance to be used in tables or diagrams.

property.name: description

property.name: content

property.name: version
property.description: Represents the instance as it was at a specific time-point.

property.name: containedInstance
property.description: References to other instances that can be found within this instance (e.g. the observations contained in a bundle).

element.name: Process

property.name: title
property.description: A short descriptive label the process to be used in tables or diagrams.

property.name: description
property.description: An explanation of what the process represents and what it does.

property.name: preConditions
property.description: Description of the initial state of the actors, environment and data before the process starts.

property.name: postConditions
property.description: Description of the final state of the actors, environment and data after the process has been successfully completed.

property.name: step
property.description: A significant action that occurs as part of the process.

resource.name: ExplanationOfBenefit
resource.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.
