property.name: identifier
property.description: A unique identifier assigned to this explanation of benefit.

property.name: traceNumber
property.description: Trace number for tracking purposes. May be defined at the jurisdiction level or between trading partners.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the resource instance.

property.name: type
property.description: The category of claim, e.g. oral, pharmacy, vision, institutional, professional.

property.name: subType
property.description: A finer grained suite of claim type codes which may convey additional information such as Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service.

property.name: use
property.description: A code to indicate whether the nature of the request is: Claim - A request to an Insurer to adjudicate the supplied charges for health care goods and services under the identified policy and to pay the determined Benefit amount, if any; Preauthorization - A request to an Insurer to adjudicate the supplied proposed future charges for health care goods and services under the identified policy and to approve the services and provide the expected benefit amounts and potentially to reserve funds to pay the benefits when Claims for the indicated services are later submitted; or, Pre-determination - A request to an Insurer to adjudicate the supplied 'what if' charges for health care goods and services under the identified policy and report back what the Benefit payable would be had the services actually been provided.

property.name: patient
property.description: The party to whom the professional services and/or products have been supplied or are being considered and for whom actual for forecast reimbursement is sought.

property.name: billablePeriod
property.description: The period for which charges are being submitted.

property.name: created
property.description: The date this resource was created.

property.name: enterer
property.description: Individual who created the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.

property.name: insurer
property.description: The party responsible for authorization, adjudication and reimbursement.

property.name: provider
property.description: The provider which is responsible for the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.

property.name: priority
property.description: The provider-required urgency of processing the request. Typical values include: stat, normal deferred.

property.name: fundsReserveRequested
property.description: A code to indicate whether and for whom funds are to be reserved for future claims.

property.name: fundsReserve
property.description: A code, used only on a response to a preauthorization, to indicate whether the benefits payable have been reserved and for whom.

property.name: related
property.description: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior submissions or claims for related services or for the same event.

property.name: prescription
property.description: Prescription is the document/authorization given to the claim author for them to provide products and services for which consideration (reimbursement) is sought. Could be a RX for medications, an 'order' for oxygen or wheelchair or physiotherapy treatments.

property.name: originalPrescription
property.description: Original prescription which has been superseded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products.

property.name: event
property.description: Information code for an event with a corresponding date or period.

property.name: payee
property.description: The party to be reimbursed for cost of the products and services according to the terms of the policy.

property.name: referral
property.description: The referral information received by the claim author, it is not to be used when the author generates a referral for a patient. A copy of that referral may be provided as supporting information. Some insurers require proof of referral to pay for services or to pay specialist rates for services.

property.name: encounter
property.description: Healthcare encounters related to this claim.

property.name: facility
property.description: Facility where the services were provided.

property.name: claim
property.description: The business identifier for the instance of the adjudication request: claim predetermination or preauthorization.

property.name: claimResponse
property.description: The business identifier for the instance of the adjudication response: claim, predetermination or preauthorization response.

property.name: outcome
property.description: The outcome of the claim, predetermination, or preauthorization processing.

property.name: decision
property.description: The result of the claim, predetermination, or preauthorization adjudication.

property.name: disposition
property.description: A human readable description of the status of the adjudication.

property.name: preAuthRef
property.description: Reference from the Insurer which is used in later communications which refers to this adjudication.

property.name: preAuthRefPeriod
property.description: The timeframe during which the supplied preauthorization reference may be quoted on claims to obtain the adjudication as provided.

property.name: diagnosisRelatedGroup
property.description: A package billing code or bundle code used to group products and services to a particular health condition (such as heart attack) which is based on a predetermined grouping code system.

property.name: careTeam
property.description: The members of the team who provided the products and services.

property.name: supportingInfo
property.description: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues.

property.name: diagnosis
property.description: Information about diagnoses relevant to the claim items.

property.name: procedure
property.description: Procedures performed on the patient relevant to the billing items with the claim.

property.name: precedence
property.description: This indicates the relative order of a series of EOBs related to different coverages for the same suite of services.

property.name: insurance
property.description: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services specified on the claim.

property.name: accident
property.description: Details of a accident which resulted in injuries which required the products and services listed in the claim.

property.name: patientPaid
property.description: The amount paid by the patient, in total at the claim claim level or specifically for the item and detail level, to the provider for goods and services.

property.name: item
property.description: A claim line. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of details which can also be a simple items or groups of sub-details.

property.name: addItem
property.description: The first-tier service adjudications for payor added product or service lines.

property.name: adjudication
property.description: The adjudication results which are presented at the header level rather than at the line-item or add-item levels.

property.name: total
property.description: Categorized monetary totals for the adjudication.

property.name: payment
property.description: Payment details for the adjudication of the claim.

property.name: formCode
property.description: A code for the form to be used for printing the content.

property.name: form
property.description: The actual form, by reference or inclusion, for printing the content or an EOB.

property.name: processNote
property.description: A note that describes or explains adjudication results in a human readable form.

property.name: benefitPeriod
property.description: The term of the benefits documented in this response.

property.name: benefitBalance
property.description: Balance by Benefit Category.

element.name: Related
element.description: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior submissions or claims for related services or for the same event.

property.name: claim
property.description: Reference to a related claim.

property.name: relationship
property.description: A code to convey how the claims are related.

property.name: reference
property.description: An alternate organizational reference to the case or file to which this particular claim pertains.

element.name: Event
element.description: Information code for an event with a corresponding date or period.

property.name: type
property.description: A coded event such as when a service is expected or a card printed.

property.name: when
property.description: A date or period in the past or future indicating when the event occurred or is expectd to occur.

element.name: Payee
element.description: The party to be reimbursed for cost of the products and services according to the terms of the policy.

property.name: type
property.description: Type of Party to be reimbursed: Subscriber, provider, other.

property.name: party
property.description: Reference to the individual or organization to whom any payment will be made.

element.name: CareTeam
element.description: The members of the team who provided the products and services.

property.name: sequence
property.description: A number to uniquely identify care team entries.

property.name: provider
property.description: Member of the team who provided the product or service.

property.name: responsible
property.description: The party who is billing and/or responsible for the claimed products or services.

property.name: role
property.description: The lead, assisting or supervising practitioner and their discipline if a multidisciplinary team.

property.name: specialty
property.description: The specialization of the practitioner or provider which is applicable for this service.

element.name: SupportingInfo
element.description: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues.

property.name: sequence
property.description: A number to uniquely identify supporting information entries.

property.name: category
property.description: The general class of the information supplied: information; exception; accident, employment; onset, etc.

property.name: code
property.description: System and code pertaining to the specific information regarding special conditions relating to the setting, treatment or patient for which care is sought.

property.name: timing
property.description: The date when or period to which this information refers.

property.name: value
property.description: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

property.name: reason
property.description: Provides the reason in the situation where a reason code is required in addition to the content.

element.name: Diagnosis
element.description: Information about diagnoses relevant to the claim items.

property.name: sequence
property.description: A number to uniquely identify diagnosis entries.

property.name: diagnosis
property.description: The nature of illness or problem in a coded form or as a reference to an external defined Condition.

property.name: type
property.description: When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.

property.name: onAdmission
property.description: Indication of whether the diagnosis was present on admission to a facility.

element.name: Procedure
element.description: Procedures performed on the patient relevant to the billing items with the claim.

property.name: sequence
property.description: A number to uniquely identify procedure entries.

property.name: type
property.description: When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.

property.name: date
property.description: Date and optionally time the procedure was performed.

property.name: procedure
property.description: The code or reference to a Procedure resource which identifies the clinical intervention performed.

property.name: udi
property.description: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

element.name: Insurance
element.description: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services specified on the claim.

property.name: focal
property.description: A flag to indicate that this Coverage is to be used for adjudication of this claim when set to true.

property.name: coverage
property.description: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.

property.name: preAuthRef
property.description: Reference numbers previously provided by the insurer to the provider to be quoted on subsequent claims containing services or products related to the prior authorization.

element.name: Accident
element.description: Details of a accident which resulted in injuries which required the products and services listed in the claim.

property.name: date
property.description: Date of an accident event related to the products and services contained in the claim.

property.name: type
property.description: The type or context of the accident event for the purposes of selection of potential insurance coverages and determination of coordination between insurers.

property.name: location
property.description: The physical location of the accident event.

element.name: Item
element.description: A claim line. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of details which can also be a simple items or groups of sub-details.

property.name: sequence
property.description: A number to uniquely identify item entries.

property.name: careTeamSequence
property.description: Care team members related to this service or product.

property.name: diagnosisSequence
property.description: Diagnoses applicable for this service or product.

property.name: procedureSequence
property.description: Procedures applicable for this service or product.

property.name: informationSequence
property.description: Exceptions, special conditions and supporting information applicable for this service or product.

property.name: traceNumber
property.description: Trace number for tracking purposes. May be defined at the jurisdiction level or between trading partners.

property.name: revenue
property.description: The type of revenue or cost center providing the product and/or service.

property.name: category
property.description: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.

property.name: productOrService
property.description: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related item details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item. This element may be the start of a range of .productOrService codes used in conjunction with .productOrServiceEnd or it may be a solo element where .productOrServiceEnd is not used.

property.name: productOrServiceEnd
property.description: This contains the end of a range of product, service, drug or other billing codes for the item. This element is not used when the .productOrService is a group code. This value may only be present when a .productOfService code has been provided to convey the start of the range. Typically this value may be used only with preauthorizations and not with claims.

property.name: request
property.description: Request or Referral for Goods or Service to be rendered.

property.name: modifier
property.description: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.

property.name: programCode
property.description: Identifies the program under which this may be recovered.

property.name: serviced
property.description: The date or dates when the service or product was supplied, performed or completed.

property.name: location
property.description: Where the product or service was provided.

property.name: patientPaid
property.description: The amount paid by the patient, in total at the claim claim level or specifically for the item and detail level, to the provider for goods and services.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

property.name: unitPrice
property.description: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

property.name: factor
property.description: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

property.name: tax
property.description: The total of taxes applicable for this product or service.

property.name: net
property.description: The total amount claimed for the group (if a grouper) or the line item. Net = unit price * quantity * factor.

property.name: udi
property.description: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

property.name: bodySite
property.description: Physical location where the service is performed or applies.

property.name: encounter
property.description: Healthcare encounters related to this claim.

property.name: noteNumber
property.description: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

property.name: reviewOutcome
property.description: The high-level results of the adjudication if adjudication has been performed.

property.name: adjudication
property.description: If this item is a group then the values here are a summary of the adjudication of the detail items. If this item is a simple product or service then this is the result of the adjudication of this item.

property.name: detail
property.description: Second-tier of goods and services.

element.name: AddItem
element.description: The first-tier service adjudications for payor added product or service lines.

property.name: itemSequence
property.description: Claim items which this service line is intended to replace.

property.name: detailSequence
property.description: The sequence number of the details within the claim item which this line is intended to replace.

property.name: subDetailSequence
property.description: The sequence number of the sub-details woithin the details within the claim item which this line is intended to replace.

property.name: traceNumber
property.description: Trace number for tracking purposes. May be defined at the jurisdiction level or between trading partners.

property.name: provider
property.description: The providers who are authorized for the services rendered to the patient.

property.name: revenue
property.description: The type of revenue or cost center providing the product and/or service.

property.name: productOrService
property.description: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related item details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item. This element may be the start of a range of .productOrService codes used in conjunction with .productOrServiceEnd or it may be a solo element where .productOrServiceEnd is not used.

property.name: productOrServiceEnd
property.description: This contains the end of a range of product, service, drug or other billing codes for the item. This element is not used when the .productOrService is a group code. This value may only be present when a .productOfService code has been provided to convey the start of the range. Typically this value may be used only with preauthorizations and not with claims.

property.name: request
property.description: Request or Referral for Goods or Service to be rendered.

property.name: modifier
property.description: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.

property.name: programCode
property.description: Identifies the program under which this may be recovered.

property.name: serviced
property.description: The date or dates when the service or product was supplied, performed or completed.

property.name: location
property.description: Where the product or service was provided.

property.name: patientPaid
property.description: The amount paid by the patient, in total at the claim claim level or specifically for the item and detail level, to the provider for goods and services.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

property.name: unitPrice
property.description: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

property.name: factor
property.description: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

property.name: tax
property.description: The total of taxes applicable for this product or service.

property.name: net
property.description: The total amount claimed for the group (if a grouper) or the addItem. Net = unit price * quantity * factor.

property.name: bodySite
property.description: Physical location where the service is performed or applies.

property.name: noteNumber
property.description: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

property.name: reviewOutcome
property.description: The high-level results of the adjudication if adjudication has been performed.

property.name: adjudication
property.description: The adjudication results.

property.name: detail
property.description: The second-tier service adjudications for payor added services.

element.name: Total
element.description: Categorized monetary totals for the adjudication.

property.name: category
property.description: A code to indicate the information type of this adjudication record. Information types may include: the value submitted, maximum values or percentages allowed or payable under the plan, amounts that the patient is responsible for in aggregate or pertaining to this item, amounts paid by other coverages, and the benefit payable for this item.

property.name: amount
property.description: Monetary total amount associated with the category.

element.name: Payment
element.description: Payment details for the adjudication of the claim.

property.name: type
property.description: Whether this represents partial or complete payment of the benefits payable.

property.name: adjustment
property.description: Total amount of all adjustments to this payment included in this transaction which are not related to this claim's adjudication.

property.name: adjustmentReason
property.description: Reason for the payment adjustment.

property.name: date
property.description: Estimated date the payment will be issued or the actual issue date of payment.

property.name: amount
property.description: Benefits payable less any payment adjustment.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Issuer's unique identifier for the payment instrument.

element.name: ProcessNote
element.description: A note that describes or explains adjudication results in a human readable form.

property.name: number
property.description: A number to uniquely identify a note entry.

property.name: type
property.description: The business purpose of the note text.

property.name: text
property.description: The explanation or description associated with the processing.

property.name: language
property.description: A code to define the language used in the text of the note.

element.name: BenefitBalance
element.description: Balance by Benefit Category.

property.name: category
property.description: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.

property.name: excluded
property.description: True if the indicated class of service is excluded from the plan, missing or False indicates the product or service is included in the coverage.

property.name: name
property.description: A short name or tag for the benefit.

property.name: description
property.description: A richer description of the benefit or services covered.

property.name: network
property.description: Is a flag to indicate whether the benefits refer to in-network providers or out-of-network providers.

property.name: unit
property.description: Indicates if the benefits apply to an individual or to the family.

property.name: term
property.description: The term or period of the values such as 'maximum lifetime benefit' or 'maximum annual visits'.

property.name: financial
property.description: Benefits Used to date.

resource.name: FamilyMemberHistory
resource.description: Significant health conditions for a person related to the patient relevant in the context of care for the patient.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this family member history by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: instantiatesCanonical
property.description: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this FamilyMemberHistory.

property.name: instantiatesUri
property.description: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this FamilyMemberHistory.

property.name: status
property.description: A code specifying the status of the record of the family history of a specific family member.

property.name: dataAbsentReason
property.description: Describes why the family member's history is not available.

property.name: patient
property.description: The person who this history concerns.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and possibly time) when the family member history was recorded or last updated.

property.name: participant
property.description: Indicates who or what participated in the activities related to the family member history and how they were involved.

property.name: name
property.description: This will either be a name or a description; e.g. "Aunt Susan", "my cousin with the red hair".

property.name: relationship
property.description: The type of relationship this person has to the patient (father, mother, brother etc.).

property.name: sex
property.description: The birth sex of the family member.

property.name: born
property.description: The actual or approximate date of birth of the relative.

property.name: age
property.description: The age of the relative at the time the family member history is recorded.

property.name: estimatedAge
property.description: If true, indicates that the age value specified is an estimated value.

property.name: deceased
property.description: Deceased flag or the actual or approximate age of the relative at the time of death for the family member history record.

property.name: reason
property.description: Describes why the family member history occurred in coded or textual form, or Indicates a Condition, Observation, AllergyIntolerance, or QuestionnaireResponse that justifies this family member history event.

property.name: note
property.description: This property allows a non condition-specific note to the made about the related person. Ideally, the note would be in the condition property, but this is not always possible.

property.name: condition
property.description: The significant Conditions (or condition) that the family member had. This is a repeating section to allow a system to represent more than one condition per resource, though there is nothing stopping multiple resources - one per condition.

property.name: procedure
property.description: The significant Procedures (or procedure) that the family member had. This is a repeating section to allow a system to represent more than one procedure per resource, though there is nothing stopping multiple resources - one per procedure.

element.name: Participant
element.description: Indicates who or what participated in the activities related to the family member history and how they were involved.

property.name: function
property.description: Distinguishes the type of involvement of the actor in the activities related to the family member history.

property.name: actor
property.description: Indicates who or what participated in the activities related to the family member history.

element.name: Condition
element.description: The significant Conditions (or condition) that the family member had. This is a repeating section to allow a system to represent more than one condition per resource, though there is nothing stopping multiple resources - one per condition.

property.name: code
property.description: The actual condition specified. Could be a coded condition (like MI or Diabetes) or a less specific string like 'cancer' depending on how much is known about the condition and the capabilities of the creating system.

property.name: outcome
property.description: Indicates what happened following the condition. If the condition resulted in death, deceased date is captured on the relation.

property.name: contributedToDeath
property.description: This condition contributed to the cause of death of the related person. If contributedToDeath is not populated, then it is unknown.

property.name: onset
property.description: Either the age of onset, range of approximate age or descriptive string can be recorded. For conditions with multiple occurrences, this describes the first known occurrence.

property.name: note
property.description: An area where general notes can be placed about this specific condition.

element.name: Procedure
element.description: The significant Procedures (or procedure) that the family member had. This is a repeating section to allow a system to represent more than one procedure per resource, though there is nothing stopping multiple resources - one per procedure.

property.name: code
property.description: The actual procedure specified. Could be a coded procedure or a less specific string depending on how much is known about the procedure and the capabilities of the creating system.

property.name: outcome
property.description: Indicates what happened following the procedure. If the procedure resulted in death, deceased date is captured on the relation.

property.name: contributedToDeath
property.description: This procedure contributed to the cause of death of the related person. If contributedToDeath is not populated, then it is unknown.

property.name: performed
property.description: Estimated or actual date, date-time, period, or age when the procedure was performed. Allows a period to support complex procedures that span more than one date, and also allows for the length of the procedure to be captured.

property.name: note
property.description: An area where general notes can be placed about this specific procedure.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this flag by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: status
property.description: Supports basic workflow.

property.name: category
property.description: Allows a flag to be divided into different categories like clinical, administrative etc. Intended to be used as a means of filtering which flags are displayed to particular user or in a given context.

property.name: code
property.description: The coded value or textual component of the flag to display to the user.

property.name: subject
property.description: The patient, related person, location, group, organization, or practitioner etc. this is about record this flag is associated with.

property.name: period
property.description: The period of time from the activation of the flag to inactivation of the flag. If the flag is active, the end of the period should be unspecified.

property.name: encounter
property.description: This alert is only relevant during the encounter.

property.name: author
property.description: The person, organization or device that created the flag.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifier for this formulary item.

property.name: code
property.description: A code (or set of codes) that specify the product or service that is identified by this formulary item.

property.name: status
property.description: The validity about the information of the formulary item and not of the underlying product or service itself.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifiers for this genomic study.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the genomic study.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of the study, e.g., Familial variant segregation, Functional variation detection, or Gene expression profiling.

property.name: subject
property.description: The primary subject of the genomic study.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The healthcare event with which this genomics study is associated.

property.name: startDate
property.description: When the genomic study was started.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: Event resources that the genomic study is based on.

property.name: referrer
property.description: Healthcare professional who requested or referred the genomic study.

property.name: interpreter
property.description: Healthcare professionals who interpreted the genomic study.

property.name: reason
property.description: Why the genomic study was performed.

property.name: instantiatesCanonical
property.description: The defined protocol that describes the study.

property.name: instantiatesUri
property.description: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol that describes the study.

property.name: note
property.description: Comments related to the genomic study.

property.name: description
property.description: Description of the genomic study.

property.name: analysis
property.description: The details about a specific analysis that was performed in this GenomicStudy.

element.name: Analysis
element.description: The details about a specific analysis that was performed in this GenomicStudy.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifiers for the analysis event.

property.name: methodType
property.description: Type of the methods used in the analysis, e.g., Fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH), Karyotyping, or Microsatellite instability testing (MSI).

property.name: changeType
property.description: Type of the genomic changes studied in the analysis, e.g., DNA, RNA, or amino acid change.

property.name: genomeBuild
property.description: The reference genome build that is used in this analysis.

property.name: instantiatesCanonical
property.description: The defined protocol that describes the analysis.

property.name: instantiatesUri
property.description: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol that describes the analysis.

property.name: title
property.description: Name of the analysis event (human friendly).

property.name: focus
property.description: The focus of a genomic analysis when it is not the patient of record representing something or someone associated with the patient such as a spouse, parent, child, or sibling. For example, in trio testing, the GenomicStudy.subject would be the child (proband) and the GenomicStudy.analysis.focus of a specific analysis would be the parent.

property.name: specimen
property.description: The specimen used in the analysis event.

property.name: date
property.description: The date of the analysis event.

property.name: note
property.description: Any notes capture with the analysis event.

property.name: protocolPerformed
property.description: The protocol that was performed for the analysis event.

property.name: regionsStudied
property.description: The genomic regions to be studied in the analysis (BED file).

property.name: regionsCalled
property.description: Genomic regions actually called in the analysis event (BED file).

property.name: input
property.description: Inputs for the analysis event.

property.name: output
property.description: Outputs for the analysis event.

property.name: performer
property.description: Performer for the analysis event.

property.name: device
property.description: Devices used for the analysis (e.g., instruments, software), with settings and parameters.

resource.name: Goal
resource.description: Describes the intended objective(s) for a patient, group or organization care, for example, weight loss, restoring an activity of daily living, obtaining herd immunity via immunization, meeting a process improvement objective, etc.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this goal by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: lifecycleStatus
property.description: The state of the goal throughout its lifecycle.

property.name: achievementStatus
property.description: Describes the progression, or lack thereof, towards the goal against the target.

property.name: category
property.description: Indicates a category the goal falls within.

property.name: continuous
property.description: After meeting the goal, ongoing activity is needed to sustain the goal objective.

property.name: priority
property.description: Identifies the mutually agreed level of importance associated with reaching/sustaining the goal.

property.name: description
property.description: Human-readable and/or coded description of a specific desired objective of care, such as "control blood pressure" or "negotiate an obstacle course" or "dance with child at wedding".

property.name: subject
property.description: Identifies the patient, group or organization for whom the goal is being established.

property.name: start
property.description: The date or event after which the goal should begin being pursued.

property.name: target
property.description: Indicates what should be done by when.

property.name: statusDate
property.description: Identifies when the current status. I.e. When initially created, when achieved, when cancelled, etc.

property.name: statusReason
property.description: Captures the reason for the current status.

property.name: source
property.description: Indicates whose goal this is - patient goal, practitioner goal, etc.

property.name: addresses
property.description: The identified conditions and other health record elements that are intended to be addressed by the goal.

property.name: note
property.description: Any comments related to the goal.

property.name: outcome
property.description: Identifies the change (or lack of change) at the point when the status of the goal is assessed.

element.name: Target
element.description: Indicates what should be done by when.

property.name: measure
property.description: The parameter whose value is being tracked, e.g. body weight, blood pressure, or hemoglobin A1c level.

property.name: detail
property.description: The target value of the focus to be achieved to signify the fulfillment of the goal, e.g. 150 pounds, 7.0%. Either the high or low or both values of the range can be specified. When a low value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any focus value at or below the high value. Similarly, if the high value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any focus value at or above the low value.

property.name: due
property.description: Indicates either the date or the duration after start by which the goal should be met.

resource.name: GraphDefinition
resource.description: A formal computable definition of a graph of resources - that is, a coherent set of resources that form a graph by following references. The Graph Definition resource defines a set and makes rules about the set.

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this graph definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this graph definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the graph definition is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this GraphDefinition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the graph definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the graph definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the graph definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the capability statement.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this graph definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this graph definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the graph definition was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the graph definition changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the graph definition.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the graph definition from a consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate graph definition instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the graph definition is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this graph definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the graph definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the graph definition.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: start
property.description: The Node at which instances of this graph start. If there is no nominated start, the graph can start at any of the nodes.

property.name: node
property.description: Potential target for the link.

property.name: link
property.description: Links this graph makes rules about.

element.name: Node
element.description: Potential target for the link.

property.name: nodeId
property.description: Internal ID of node - target for link references.

property.name: description
property.description: Information about why this node is of interest in this graph definition.

property.name: type
property.description: Type of resource this link refers to.

property.name: profile
property.description: Profile for the target resource.

element.name: Link
element.description: Links this graph makes rules about.

property.name: description
property.description: Information about why this link is of interest in this graph definition.

property.name: min
property.description: Minimum occurrences for this link.

property.name: max
property.description: Maximum occurrences for this link.

property.name: sourceId
property.description: The source node for this link.

property.name: path
property.description: A FHIRPath expression that identifies one of FHIR References to other resources.

property.name: sliceName
property.description: Which slice (if profiled).

property.name: targetId
property.description: The target node for this link.

property.name: params
property.description: A set of parameters to look up.

property.name: compartment
property.description: Compartment Consistency Rules.

resource.name: Group
resource.description: Represents a defined collection of entities that may be discussed or acted upon collectively but which are not expected to act collectively, and are not formally or legally recognized; i.e. a collection of entities that isn't an Organization.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this participant by one of the applications involved. These identifiers remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: active
property.description: Indicates whether the record for the group is available for use or is merely being retained for historical purposes.

property.name: type
property.description: Identifies the broad classification of the kind of resources the group includes.

property.name: membership
property.description: Basis for membership in the Group: * 'definitional': The Group.characteristics specified are both necessary and sufficient to determine membership. All entities that meet the criteria are considered to be members of the group, whether referenced by the group or not. If members are present, they are individuals that happen to be known as meeting the Group.characteristics. The list cannot be presumed to be complete. * 'enumerated': The Group.characteristics are necessary but not sufficient to determine membership. Membership is determined by being listed as one of the Group.member.

property.name: code
property.description: Provides a specific type of resource the group includes; e.g. "cow", "syringe", etc.

property.name: name
property.description: A label assigned to the group for human identification and communication.

property.name: description
property.description: Explanation of what the group represents and how it is intended to be used.

property.name: quantity
property.description: A count of the number of resource instances that are part of the group.

property.name: managingEntity
property.description: Entity responsible for defining and maintaining Group characteristics and/or registered members.

property.name: characteristic
property.description: Identifies traits whose presence r absence is shared by members of the group.

property.name: member
property.description: Identifies the resource instances that are members of the group.

element.name: Characteristic
element.description: Identifies traits whose presence r absence is shared by members of the group.

property.name: code
property.description: A code that identifies the kind of trait being asserted.

property.name: value
property.description: The value of the trait that holds (or does not hold - see 'exclude') for members of the group.

property.name: exclude
property.description: If true, indicates the characteristic is one that is NOT held by members of the group.

property.name: period
property.description: The period over which the characteristic is tested; e.g. the patient had an operation during the month of June.

element.name: Member
element.description: Identifies the resource instances that are members of the group.

property.name: entity
property.description: A reference to the entity that is a member of the group. Must be consistent with Group.type. If the entity is another group, then the type must be the same.

property.name: period
property.description: The period that the member was in the group, if known.

property.name: inactive
property.description: A flag to indicate that the member is no longer in the group, but previously may have been a member.

resource.name: GuidanceResponse

property.name: requestIdentifier
property.description: The identifier of the request associated with this response. If an identifier was given as part of the request, it will be reproduced here to enable the requester to more easily identify the response in a multi-request scenario.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Allows a service to provide unique, business identifiers for the response.

property.name: module
property.description: An identifier, CodeableConcept or canonical reference to the guidance that was requested.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the response. If the evaluation is completed successfully, the status will indicate success. However, in order to complete the evaluation, the engine may require more information. In this case, the status will be data-required, and the response will contain a description of the additional required information. If the evaluation completed successfully, but the engine determines that a potentially more accurate response could be provided if more data was available, the status will be data-requested, and the response will contain a description of the additional requested information.

property.name: subject
property.description: The patient for which the request was processed.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The encounter during which this response was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

property.name: occurrenceDateTime
property.description: Indicates when the guidance response was processed.

property.name: performer
property.description: Provides a reference to the device that performed the guidance.

property.name: reason
property.description: Describes the reason for the guidance response in coded or textual form, or Indicates the reason the request was initiated. This is typically provided as a parameter to the evaluation and echoed by the service, although for some use cases, such as subscription- or event-based scenarios, it may provide an indication of the cause for the response.

property.name: note
property.description: Provides a mechanism to communicate additional information about the response.

property.name: evaluationMessage
property.description: Messages resulting from the evaluation of the artifact or artifacts. As part of evaluating the request, the engine may produce informational or warning messages. These messages will be provided by this element.

property.name: outputParameters
property.description: The output parameters of the evaluation, if any. Many modules will result in the return of specific resources such as procedure or communication requests that are returned as part of the operation result. However, modules may define specific outputs that would be returned as the result of the evaluation, and these would be returned in this element.

property.name: result
property.description: The actions, if any, produced by the evaluation of the artifact.

property.name: dataRequirement
property.description: If the evaluation could not be completed due to lack of information, or additional information would potentially result in a more accurate response, this element will a description of the data required in order to proceed with the evaluation. A subsequent request to the service should include this data.

resource.name: HealthcareService
resource.description: The details of a healthcare service available at a location or in a catalog. In the case where there is a hierarchy of services (for example, Lab -> Pathology -> Wound Cultures), this can be represented using a set of linked HealthcareServices.

This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: identifier
property.description: External identifiers for this item.

property.name: active
property.description: This flag is used to mark the record to not be used. This is not used when a center is closed for maintenance, or for holidays, the notAvailable period is to be used for this.

property.name: providedBy
property.description: The organization that provides this healthcare service.

property.name: offeredIn
property.description: When the HealthcareService is representing a specific, schedulable service, the availableIn property can refer to a generic service.

property.name: category
property.description: Identifies the broad category of service being performed or delivered.

property.name: type
property.description: The specific type of service that may be delivered or performed.

property.name: specialty
property.description: Collection of specialties handled by the Healthcare service. This is more of a medical term.

property.name: location
property.description: The location(s) where this healthcare service may be provided.

property.name: name
property.description: Further description of the service as it would be presented to a consumer while searching.

property.name: comment
property.description: Any additional description of the service and/or any specific issues not covered by the other attributes, which can be displayed as further detail under the serviceName.

property.name: extraDetails
property.description: Extra details about the service that can't be placed in the other fields.

property.name: photo
property.description: If there is a photo/symbol associated with this HealthcareService, it may be included here to facilitate quick identification of the service in a list.

property.name: contact
property.description: The contact details of communication devices available relevant to the specific HealthcareService. This can include addresses, phone numbers, fax numbers, mobile numbers, email addresses and web sites.

property.name: coverageArea
property.description: The location(s) that this service is available to (not where the service is provided).

property.name: serviceProvisionCode
property.description: The code(s) that detail the conditions under which the healthcare service is available/offered.

property.name: eligibility
property.description: Does this service have specific eligibility requirements that need to be met in order to use the service?

property.name: program
property.description: Programs that this service is applicable to.

property.name: characteristic
property.description: Collection of characteristics (attributes).

property.name: communication
property.description: Some services are specifically made available in multiple languages, this property permits a directory to declare the languages this is offered in. Typically this is only provided where a service operates in communities with mixed languages used.

property.name: referralMethod
property.description: Ways that the service accepts referrals, if this is not provided then it is implied that no referral is required.

property.name: appointmentRequired
property.description: Indicates whether or not a prospective consumer will require an appointment for a particular service at a site to be provided by the Organization. Indicates if an appointment is required for access to this service.

property.name: availability
property.description: A collection of times that the healthcare service is available.

property.name: endpoint
property.description: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the specific healthcare services defined at this resource.

element.name: Eligibility
element.description: Does this service have specific eligibility requirements that need to be met in order to use the service?

property.name: code
property.description: Coded value for the eligibility.

property.name: comment
property.description: Describes the eligibility conditions for the service.

resource.name: ImagingSelection
resource.description: A selection of DICOM SOP instances and/or frames within a single Study and Series. This might include additional specifics such as an image region, an Observation UID or a Segmentation Number, allowing linkage to an Observation Resource or transferring this information along with the ImagingStudy Resource.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: A unique identifier assigned to this imaging selection.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of the ImagingSelection resource. This is not the status of any ImagingStudy, ServiceRequest, or Task resources associated with the ImagingSelection.

property.name: subject
property.description: The patient, or group of patients, location, device, organization, procedure or practitioner this imaging selection is about and into whose or what record the imaging selection is placed.

property.name: issued
property.description: The date and time this imaging selection was created.

property.name: performer
property.description: Selector of the instances - human or machine.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A list of the diagnostic requests that resulted in this imaging selection being performed.

property.name: category
property.description: Classifies the imaging selection.

property.name: code
property.description: Reason for referencing the selected content.

property.name: studyUid
property.description: The Study Instance UID for the DICOM Study from which the images were selected.

property.name: derivedFrom
property.description: The imaging study from which the imaging selection is made.

property.name: endpoint
property.description: The network service providing retrieval access to the selected images, frames, etc. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints.

property.name: seriesUid
property.description: The Series Instance UID for the DICOM Series from which the images were selected.

property.name: seriesNumber
property.description: The Series Number for the DICOM Series from which the images were selected.

property.name: frameOfReferenceUid
property.description: The Frame of Reference UID identifying the coordinate system that conveys spatial and/or temporal information for the selected images or frames.

property.name: bodySite
property.description: The anatomic structures examined. See DICOM Part 16 Annex L (http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part16/chapter_L.html) for DICOM to SNOMED-CT mappings.

property.name: focus
property.description: The actual focus of an observation when it is not the patient of record representing something or someone associated with the patient such as a spouse, parent, fetus, or donor. For example, fetus observations in a mother's record. The focus of an observation could also be an existing condition, an intervention, the subject's diet, another observation of the subject, or a body structure such as tumor or implanted device. An example use case would be using the Observation resource to capture whether the mother is trained to change her child's tracheostomy tube. In this example, the child is the patient of record and the mother is the focus.

property.name: instance
property.description: Each imaging selection includes one or more selected DICOM SOP instances.

element.name: Performer
element.description: Selector of the instances - human or machine.

property.name: function
property.description: Distinguishes the type of involvement of the performer.

property.name: actor
property.description: Author - human or machine.

element.name: Instance
element.description: Each imaging selection includes one or more selected DICOM SOP instances.

property.name: uid
property.description: The SOP Instance UID for the selected DICOM instance.

property.name: number
property.description: The Instance Number for the selected DICOM instance.

property.name: sopClass
property.description: The SOP Class UID for the selected DICOM instance.

property.name: subset
property.description: Selected subset of the SOP Instance. The content and format of the subset item is determined by the SOP Class of the selected instance. May be one of: - A list of frame numbers selected from a multiframe SOP Instance. - A list of Content Item Observation UID values selected from a DICOM SR or other structured document SOP Instance. - A list of segment numbers selected from a segmentation SOP Instance. - A list of Region of Interest (ROI) numbers selected from a radiotherapy structure set SOP Instance.

property.name: imageRegion2D
property.description: Each imaging selection instance or frame list might includes an image region, specified by a region type and a set of 2D coordinates. If the parent imagingSelection.instance contains a subset element of type frame, the image region applies to all frames in the subset list.

property.name: imageRegion3D
property.description: Each imaging selection might includes a 3D image region, specified by a region type and a set of 3D coordinates.

resource.name: ImagingStudy
resource.description: Representation of the content produced in a DICOM imaging study. A study comprises a set of series, each of which includes a set of Service-Object Pair Instances (SOP Instances - images or other data) acquired or produced in a common context. A series is of only one modality (e.g. X-ray, CT, MR, ultrasound), but a study may have multiple series of different modalities.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifiers for the ImagingStudy such as DICOM Study Instance UID.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of the ImagingStudy resource. This is not the status of any ServiceRequest or Task resources associated with the ImagingStudy.

property.name: modality
property.description: A list of all the distinct values of series.modality. This may include both acquisition and non-acquisition modalities.

property.name: subject
property.description: The subject, typically a patient, of the imaging study.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The healthcare event (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this ImagingStudy is made.

property.name: started
property.description: Date and time the study started.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A list of the diagnostic requests that resulted in this imaging study being performed.

property.name: partOf
property.description: A larger event of which this particular ImagingStudy is a component or step. For example, an ImagingStudy as part of a procedure.

property.name: referrer
property.description: The requesting/referring physician.

property.name: endpoint
property.description: The network service providing access (e.g., query, view, or retrieval) for the study. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints. A study-level endpoint applies to each series in the study, unless overridden by a series-level endpoint with the same Endpoint.connectionType.

property.name: numberOfSeries
property.description: Number of Series in the Study. This value given may be larger than the number of series elements this Resource contains due to resource availability, security, or other factors. This element should be present if any series elements are present.

property.name: numberOfInstances
property.description: Number of SOP Instances in Study. This value given may be larger than the number of instance elements this resource contains due to resource availability, security, or other factors. This element should be present if any instance elements are present.

property.name: procedure
property.description: This field corresponds to the DICOM Procedure Code Sequence (0008,1032). This is different from the FHIR Procedure resource that may include the ImagingStudy.

property.name: location
property.description: The principal physical location where the ImagingStudy was performed.

property.name: reason
property.description: Description of clinical condition indicating why the ImagingStudy was requested, and/or Indicates another resource whose existence justifies this Study.

property.name: note
property.description: Per the recommended DICOM mapping, this element is derived from the Study Description attribute (0008,1030). Observations or findings about the imaging study should be recorded in another resource, e.g. Observation, and not in this element.

property.name: description
property.description: The Imaging Manager description of the study. Institution-generated description or classification of the Study (component) performed.

property.name: series
property.description: Each study has one or more series of images or other content.

element.name: Series
element.description: Each study has one or more series of images or other content.

property.name: uid
property.description: The DICOM Series Instance UID for the series.

property.name: number
property.description: The numeric identifier of this series in the study.

property.name: modality
property.description: The distinct modality for this series. This may include both acquisition and non-acquisition modalities.

property.name: description
property.description: A description of the series.

property.name: numberOfInstances
property.description: Number of SOP Instances in the Study. The value given may be larger than the number of instance elements this resource contains due to resource availability, security, or other factors. This element should be present if any instance elements are present.

property.name: endpoint
property.description: The network service providing access (e.g., query, view, or retrieval) for this series. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints. A series-level endpoint, if present, has precedence over a study-level endpoint with the same Endpoint.connectionType.

property.name: bodySite
property.description: The anatomic structures examined. See DICOM Part 16 Annex L (http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part16/chapter_L.html) for DICOM to SNOMED-CT mappings. The bodySite may indicate the laterality of body part imaged; if so, it shall be consistent with any content of ImagingStudy.series.laterality.

property.name: laterality
property.description: The laterality of the (possibly paired) anatomic structures examined. E.g., the left knee, both lungs, or unpaired abdomen. If present, shall be consistent with any laterality information indicated in ImagingStudy.series.bodySite.

property.name: specimen
property.description: The specimen imaged, e.g., for whole slide imaging of a biopsy.

property.name: started
property.description: The date and time the series was started.

property.name: performer
property.description: Indicates who or what performed the series and how they were involved.

property.name: instance
property.description: A single SOP instance within the series, e.g. an image, or presentation state.

resource.name: Immunization
resource.description: Describes the event of a patient being administered a vaccine or a record of an immunization as reported by a patient, a clinician or another party.

property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.
