property.name: identifier
property.description: A unique identifier assigned to this immunization record.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A plan, order or recommendation fulfilled in whole or in part by this immunization.

property.name: status
property.description: Indicates the current status of the immunization event.

property.name: statusReason
property.description: Indicates the reason the immunization event was not performed.

property.name: vaccineCode
property.description: Vaccine that was administered or was to be administered.

property.name: administeredProduct
property.description: An indication of which product was administered to the patient. This is typically a more detailed representation of the concept conveyed by the vaccineCode data element. If a Medication resource is referenced, it may be to a stand-alone resource or a contained resource within the Immunization resource.

property.name: manufacturer
property.description: Name of vaccine manufacturer.

property.name: lotNumber
property.description: Lot number of the vaccine product.

property.name: expirationDate
property.description: Date vaccine batch expires.

property.name: patient
property.description: The patient who either received or did not receive the immunization.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The visit or admission or other contact between patient and health care provider the immunization was performed as part of.

property.name: supportingInformation
property.description: Additional information that is relevant to the immunization (e.g. for a vaccine recipient who is pregnant, the gestational age of the fetus). The reason why a vaccine was given (e.g. occupation, underlying medical condition) should be conveyed in Immunization.reason, not as supporting information. The reason why a vaccine was not given (e.g. contraindication) should be conveyed in Immunization.statusReason, not as supporting information.

property.name: occurrence
property.description: Date vaccine administered or was to be administered.

property.name: primarySource
property.description: Indicates whether the data contained in the resource was captured by the individual/organization which was responsible for the administration of the vaccine rather than as 'secondary reported' data documented by a third party. A value of 'true' means this data originated with the individual/organization which was responsible for the administration of the vaccine.

property.name: informationSource
property.description: Typically the source of the data when the report of the immunization event is not based on information from the person who administered the vaccine.

property.name: location
property.description: The service delivery location where the vaccine administration occurred.

property.name: site
property.description: Body site where vaccine was administered.

property.name: route
property.description: The path by which the vaccine product is taken into the body.

property.name: doseQuantity
property.description: The quantity of vaccine product that was administered.

property.name: performer
property.description: Indicates who performed the immunization event.

property.name: note
property.description: Extra information about the immunization that is not conveyed by the other attributes.

property.name: reason
property.description: Describes why the immunization occurred in coded or textual form, or Indicates another resource (Condition, Observation or DiagnosticReport) whose existence justifies this immunization.

property.name: isSubpotent
property.description: Indication if a dose is considered to be subpotent. By default, a dose should be considered to be potent.

property.name: subpotentReason
property.description: Reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent.

property.name: programEligibility
property.description: Indicates a patient's eligibility for a funding program.

property.name: fundingSource
property.description: Indicates the source of the vaccine actually administered. This may be different than the patient eligibility (e.g. the patient may be eligible for a publically purchased vaccine but due to inventory issues, vaccine purchased with private funds was actually administered).

property.name: reaction
property.description: Categorical data indicating that an adverse event is associated in time to an immunization.

property.name: protocolApplied
property.description: The protocol (set of recommendations) being followed by the provider who administered the dose.

element.name: Performer
element.description: Indicates who performed the immunization event.

property.name: function
property.description: Describes the type of performance (e.g. ordering provider, administering provider, etc.).

property.name: actor
property.description: The practitioner or organization who performed the action.

element.name: ProgramEligibility
element.description: Indicates a patient's eligibility for a funding program.

property.name: program
property.description: Indicates which program the patient had their eligility evaluated for.

property.name: programStatus
property.description: Indicates the patient's eligility status for for a specific payment program.

element.name: Reaction
element.description: Categorical data indicating that an adverse event is associated in time to an immunization.

property.name: date
property.description: Date of reaction to the immunization.

property.name: manifestation
property.description: Details of the reaction.

property.name: reported
property.description: Self-reported indicator.

element.name: ProtocolApplied
element.description: The protocol (set of recommendations) being followed by the provider who administered the dose.

property.name: series
property.description: One possible path to achieve presumed immunity against a disease - within the context of an authority.

property.name: authority
property.description: Indicates the authority who published the protocol (e.g. ACIP) that is being followed.

property.name: targetDisease
property.description: The vaccine preventable disease the dose is being administered against.

property.name: doseNumber
property.description: Nominal position in a series as intended by the practitioner administering the dose.

property.name: seriesDoses
property.description: The recommended number of doses to achieve immunity as intended by the practitioner administering the dose.

resource.name: ImmunizationEvaluation
resource.description: Describes a comparison of an immunization event against published recommendations to determine if the administration is "valid" in relation to those recommendations.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A unique identifier assigned to this immunization evaluation record.

property.name: status
property.description: Indicates the current status of the evaluation of the vaccination administration event.

property.name: patient
property.description: The individual for whom the evaluation is being done.

property.name: date
property.description: The date the evaluation of the vaccine administration event was performed.

property.name: authority
property.description: Indicates the authority who published the protocol (e.g. ACIP).

property.name: targetDisease
property.description: The vaccine preventable disease the dose is being evaluated against.

property.name: immunizationEvent
property.description: The vaccine administration event being evaluated.

property.name: doseStatus
property.description: Indicates if the dose is valid or not valid with respect to the published recommendations.

property.name: doseStatusReason
property.description: Provides an explanation as to why the vaccine administration event is valid or not relative to the published recommendations.

property.name: description
property.description: Additional information about the evaluation.

property.name: series
property.description: One possible path to achieve presumed immunity against a disease - within the context of an authority.

property.name: doseNumber
property.description: Nominal position in a series as determined by the outcome of the evaluation process.

property.name: seriesDoses
property.description: The recommended number of doses to achieve immunity as determined by the outcome of the evaluation process.

resource.name: ImmunizationRecommendation
resource.description: A patient's point-in-time set of recommendations (i.e. forecasting) according to a published schedule with optional supporting justification.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. property.name: identifier
property.description: A unique identifier assigned to this particular recommendation record.

property.name: patient
property.description: The patient the recommendation(s) are for.

property.name: date
property.description: The date the immunization recommendation(s) were created.

property.name: authority
property.description: Indicates the authority who published the protocol (e.g. ACIP).

property.name: recommendation
property.description: Vaccine administration recommendations.

element.name: Recommendation
element.description: Vaccine administration recommendations.

property.name: vaccineCode
property.description: Vaccine(s) or vaccine group that pertain to the recommendation.

property.name: targetDisease
property.description: The targeted disease for the recommendation.

property.name: contraindicatedVaccineCode
property.description: Vaccine(s) which should not be used to fulfill the recommendation.

property.name: forecastStatus
property.description: Indicates the patient status with respect to the path to immunity for the target disease.

property.name: forecastReason
property.description: The reason for the assigned forecast status.

property.name: dateCriterion
property.description: Vaccine date recommendations. For example, earliest date to administer, latest date to administer, etc.

property.name: description
property.description: Contains the description about the protocol under which the vaccine was administered.

property.name: series
property.description: One possible path to achieve presumed immunity against a disease - within the context of an authority.

property.name: doseNumber
property.description: Nominal position of the recommended dose in a series as determined by the evaluation and forecasting process (e.g. dose 2 is the next recommended dose).

property.name: seriesDoses
property.description: The recommended number of doses to achieve immunity as determined by the evaluation and forecasting process.

property.name: supportingImmunization
property.description: Immunization event history and/or evaluation that supports the status and recommendation.

property.name: supportingPatientInformation
property.description: Patient Information that supports the status and recommendation. This includes patient observations, adverse reactions and allergy/intolerance information.

resource.name: ImplementationGuide
resource.description: A set of rules of how a particular interoperability or standards problem is solved - typically through the use of FHIR resources. This resource is used to gather all the parts of an implementation guide into a logical whole and to publish a computable definition of all the parts.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this implementation guide when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this implementation guide is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the implementation guide is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this implementation guide when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the implementation guide when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the implementation guide author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the implementation guide. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the implementation guide.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this implementation guide. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this implementation guide is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the implementation guide was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the implementation guide changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the implementation guide.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the implementation guide from a consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate implementation guide instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the implementation guide is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this implementation guide is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the implementation guide and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the implementation guide.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: packageId
property.description: The NPM package name for this Implementation Guide, used in the NPM package distribution, which is the primary mechanism by which FHIR based tooling manages IG dependencies. This value must be globally unique, and should be assigned with care.

property.name: license
property.description: The license that applies to this Implementation Guide, using an SPDX license code, or 'not-open-source'.

property.name: fhirVersion
property.description: The version(s) of the FHIR specification that this ImplementationGuide targets - e.g. describes how to use. The value of this element is the formal version of the specification, without the revision number, e.g. [publication].[major].[minor], which is 4.6.0. for this version.

property.name: dependsOn
property.description: Another implementation guide that this implementation depends on. Typically, an implementation guide uses value sets, profiles etc.defined in other implementation guides.

property.name: global
property.description: A set of profiles that all resources covered by this implementation guide must conform to.

property.name: definition
property.description: The information needed by an IG publisher tool to publish the whole implementation guide.

property.name: manifest
property.description: Information about an assembled implementation guide, created by the publication tooling.

element.name: DependsOn
element.description: Another implementation guide that this implementation depends on. Typically, an implementation guide uses value sets, profiles etc.defined in other implementation guides.

property.name: uri
property.description: A canonical reference to the Implementation guide for the dependency.

property.name: packageId
property.description: The NPM package name for the Implementation Guide that this IG depends on.

property.name: version
property.description: The version of the IG that is depended on, when the correct version is required to understand the IG correctly.

property.name: reason
property.description: A description explaining the nature of the dependency on the listed IG.

element.name: Global
element.description: A set of profiles that all resources covered by this implementation guide must conform to.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of resource that all instances must conform to.

property.name: profile
property.description: A reference to the profile that all instances must conform to.

element.name: Definition
element.description: The information needed by an IG publisher tool to publish the whole implementation guide.

property.name: grouping
property.description: A logical group of resources. Logical groups can be used when building pages.

property.name: resource
property.description: A resource that is part of the implementation guide. Conformance resources (value set, structure definition, capability statements etc.) are obvious candidates for inclusion, but any kind of resource can be included as an example resource.

property.name: page
property.description: A page / section in the implementation guide. The root page is the implementation guide home page.

property.name: parameter
property.description: A set of parameters that defines how the implementation guide is built. The parameters are defined by the relevant tools that build the implementation guides.

property.name: template
property.description: A template for building resources.

element.name: Manifest
element.description: Information about an assembled implementation guide, created by the publication tooling.

property.name: rendering
property.description: A pointer to official web page, PDF or other rendering of the implementation guide.

property.name: resource
property.description: A resource that is part of the implementation guide. Conformance resources (value set, structure definition, capability statements etc.) are obvious candidates for inclusion, but any kind of resource can be included as an example resource.

property.name: page
property.description: Information about a page within the IG.

property.name: image
property.description: Indicates a relative path to an image that exists within the IG.

property.name: other
property.description: Indicates the relative path of an additional non-page, non-image file that is part of the IG - e.g. zip, jar and similar files that could be the target of a hyperlink in a derived IG.

resource.name: Ingredient
resource.description: An ingredient of a manufactured item or pharmaceutical product.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: identifier
property.description: The identifier(s) of this Ingredient that are assigned by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this ingredient. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: for
property.description: The product which this ingredient is a constituent part of.

property.name: role
property.description: A classification of the ingredient identifying its purpose within the product, e.g. active, inactive.

property.name: function
property.description: A classification of the ingredient identifying its precise purpose(s) in the drug product. This extends the Ingredient.role to add more detail. Example: antioxidant, alkalizing agent.

property.name: group
property.description: A classification of the ingredient according to where in the physical item it tends to be used, such the outer shell of a tablet, inner body or ink.

property.name: allergenicIndicator
property.description: If the ingredient is a known or suspected allergen. Note that this is a property of the substance, so if a reference to a SubstanceDefinition is used to decribe that (rather than just a code), the allergen information should go there, not here.

property.name: comment
property.description: A place for providing any notes that are relevant to the component, e.g. removed during process, adjusted for loss on drying.

property.name: manufacturer
property.description: The organization(s) that manufacture this ingredient. Can be used to indicate: 1) Organizations we are aware of that manufacture this ingredient 2) Specific Manufacturer(s) currently being used 3) Set of organisations allowed to manufacture this ingredient for this product Users must be clear on the application of context relevant to their use case.

property.name: substance
property.description: The substance that comprises this ingredient.

element.name: Manufacturer
element.description: The organization(s) that manufacture this ingredient. Can be used to indicate: 1) Organizations we are aware of that manufacture this ingredient 2) Specific Manufacturer(s) currently being used 3) Set of organisations allowed to manufacture this ingredient for this product Users must be clear on the application of context relevant to their use case.

property.name: role
property.description: The way in which this manufacturer is associated with the ingredient. For example whether it is a possible one (others allowed), or an exclusive authorized one for this ingredient. Note that this is not the manufacturing process role.

property.name: manufacturer
property.description: An organization that manufactures this ingredient.

element.name: Substance
element.description: The substance that comprises this ingredient.

property.name: code
property.description: A code or full resource that represents the ingredient's substance.

property.name: strength
property.description: The quantity of substance in the unit of presentation, or in the volume (or mass) of the single pharmaceutical product or manufactured item. The allowed repetitions do not represent different strengths, but are different representations - mathematically equivalent - of a single strength.

resource.description: Details of a Health Insurance product/plan provided by an organization.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this health insurance product which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of the health insurance product.

property.name: type
property.description: The kind of health insurance product.

property.name: name
property.description: Official name of the health insurance product as designated by the owner.

property.name: alias
property.description: A list of alternate names that the product is known as, or was known as in the past.

property.name: period
property.description: The period of time that the health insurance product is available.

property.name: ownedBy
property.description: The entity that is providing the health insurance product and underwriting the risk. This is typically an insurance carriers, other third-party payers, or health plan sponsors comonly referred to as 'payers'.

property.name: administeredBy
property.description: An organization which administer other services such as underwriting, customer service and/or claims processing on behalf of the health insurance product owner.

property.name: coverageArea
property.description: The geographic region in which a health insurance product's benefits apply.

property.name: contact
property.description: The contact details of communication devices available relevant to the specific Insurance Plan/Product. This can include addresses, phone numbers, fax numbers, mobile numbers, email addresses and web sites.

property.name: endpoint
property.description: The technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the health insurance product.

property.name: network
property.description: Reference to the network included in the health insurance product.

property.name: coverage
property.description: Details about the coverage offered by the insurance product.

property.name: plan
property.description: Details about an insurance plan.

element.name: Coverage
element.description: Details about the coverage offered by the insurance product.

property.name: type
property.description: Type of coverage (Medical; Dental; Mental Health; Substance Abuse; Vision; Drug; Short Term; Long Term Care; Hospice; Home Health).

property.name: network
property.description: Reference to the network that providing the type of coverage.

property.name: benefit
property.description: Specific benefits under this type of coverage.

element.name: Plan
element.description: Details about an insurance plan.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this health insurance plan which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: type
property.description: Type of plan. For example, "Platinum" or "High Deductable".

property.name: coverageArea
property.description: The geographic region in which a health insurance plan's benefits apply.

property.name: network
property.description: Reference to the network that providing the type of coverage.

property.name: generalCost
property.description: Overall costs associated with the plan.

property.name: specificCost
property.description: Costs associated with the coverage provided by the product.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifier for the inventory item.

property.name: status
property.description: Status of the item entry.

property.name: category
property.description: Category or class of the item.

property.name: code
property.description: Code designating the specific type of item.

property.name: name
property.description: The item name(s) - the brand name, or common name, functional name, generic name.

property.name: responsibleOrganization
property.description: Organization(s) responsible for the product.

property.name: description
property.description: The descriptive characteristics of the inventory item.

property.name: inventoryStatus
property.description: The usage status e.g. recalled, in use, discarded... This can be used to indicate that the items have been taken out of inventory, or are in use, etc.

property.name: baseUnit
property.description: The base unit of measure - the unit in which the product is used or counted.

property.name: netContent
property.description: Net content or amount present in the item.

property.name: association
property.description: Association with other items or products.

property.name: characteristic
property.description: The descriptive or identifying characteristics of the item.

property.name: instance
property.description: Instances or occurrences of the product.

property.name: productReference
property.description: Link to a product resource used in clinical workflows.

element.name: Name
element.description: The item name(s) - the brand name, or common name, functional name, generic name.

property.name: nameType
property.description: The type of name e.g. 'brand-name', 'functional-name', 'common-name'.

property.name: language
property.description: The language that the item name is expressed in.

property.name: name
property.description: The name or designation that the item is given.

element.name: ResponsibleOrganization
element.description: Organization(s) responsible for the product.

property.name: role
property.description: The role of the organization e.g. manufacturer, distributor, etc.

property.name: organization
property.description: An organization that has an association with the item, e.g. manufacturer, distributor, responsible, etc.

element.name: Description
element.description: The descriptive characteristics of the inventory item.

property.name: language
property.description: The language for the item description, when an item must be described in different languages and those languages may be authoritative and not translations of a 'main' language.

property.name: description
property.description: Textual description of the item.

element.name: Association
element.description: Association with other items or products.

property.name: associationType
property.description: This attribute defined the type of association when establishing associations or relations between items, e.g. 'packaged within' or 'used with' or 'to be mixed with.

property.name: relatedItem
property.description: The related item or product.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The quantity of the related product in this product - Numerator is the quantity of the related product. Denominator is the quantity of the present product. For example a value of 20 means that this product contains 20 units of the related product; a value of 1:20 means the inverse - that the contained product contains 20 units of the present product.

element.name: Characteristic
element.description: The descriptive or identifying characteristics of the item.

property.name: characteristicType
property.description: The type of characteristic that is being defined.

property.name: value
property.description: The value of the attribute.

element.name: Instance
element.description: Instances or occurrences of the product.

property.name: identifier
property.description: The identifier for the physical instance, typically a serial number.

property.name: lotNumber
property.description: The lot or batch number of the item.

property.name: expiry
property.description: The expiry date or date and time for the product.

property.name: subject
property.description: The subject that the item is associated with.

property.name: location
property.description: The location that the item is associated with.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifier for the InventoryReport.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the inventory check or notification - whether this is draft (e.g. the report is still pending some updates) or active.

property.name: countType
property.description: Whether the report is about the current inventory count (snapshot) or a differential change in inventory (change).

property.name: operationType
property.description: What type of operation is being performed - addition or subtraction.

property.name: operationTypeReason
property.description: The reason for this count - regular count, ad-hoc count, new arrivals, etc.

property.name: reportedDateTime
property.description: When the report has been submitted.

property.name: reporter
property.description: Who submits the report.

property.name: reportingPeriod
property.description: The period the report refers to.

property.name: inventoryListing
property.description: An inventory listing section (grouped by any of the attributes).

property.name: note
property.description: A note associated with the InventoryReport.

element.name: InventoryListing
element.description: An inventory listing section (grouped by any of the attributes).

property.name: location
property.description: Location of the inventory items.

property.name: itemStatus
property.description: The status of the items.

property.name: countingDateTime
property.description: The date and time when the items were counted.

property.name: item
property.description: The item or items in this listing.

resource.name: Invoice
resource.description: Invoice containing collected ChargeItems from an Account with calculated individual and total price for Billing purpose.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifier of this Invoice, often used for reference in correspondence about this invoice or for tracking of payments.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of the Invoice.

property.name: cancelledReason
property.description: In case of Invoice cancellation a reason must be given (entered in error, superseded by corrected invoice etc.).

property.name: type
property.description: Type of Invoice depending on domain, realm an usage (e.g. internal/external, dental, preliminary).

property.name: subject
property.description: The individual or set of individuals receiving the goods and services billed in this invoice.

property.name: recipient
property.description: The individual or Organization responsible for balancing of this invoice.

property.name: date
property.description: Depricared by the element below.

property.name: creation
property.description: Date/time(s) of when this Invoice was posted.

property.name: period
property.description: Date/time(s) range of services included in this invoice.

property.name: participant
property.description: Indicates who or what performed or participated in the charged service.

property.name: issuer
property.description: The organizationissuing the Invoice.

property.name: account
property.description: Account which is supposed to be balanced with this Invoice.

property.name: lineItem
property.description: Each line item represents one charge for goods and services rendered. Details such.ofType(date), code and amount are found in the referenced ChargeItem resource.

property.name: totalPriceComponent
property.description: The total amount for the Invoice may be calculated as the sum of the line items with surcharges/deductions that apply in certain conditions. The priceComponent element can be used to offer transparency to the recipient of the Invoice of how the total price was calculated.

property.name: totalNet
property.description: Invoice total , taxes excluded.

property.name: totalGross
property.description: Invoice total, tax included.

property.name: paymentTerms
property.description: Payment details such as banking details, period of payment, deductibles, methods of payment.

property.name: note
property.description: Comments made about the invoice by the issuer, subject, or other participants.

element.name: Participant
element.description: Indicates who or what performed or participated in the charged service.

property.name: role
property.description: Describes the type of involvement (e.g. transcriptionist, creator etc.). If the invoice has been created automatically, the Participant may be a billing engine or another kind of device.

property.name: actor
property.description: The device, practitioner, etc. who performed or participated in the service.

element.name: LineItem
element.description: Each line item represents one charge for goods and services rendered. Details such.ofType(date), code and amount are found in the referenced ChargeItem resource.

property.name: sequence
property.description: Sequence in which the items appear on the invoice.

property.name: serviced
property.description: Date/time(s) range when this service was delivered or completed.

property.name: chargeItem
property.description: The ChargeItem contains information such as the billing code, date, amount etc. If no further details are required for the lineItem, inline billing codes can be added using the CodeableConcept data type instead of the Reference.

property.name: priceComponent
property.description: The price for a ChargeItem may be calculated as a base price with surcharges/deductions that apply in certain conditions. A ChargeItemDefinition resource that defines the prices, factors and conditions that apply to a billing code is currently under development. The priceComponent element can be used to offer transparency to the recipient of the Invoice as to how the prices have been calculated.

resource.name: Library
resource.description: The Library resource is a general-purpose container for knowledge asset definitions. It can be used to describe and expose existing knowledge assets such as logic libraries and information model descriptions, as well as to describe a collection of knowledge assets.

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this library when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this library is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the library is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this library when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. e.g. CMS or NQF identifiers for a measure artifact. Note that at least one identifier is required for non-experimental active artifacts.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the library when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the library author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. To provide a version consistent with the Decision Support Service specification, use the format Major.Minor.Revision (e.g. 1.0.0). For more information on versioning knowledge assets, refer to the Decision Support Service specification. Note that a version is required for non-experimental active artifacts.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the library. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the library.

property.name: subtitle
property.description: An explanatory or alternate title for the library giving additional information about its content.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this library. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this library is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: type
property.description: Identifies the type of library such as a Logic Library, Model Definition, Asset Collection, or Module Definition.

property.name: subject
property.description: A code or group definition that describes the intended subject of the contents of the library.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the library was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the library changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the library.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the library from a consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate library instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the library is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this library is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: usage
property.description: A detailed description of how the library is used from a clinical perspective.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the library and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the library.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: approvalDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

property.name: lastReviewDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.

property.name: effectivePeriod
property.description: The period during which the library content was or is planned to be in active use.

property.name: topic
property.description: Descriptive topics related to the content of the library. Topics provide a high-level categorization of the library that can be useful for filtering and searching.

property.name: author
property.description: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.

property.name: editor
property.description: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.

property.name: reviewer
property.description: An individual or organization asserted by the publisher to be primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.

property.name: endorser
property.description: An individual or organization asserted by the publisher to be responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.

property.name: relatedArtifact
property.description: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.

property.name: parameter
property.description: The parameter element defines parameters used by the library.

property.name: dataRequirement
property.description: Describes a set of data that must be provided in order to be able to successfully perform the computations defined by the library.

property.name: content
property.description: The content of the library as an Attachment. The content may be a reference to a url, or may be directly embedded as a base-64 string. Either way, the contentType of the attachment determines how to interpret the content.

property.name: active
property.description: Indicates whether the asserted set of linkages are considered to be "in effect".

property.name: author
property.description: Identifies the user or organization responsible for asserting the linkages as well as the user or organization who establishes the context in which the nature of each linkage is evaluated.

property.name: item
property.description: Identifies which record considered as the reference to the same real-world occurrence as well as how the items should be evaluated within the collection of linked items.

element.name: Item
element.description: Identifies which record considered as the reference to the same real-world occurrence as well as how the items should be evaluated within the collection of linked items.

property.name: type
property.description: Distinguishes which item is "source of truth" (if any) and which items are no longer considered to be current representations.

property.name: resource
property.description: The resource instance being linked as part of the group.

resource.name: List
resource.description: A List is a curated collection of resources, for things such as problem lists, allergy lists, facility list, organization list, etc.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifier for the List assigned for business purposes outside the context of FHIR.

property.name: status
property.description: Indicates the current state of this list.

property.name: mode
property.description: How this list was prepared - whether it is a working list that is suitable for being maintained on an ongoing basis, or if it represents a snapshot of a list of items from another source, or whether it is a prepared list where items may be marked as added, modified or deleted.

property.name: title
property.description: A label for the list assigned by the author.

property.name: code
property.description: This code defines the purpose of the list - why it was created.

property.name: subject
property.description: The common subject(s) (or patient(s)) of the resources that are in the list if there is one (or a set of subjects).

property.name: encounter
property.description: The encounter that is the context in which this list was created.

property.name: date
property.description: Date list was last reviewed/revised and determined to be 'current'.

property.name: source
property.description: The entity responsible for deciding what the contents of the list were. Where the list was created by a human, this is the same as the author of the list.

property.name: orderedBy
property.description: What order applies to the items in the list.

property.name: note
property.description: Comments that apply to the overall list.

property.name: entry
property.description: Entries in this list.

property.name: emptyReason
property.description: If the list is empty, why the list is empty.

element.name: Entry
element.description: Entries in this list.

property.name: flag
property.description: The flag allows the system constructing the list to indicate the role and significance of the item in the list.

property.name: deleted
property.description: True if this item is marked as deleted in the list.

property.name: date
property.description: When this item was added to the list.

property.name: item
property.description: A reference to the actual resource from which data was derived.

resource.name: Location
resource.description: Details and position information for a place where services are provided and resources and participants may be stored, found, contained, or accommodated.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Unique code or number identifying the location to its users.

property.name: status
property.description: The status property covers the general availability of the resource, not the current value which may be covered by the operationStatus, or by a schedule/slots if they are configured for the location.

property.name: operationalStatus
property.description: The operational status covers operation values most relevant to beds (but can also apply to rooms/units/chairs/etc. such as an isolation unit/dialysis chair). This typically covers concepts such as contamination, housekeeping, and other activities like maintenance.

property.name: name
property.description: Name of the location as used by humans. Does not need to be unique.

property.name: alias
property.description: A list of alternate names that the location is known as, or was known as, in the past.

property.name: description
property.description: Description of the Location, which helps in finding or referencing the place.

property.name: mode
property.description: Indicates whether a resource instance represents a specific location or a class of locations.

property.name: type
property.description: Indicates the type of function performed at the location.

property.name: contact
property.description: The contact details of communication devices available at the location. This can include addresses, phone numbers, fax numbers, mobile numbers, email addresses and web sites.

property.name: address
property.description: Physical location.

property.name: form
property.description: Physical form of the location, e.g. building, room, vehicle, road, virtual.

property.name: position
property.description: The absolute geographic location of the Location, expressed using the WGS84 datum (This is the same co-ordinate system used in KML).

property.name: managingOrganization
property.description: The organization responsible for the provisioning and upkeep of the location.

property.name: partOf
property.description: Another Location of which this Location is physically a part of.

property.name: characteristic
property.description: Collection of characteristics (attributes).

property.name: hoursOfOperation
property.description: What days/times during a week is this location usually open, and any exceptions where the location is not available.

property.name: virtualService
property.description: Connection details of a virtual service (e.g. shared conference call facility with dedicated number/details).

property.name: endpoint
property.description: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the location.

element.name: Position
element.description: The absolute geographic location of the Location, expressed using the WGS84 datum (This is the same co-ordinate system used in KML).

property.name: longitude
property.description: Longitude. The value domain and the interpretation are the same as for the text of the longitude element in KML (see notes on Location main page).

property.name: latitude
property.description: Latitude. The value domain and the interpretation are the same as for the text of the latitude element in KML (see notes on Location main page).

property.name: altitude
property.description: Altitude. The value domain and the interpretation are the same as for the text of the altitude element in KML (see notes on Location main page).

resource.name: ManufacturedItemDefinition
resource.description: The definition and characteristics of a medicinal manufactured item, such as a tablet or capsule, as contained in a packaged medicinal product.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Unique identifier.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this item. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: name
property.description: A descriptive name applied to this item.

property.name: manufacturedDoseForm
property.description: Dose form as manufactured and before any transformation into the pharmaceutical product.

property.name: unitOfPresentation
property.description: The "real-world" units in which the quantity of the manufactured item is described.

property.name: manufacturer
property.description: Manufacturer of the item, one of several possible.

property.name: marketingStatus
property.description: Allows specifying that an item is on the market for sale, or that it is not available, and the dates and locations associated.

property.name: ingredient
property.description: The ingredients of this manufactured item. This is only needed if the ingredients are not specified by incoming references from the Ingredient resource.

property.name: property
property.description: General characteristics of this item.

property.name: component
property.description: Physical parts of the manufactured item, that it is intrisically made from. This is distinct from the ingredients that are part of its chemical makeup.

element.name: Property
element.description: General characteristics of this item.

property.name: type
property.description: A code expressing the type of characteristic.

property.name: value
property.description: A value for the characteristic.

element.name: Component
element.description: Physical parts of the manufactured item, that it is intrisically made from. This is distinct from the ingredients that are part of its chemical makeup.

property.name: type
property.description: Defining type of the component e.g. shell, layer, ink.

property.name: function
property.description: The function of this component within the item e.g. delivers active ingredient, masks taste.

property.name: amount
property.description: The measurable amount of total quantity of all substances in the component, expressable in different ways (e.g. by mass or volume).

property.name: constituent
property.description: A reference to a constituent of the manufactured item as a whole, linked here so that its component location within the item can be indicated. This not where the item's ingredient are primarily stated (for which see Ingredient.for or ManufacturedItemDefinition.ingredient).

property.name: property
property.description: General characteristics of this component.

property.name: component
property.description: A component that this component contains or is made from.

resource.name: Measure
resource.description: The Measure resource provides the definition of a quality measure.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this measure when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this measure is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the measure is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this measure when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the measure when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the measure author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. To provide a version consistent with the Decision Support Service specification, use the format Major.Minor.Revision (e.g. 1.0.0). For more information on versioning knowledge assets, refer to the Decision Support Service specification. Note that a version is required for non-experimental active artifacts.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the measure. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the measure.

property.name: subtitle
property.description: An explanatory or alternate title for the measure giving additional information about its content.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this measure. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this measure is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: subject
property.description: The intended subjects for the measure. If this element is not provided, a Patient subject is assumed, but the subject of the measure can be anything.

property.name: basis
property.description: The population basis specifies the type of elements in the population. For a subject-based measure, this is boolean (because the subject and the population basis are the same, and the population criteria define yes/no values for each individual in the population). For measures that have a population basis that is different than the subject, this element specifies the type of the population basis. For example, an encounter-based measure has a subject of Patient and a population basis of Encounter, and the population criteria all return lists of Encounters.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the measure was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the measure changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the measure.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the measure from a consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate measure instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the measure is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this measure is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: usage
property.description: A detailed description, from a clinical perspective, of how the measure is used.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the measure and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the measure.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: approvalDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

property.name: lastReviewDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.

property.name: effectivePeriod
property.description: The period during which the measure content was or is planned to be in active use.

property.name: topic
property.description: Descriptive topics related to the content of the measure. Topics provide a high-level categorization grouping types of measures that can be useful for filtering and searching.

property.name: author
property.description: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.

property.name: editor
property.description: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.

property.name: reviewer
property.description: An individual or organization asserted by the publisher to be primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.

property.name: endorser
property.description: An individual or organization asserted by the publisher to be responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.

property.name: relatedArtifact
property.description: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.

property.name: library
property.description: A reference to a Library resource containing the formal logic used by the measure.

property.name: disclaimer
property.description: Notices and disclaimers regarding the use of the measure or related to intellectual property (such as code systems) referenced by the measure.

property.name: scoring
property.description: Indicates how the calculation is performed for the measure, including proportion, ratio, continuous-variable, and cohort. The value set is extensible, allowing additional measure scoring types to be represented.

property.name: scoringUnit
property.description: Defines the expected units of measure for the measure score. This element SHOULD be specified as a UCUM unit.

property.name: compositeScoring
property.description: If this is a composite measure, the scoring method used to combine the component measures to determine the composite score.

property.name: type
property.description: Indicates whether the measure is used to examine a process, an outcome over time, a patient-reported outcome, or a structure measure such as utilization.

property.name: riskAdjustment
property.description: A description of the risk adjustment factors that may impact the resulting score for the measure and how they may be accounted for when computing and reporting measure results.

property.name: rateAggregation
property.description: Describes how to combine the information calculated, based on logic in each of several populations, into one summarized result.

property.name: rationale
property.description: Provides a succinct statement of the need for the measure. Usually includes statements pertaining to importance criterion: impact, gap in care, and evidence.

property.name: clinicalRecommendationStatement
property.description: Provides a summary of relevant clinical guidelines or other clinical recommendations supporting the measure.

property.name: improvementNotation
property.description: Information on whether an increase or decrease in score is the preferred result (e.g., a higher score indicates better quality OR a lower score indicates better quality OR quality is within a range).

property.name: term
property.description: Provides a description of an individual term used within the measure.

property.name: guidance
property.description: Additional guidance for the measure including how it can be used in a clinical context, and the intent of the measure.

property.name: group
property.description: A group of population criteria for the measure.

property.name: supplementalData
property.description: The supplemental data criteria for the measure report, specified as either the name of a valid CQL expression within a referenced library, or a valid FHIR Resource Path.

element.name: Term
element.description: Provides a description of an individual term used within the measure.

property.name: code
property.description: A codeable representation of the defined term.

property.name: definition
property.description: Provides a definition for the term as used within the measure.

element.name: Group
element.description: A group of population criteria for the measure.

property.name: linkId
property.description: An identifier that is unique within the Measure allowing linkage to the equivalent item in a MeasureReport resource.

property.name: code
property.description: Indicates a meaning for the group. This can be as simple as a unique identifier, or it can establish meaning in a broader context by drawing from a terminology, allowing groups to be correlated across measures.

property.name: description
property.description: The human readable description of this population group.

property.name: type
property.description: Indicates whether the measure is used to examine a process, an outcome over time, a patient-reported outcome, or a structure measure such as utilization.

property.name: subject
property.description: The intended subjects for the measure. If this element is not provided, a Patient subject is assumed, but the subject of the measure can be anything.

property.name: basis
property.description: The population basis specifies the type of elements in the population. For a subject-based measure, this is boolean (because the subject and the population basis are the same, and the population criteria define yes/no values for each individual in the population). For measures that have a population basis that is different than the subject, this element specifies the type of the population basis. For example, an encounter-based measure has a subject of Patient and a population basis of Encounter, and the population criteria all return lists of Encounters.

property.name: scoring
property.description: Indicates how the calculation is performed for the measure, including proportion, ratio, continuous-variable, and cohort. The value set is extensible, allowing additional measure scoring types to be represented.

property.name: scoringUnit
property.description: Defines the expected units of measure for the measure score. This element SHOULD be specified as a UCUM unit.

property.name: rateAggregation
property.description: Describes how to combine the information calculated, based on logic in each of several populations, into one summarized result.

property.name: improvementNotation
property.description: Information on whether an increase or decrease in score is the preferred result (e.g., a higher score indicates better quality OR a lower score indicates better quality OR quality is within a range).

property.name: library
property.description: A reference to a Library resource containing the formal logic used by the measure group.

property.name: population
property.description: A population criteria for the measure.

property.name: stratifier
property.description: The stratifier criteria for the measure report, specified as either the name of a valid CQL expression defined within a referenced library or a valid FHIR Resource Path.

element.name: SupplementalData
element.description: The supplemental data criteria for the measure report, specified as either the name of a valid CQL expression within a referenced library, or a valid FHIR Resource Path.

property.name: linkId
property.description: An identifier that is unique within the Measure allowing linkage to the equivalent item in a MeasureReport resource.

property.name: code
property.description: Indicates a meaning for the supplemental data. This can be as simple as a unique identifier, or it can establish meaning in a broader context by drawing from a terminology, allowing supplemental data to be correlated across measures.

property.name: usage
property.description: An indicator of the intended usage for the supplemental data element. Supplemental data indicates the data is additional information requested to augment the measure information. Risk adjustment factor indicates the data is additional information used to calculate risk adjustment factors when applying a risk model to the measure calculation.

property.name: description
property.description: The human readable description of this supplemental data.

property.name: criteria
property.description: The criteria for the supplemental data. This is typically the name of a valid expression defined within a referenced library, but it may also be a path to a specific data element. The criteria defines the data to be returned for this element.

resource.name: MeasureReport
resource.description: The MeasureReport resource contains the results of the calculation of a measure; and optionally a reference to the resources involved in that calculation.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
