property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this MeasureReport when it is represented in other formats or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: status
property.description: The MeasureReport status. No data will be available until the MeasureReport status is complete.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of measure report. This may be an individual report, which provides the score for the measure for an individual member of the population; a subject-listing, which returns the list of members that meet the various criteria in the measure; a summary report, which returns a population count for each of the criteria in the measure; or a data-collection, which enables the MeasureReport to be used to exchange the data-of-interest for a quality measure.

property.name: dataUpdateType
property.description: Indicates whether the data submitted in a data-exchange report represents a snapshot or incremental update. A snapshot update replaces all previously submitted data for the receiver, whereas an incremental update represents only updated and/or changed data and should be applied as a differential update to the existing submitted data for the receiver.

property.name: measure
property.description: A reference to the Measure that was calculated to produce this report.

property.name: subject
property.description: Optional subject identifying the individual or individuals the report is for.

property.name: date
property.description: The date this measure was calculated.

property.name: reporter
property.description: The individual or organization that is reporting the data.

property.name: reportingVendor
property.description: A reference to the vendor who queried the data, calculated results and/or generated the report. The 'reporting vendor' is intended to represent the submitting entity when it is not the same as the reporting entity. This extension is used when the Receiver is interested in getting vendor information in the report.

property.name: location
property.description: A reference to the location for which the data is being reported.

property.name: period
property.description: The reporting period for which the report was calculated.

property.name: inputParameters
property.description: A reference to a Parameters resource (typically represented using a contained resource) that represents any input parameters that were provided to the operation that generated the report.

property.name: scoring
property.description: Indicates how the calculation is performed for the measure, including proportion, ratio, continuous-variable, and cohort. The value set is extensible, allowing additional measure scoring types to be represented. It is expected to be the same as the scoring element on the referenced Measure.

property.name: improvementNotation
property.description: Whether improvement in the measure is noted by an increase or decrease in the measure score.

property.name: group
property.description: The results of the calculation, one for each population group in the measure.

property.name: supplementalData
property.description: A reference to a Resource that represents additional information collected for the report. If the value of the supplemental data is not a Resource (i.e. evaluating the supplementalData expression for this case in the measure results in a value that is not a FHIR Resource), it is reported as a reference to a contained Observation resource.

property.name: evaluatedResource
property.description: Evaluated resources are used to capture what data was involved in the calculation of a measure. This usage is only allowed for individual reports to ensure that the size of the MeasureReport resource is bounded.

element.name: Group
element.description: The results of the calculation, one for each population group in the measure.

property.name: linkId
property.description: The group from the Measure that corresponds to this group in the MeasureReport resource.

property.name: code
property.description: The meaning of the population group as defined in the measure definition.

property.name: subject
property.description: Optional subject identifying the individual or individuals the report is for.

property.name: population
property.description: The populations that make up the population group, one for each type of population appropriate for the measure.

property.name: measureScore
property.description: The measure score for this population group, calculated as appropriate for the measure type and scoring method, and based on the contents of the populations defined in the group.

property.name: stratifier
property.description: When a measure includes multiple stratifiers, there will be a stratifier group for each stratifier defined by the measure.

resource.name: Medication
resource.description: This resource is primarily used for the identification and definition of a medication, including ingredients, for the purposes of prescribing, dispensing, and administering a medication as well as for making statements about medication use.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifier for this medication.

property.name: code
property.description: A code (or set of codes) that specify this medication, or a textual description if no code is available. Usage note: This could be a standard medication code such as a code from RxNorm, SNOMED CT, IDMP etc. It could also be a national or local formulary code, optionally with translations to other code systems.

property.name: status
property.description: A code to indicate if the medication is in active use.

property.name: marketingAuthorizationHolder
property.description: The company or other legal entity that has authorization, from the appropriate drug regulatory authority, to market a medicine in one or more jurisdictions. Typically abbreviated MAH.Note: The MAH may manufacture the product and may also contract the manufacturing of the product to one or more companies (organizations).

property.name: doseForm
property.description: Describes the form of the item. Powder; tablets; capsule.

property.name: totalVolume
property.description: When the specified product code does not infer a package size, this is the specific amount of drug in the product. For example, when specifying a product that has the same strength (For example, Insulin glargine 100 unit per mL solution for injection), this attribute provides additional clarification of the package amount (For example, 3 mL, 10mL, etc.).

property.name: ingredient
property.description: Identifies a particular constituent of interest in the product.

property.name: batch
property.description: Information that only applies to packages (not products).

property.name: definition
property.description: A reference to a knowledge resource that provides more information about this medication.

element.name: Ingredient
element.description: Identifies a particular constituent of interest in the product.

property.name: item
property.description: The ingredient (substance or medication) that the ingredient.strength relates to. This is represented as a concept from a code system or described in another resource (Substance or Medication).

property.name: isActive
property.description: Indication of whether this ingredient affects the therapeutic action of the drug.

property.name: strength
property.description: Specifies how many (or how much) of the items there are in this Medication. For example, 250 mg per tablet. This is expressed as a ratio where the numerator is 250mg and the denominator is 1 tablet but can also be expressed a quantity when the denominator is assumed to be 1 tablet.

element.name: Batch
element.description: Information that only applies to packages (not products).

property.name: lotNumber
property.description: The assigned lot number of a batch of the specified product.

property.name: expirationDate
property.description: When this specific batch of product will expire.

resource.name: MedicationAdministration
resource.description: Describes the event of a patient consuming or otherwise being administered a medication. This may be as simple as swallowing a tablet or it may be a long running infusion. Related resources tie this event to the authorizing prescription, and the specific encounter between patient and health care practitioner. This event can also be used to record waste using a status of not-done and the appropriate statusReason.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifiers associated with this Medication Administration that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate. They are business identifiers assigned to this resource by the performer or other systems and remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A plan that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this MedicationAdministration.

property.name: partOf
property.description: A larger event of which this particular event is a component or step.

property.name: status
property.description: Will generally be set to show that the administration has been completed. For some long running administrations such as infusions, it is possible for an administration to be started but not completed or it may be paused while some other process is under way.

property.name: statusReason
property.description: A code indicating why the administration was not performed.

property.name: category
property.description: The type of medication administration (for example, drug classification like ATC, where meds would be administered, legal category of the medication).

property.name: medication
property.description: Identifies the medication that was administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

property.name: subject
property.description: The person or animal or group receiving the medication.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The visit, admission, or other contact between patient and health care provider during which the medication administration was performed.

property.name: supportingInformation
property.description: Additional information (for example, patient height and weight) that supports the administration of the medication. This attribute can be used to provide documentation of specific characteristics of the patient present at the time of administration. For example, if the dose says "give "x" if the heartrate exceeds "y"", then the heart rate can be included using this attribute.

property.name: occurence
property.description: A specific date/time or interval of time during which the administration took place (or did not take place). For many administrations, such as swallowing a tablet the use of dateTime is more appropriate.

property.name: recorded
property.description: The date the occurrence of the MedicationAdministration was first captured in the record - potentially significantly after the occurrence of the event.

property.name: isSubPotent
property.description: An indication that the full dose was not administered.

property.name: subPotentReason
property.description: The reason or reasons why the full dose was not administered.

property.name: performer
property.description: The performer of the medication treatment. For devices this is the device that performed the administration of the medication. An IV Pump would be an example of a device that is performing the administration. Both the IV Pump and the practitioner that set the rate or bolus on the pump can be listed as performers.

property.name: reason
property.description: A code, Condition or observation that supports why the medication was administered.

property.name: request
property.description: The original request, instruction or authority to perform the administration.

property.name: device
property.description: The device that is to be used for the administration of the medication (for example, PCA Pump).

property.name: note
property.description: Extra information about the medication administration that is not conveyed by the other attributes.

property.name: dosage
property.description: Describes the medication dosage information details e.g. dose, rate, site, route, etc.

property.name: eventHistory
property.description: A summary of the events of interest that have occurred, such as when the administration was verified.

element.name: Performer
element.description: The performer of the medication treatment. For devices this is the device that performed the administration of the medication. An IV Pump would be an example of a device that is performing the administration. Both the IV Pump and the practitioner that set the rate or bolus on the pump can be listed as performers.

property.name: function
property.description: Distinguishes the type of involvement of the performer in the medication administration.

property.name: actor
property.description: Indicates who or what performed the medication administration.

element.name: Dosage
element.description: Describes the medication dosage information details e.g. dose, rate, site, route, etc.

property.name: text
property.description: Free text dosage can be used for cases where the dosage administered is too complex to code. When coded dosage is present, the free text dosage may still be present for display to humans. The dosage instructions should reflect the dosage of the medication that was administered.

property.name: site
property.description: A coded specification of the anatomic site where the medication first entered the body. For example, "left arm".

property.name: route
property.description: A code specifying the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto the patient. For example, topical, intravenous, etc.

property.name: method
property.description: A coded value indicating the method by which the medication is intended to be or was introduced into or on the body. This attribute will most often NOT be populated. It is most commonly used for injections. For example, Slow Push, Deep IV.

property.name: dose
property.description: The amount of the medication given at one administration event. Use this value when the administration is essentially an instantaneous event such as a swallowing a tablet or giving an injection.

property.name: rate
property.description: Identifies the speed with which the medication was or will be introduced into the patient. Typically, the rate for an infusion e.g. 100 ml per 1 hour or 100 ml/hr. May also be expressed as a rate per unit of time, e.g. 500 ml per 2 hours. Other examples: 200 mcg/min or 200 mcg/1 minute; 1 liter/8 hours.

resource.name: MedicationDispense
resource.description: Indicates that a medication product is to be or has been dispensed for a named person/patient. This includes a description of the medication product (supply) provided and the instructions for administering the medication. The medication dispense is the result of a pharmacy system responding to a medication order.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifiers associated with this Medication Dispense that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate. They are business identifiers assigned to this resource by the performer or other systems and remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A plan that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this MedicationDispense.

property.name: partOf
property.description: The procedure or medication administration that triggered the dispense.

property.name: status
property.description: A code specifying the state of the set of dispense events.

property.name: notPerformedReason
property.description: Indicates the reason why a dispense was not performed.

property.name: statusChanged
property.description: The date (and maybe time) when the status of the dispense record changed.

property.name: category
property.description: Indicates the type of medication dispense (for example, drug classification like ATC, where meds would be administered, legal category of the medication.).

property.name: medication
property.description: Identifies the medication supplied. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

property.name: subject
property.description: A link to a resource representing the person or the group to whom the medication will be given.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The encounter that establishes the context for this event.

property.name: supportingInformation
property.description: Additional information that supports the medication being dispensed. For example, there may be requirements that a specific lab test has been completed prior to dispensing or the patient's weight at the time of dispensing is documented.

property.name: performer
property.description: Indicates who or what performed the event.

property.name: location
property.description: The principal physical location where the dispense was performed.

property.name: authorizingPrescription
property.description: Indicates the medication order that is being dispensed against.

property.name: type
property.description: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. For example, Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The amount of medication that has been dispensed. Includes unit of measure.

property.name: daysSupply
property.description: The amount of medication expressed as a timing amount.

property.name: recorded
property.description: The date (and maybe time) when the dispense activity started if whenPrepared or whenHandedOver is not populated.

property.name: whenPrepared
property.description: The time when the dispensed product was packaged and reviewed.

property.name: whenHandedOver
property.description: The time the dispensed product was provided to the patient or their representative.

property.name: destination
property.description: Identification of the facility/location where the medication was/will be shipped to, as part of the dispense event.

property.name: receiver
property.description: Identifies the person who picked up the medication or the location of where the medication was delivered. This will usually be a patient or their caregiver, but some cases exist where it can be a healthcare professional or a location.

property.name: note
property.description: Extra information about the dispense that could not be conveyed in the other attributes.

property.name: renderedDosageInstruction
property.description: The full representation of the dose of the medication included in all dosage instructions. To be used when multiple dosage instructions are included to represent complex dosing such as increasing or tapering doses.

property.name: dosageInstruction
property.description: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.

property.name: substitution
property.description: Indicates whether or not substitution was made as part of the dispense. In some cases, substitution will be expected but does not happen, in other cases substitution is not expected but does happen. This block explains what substitution did or did not happen and why. If nothing is specified, substitution was not done.

property.name: eventHistory
property.description: A summary of the events of interest that have occurred, such as when the dispense was verified.

element.name: Performer
element.description: Indicates who or what performed the event.

property.name: function
property.description: Distinguishes the type of performer in the dispense. For example, date enterer, packager, final checker.

property.name: actor
property.description: The device, practitioner, etc. who performed the action. It should be assumed that the actor is the dispenser of the medication.

element.name: Substitution
element.description: Indicates whether or not substitution was made as part of the dispense. In some cases, substitution will be expected but does not happen, in other cases substitution is not expected but does happen. This block explains what substitution did or did not happen and why. If nothing is specified, substitution was not done.

property.name: wasSubstituted
property.description: True if the dispenser dispensed a different drug or product from what was prescribed.

property.name: type
property.description: A code signifying whether a different drug was dispensed from what was prescribed.

property.name: reason
property.description: Indicates the reason for the substitution (or lack of substitution) from what was prescribed.

property.name: responsibleParty
property.description: The person or organization that has primary responsibility for the substitution.

resource.name: MedicationKnowledge
resource.description: Information about a medication that is used to support knowledge.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifier for this medication.

property.name: code
property.description: A code that specifies this medication, or a textual description if no code is available. Usage note: This could be a standard medication code such as a code from RxNorm, SNOMED CT, IDMP etc. It could also be a national or local formulary code, optionally with translations to other code systems.

property.name: status
property.description: A code to indicate if the medication referred to by this MedicationKnowledge is in active use within the drug database or inventory system. The status refers to the validity about the information of the medication and not to its medicinal properties.

property.name: author
property.description: The creator or owner of the knowledge or information about the medication.

property.name: intendedJurisdiction
property.description: Lists the jurisdictions that this medication knowledge was written for.

property.name: name
property.description: All of the names for a medication, for example, the name(s) given to a medication in different countries. For example, acetaminophen and paracetamol or salbutamol and albuterol.

property.name: relatedMedicationKnowledge
property.description: Associated or related medications. For example, if the medication is a branded product (e.g. Crestor), this is the Therapeutic Moeity (e.g. Rosuvastatin) or if this is a generic medication (e.g. Rosuvastatin), this would link to a branded product (e.g. Crestor.

property.name: associatedMedication
property.description: Links to associated medications that could be prescribed, dispensed or administered.

property.name: productType
property.description: Category of the medication or product (e.g. branded product, therapeutic moeity, generic product, innovator product, etc.).

property.name: monograph
property.description: Associated documentation about the medication.

property.name: preparationInstruction
property.description: The instructions for preparing the medication.

property.name: cost
property.description: The price of the medication.

property.name: monitoringProgram
property.description: The program under which the medication is reviewed.

property.name: indicationGuideline
property.description: Guidelines or protocols that are applicable for the administration of the medication based on indication.

property.name: medicineClassification
property.description: Categorization of the medication within a formulary or classification system.

property.name: packaging
property.description: Information that only applies to packages (not products).

property.name: clinicalUseIssue
property.description: Potential clinical issue with or between medication(s) (for example, drug-drug interaction, drug-disease contraindication, drug-allergy interaction, etc.).

property.name: storageGuideline
property.description: Information on how the medication should be stored, for example, refrigeration temperatures and length of stability at a given temperature.

property.name: regulatory
property.description: Regulatory information about a medication.

property.name: definitional
property.description: Along with the link to a Medicinal Product Definition resource, this information provides common definitional elements that are needed to understand the specific medication that is being described.

element.name: RelatedMedicationKnowledge
element.description: Associated or related medications. For example, if the medication is a branded product (e.g. Crestor), this is the Therapeutic Moeity (e.g. Rosuvastatin) or if this is a generic medication (e.g. Rosuvastatin), this would link to a branded product (e.g. Crestor.

property.name: type
property.description: The category of the associated medication knowledge reference.

property.name: reference
property.description: Associated documentation about the associated medication knowledge.

element.name: Monograph
element.description: Associated documentation about the medication.

property.name: type
property.description: The category of documentation about the medication. (e.g. professional monograph, patient education monograph).

property.name: source
property.description: Associated documentation about the medication.

element.name: Cost
element.description: The price of the medication.

property.name: effectiveDate
property.description: The date range for which the cost information of the medication is effective.

property.name: type
property.description: The category of the cost information. For example, manufacturers' cost, patient cost, claim reimbursement cost, actual acquisition cost.

property.name: source
property.description: The source or owner that assigns the price to the medication.

property.name: cost
property.description: The price or representation of the cost (for example, Band A, Band B or $, $$) of the medication.

element.name: MonitoringProgram
element.description: The program under which the medication is reviewed.

property.name: type
property.description: Type of program under which the medication is monitored.

property.name: name
property.description: Name of the reviewing program.

element.name: IndicationGuideline
element.description: Guidelines or protocols that are applicable for the administration of the medication based on indication.

property.name: indication
property.description: Indication or reason for use of the medication that applies to the specific administration guideline.

property.name: dosingGuideline
property.description: The guidelines for the dosage of the medication for the indication.

element.name: MedicineClassification
element.description: Categorization of the medication within a formulary or classification system.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of category for the medication (for example, therapeutic classification, therapeutic sub-classification).

property.name: source
property.description: Either a textual source of the classification or a reference to an online source.

property.name: classification
property.description: Specific category assigned to the medication (e.g. anti-infective, anti-hypertensive, antibiotic, etc.).

element.name: Packaging
element.description: Information that only applies to packages (not products).

property.name: cost
property.description: The cost of the packaged medication.

property.name: packagedProduct
property.description: A reference to a PackagedProductDefinition that provides the details of the product that is in the packaging and is being priced.

element.name: StorageGuideline
element.description: Information on how the medication should be stored, for example, refrigeration temperatures and length of stability at a given temperature.

property.name: reference
property.description: Reference to additional information about the storage guidelines.

property.name: note
property.description: Additional notes about the storage.

property.name: stabilityDuration
property.description: Duration that the medication remains stable if the environmentalSetting is respected.

property.name: environmentalSetting
property.description: Describes a setting/value on the environment for the adequate storage of the medication and other substances. Environment settings may involve temperature, humidity, or exposure to light.

element.name: Regulatory
element.description: Regulatory information about a medication.

property.name: regulatoryAuthority
property.description: The authority that is specifying the regulations.

property.name: substitution
property.description: Specifies if changes are allowed when dispensing a medication from a regulatory perspective.

property.name: schedule
property.description: Specifies the schedule of a medication in jurisdiction.

property.name: maxDispense
property.description: The maximum number of units of the medication that can be dispensed in a period.

element.name: Definitional
element.description: Along with the link to a Medicinal Product Definition resource, this information provides common definitional elements that are needed to understand the specific medication that is being described.

property.name: definition
property.description: Associated definitions for this medication.

property.name: doseForm
property.description: Describes the form of the item. Powder; tablets; capsule.

property.name: intendedRoute
property.description: The intended or approved route of administration.

property.name: ingredient
property.description: Identifies a particular constituent of interest in the product.

property.name: drugCharacteristic
property.description: Specifies descriptive properties of the medicine, such as color, shape, imprints, etc.

resource.name: MedicationRequest
resource.description: An order or request for both supply of the medication and the instructions for administration of the medication to a patient. The resource is called "MedicationRequest" rather than "MedicationPrescription" or "MedicationOrder" to generalize the use across inpatient and outpatient settings, including care plans, etc., and to harmonize with workflow patterns.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifiers associated with this medication request that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate. They are business identifiers assigned to this resource by the performer or other systems and remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this medication request.

property.name: priorPrescription
property.description: Reference to an order/prescription that is being replaced by this MedicationRequest.

property.name: groupIdentifier
property.description: A shared identifier common to multiple independent Request instances that were activated/authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author. The presence of the same identifier on each request ties those requests together and may have business ramifications in terms of reporting of results, billing, etc. E.g. a requisition number shared by a set of lab tests ordered together, or a prescription number shared by all meds ordered at one time.

property.name: status
property.description: A code specifying the current state of the order. Generally, this will be active or completed state.

property.name: statusReason
property.description: Captures the reason for the current state of the MedicationRequest.

property.name: statusChanged
property.description: The date (and perhaps time) when the status was changed.

property.name: intent
property.description: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, or an original order.

property.name: category
property.description: An arbitrary categorization or grouping of the medication request. It could be used for indicating where meds are intended to be administered, eg. in an inpatient setting or in a patient's home, or a legal category of the medication.

property.name: priority
property.description: Indicates how quickly the Medication Request should be addressed with respect to other requests.

property.name: doNotPerform
property.description: If true, indicates that the provider is asking for the patient to either stop taking or to not start taking the specified medication. For example, the patient is taking an existing medication and the provider is changing their medication. They want to create two seperate requests: one to stop using the current medication and another to start the new medication.

property.name: medication
property.description: Identifies the medication being requested. This is a link to a resource that represents the medication which may be the details of the medication or simply an attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

property.name: subject
property.description: The individual or group for whom the medication has been requested.

property.name: informationSource
property.description: The person or organization who provided the information about this request, if the source is someone other than the requestor. This is often used when the MedicationRequest is reported by another person.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The Encounter during which this [x] was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

property.name: supportingInformation
property.description: Information to support fulfilling (i.e. dispensing or administering) of the medication, for example, patient height and weight, a MedicationStatement for the patient).

property.name: authoredOn
property.description: The date (and perhaps time) when the prescription was initially written or authored on.

property.name: requester
property.description: The individual, organization, or device that initiated the request and has responsibility for its activation.

property.name: reported
property.description: Indicates if this record was captured as a secondary 'reported' record rather than as an original primary source-of-truth record. It may also indicate the source of the report.

property.name: performerType
property.description: Indicates the type of performer of the administration of the medication.

property.name: performer
property.description: The specified desired performer of the medication treatment (e.g. the performer of the medication administration). For devices, this is the device that is intended to perform the administration of the medication. An IV Pump would be an example of a device that is performing the administration. Both the IV Pump and the practitioner that set the rate or bolus on the pump can be listed as performers.

property.name: device
property.description: The intended type of device that is to be used for the administration of the medication (for example, PCA Pump).

property.name: recorder
property.description: The person who entered the order on behalf of another individual for example in the case of a verbal or a telephone order.

property.name: reason
property.description: The reason or the indication for ordering or not ordering the medication.

property.name: courseOfTherapyType
property.description: The description of the overall pattern of the administration of the medication to the patient.

property.name: insurance
property.description: Insurance plans, coverage extensions, pre-authorizations and/or pre-determinations that may be required for delivering the requested service.

property.name: note
property.description: Extra information about the prescription that could not be conveyed by the other attributes.

property.name: renderedDosageInstruction
property.description: The full representation of the dose of the medication included in all dosage instructions. To be used when multiple dosage instructions are included to represent complex dosing such as increasing or tapering doses.

property.name: effectiveDosePeriod
property.description: The period over which the medication is to be taken. Where there are multiple dosageInstruction lines (for example, tapering doses), this is the earliest date and the latest end date of the dosageInstructions.

property.name: dosageInstruction
property.description: Specific instructions for how the medication is to be used by the patient.

property.name: dispenseRequest
property.description: Indicates the specific details for the dispense or medication supply part of a medication request (also known as a Medication Prescription or Medication Order). Note that this information is not always sent with the order. There may be in some settings (e.g. hospitals) institutional or system support for completing the dispense details in the pharmacy department.

property.name: substitution
property.description: Indicates whether or not substitution can or should be part of the dispense. In some cases, substitution must happen, in other cases substitution must not happen. This block explains the prescriber's intent. If nothing is specified substitution may be done.

property.name: eventHistory
property.description: Links to Provenance records for past versions of this resource or fulfilling request or event resources that identify key state transitions or updates that are likely to be relevant to a user looking at the current version of the resource.

element.name: DispenseRequest
element.description: Indicates the specific details for the dispense or medication supply part of a medication request (also known as a Medication Prescription or Medication Order). Note that this information is not always sent with the order. There may be in some settings (e.g. hospitals) institutional or system support for completing the dispense details in the pharmacy department.

property.name: initialFill
property.description: Indicates the quantity or duration for the first dispense of the medication.

property.name: dispenseInterval
property.description: The minimum period of time that must occur between dispenses of the medication.

property.name: validityPeriod
property.description: This indicates the validity period of a prescription (stale dating the Prescription).

property.name: numberOfRepeatsAllowed
property.description: An integer indicating the number of times, in addition to the original dispense, (aka refills or repeats) that the patient can receive the prescribed medication. Usage Notes: This integer does not include the original order dispense. This means that if an order indicates dispense 30 tablets plus "3 repeats", then the order can be dispensed a total of 4 times and the patient can receive a total of 120 tablets. A prescriber may explicitly say that zero refills are permitted after the initial dispense.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The amount that is to be dispensed for one fill.

property.name: expectedSupplyDuration
property.description: Identifies the period time over which the supplied product is expected to be used, or the length of time the dispense is expected to last.

property.name: dispenser
property.description: Indicates the intended performing Organization that will dispense the medication as specified by the prescriber.

property.name: dispenserInstruction
property.description: Provides additional information to the dispenser, for example, counselling to be provided to the patient.

property.name: doseAdministrationAid
property.description: Provides information about the type of adherence packaging to be supplied for the medication dispense.

element.name: Substitution
element.description: Indicates whether or not substitution can or should be part of the dispense. In some cases, substitution must happen, in other cases substitution must not happen. This block explains the prescriber's intent. If nothing is specified substitution may be done.

property.name: allowed
property.description: True if the prescriber allows a different drug to be dispensed from what was prescribed.

property.name: reason
property.description: Indicates the reason for the substitution, or why substitution must or must not be performed.

resource.name: MedicationStatement
resource.description: A record of a medication that is being consumed by a patient. A MedicationStatement may indicate that the patient may be taking the medication now or has taken the medication in the past or will be taking the medication in the future. The source of this information can be the patient, significant other (such as a family member or spouse), or a clinician. A common scenario where this information is captured is during the history taking process during a patient visit or stay. The medication information may come from sources such as the patient's memory, from a prescription bottle, or from a list of medications the patient, clinician or other party maintains. The primary difference between a medicationstatement and a medicationadministration is that the medication administration has complete administration information and is based on actual administration information from the person who administered the medication. A medicationstatement is often, if not always, less specific. There is no required date/time when the medication was administered, in fact we only know that a source has reported the patient is taking this medication, where details such as time, quantity, or rate or even medication product may be incomplete or missing or less precise. As stated earlier, the Medication Statement information may come from the patient's memory, from a prescription bottle or from a list of medications the patient, clinician or other party maintains. Medication administration is more formal and is not missing detailed information.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifiers associated with this Medication Statement that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate. They are business identifiers assigned to this resource by the performer or other systems and remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: partOf
property.description: A larger event of which this particular MedicationStatement is a component or step.

property.name: status
property.description: A code representing the status of recording the medication statement.

property.name: category
property.description: Type of medication statement (for example, drug classification like ATC, where meds would be administered, legal category of the medication.).

property.name: medication
property.description: Identifies the medication being administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

property.name: subject
property.description: The person, animal or group who is/was taking the medication.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The encounter that establishes the context for this MedicationStatement.

property.name: effective
property.description: The interval of time during which it is being asserted that the patient is/was/will be taking the medication (or was not taking, when the MedicationStatement.adherence element is Not Taking).

property.name: dateAsserted
property.description: The date when the Medication Statement was asserted by the information source.

property.name: informationSource
property.description: The person or organization that provided the information about the taking of this medication. Note: Use derivedFrom when a MedicationStatement is derived from other resources, e.g. Claim or MedicationRequest.

property.name: derivedFrom
property.description: Allows linking the MedicationStatement to the underlying MedicationRequest, or to other information that supports or is used to derive the MedicationStatement.

property.name: reason
property.description: A concept, Condition or observation that supports why the medication is being/was taken.

property.name: note
property.description: Provides extra information about the Medication Statement that is not conveyed by the other attributes.

property.name: relatedClinicalInformation
property.description: Link to information that is relevant to a medication statement, for example, illicit drug use, gestational age, etc.

property.name: renderedDosageInstruction
property.description: The full representation of the dose of the medication included in all dosage instructions. To be used when multiple dosage instructions are included to represent complex dosing such as increasing or tapering doses.

property.name: dosage
property.description: Indicates how the medication is/was or should be taken by the patient.

property.name: adherence
property.description: Indicates whether the medication is or is not being consumed or administered.

element.name: Adherence
element.description: Indicates whether the medication is or is not being consumed or administered.

property.name: code
property.description: Type of the adherence for the medication.

property.name: reason
property.description: Captures the reason for the current use or adherence of a medication.

resource.name: MedicinalProductDefinition
resource.description: Detailed definition of a medicinal product, typically for uses other than direct patient care (e.g. regulatory use, drug catalogs, to support prescribing, adverse events management etc.).

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifier for this product. Could be an MPID. When in development or being regulated, products are typically referenced by official identifiers, assigned by a manufacturer or regulator, and unique to a product (which, when compared to a product instance being prescribed, is actually a product type). See also MedicinalProductDefinition.code.

property.name: type
property.description: Regulatory type, e.g. Investigational or Authorized.

property.name: domain
property.description: If this medicine applies to human or veterinary uses.

property.name: version
property.description: A business identifier relating to a specific version of the product, this is commonly used to support revisions to an existing product.

property.name: status
property.description: The status within the lifecycle of this product record. A high-level status, this is not intended to duplicate details carried elsewhere such as legal status, or authorization status.

property.name: statusDate
property.description: The date at which the given status became applicable.

property.name: description
property.description: General description of this product.

property.name: combinedPharmaceuticalDoseForm
property.description: The dose form for a single part product, or combined form of a multiple part product. This is one concept that describes all the components. It does not represent the form with components physically mixed, if that might be necessary, for which see (AdministrableProductDefinition.administrableDoseForm).

property.name: route
property.description: The path by which the product is taken into or makes contact with the body. In some regions this is referred to as the licenced or approved route. See also AdministrableProductDefinition resource. MedicinalProductDefinition.route is the same concept as AdministrableProductDefinition.routeOfAdministration.code, and they cannot be used together.

property.name: indication
property.description: Description of indication(s) for this product, used when structured indications are not required. In cases where structured indications are required, they are captured using the ClinicalUseDefinition resource. An indication is a medical situation for which using the product is appropriate.

property.name: legalStatusOfSupply
property.description: The legal status of supply of the medicinal product as classified by the regulator.

property.name: additionalMonitoringIndicator
property.description: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to additional monitoring for regulatory reasons, such as heightened reporting requirements.

property.name: specialMeasures
property.description: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to special measures for regulatory reasons, such as a requirement to conduct post-authorization studies.

property.name: pediatricUseIndicator
property.description: If authorised for use in children, or infants, neonates etc.

property.name: classification
property.description: Allows the product to be classified by various systems, commonly WHO ATC.

property.name: marketingStatus
property.description: Marketing status of the medicinal product, in contrast to marketing authorization. This refers to the product being actually 'on the market' as opposed to being allowed to be on the market (which is an authorization).

property.name: packagedMedicinalProduct
property.description: Package type for the product. See also the PackagedProductDefinition resource.

property.name: comprisedOf
property.description: Types of medicinal manufactured items and/or devices that this product consists of, such as tablets, capsule, or syringes. Used as a direct link when the item's packaging is not being recorded (see also PackagedProductDefinition.package.containedItem.item).

property.name: ingredient
property.description: The ingredients of this medicinal product - when not detailed in other resources. This is only needed if the ingredients are not specified by incoming references from the Ingredient resource, or indirectly via incoming AdministrableProductDefinition, PackagedProductDefinition or ManufacturedItemDefinition references. In cases where those levels of detail are not used, the ingredients may be specified directly here as codes.

property.name: impurity
property.description: Any component of the drug product which is not the chemical entity defined as the drug substance, or an excipient in the drug product. This includes process-related impurities and contaminants, product-related impurities including degradation products.

property.name: attachedDocument
property.description: Additional information or supporting documentation about the medicinal product.

property.name: masterFile
property.description: A master file for the medicinal product (e.g. Pharmacovigilance System Master File). Drug master files (DMFs) are documents submitted to regulatory agencies to provide confidential detailed information about facilities, processes or articles used in the manufacturing, processing, packaging and storing of drug products.

property.name: contact
property.description: A product specific contact, person (in a role), or an organization.

property.name: clinicalTrial
property.description: Clinical trials or studies that this product is involved in.

property.name: code
property.description: A code that this product is known by, usually within some formal terminology, perhaps assigned by a third party (i.e. not the manufacturer or regulator). Products (types of medications) tend to be known by identifiers during development and within regulatory process. However when they are prescribed they tend to be identified by codes. The same product may be have multiple codes, applied to it by multiple organizations.

property.name: name
property.description: The product's name, including full name and possibly coded parts.

property.name: crossReference
property.description: Reference to another product, e.g. for linking authorised to investigational product, or a virtual product.

property.name: operation
property.description: A manufacturing or administrative process or step associated with (or performed on) the medicinal product.

property.name: characteristic
property.description: Allows the key product features to be recorded, such as "sugar free", "modified release", "parallel import".

element.name: Contact
element.description: A product specific contact, person (in a role), or an organization.

property.name: type
property.description: Allows the contact to be classified, for example QPPV, Pharmacovigilance Enquiry Information.

property.name: contact
property.description: A product specific contact, person (in a role), or an organization.

element.name: Name
element.description: The product's name, including full name and possibly coded parts.

property.name: productName
property.description: The full product name.

property.name: type
property.description: Type of product name, such as rINN, BAN, Proprietary, Non-Proprietary.

property.name: part
property.description: Coding words or phrases of the name.

property.name: usage
property.description: Country and jurisdiction where the name applies, and associated language.

element.name: CrossReference
element.description: Reference to another product, e.g. for linking authorised to investigational product, or a virtual product.

property.name: product
property.description: Reference to another product, e.g. for linking authorised to investigational product.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of relationship, for instance branded to generic, virtual to actual product, product to development product (investigational), parallel import version.

element.name: Operation
element.description: A manufacturing or administrative process or step associated with (or performed on) the medicinal product.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of manufacturing operation e.g. manufacturing itself, re-packaging. For the authorization of this, a RegulatedAuthorization would point to the same plan or activity referenced here.

property.name: effectiveDate
property.description: Date range of applicability.

property.name: organization
property.description: The organization or establishment responsible for (or associated with) the particular process or step, examples include the manufacturer, importer, agent.

property.name: confidentialityIndicator
property.description: Specifies whether this particular business or manufacturing process is considered proprietary or confidential.

element.name: Characteristic
element.description: Allows the key product features to be recorded, such as "sugar free", "modified release", "parallel import".

property.name: type
property.description: A code expressing the type of characteristic.

property.name: value
property.description: A value for the characteristic.text.

property.name: url
property.description: The business identifier that is used to reference the MessageDefinition and *is* expected to be consistent from server to server.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this message definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the message definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the message definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the message definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the message definition.

property.name: replaces
property.description: A MessageDefinition that is superseded by this definition.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this message definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this message definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the message definition was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the message definition changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the message definition.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the message definition from a consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate message definition instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the message definition is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this message definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the message definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the message definition.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: base
property.description: The MessageDefinition that is the basis for the contents of this resource.

property.name: parent
property.description: Identifies a protocol or workflow that this MessageDefinition represents a step in.

property.name: event
property.description: Event code or link to the EventDefinition.

property.name: category
property.description: The impact of the content of the message.

property.name: focus
property.description: Identifies the resource (or resources) that are being addressed by the event. For example, the Encounter for an admit message or two Account records for a merge.

property.name: responseRequired
property.description: Declare at a message definition level whether a response is required or only upon error or success, or never.

property.name: allowedResponse
property.description: Indicates what types of messages may be sent as an application-level response to this message.

property.name: graph
property.description: Graph is Canonical reference to a GraphDefinition. If a URL is provided, it is the canonical reference to a GraphDefinition that it controls what additional resources are to be added to the Bundle when building the message. The GraphDefinition can also specify profiles that apply to the various resources.

element.name: Focus

property.name: code
property.description: The kind of resource that must be the focus for this message.

property.name: profile
property.description: A profile that reflects constraints for the focal resource (and potentially for related resources).

property.name: min
property.description: Identifies the minimum number of resources of this type that must be pointed to by a message in order for it to be valid against this MessageDefinition.

property.name: max
property.description: Identifies the maximum number of resources of this type that must be pointed to by a message in order for it to be valid against this MessageDefinition.

element.name: AllowedResponse
element.description: Indicates what types of messages may be sent as an application-level response to this message.

property.name: message
property.description: A reference to the message definition that must be adhered to by this supported response.

property.name: situation
property.description: Provides a description of the circumstances in which this response should be used (as opposed to one of the alternative responses).
