property.name: event
property.description: Code that identifies the event this message represents and connects it with its definition. Events defined as part of the FHIR specification are defined by the implementation. Alternatively a canonical uri to the EventDefinition.

property.name: destination
property.description: The destination application which the message is intended for.

property.name: sender
property.description: Identifies the sending system to allow the use of a trust relationship.

property.name: author
property.description: The logical author of the message - the personor device that decided the described event should happen. When there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the MessageHeader. Can provide other authors in extensions.

property.name: source
property.description: The source application from which this message originated.

property.name: responsible
property.description: The person or organization that accepts overall responsibility for the contents of the message. The implication is that the message event happened under the policies of the responsible party.

property.name: reason
property.description: Coded indication of the cause for the event - indicates a reason for the occurrence of the event that is a focus of this message.

property.name: response
property.description: Information about the message that this message is a response to. Only present if this message is a response.

property.name: focus
property.description: The actual data of the message - a reference to the root/focus class of the event. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource.

property.name: definition
property.description: Permanent link to the MessageDefinition for this message.

element.name: Destination
element.description: The destination application which the message is intended for.

property.name: endpoint
property.description: Indicates where the message should be routed.

property.name: name
property.description: Human-readable name for the target system.

property.name: target
property.description: Identifies the target end system in situations where the initial message transmission is to an intermediary system.

property.name: receiver
property.description: Allows data conveyed by a message to be addressed to a particular person or department when routing to a specific application isn't sufficient.

element.name: Source
element.description: The source application from which this message originated.

property.name: endpoint
property.description: Identifies the routing target to send acknowledgements to.

property.name: name
property.description: Human-readable name for the source system.

property.name: software
property.description: May include configuration or other information useful in debugging.

property.name: version
property.description: Can convey versions of multiple systems in situations where a message passes through multiple hands.

property.name: contact
property.description: An e-mail, phone, website or other contact point to use to resolve issues with message communications.

element.name: Response
element.description: Information about the message that this message is a response to. Only present if this message is a response.

property.name: identifier
property.description: The Bundle.identifier of the message to which this message is a response.

property.name: code
property.description: Code that identifies the type of response to the message - whether it was successful or not, and whether it should be resent or not.

property.name: details
property.description: Full details of any issues found in the message.

resource.name: MetadataResource
resource.description: Common Interface declaration for conformance and knowledge artifact resources.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this {{title}} when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this {{title}} is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the {{title}} is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this {{title}} when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the {{title}} when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the {{title}} author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence without additional knowledge. (See the versionAlgorithm element.)

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the {{title}}. This name should be usable as an identifier for the resource by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the {{title}}.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of this {{title}}.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this {{title}} is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the {{title}} was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the {{title}} changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the {{title}}.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the {{title}} from a consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate {{title}}s.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the {{title}} is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this {{title}} is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the {{title}} and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the {{title}}.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: approvalDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

property.name: lastReviewDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.

property.name: effectivePeriod
property.description: The period during which the {{title}} content was or is planned to be in active use.

property.name: topic
property.description: Descriptive topics related to the content of the {{title}}. Topics provide a high-level categorization as well as keywords for the {{title}} that can be useful for filtering and searching.

property.name: author
property.description: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the {{title}}.

property.name: editor
property.description: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the {{title}}.

property.name: reviewer
property.description: An individual or organization asserted by the publisher to be primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the {{title}}.

property.name: endorser
property.description: An individual or organization asserted by the publisher to be responsible for officially endorsing the {{title}} for use in some setting.

property.name: relatedArtifact
property.description: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, dependencies, bibliographic references, and predecessor and successor artifacts.

resource.name: MolecularSequence
resource.description: Representation of a molecular sequence.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A unique identifier for this particular sequence instance.

property.name: type
property.description: Amino Acid Sequence/ DNA Sequence / RNA Sequence.

property.name: subject
property.description: Indicates the subject this sequence is associated too.

property.name: focus
property.description: The actual focus of a molecular sequence when it is not the patient of record representing something or someone associated with the patient such as a spouse, parent, child, or sibling. For example, in trio testing, the subject would be the child (proband) and the focus would be the parent.

property.name: specimen
property.description: Specimen used for sequencing.

property.name: device
property.description: The method for sequencing, for example, chip information.

property.name: performer
property.description: The organization or lab that should be responsible for this result.

property.name: literal
property.description: Sequence that was observed.

property.name: formatted
property.description: Sequence that was observed as file content. Can be an actual file contents, or referenced by a URL to an external system.

property.name: relative
property.description: A sequence defined relative to another sequence.

element.name: Relative
element.description: A sequence defined relative to another sequence.

property.name: coordinateSystem
property.description: These are different ways of identifying nucleotides or amino acids within a sequence. Different databases and file types may use different systems. For detail definitions, see https://loinc.org/92822-6/ for more detail.

property.name: ordinalPosition
property.description: Indicates the order in which the sequence should be considered when putting multiple 'relative' elements together.

property.name: sequenceRange
property.description: Indicates the nucleotide range in the composed sequence when multiple 'relative' elements are used together.

property.name: startingSequence
property.description: A sequence that is used as a starting sequence to describe variants that are present in a sequence analyzed.

property.name: edit
property.description: Changes in sequence from the starting sequence.

property.name: status

property.name: kind

property.name: comment

property.name: period

property.name: authoritative
property.description: Indicates whether this identifier ie endorsed by the official owner of the associated naming system.

resource.name: NutritionIntake
resource.description: A record of food or fluid that is being consumed by a patient. A NutritionIntake may indicate that the patient may be consuming the food or fluid now or has consumed the food or fluid in the past. The source of this information can be the patient, significant other (such as a family member or spouse), or a clinician. A common scenario where this information is captured is during the history taking process during a patient visit or stay or through an app that tracks food or fluids consumed. The consumption information may come from sources such as the patient's memory, from a nutrition label, or from a clinician documenting observed intake.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifiers associated with this Nutrition Intake that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate. They are business identifiers assigned to this resource by the performer or other systems and remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: instantiatesCanonical
property.description: Instantiates FHIR protocol or definition.

property.name: instantiatesUri
property.description: Instantiates external protocol or definition.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.

property.name: partOf
property.description: A larger event of which this particular event is a component or step.

property.name: status
property.description: A code representing the patient or other source's judgment about the state of the intake that this assertion is about. Generally, this will be active or completed.

property.name: statusReason
property.description: Captures the reason for the current state of the NutritionIntake.

property.name: code
property.description: Overall type of nutrition intake.

property.name: subject
property.description: The person, animal or group who is/was consuming the food or fluid.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The encounter that establishes the context for this NutritionIntake.

property.name: occurrence
property.description: The interval of time during which it is being asserted that the patient is/was consuming the food or fluid.

property.name: recorded
property.description: The date when the Nutrition Intake was asserted by the information source.

property.name: reported
property.description: The person or organization that provided the information about the consumption of this food or fluid. Note: Use derivedFrom when a NutritionIntake is derived from other resources.

property.name: consumedItem
property.description: What food or fluid product or item was consumed.

property.name: ingredientLabel
property.description: Total nutrient amounts for the whole meal, product, serving, etc.

property.name: performer
property.description: Who performed the intake and how they were involved.

property.name: location
property.description: Where the intake occurred.

property.name: derivedFrom
property.description: Allows linking the NutritionIntake to the underlying NutritionOrder, or to other information, such as AllergyIntolerance, that supports or is used to derive the NutritionIntake.

property.name: reason
property.description: A reason, Condition or observation for why the food or fluid is /was consumed.

property.name: note
property.description: Provides extra information about the Nutrition Intake that is not conveyed by the other attributes.

element.name: ConsumedItem
element.description: What food or fluid product or item was consumed.

property.name: type
property.description: Indicates what a category of item that was consumed: e.g., food, fluid, enteral, etc.

property.name: nutritionProduct
property.description: Identifies the food or fluid product that was consumed. This is potentially a link to a resource representing the details of the food product (TBD) or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the food from a known list of foods.

property.name: schedule
property.description: Scheduled frequency of consumption.

property.name: amount
property.description: Quantity of the specified food.

property.name: rate
property.description: Rate at which enteral feeding was administered.

property.name: notConsumed
property.description: Indicator when a patient is in a setting where it is helpful to know if food was not consumed, such as it was refused, held (as in tube feedings), or otherwise not provided. If a consumption is being recorded from an app, such as MyFitnessPal, this indicator will likely not be used.

property.name: notConsumedReason
property.description: Document the reason the food or fluid was not consumed, such as refused, held, etc.

element.name: IngredientLabel
element.description: Total nutrient amounts for the whole meal, product, serving, etc.

property.name: nutrient
property.description: Total nutrient consumed. This could be a macronutrient (protein, fat, carbohydrate), or a vitamin and mineral.

property.name: amount
property.description: Total amount of nutrient consumed.

element.name: Performer
element.description: Who performed the intake and how they were involved.

property.name: function
property.description: Type of performer.

property.name: actor
property.description: Who performed the intake.

resource.name: NutritionOrder
resource.description: A request to supply a diet, formula feeding (enteral) or oral nutritional supplement to a patient/resident.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifiers assigned to this order by the order sender or by the order receiver.

property.name: instantiatesCanonical
property.description: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this NutritionOrder.

property.name: instantiatesUri
property.description: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this NutritionOrder.

property.name: instantiates
property.description: The URL pointing to a protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this NutritionOrder.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this nutrition order.

property.name: groupIdentifier
property.description: A shared identifier common to all nutrition orders that were authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author, representing the composite or group identifier.

property.name: status
property.description: The workflow status of the nutrition order/request.

property.name: intent
property.description: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the NutrionOrder and where the request fits into the workflow chain.

property.name: priority
property.description: Indicates how quickly the Nutrition Order should be addressed with respect to other requests.

property.name: subject
property.description: The person or set of individuals who needs the nutrition order for an oral diet, nutritional supplement and/or enteral or formula feeding.

property.name: encounter
property.description: An encounter that provides additional information about the healthcare context in which this request is made.

property.name: supportingInformation
property.description: Information to support fulfilling (i.e. dispensing or administering) of the nutrition, for example, patient height and weight).

property.name: dateTime
property.description: The date and time that this nutrition order was requested.

property.name: orderer
property.description: The practitioner that holds legal responsibility for ordering the diet, nutritional supplement, or formula feedings.

property.name: performer
property.description: The specified desired performer of the nutrition order.

property.name: allergyIntolerance
property.description: A link to a record of allergies or intolerances which should be included in the nutrition order.

property.name: foodPreferenceModifier
property.description: This modifier is used to convey order-specific modifiers about the type of food that should be given. These can be derived from patient allergies, intolerances, or preferences such as Halal, Vegan or Kosher. This modifier applies to the entire nutrition order inclusive of the oral diet, nutritional supplements and enteral formula feedings.

property.name: excludeFoodModifier
property.description: This modifier is used to convey Order-specific modifier about the type of oral food or oral fluids that should not be given. These can be derived from patient allergies, intolerances, or preferences such as No Red Meat, No Soy or No Wheat or Gluten-Free. While it should not be necessary to repeat allergy or intolerance information captured in the referenced AllergyIntolerance resource in the excludeFoodModifier, this element may be used to convey additional specificity related to foods that should be eliminated from the patient's diet for any reason. This modifier applies to the entire nutrition order inclusive of the oral diet, nutritional supplements and enteral formula feedings.

property.name: outsideFoodAllowed
property.description: This modifier is used to convey whether a food item is allowed to be brought in by the patient and/or family. If set to true, indicates that the receiving system does not need to supply the food item.

property.name: oralDiet
property.description: Diet given orally in contrast to enteral (tube) feeding.

property.name: supplement
property.description: Oral nutritional products given in order to add further nutritional value to the patient's diet.

property.name: enteralFormula
property.description: Feeding provided through the gastrointestinal tract via a tube, catheter, or stoma that delivers nutrition distal to the oral cavity.

property.name: note
property.description: Comments made about the {{title}} by the requester, performer, subject or other participants.

element.name: OralDiet
element.description: Diet given orally in contrast to enteral (tube) feeding.

property.name: type
property.description: The kind of diet or dietary restriction such as fiber restricted diet or diabetic diet.

property.name: schedule
property.description: Schedule information for an oral diet.

property.name: nutrient
property.description: Class that defines the quantity and type of nutrient modifications (for example carbohydrate, fiber or sodium) required for the oral diet.

property.name: texture
property.description: Class that describes any texture modifications required for the patient to safely consume various types of solid foods.

property.name: fluidConsistencyType
property.description: The required consistency (e.g. honey-thick, nectar-thick, thin, thickened.) of liquids or fluids served to the patient.

property.name: instruction
property.description: Free text or additional instructions or information pertaining to the oral diet.

element.name: Supplement
element.description: Oral nutritional products given in order to add further nutritional value to the patient's diet.

property.name: type
property.description: The kind of nutritional supplement product required such as a high protein or pediatric clear liquid supplement.

property.name: productName
property.description: The product or brand name of the nutritional supplement such as "Acme Protein Shake".

property.name: schedule
property.description: Schedule information for a supplement.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The amount of the nutritional supplement to be given.

property.name: instruction
property.description: Free text or additional instructions or information pertaining to the oral supplement.

element.name: EnteralFormula
element.description: Feeding provided through the gastrointestinal tract via a tube, catheter, or stoma that delivers nutrition distal to the oral cavity.

property.name: baseFormulaType
property.description: The type of enteral or infant formula such as an adult standard formula with fiber or a soy-based infant formula.

property.name: baseFormulaProductName
property.description: The product or brand name of the enteral or infant formula product such as "ACME Adult Standard Formula".

property.name: deliveryDevice
property.description: The intended type of device that is to be used for the administration of the enteral formula.

property.name: additive
property.description: Indicates modular components to be provided in addition or mixed with the base formula.

property.name: caloricDensity
property.description: The amount of energy (calories) that the formula should provide per specified volume, typically per mL or fluid oz. For example, an infant may require a formula that provides 24 calories per fluid ounce or an adult may require an enteral formula that provides 1.5 calorie/mL.

property.name: routeOfAdministration
property.description: The route or physiological path of administration into the patient's gastrointestinal tract for purposes of providing the formula feeding, e.g. nasogastric tube.

property.name: administration
property.description: Formula administration instructions as structured data. This repeating structure allows for changing the administration rate or volume over time for both bolus and continuous feeding. An example of this would be an instruction to increase the rate of continuous feeding every 2 hours.

property.name: maxVolumeToDeliver
property.description: The maximum total quantity of formula that may be administered to a subject over the period of time, e.g. 1440 mL over 24 hours.

property.name: administrationInstruction
property.description: Free text formula administration, feeding instructions or additional instructions or information.

resource.name: NutritionProduct
resource.description: A food or supplement that is consumed by patients.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: code
property.description: The code assigned to the product, for example a USDA NDB number, a USDA FDC ID number, or a Langual code.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of the product.

property.name: category
property.description: Nutrition products can have different classifications - according to its nutritional properties, preparation methods, etc.

property.name: manufacturer
property.description: The organisation (manufacturer, representative or legal authorization holder) that is responsible for the device.

property.name: nutrient
property.description: The product's nutritional information expressed by the nutrients.

property.name: ingredient
property.description: Ingredients contained in this product.

property.name: knownAllergen
property.description: Allergens that are known or suspected to be a part of this nutrition product.

property.name: characteristic
property.description: Specifies descriptive properties of the nutrition product.

property.name: instance
property.description: Conveys instance-level information about this product item. One or several physical, countable instances or occurrences of the product.

property.name: note
property.description: Comments made about the product.

element.name: Nutrient
element.description: The product's nutritional information expressed by the nutrients.

property.name: item
property.description: The (relevant) nutrients in the product.

property.name: amount
property.description: The amount of nutrient expressed in one or more units: X per pack / per serving / per dose.

element.name: Ingredient
element.description: Ingredients contained in this product.

property.name: item
property.description: The ingredient contained in the product.

property.name: amount
property.description: The amount of ingredient that is in the product.

element.name: Characteristic
element.description: Specifies descriptive properties of the nutrition product.

property.name: type
property.description: A code specifying which characteristic of the product is being described (for example, colour, shape).

property.name: value
property.description: The actual characteristic value corresponding to the type.

element.name: Instance
element.description: Conveys instance-level information about this product item. One or several physical, countable instances or occurrences of the product.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The amount of items or instances that the resource considers, for instance when referring to 2 identical units together.

property.name: identifier
property.description: The identifier for the physical instance, typically a serial number or manufacturer number.

property.name: name
property.description: The name for the specific product.

property.name: lotNumber
property.description: The identification of the batch or lot of the product.

property.name: expiry
property.description: The time after which the product is no longer expected to be in proper condition, or its use is not advised or not allowed.

property.name: useBy
property.description: The time after which the product is no longer expected to be in proper condition, or its use is not advised or not allowed.

property.name: biologicalSourceEvent
property.description: An identifier that supports traceability to the event during which material in this product from one or more biological entities was obtained or pooled.

resource.name: Observation
resource.description: Measurements and simple assertions made about a patient, device or other subject.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: A unique identifier assigned to this observation.

property.name: instantiates
property.description: The reference to a FHIR ObservationDefinition resource that provides the definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Observation instance.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event. For example, a MedicationRequest may require a patient to have laboratory test performed before it is dispensed.

property.name: triggeredBy
property.description: Identifies the observation(s) that triggered the performance of this observation.

property.name: partOf
property.description: A larger event of which this particular Observation is a component or step. For example, an observation as part of a procedure.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the result value.

property.name: category
property.description: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made.

property.name: code
property.description: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation "name".

property.name: subject
property.description: The patient, or group of patients, location, device, organization, procedure or practitioner this observation is about and into whose or what record the observation is placed. If the actual focus of the observation is different from the subject (or a sample of, part, or region of the subject), the `focus` element or the `code` itself specifies the actual focus of the observation.

property.name: focus
property.description: The actual focus of an observation when it is not the patient of record representing something or someone associated with the patient such as a spouse, parent, fetus, or donor. For example, fetus observations in a mother's record. The focus of an observation could also be an existing condition, an intervention, the subject's diet, another observation of the subject, or a body structure such as tumor or implanted device. An example use case would be using the Observation resource to capture whether the mother is trained to change her child's tracheostomy tube. In this example, the child is the patient of record and the mother is the focus.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The healthcare event (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this observation is made.

property.name: effective
property.description: The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true. For biological subjects - e.g. human patients - this is usually called the "physiologically relevant time". This is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection, but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

property.name: issued
property.description: The date and time this version of the observation was made available to providers, typically after the results have been reviewed and verified.

property.name: performer
property.description: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true".

property.name: value
property.description: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

property.name: dataAbsentReason
property.description: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

property.name: interpretation
property.description: A categorical assessment of an observation value. For example, high, low, normal.

property.name: note
property.description: Comments about the observation or the results.

property.name: bodySite
property.description: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the observation was made (i.e. the target site).

property.name: bodyStructure
property.description: Indicates the body structure on the subject's body where the observation was made (i.e. the target site).

property.name: method
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to perform the observation.

property.name: specimen
property.description: The specimen that was used when this observation was made.

property.name: device
property.description: A reference to the device that generates the measurements or the device settings for the device.

property.name: referenceRange
property.description: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range. Multiple reference ranges are interpreted as an "OR". In other words, to represent two distinct target populations, two `referenceRange` elements would be used.

property.name: hasMember
property.description: This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.

property.name: derivedFrom
property.description: The target resource that represents a measurement from which this observation value is derived. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image.

property.name: component
property.description: Some observations have multiple component observations. These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes. Examples include systolic and diastolic component observations for blood pressure measurement and multiple component observations for genetics observations.

element.name: TriggeredBy
element.description: Identifies the observation(s) that triggered the performance of this observation.

property.name: observation
property.description: Reference to the triggering observation.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of trigger. Reflex | Repeat | Re-run.

property.name: reason
property.description: Provides the reason why this observation was performed as a result of the observation(s) referenced.

element.name: ReferenceRange
element.description: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range. Multiple reference ranges are interpreted as an "OR". In other words, to represent two distinct target populations, two `referenceRange` elements would be used.

property.name: low
property.description: The value of the low bound of the reference range. The low bound of the reference range endpoint is inclusive of the value (e.g. reference range is >=5 - <=9). If the low bound is omitted, it is assumed to be meaningless (e.g. reference range is <=2.3).

property.name: high
property.description: The value of the high bound of the reference range. The high bound of the reference range endpoint is inclusive of the value (e.g. reference range is >=5 - <=9). If the high bound is omitted, it is assumed to be meaningless (e.g. reference range is >= 2.3).

property.name: normalValue
property.description: The value of the normal value of the reference range.

property.name: type
property.description: Codes to indicate the what part of the targeted reference population it applies to. For example, the normal or therapeutic range.

property.name: appliesTo
property.description: Codes to indicate the target population this reference range applies to. For example, a reference range may be based on the normal population or a particular sex or race. Multiple `appliesTo` are interpreted as an "AND" of the target populations. For example, to represent a target population of African American females, both a code of female and a code for African American would be used.

property.name: age
property.description: The age at which this reference range is applicable. This is a neonatal age (e.g. number of weeks at term) if the meaning says so.

property.name: text
property.description: Text based reference range in an observation which may be used when a quantitative range is not appropriate for an observation. An example would be a reference value of "Negative" or a list or table of "normals".

element.name: Component
element.description: Some observations have multiple component observations. These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes. Examples include systolic and diastolic component observations for blood pressure measurement and multiple component observations for genetics observations.

property.name: code
property.description: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation "code".

property.name: value
property.description: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

property.name: dataAbsentReason
property.description: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.component.value[x] is missing.

property.name: interpretation
property.description: A categorical assessment of an observation value. For example, high, low, normal.

property.name: referenceRange
property.description: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range.

resource.name: ObservationDefinition

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URL that is used to identify this ObservationDefinition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this ObservationDefinition is (or will be) published. The URL SHOULD include the major version of the ObservationDefinition. For more information see Technical and Business Versions.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this ObservationDefinition. by the performer and/or other systems. These identifiers remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the ObservationDefinition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the ObservationDefinition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions are orderable.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the ObservationDefinition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the ObservationDefinition.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of the ObservationDefinition.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A flag to indicate that this ObservationDefinition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the ObservationDefinition was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the ObservationDefinition changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the ObservationDefinition. May also allow for contact.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the ObservationDefinition from the consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate ObservationDefinition instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A jurisdiction in which the ObservationDefinition is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explains why this ObservationDefinition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: Copyright statement relating to the ObservationDefinition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the ObservationDefinition.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: approvalDate
property.description: The date on which the asset content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

property.name: lastReviewDate
property.description: The date on which the asset content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after that, but doesn't change the original approval date.

property.name: effectivePeriod
property.description: The period during which the ObservationDefinition content was or is planned to be effective.

property.name: derivedFromCanonical
property.description: The canonical URL pointing to another FHIR-defined ObservationDefinition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this definition.

property.name: derivedFromUri
property.description: The URL pointing to an externally-defined observation definition, guideline or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this definition.

property.name: subject
property.description: A code that describes the intended kind of subject of Observation instances conforming to this ObservationDefinition.

property.name: performerType
property.description: The type of individual/organization/device that is expected to act upon instances of this definition.

property.name: category
property.description: A code that classifies the general type of observation.

property.name: code
property.description: Describes what will be observed. Sometimes this is called the observation "name".

property.name: permittedDataType
property.description: The data types allowed for the value element of the instance observations conforming to this ObservationDefinition.

property.name: multipleResultsAllowed
property.description: Multiple results allowed for observations conforming to this ObservationDefinition.

property.name: bodySite
property.description: The site on the subject's body where the observation is to be made.

property.name: method
property.description: The method or technique used to perform the observation.

property.name: specimen
property.description: The kind of specimen that this type of observation is produced on.

property.name: device
property.description: The measurement model of device or actual device used to produce observations of this type.

property.name: preferredReportName
property.description: The preferred name to be used when reporting the results of observations conforming to this ObservationDefinition.

property.name: permittedUnit
property.description: Units allowed for the valueQuantity element in the instance observations conforming to this ObservationDefinition.

property.name: qualifiedValue
property.description: A set of qualified values associated with a context and a set of conditions - provides a range for quantitative and ordinal observations and a collection of value sets for qualitative observations.

property.name: hasMember
property.description: This ObservationDefinition defines a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.

property.name: component
property.description: Some observations have multiple component observations, expressed as separate code value pairs.

element.name: QualifiedValue
element.description: A set of qualified values associated with a context and a set of conditions - provides a range for quantitative and ordinal observations and a collection of value sets for qualitative observations.

property.name: context
property.description: A concept defining the context for this set of qualified values.

property.name: appliesTo
property.description: The target population this set of qualified values applies to.

property.name: gender
property.description: The gender this set of qualified values applies to.

property.name: age
property.description: The age range this set of qualified values applies to.

property.name: gestationalAge
property.description: The gestational age this set of qualified values applies to.

property.name: condition
property.description: Text based condition for which the the set of qualified values is valid.

property.name: rangeCategory
property.description: The category of range of values for continuous or ordinal observations that match the criteria of this set of qualified values.

property.name: range
property.description: The range of values defined for continuous or ordinal observations that match the criteria of this set of qualified values.

property.name: validCodedValueSet
property.description: The set of valid coded results for qualitative observations that match the criteria of this set of qualified values.

property.name: normalCodedValueSet
property.description: The set of normal coded results for qualitative observations that match the criteria of this set of qualified values.

property.name: abnormalCodedValueSet
property.description: The set of abnormal coded results for qualitative observations that match the criteria of this set of qualified values.

property.name: criticalCodedValueSet
property.description: The set of critical coded results for qualitative observations that match the criteria of this set of qualified values.

element.name: Component
element.description: Some observations have multiple component observations, expressed as separate code value pairs.

property.name: code
property.description: Describes what will be observed.

property.name: permittedDataType
property.description: The data types allowed for the value element of the instance of this component observations.

property.name: permittedUnit
property.description: Units allowed for the valueQuantity element in the instance observations conforming to this ObservationDefinition.

property.name: qualifiedValue
property.description: A set of qualified values associated with a context and a set of conditions - provides a range for quantitative and ordinal observations and a collection of value sets for qualitative observations.

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this operation definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this operation definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the operation definition is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this implementation guide when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the operation definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the operation definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the operation definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the operation definition.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of this operation definition.

property.name: kind
property.description: Whether this is an operation or a named query.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this operation definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the operation definition was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the operation definition changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the operation definition.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the operation definition from a consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate operation definition.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the operation definition is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this operation definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the operation definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the operation definition.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: affectsState
property.description: Whether the operation affects state. Side effects such as producing audit trail entries do not count as 'affecting state'.

property.name: code
property.description: The label that is recommended to be used in the URL for this operation. In some cases, servers may need to use a different CapabilityStatement operation.name to differentiate between multiple SearchParameters that happen to have the same code.

property.name: comment
property.description: Additional information about how to use this operation or named query.

property.name: base
property.description: Indicates that this operation definition is a constraining profile on the base.

property.name: resource
property.description: The types on which this operation can be executed.

property.name: system
property.description: Indicates whether this operation or named query can be invoked at the system level (e.g. without needing to choose a resource type for the context).

property.name: type
property.description: Indicates whether this operation or named query can be invoked at the resource type level for any given resource type level (e.g. without needing to choose a specific resource id for the context).

property.name: instance
property.description: Indicates whether this operation can be invoked on a particular instance of one of the given types.

property.name: inputProfile
property.description: Additional validation information for the in parameters - a single profile that covers all the parameters. The profile is a constraint on the parameters resource as a whole.

property.name: outputProfile
property.description: Additional validation information for the out parameters - a single profile that covers all the parameters. The profile is a constraint on the parameters resource.

property.name: parameter
property.description: The parameters for the operation/query.

property.name: overload
property.description: Defines an appropriate combination of parameters to use when invoking this operation, to help code generators when generating overloaded parameter sets for this operation.

element.name: Parameter
element.description: The parameters for the operation/query.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of used to identify the parameter.

property.name: use
property.description: Whether this is an input or an output parameter.

property.name: scope
property.description: If present, indicates that the parameter applies when the operation is being invoked at the specified level.

property.name: min
property.description: The minimum number of times this parameter SHALL appear in the request or response.

property.name: max
property.description: The maximum number of times this element is permitted to appear in the request or response.

property.name: documentation
property.description: Describes the meaning or use of this parameter.

property.name: type
property.description: The type for this parameter.

property.name: allowedType
property.description: Support for polymorphic types. If the parameter type is abstract, this element lists allowed sub-types for the parameter.

property.name: targetProfile
property.description: Used when the type is "Reference" or "canonical", and identifies a profile structure or implementation Guide that applies to the target of the reference this parameter refers to. If any profiles are specified, then the content must conform to at least one of them. The URL can be a local reference - to a contained StructureDefinition, or a reference to another StructureDefinition or Implementation Guide by a canonical URL. When an implementation guide is specified, the target resource SHALL conform to at least one profile defined in the implementation guide.

property.name: searchType
property.description: How the parameter is understood if/when it used as search parameter. This is only used if the parameter is a string.

property.name: binding
property.description: Binds to a value set if this parameter is coded (code, Coding, CodeableConcept).

property.name: referencedFrom
property.description: Identifies other resource parameters within the operation invocation that are expected to resolve to this resource.

property.name: part
property.description: The parts of a nested Parameter.

element.name: Overload
element.description: Defines an appropriate combination of parameters to use when invoking this operation, to help code generators when generating overloaded parameter sets for this operation.

property.name: parameterName
property.description: Name of parameter to include in overload.

property.name: comment
property.description: Comments to go on overload.

property.name: meta

property.name: issue
property.description: An error, warning, or information message that results from a system action.

element.name: Issue
element.description: An error, warning, or information message that results from a system action.

property.name: severity
property.description: Indicates whether the issue indicates a variation from successful processing.

property.name: code
property.description: Describes the type of the issue. The system that creates an OperationOutcome SHALL choose the most applicable code from the IssueType value set, and may additional provide its own code for the error in the details element.

property.name: details
property.description: Additional details about the error. This may be a text description of the error or a system code that identifies the error.

property.name: diagnostics
property.description: Additional diagnostic information about the issue.

property.name: location
property.description: This element is deprecated because it is XML specific. It is replaced by issue.expression, which is format independent, and simpler to parse. For resource issues, this will be a simple XPath limited to element names, repetition indicators and the default child accessor that identifies one of the elements in the resource that caused this issue to be raised. For HTTP errors, will be "http." + the parameter name.

property.name: expression
property.description: A [simple subset of FHIRPath](fhirpath.html#simple) limited to element names, repetition indicators and the default child accessor that identifies one of the elements in the resource that caused this issue to be raised.

resource.name: Organization
resource.description: A formally or informally recognized grouping of people or organizations formed for the purpose of achieving some form of collective action. Includes companies, institutions, corporations, departments, community groups, healthcare practice groups, payer/insurer, etc.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifier for the organization that is used to identify the organization across multiple disparate systems.

property.name: active
property.description: Whether the organization's record is still in active use.

property.name: type
property.description: The kind(s) of organization that this is.

property.name: name
property.description: A name associated with the organization.

property.name: alias
property.description: A list of alternate names that the organization is known as, or was known as in the past.

property.name: description
property.description: Description of the organization, which helps provide additional general context on the organization to ensure that the correct organization is selected.

property.name: contact
property.description: The contact details of communication devices available relevant to the specific Organization. This can include addresses, phone numbers, fax numbers, mobile numbers, email addresses and web sites.

property.name: partOf
property.description: The organization of which this organization forms a part.

property.name: endpoint
property.description: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the organization.

property.name: qualification
property.description: The official certifications, accreditations, training, designations and licenses that authorize and/or otherwise endorse the provision of care by the organization. For example, an approval to provide a type of services issued by a certifying body (such as the US Joint Commission) to an organization.

element.name: Qualification
element.description: The official certifications, accreditations, training, designations and licenses that authorize and/or otherwise endorse the provision of care by the organization. For example, an approval to provide a type of services issued by a certifying body (such as the US Joint Commission) to an organization.

property.name: identifier
property.description: An identifier allocated to this qualification for this organization.

property.name: code
property.description: Coded representation of the qualification.

property.name: period
property.description: Period during which the qualification is valid.

property.name: issuer
property.description: Organization that regulates and issues the qualification.

resource.name: OrganizationAffiliation
resource.description: Defines an affiliation/assotiation/relationship between 2 distinct organizations, that is not a part-of relationship/sub-division relationship.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers that are specific to this role.

property.name: active
property.description: Whether this organization affiliation record is in active use.

property.name: period
property.description: The period during which the participatingOrganization is affiliated with the primary organization.

property.name: organization
property.description: Organization where the role is available (primary organization/has members).

property.name: participatingOrganization
property.description: The Participating Organization provides/performs the role(s) defined by the code to the Primary Organization (e.g. providing services or is a member of).

property.name: network
property.description: The network in which the participatingOrganization provides the role's services (if defined) at the indicated locations (if defined).

property.name: code
property.description: Definition of the role the participatingOrganization plays in the association.

property.name: specialty
property.description: Specific specialty of the participatingOrganization in the context of the role.

property.name: location
property.description: The location(s) at which the role occurs.

property.name: healthcareService
property.description: Healthcare services provided through the role.

property.name: contact
property.description: The contact details of communication devices available at the participatingOrganization relevant to this Affiliation.

property.name: endpoint
property.description: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for this role.

resource.name: PackagedProductDefinition
resource.description: A medically related item or items, in a container or package.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.
