property.name: identifier
property.description: A unique identifier for this package as whole - not the the content of the package. Unique instance identifiers assigned to a package by manufacturers, regulators, drug catalogue custodians or other organizations.

property.name: name
property.description: A name for this package. Typically what it would be listed as in a drug formulary or catalogue, inventory etc.

property.name: type
property.description: A high level category e.g. medicinal product, raw material, shipping/transport container, etc.

property.name: packageFor
property.description: The product this package model relates to, not the contents of the package (for which see package.containedItem).

property.name: status
property.description: The status within the lifecycle of this item. A high level status, this is not intended to duplicate details carried elsewhere such as legal status, or authorization or marketing status.

property.name: statusDate
property.description: The date at which the given status became applicable.

property.name: containedItemQuantity
property.description: A total of the complete count of contained items of a particular type/form, independent of sub-packaging or organization. This can be considered as the pack size. This attribute differs from containedItem.amount in that it can give a single aggregated count of all tablet types in a pack, even when these are different manufactured items. For example a pill pack of 21 tablets plus 7 sugar tablets, can be denoted here as '28 tablets'. This attribute is repeatable so that the different item types in one pack type can be counted (e.g. a count of vials and count of syringes). Each repeat must have different units, so that it is clear what the different sets of counted items are, and it is not intended to allow different counts of similar items (e.g. not '2 tubes and 3 tubes'). Repeats are not to be used to represent different pack sizes (e.g. 20 pack vs. 50 pack) - which would be different instances of this resource.

property.name: description
property.description: Textual description. Note that this is not the name of the package or product.

property.name: legalStatusOfSupply
property.description: The legal status of supply of the packaged item as classified by the regulator.

property.name: marketingStatus
property.description: Allows specifying that an item is on the market for sale, or that it is not available, and the dates and locations associated.

property.name: copackagedIndicator
property.description: Identifies if the package contains different items, such as when a drug product is supplied with another item e.g. a diluent or adjuvant.

property.name: manufacturer
property.description: Manufacturer of this package type. When there are multiple it means these are all possible manufacturers.

property.name: attachedDocument
property.description: Additional information or supporting documentation about the packaged product.

property.name: packaging
property.description: A packaging item, as a container for medically related items, possibly with other packaging items within, or a packaging component, such as bottle cap (which is not a device or a medication manufactured item).

property.name: characteristic
property.description: Allows the key features to be recorded, such as "hospital pack", "nurse prescribable", "calendar pack".

element.name: LegalStatusOfSupply
element.description: The legal status of supply of the packaged item as classified by the regulator.

property.name: code
property.description: The actual status of supply. Conveys in what situation this package type may be supplied for use.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: The place where the legal status of supply applies. When not specified, this indicates it is unknown in this context.

element.name: Packaging
element.description: A packaging item, as a container for medically related items, possibly with other packaging items within, or a packaging component, such as bottle cap (which is not a device or a medication manufactured item).

property.name: identifier
property.description: A business identifier that is specific to this particular part of the packaging, often assigned by the manufacturer. Including possibly Data Carrier Identifier (a GS1 barcode).

property.name: type
property.description: The physical type of the container of the items.

property.name: componentPart
property.description: Is this a part of the packaging (e.g. a cap or bottle stopper), rather than the packaging itself (e.g. a bottle or vial). The latter type are designed be a container, but the former are not.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The quantity of packaging items contained at this layer of the package. This does not relate to the number of contained items but relates solely to the number of packaging items. When looking at the outermost layer it is always 1. If there are two boxes within, at the next layer it would be 2.

property.name: material
property.description: Material type of the package item.

property.name: alternateMaterial
property.description: A possible alternate material for this part of the packaging, that is allowed to be used instead of the usual material (e.g. different types of plastic for a blister sleeve).

property.name: shelfLifeStorage
property.description: Shelf Life and storage information.

property.name: manufacturer
property.description: Manufacturer of this packaging item. When there are multiple values each one is a potential manufacturer of this packaging item.

property.name: property
property.description: General characteristics of this item.

property.name: containedItem
property.description: The item(s) within the packaging.

property.name: packaging
property.description: Allows containers (and parts of containers) within containers, still as a part of a single packaged product. See also PackagedProductDefinition.packaging.containedItem.item(PackagedProductDefinition).

It is not persisted or allowed to be referenced by other resources except as described in the definition of the Parameters resource.

property.name: value
property.description: Conveys the content if the parameter is a data type.

property.name: resource
property.description: Conveys the content if the parameter is a whole resource.

property.name: part
property.description: A named part of a multi-part parameter.

property.name: identifier
property.description: An identifier for this patient.

property.name: active
property.description: Whether this patient record is in active use. Many systems use this property to mark as non-current patients, such as those that have not been seen for a period of time based on an organization's business rules. It is often used to filter patient lists to exclude inactive patients Deceased patients may also be marked as inactive for the same reasons, but may be active for some time after death.

property.name: name
property.description: A name associated with the individual.

property.name: telecom
property.description: A contact detail (e.g. a telephone number or an email address) by which the individual may be contacted.

property.name: gender
property.description: Administrative Gender - the gender that the patient is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.

property.name: birthDate
property.description: The date of birth for the individual.

property.name: deceased
property.description: Indicates if the individual is deceased or not.

property.name: address
property.description: An address for the individual.

property.name: maritalStatus
property.description: This field contains a patient's most recent marital (civil) status.

property.name: multipleBirth
property.description: Indicates whether the patient is part of a multiple (boolean) or indicates the actual birth order (integer).

property.name: photo
property.description: Image of the patient.

property.name: contact
property.description: A contact party (e.g. guardian, partner, friend) for the patient.

property.name: communication
property.description: A language which may be used to communicate with the patient about his or her health.

property.name: generalPractitioner
property.description: Patient's nominated care provider.

property.name: managingOrganization
property.description: Organization that is the custodian of the patient record.

property.name: link
property.description: Link to a Patient or RelatedPerson resource that concerns the same actual individual.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A unique identifier assigned to this payment notice.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the resource instance.

property.name: request
property.description: Reference of resource for which payment is being made.

property.name: response
property.description: Reference of response to resource for which payment is being made.

property.name: created
property.description: The date when this resource was created.

property.name: reporter
property.description: The party who reports the payment notice.

property.name: payment
property.description: A reference to the payment which is the subject of this notice.

property.name: paymentDate
property.description: The date when the above payment action occurred.

property.name: payee
property.description: The party who will receive or has received payment that is the subject of this notification.

property.name: recipient
property.description: The party who is notified of the payment status.

property.name: amount
property.description: The amount sent to the payee.

property.name: paymentStatus
property.description: A code indicating whether payment has been sent or cleared.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A unique identifier assigned to this payment reconciliation.

property.name: type
property.description: Code to indicate the nature of the payment such as payment, adjustment.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the resource instance.

property.name: kind
property.description: The workflow or activity which gave rise to or during which the payment ocurred such as a kiosk, deposit on account, periodic payment etc.

property.name: period
property.description: The period of time for which payments have been gathered into this bulk payment for settlement.

property.name: created
property.description: The date when the resource was created.

property.name: enterer
property.description: Payment enterer if not the actual payment issuer.

property.name: issuerType
property.description: The type of the source such as patient or insurance.

property.name: paymentIssuer
property.description: The party who generated the payment.

property.name: request
property.description: Original request resource reference.

property.name: requestor
property.description: The practitioner who is responsible for the services rendered to the patient.

property.name: outcome
property.description: The outcome of a request for a reconciliation.

property.name: disposition
property.description: A human readable description of the status of the request for the reconciliation.

property.name: date
property.description: The date of payment as indicated on the financial instrument.

property.name: location
property.description: The location of the site or device for electronic transfers or physical location for cash payments.

property.name: method
property.description: The means of payment such as check, card cash, or electronic funds transfer.

property.name: cardBrand
property.description: The card brand such as debit, Visa, Amex etc. used if a card is the method of payment.

property.name: accountNumber
property.description: A portion of the account number, often the last 4 digits, used for verification not charging purposes.

property.name: expirationDate
property.description: The year and month (YYYY-MM) when the instrument, typically card, expires.

property.name: processor
property.description: The name of the card processor, etf processor, bank for checks.

property.name: referenceNumber
property.description: The check number, eft reference, car processor reference.

property.name: authorization
property.description: An alphanumeric issued by the processor to confirm the successful issuance of payment.

property.name: tenderedAmount
property.description: The amount offered by the issuer, typically applies to cash when the issuer provides an amount in bank note denominations equal to or excess of the amount actually being paid.

property.name: returnedAmount
property.description: The amount returned by the receiver which is excess to the amount payable, often referred to as 'change'.

property.name: amount
property.description: Total payment amount as indicated on the financial instrument.

property.name: paymentIdentifier
property.description: Issuer's unique identifier for the payment instrument.

property.name: allocation
property.description: Distribution of the payment amount for a previously acknowledged payable.

property.name: formCode
property.description: A code for the form to be used for printing the content.

property.name: processNote
property.description: A note that describes or explains the processing in a human readable form.

element.name: Allocation
element.description: Distribution of the payment amount for a previously acknowledged payable.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Unique identifier for the current payment item for the referenced payable.

property.name: predecessor
property.description: Unique identifier for the prior payment item for the referenced payable.

property.name: target
property.description: Specific resource to which the payment/adjustment/advance applies.

property.name: targetItem
property.description: Identifies the claim line item, encounter or other sub-element being paid. Note payment may be partial, that is not match the then outstanding balance or amount incurred.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The Encounter to which this payment applies, may be completed by the receiver, used for search.

property.name: account
property.description: The Account to which this payment applies, may be completed by the receiver, used for search.

property.name: type
property.description: Code to indicate the nature of the payment.

property.name: submitter
property.description: The party which submitted the claim or financial transaction.

property.name: response
property.description: A resource, such as a ClaimResponse, which contains a commitment to payment.

property.name: date
property.description: The date from the response resource containing a commitment to pay.

property.name: responsible
property.description: A reference to the individual who is responsible for inquiries regarding the response and its payment.

property.name: payee
property.description: The party which is receiving the payment.

property.name: amount
property.description: The monetary amount allocated from the total payment to the payable.

element.name: ProcessNote
element.description: A note that describes or explains the processing in a human readable form.

property.name: type
property.description: The business purpose of the note text.

property.name: text
property.description: The explanation or description associated with the processing.

property.name: combining

resource.name: PlanDefinition
resource.description: This resource allows for the definition of various types of plans as a sharable, consumable, and executable artifact. The resource is general enough to support the description of a broad range of clinical and non-clinical artifacts such as clinical decision support rules, order sets, protocols, and drug quality specifications.

property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta

Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this plan definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this plan definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the plan definition is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this plan definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the plan definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the plan definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. To provide a version consistent with the Decision Support Service specification, use the format Major.Minor.Revision (e.g. 1.0.0). For more information on versioning knowledge assets, refer to the Decision Support Service specification. Note that a version is required for non-experimental active artifacts.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the plan definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the plan definition.

property.name: subtitle
property.description: An explanatory or alternate title for the plan definition giving additional information about its content.

property.name: type
property.description: A high-level category for the plan definition that distinguishes the kinds of systems that would be interested in the plan definition.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this plan definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this plan definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: subject
property.description: A code, group definition, or canonical reference that describes or identifies the intended subject of the plan definition. Canonical references are allowed to support the definition of protocols for drug and substance quality specifications, and is allowed to reference a MedicinalProductDefinition, SubstanceDefinition, AdministrableProductDefinition, ManufacturedItemDefinition, or PackagedProductDefinition resource.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the plan definition was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the plan definition changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the plan definition.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the plan definition from a consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate plan definition instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the plan definition is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this plan definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: usage
property.description: A detailed description of how the plan definition is used from a clinical perspective.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the plan definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the plan definition.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: approvalDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

property.name: lastReviewDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.

property.name: effectivePeriod
property.description: The period during which the plan definition content was or is planned to be in active use.

property.name: topic
property.description: Descriptive topics related to the content of the plan definition. Topics provide a high-level categorization of the definition that can be useful for filtering and searching.

property.name: author
property.description: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.

property.name: editor
property.description: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.

property.name: reviewer
property.description: An individual or organization asserted by the publisher to be primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.

property.name: endorser
property.description: An individual or organization asserted by the publisher to be responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.

property.name: relatedArtifact
property.description: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.

property.name: library
property.description: A reference to a Library resource containing any formal logic used by the plan definition.

property.name: goal
property.description: A goal describes an expected outcome that activities within the plan are intended to achieve. For example, weight loss, restoring an activity of daily living, obtaining herd immunity via immunization, meeting a process improvement objective, meeting the acceptance criteria for a test as specified by a quality specification, etc.

property.name: actor
property.description: Actors represent the individuals or groups involved in the execution of the defined set of activities.

property.name: action
property.description: An action or group of actions to be taken as part of the plan. For example, in clinical care, an action would be to prescribe a particular indicated medication, or perform a particular test as appropriate. In pharmaceutical quality, an action would be the test that needs to be performed on a drug product as defined in the quality specification.

property.name: asNeeded
property.description: If a CodeableConcept is present, it indicates the pre-condition for performing the service. For example "pain", "on flare-up", etc.

element.name: Goal
element.description: A goal describes an expected outcome that activities within the plan are intended to achieve. For example, weight loss, restoring an activity of daily living, obtaining herd immunity via immunization, meeting a process improvement objective, meeting the acceptance criteria for a test as specified by a quality specification, etc.

property.name: category
property.description: Indicates a category the goal falls within.

property.name: description
property.description: Human-readable and/or coded description of a specific desired objective of care, such as "control blood pressure" or "negotiate an obstacle course" or "dance with child at wedding".

property.name: priority
property.description: Identifies the expected level of importance associated with reaching/sustaining the defined goal.

property.name: start
property.description: The event after which the goal should begin being pursued.

property.name: addresses
property.description: Identifies problems, conditions, issues, or concerns the goal is intended to address.

property.name: documentation
property.description: Didactic or other informational resources associated with the goal that provide further supporting information about the goal. Information resources can include inline text commentary and links to web resources.

property.name: target
property.description: Indicates what should be done and within what timeframe.

element.name: Actor
element.description: Actors represent the individuals or groups involved in the execution of the defined set of activities.

property.name: title
property.description: A descriptive label for the actor.

property.name: description
property.description: A description of how the actor fits into the overall actions of the plan definition.

property.name: option
property.description: The characteristics of the candidates that could serve as the actor.

element.name: Action
element.description: An action or group of actions to be taken as part of the plan. For example, in clinical care, an action would be to prescribe a particular indicated medication, or perform a particular test as appropriate. In pharmaceutical quality, an action would be the test that needs to be performed on a drug product as defined in the quality specification.

property.name: linkId
property.description: An identifier that is unique within the PlanDefinition to allow linkage within the realized CarePlan and/or RequestOrchestration.

property.name: prefix
property.description: A user-visible prefix for the action. For example a section or item numbering such as 1. or A.

property.name: title
property.description: The textual description of the action displayed to a user. For example, when the action is a test to be performed, the title would be the title of the test such as Assay by HPLC.

property.name: description
property.description: A brief description of the action used to provide a summary to display to the user.

property.name: textEquivalent
property.description: A text equivalent of the action to be performed. This provides a human-interpretable description of the action when the definition is consumed by a system that might not be capable of interpreting it dynamically.

property.name: priority
property.description: Indicates how quickly the action should be addressed with respect to other actions.

property.name: code
property.description: A code that provides a meaning, grouping, or classification for the action or action group. For example, a section may have a LOINC code for the section of a documentation template. In pharmaceutical quality, an action (Test) such as pH could be classified as a physical property.

property.name: reason
property.description: A description of why this action is necessary or appropriate.

property.name: documentation
property.description: Didactic or other informational resources associated with the action that can be provided to the CDS recipient. Information resources can include inline text commentary and links to web resources.

property.name: goalId
property.description: Identifies goals that this action supports. The reference must be to a goal element defined within this plan definition. In pharmaceutical quality, a goal represents acceptance criteria (Goal) for a given action (Test), so the goalId would be the unique id of a defined goal element establishing the acceptance criteria for the action.

property.name: subject
property.description: A code, group definition, or canonical reference that describes the intended subject of the action and its children, if any. Canonical references are allowed to support the definition of protocols for drug and substance quality specifications, and is allowed to reference a MedicinalProductDefinition, SubstanceDefinition, AdministrableProductDefinition, ManufacturedItemDefinition, or PackagedProductDefinition resource.

property.name: trigger
property.description: A description of when the action should be triggered. When multiple triggers are specified on an action, any triggering event invokes the action.

property.name: condition
property.description: An expression that describes applicability criteria or start/stop conditions for the action.

property.name: input
property.description: Defines input data requirements for the action.

property.name: output
property.description: Defines the outputs of the action, if any.

property.name: relatedAction
property.description: A relationship to another action such as "before" or "30-60 minutes after start of".

property.name: timing
property.description: An optional value describing when the action should be performed.

property.name: location
property.description: Identifies the facility where the action will occur; e.g. home, hospital, specific clinic, etc.

property.name: participant
property.description: Indicates who should participate in performing the action described.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of action to perform (create, update, remove).

property.name: groupingBehavior
property.description: Defines the grouping behavior for the action and its children.

property.name: selectionBehavior
property.description: Defines the selection behavior for the action and its children.

property.name: requiredBehavior
property.description: Defines the required behavior for the action.

property.name: precheckBehavior
property.description: Defines whether the action should usually be preselected.

property.name: cardinalityBehavior
property.description: Defines whether the action can be selected multiple times.

property.name: definition
property.description: A reference to an ActivityDefinition that describes the action to be taken in detail, a MessageDefinition describing a message to be snet, a PlanDefinition that describes a series of actions to be taken, a Questionnaire that should be filled out, a SpecimenDefinition describing a specimen to be collected, or an ObservationDefinition that specifies what observation should be captured.

property.name: transform
property.description: A reference to a StructureMap resource that defines a transform that can be executed to produce the intent resource using the ActivityDefinition instance as the input.

property.name: dynamicValue
property.description: Customizations that should be applied to the statically defined resource. For example, if the dosage of a medication must be computed based on the patient's weight, a customization would be used to specify an expression that calculated the weight, and the path on the resource that would contain the result.

property.name: action
property.description: Sub actions that are contained within the action. The behavior of this action determines the functionality of the sub-actions. For example, a selection behavior of at-most-one indicates that of the sub-actions, at most one may be chosen as part of realizing the action definition.

resource.name: Practitioner
resource.description: A person who is directly or indirectly involved in the provisioning of healthcare or related services.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: An identifier that applies to this person in this role.

property.name: active
property.description: Whether this practitioner's record is in active use.

property.name: name
property.description: The name(s) associated with the practitioner.

property.name: telecom
property.description: A contact detail for the practitioner, e.g. a telephone number or an email address.

property.name: gender
property.description: Administrative Gender - the gender that the person is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.

property.name: birthDate
property.description: The date of birth for the practitioner.

property.name: deceased
property.description: Indicates if the practitioner is deceased or not.

property.name: address
property.description: Address(es) of the practitioner that are not role specific (typically home address). Work addresses are not typically entered in this property as they are usually role dependent.

property.name: photo
property.description: Image of the person.

property.name: qualification
property.description: The official qualifications, certifications, accreditations, training, licenses (and other types of educations/skills/capabilities) that authorize or otherwise pertain to the provision of care by the practitioner. For example, a medical license issued by a medical board of licensure authorizing the practitioner to practice medicine within a certain locality.

property.name: communication
property.description: A language which may be used to communicate with the practitioner, often for correspondence/administrative purposes. The `PractitionerRole.communication` property should be used for publishing the languages that a practitioner is able to communicate with patients (on a per Organization/Role basis).

element.name: Qualification
element.description: The official qualifications, certifications, accreditations, training, licenses (and other types of educations/skills/capabilities) that authorize or otherwise pertain to the provision of care by the practitioner. For example, a medical license issued by a medical board of licensure authorizing the practitioner to practice medicine within a certain locality.

property.name: identifier
property.description: An identifier that applies to this person's qualification.

property.name: code
property.description: Coded representation of the qualification.

property.name: period
property.description: Period during which the qualification is valid.

property.name: issuer
property.description: Organization that regulates and issues the qualification.

element.name: Communication
element.description: A language which may be used to communicate with the practitioner, often for correspondence/administrative purposes. The `PractitionerRole.communication` property should be used for publishing the languages that a practitioner is able to communicate with patients (on a per Organization/Role basis).

property.name: language
property.description: The ISO-639-1 alpha 2 code in lower case for the language, optionally followed by a hyphen and the ISO-3166-1 alpha 2 code for the region in upper case; e.g. "en" for English, or "en-US" for American English versus "en-AU" for Australian English.

property.name: preferred
property.description: Indicates whether or not the person prefers this language (over other languages he masters up a certain level).

resource.name: PractitionerRole
resource.description: A specific set of Roles/Locations/specialties/services that a practitioner may perform, or has performed at an organization during a period of time.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business Identifiers that are specific to a role/location.

property.name: active
property.description: Whether this practitioner role record is in active use. Some systems may use this property to mark non-active practitioners, such as those that are not currently employed.

property.name: period
property.description: The period during which the person is authorized to act as a practitioner in these role(s) for the organization.

property.name: practitioner
property.description: Practitioner that is able to provide the defined services for the organization.

property.name: organization
property.description: The organization where the Practitioner performs the roles associated.

property.name: code
property.description: Roles which this practitioner is authorized to perform for the organization.

property.name: specialty
property.description: The specialty of a practitioner that describes the functional role they are practicing at a given organization or location.

property.name: location
property.description: The location(s) at which this practitioner provides care.

property.name: healthcareService
property.description: The list of healthcare services that this worker provides for this role's Organization/Location(s).

property.name: contact
property.description: The contact details of communication devices available relevant to the specific PractitionerRole. This can include addresses, phone numbers, fax numbers, mobile numbers, email addresses and web sites.

property.name: characteristic
property.description: Collection of characteristics (attributes).

property.name: communication
property.description: A language the practitioner can use in patient communication. The practitioner may know several languages (listed in practitioner.communication), however these are the languages that could be advertised in a directory for a patient to search.

property.name: availability
property.description: A collection of times the practitioner is available or performing this role at the location and/or healthcareservice.

property.name: endpoint
property.description: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the practitioner with this role. Commonly used for locating scheduling services, or identifying where to send referrals electronically.

resource.name: Procedure
resource.description: An action that is or was performed on or for a patient, practitioner, device, organization, or location. For example, this can be a physical intervention on a patient like an operation, or less invasive like long term services, counseling, or hypnotherapy. This can be a quality or safety inspection for a location, organization, or device. This can be an accreditation procedure on a practitioner for licensing.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this procedure by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and is propagated from server to server.

property.name: instantiatesCanonical
property.description: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, order set or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Procedure.

property.name: instantiatesUri
property.description: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, order set or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Procedure.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A reference to a resource that contains details of the request for this procedure.

property.name: partOf
property.description: A larger event of which this particular procedure is a component or step.

property.name: status
property.description: A code specifying the state of the procedure. Generally, this will be the in-progress or completed state.

property.name: statusReason
property.description: Captures the reason for the current state of the procedure.

property.name: category
property.description: A code that classifies the procedure for searching, sorting and display purposes (e.g. "Surgical Procedure").

property.name: code
property.description: The specific procedure that is performed. Use text if the exact nature of the procedure cannot be coded (e.g. "Laparoscopic Appendectomy").

property.name: subject
property.description: On whom or on what the procedure was performed. This is usually an individual human, but can also be performed on animals, groups of humans or animals, organizations or practitioners (for licensing), locations or devices (for safety inspections or regulatory authorizations). If the actual focus of the procedure is different from the subject, the focus element specifies the actual focus of the procedure.

property.name: focus
property.description: Who is the target of the procedure when it is not the subject of record only. If focus is not present, then subject is the focus. If focus is present and the subject is one of the targets of the procedure, include subject as a focus as well. If focus is present and the subject is not included in focus, it implies that the procedure was only targeted on the focus. For example, when a caregiver is given education for a patient, the caregiver would be the focus and the procedure record is associated with the subject (e.g. patient). For example, use focus when recording the target of the education, training, or counseling is the parent or relative of a patient.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The Encounter during which this Procedure was created or performed or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

property.name: occurrence
property.description: Estimated or actual date, date-time, period, or age when the procedure did occur or is occurring. Allows a period to support complex procedures that span more than one date, and also allows for the length of the procedure to be captured.

property.name: recorded
property.description: The date the occurrence of the procedure was first captured in the record regardless of Procedure.status (potentially after the occurrence of the event).

property.name: recorder
property.description: Individual who recorded the record and takes responsibility for its content.

property.name: reported
property.description: Indicates if this record was captured as a secondary 'reported' record rather than as an original primary source-of-truth record. It may also indicate the source of the report.

property.name: performer
property.description: Indicates who or what performed the procedure and how they were involved.

property.name: location
property.description: The location where the procedure actually happened. E.g. a newborn at home, a tracheostomy at a restaurant.

property.name: reason
property.description: The coded reason or reference why the procedure was performed. This may be a coded entity of some type, be present as text, or be a reference to one of several resources that justify the procedure.

property.name: bodySite
property.description: Detailed and structured anatomical location information. Multiple locations are allowed - e.g. multiple punch biopsies of a lesion.

property.name: outcome
property.description: The outcome of the procedure - did it resolve the reasons for the procedure being performed?

property.name: report
property.description: This could be a histology result, pathology report, surgical report, etc.

property.name: complication
property.description: Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-performance period. These are generally tracked separately from the notes, which will typically describe the procedure itself rather than any 'post procedure' issues.

property.name: followUp
property.description: If the procedure required specific follow up - e.g. removal of sutures. The follow up may be represented as a simple note or could potentially be more complex, in which case the CarePlan resource can be used.

property.name: note
property.description: Any other notes and comments about the procedure.

property.name: focalDevice
property.description: A device that is implanted, removed or otherwise manipulated (calibration, battery replacement, fitting a prosthesis, attaching a wound-vac, etc.) as a focal portion of the Procedure.

property.name: used
property.description: Identifies medications, devices and any other substance used as part of the procedure.

property.name: supportingInfo
property.description: Other resources from the patient record that may be relevant to the procedure. The information from these resources was either used to create the instance or is provided to help with its interpretation. This extension should not be used if more specific inline elements or extensions are available.

element.name: Performer
element.description: Indicates who or what performed the procedure and how they were involved.

property.name: function
property.description: Distinguishes the type of involvement of the performer in the procedure. For example, surgeon, anaesthetist, endoscopist.

property.name: actor
property.description: Indicates who or what performed the procedure.

property.name: onBehalfOf
property.description: The Organization the Patient, RelatedPerson, Device, CareTeam, and HealthcareService was acting on behalf of.

property.name: period
property.description: Time period during which the performer performed the procedure.

element.name: FocalDevice
element.description: A device that is implanted, removed or otherwise manipulated (calibration, battery replacement, fitting a prosthesis, attaching a wound-vac, etc.) as a focal portion of the Procedure.

property.name: action
property.description: The kind of change that happened to the device during the procedure.

property.name: manipulated
property.description: The device that was manipulated (changed) during the procedure.

resource.name: Provenance
resource.description: Provenance of a resource is a record that describes entities and processes involved in producing and delivering or otherwise influencing that resource. Provenance provides a critical foundation for assessing authenticity, enabling trust, and allowing reproducibility. Provenance assertions are a form of contextual metadata and can themselves become important records with their own provenance. Provenance statement indicates clinical significance in terms of confidence in authenticity, reliability, and trustworthiness, integrity, and stage in lifecycle (e.g. Document Completion - has the artifact been legally authenticated), all of which may impact security, privacy, and trust policies.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta

Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: target
property.description: The Reference(s) that were generated or updated by the activity described in this resource. A provenance can point to more than one target if multiple resources were created/updated by the same activity.

property.name: occurred
property.description: The period during which the activity occurred.

property.name: recorded
property.description: The instant of time at which the activity was recorded.

property.name: policy
property.description: Policy or plan the activity was defined by. Typically, a single activity may have multiple applicable policy documents, such as patient consent, guarantor funding, etc.

property.name: location
property.description: Where the activity occurred, if relevant.

property.name: authorization
property.description: The authorization (e.g., PurposeOfUse) that was used during the event being recorded.

property.name: activity
property.description: An activity is something that occurs over a period of time and acts upon or with entities; it may include consuming, processing, transforming, modifying, relocating, using, or generating entities.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: Allows tracing of authorizatino for the events and tracking whether proposals/recommendations were acted upon.

property.name: patient
property.description: The patient element is available to enable deterministic tracking of activities that involve the patient as the subject of the data used in an activity.

property.name: encounter
property.description: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred, but some events may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter (e.g. pre-admission lab tests).

property.name: agent
property.description: An actor taking a role in an activity for which it can be assigned some degree of responsibility for the activity taking place.

property.name: entity
property.description: An entity used in this activity.

property.name: signature
property.description: A digital signature on the target Reference(s). The signer should match a Provenance.agent. The purpose of the signature is indicated.

element.name: Agent
element.description: An actor taking a role in an activity for which it can be assigned some degree of responsibility for the activity taking place.

property.name: type
property.description: The Functional Role of the agent with respect to the activity.

property.name: role
property.description: The structural roles of the agent indicating the agent's competency. The security role enabling the agent with respect to the activity.

property.name: who
property.description: Indicates who or what performed in the event.

property.name: onBehalfOf
property.description: The agent that delegated authority to perform the activity performed by the agent.who element.

element.name: Entity
element.description: An entity used in this activity.

property.name: role
property.description: How the entity was used during the activity.

property.name: what
property.description: Identity of the Entity used. May be a logical or physical uri and maybe absolute or relative.

property.name: agent
property.description: The entity is attributed to an agent to express the agent's responsibility for that entity, possibly along with other agents. This description can be understood as shorthand for saying that the agent was responsible for the activity which used the entity.

resource.name: Questionnaire
resource.description: A structured set of questions intended to guide the collection of answers from end-users. Questionnaires provide detailed control over order, presentation, phraseology and grouping to allow coherent, consistent data collection.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this questionnaire when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this questionnaire is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the questionnaire is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this questionnaire when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the questionnaire when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the questionnaire author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the questionnaire. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the questionnaire.

property.name: derivedFrom
property.description: The URL of a Questionnaire that this Questionnaire is based on.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of this questionnaire.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this questionnaire is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended for genuine usage.

property.name: subjectType
property.description: The types of subjects that can be the subject of responses created for the questionnaire.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the questionnaire was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the questionnaire changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the questionnaire.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the questionnaire from a consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate questionnaires.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the questionnaire is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this questionnaire is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the questionnaire and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the questionnaire.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: approvalDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

property.name: lastReviewDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.

property.name: effectivePeriod
property.description: The period during which the questionnaire content was or is planned to be in active use.

property.name: code
property.description: An identifier for this collection of questions in a particular terminology such as LOINC.

property.name: item
property.description: A particular question, question grouping or display text that is part of the questionnaire.

element.name: Item
element.description: A particular question, question grouping or display text that is part of the questionnaire.

property.name: linkId
property.description: An identifier that is unique within the Questionnaire allowing linkage to the equivalent item in a QuestionnaireResponse resource.

property.name: definition
property.description: This element is a URI that refers to an [ElementDefinition](elementdefinition.html) or to an [ObservationDefinition](observationdefinition.html) that provides information about this item, including information that might otherwise be included in the instance of the Questionnaire resource. A detailed description of the construction of the URI is shown in [Comments](questionnaire.html#definition), below.

property.name: code
property.description: A terminology code that corresponds to this group or question (e.g. a code from LOINC, which defines many questions and answers).

property.name: prefix
property.description: A short label for a particular group, question or set of display text within the questionnaire used for reference by the individual completing the questionnaire.

property.name: text
property.description: The name of a section, the text of a question or text content for a display item.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of questionnaire item this is - whether text for display, a grouping of other items or a particular type of data to be captured (string, integer, Coding, etc.).

property.name: enableWhen
property.description: A constraint indicating that this item should only be enabled (displayed/allow answers to be captured) when the specified condition is true.

property.name: enableBehavior
property.description: Controls how multiple enableWhen values are interpreted - whether all or any must be true.

property.name: disabledDisplay
property.description: Indicates if and how items that are disabled (because enableWhen evaluates to 'false') should be displayed.

property.name: required
property.description: An indication, if true, that the item must be present in a "completed" QuestionnaireResponse. If false, the item may be skipped when answering the questionnaire.

property.name: repeats
property.description: An indication, if true, that a QuestionnaireResponse for this item may include multiple answers associated with a single instance of this item (for question-type items) or multiple repetitions of the item (for group-type items).

property.name: readOnly
property.description: An indication, when true, that the value cannot be changed by a human respondent to the Questionnaire.

property.name: maxLength
property.description: The maximum number of characters that are permitted in the answer to be considered a "valid" QuestionnaireResponse.

property.name: answerConstraint
property.description: For items that have a defined set of allowed answers (via answerOption or answerValueSet), indicates whether values *other* than those specified can be selected.

property.name: answerValueSet
property.description: A reference to a value set containing a list of values representing permitted answers for a question.

property.name: answerOption
property.description: One of the permitted answers for the question.

property.name: initial
property.description: One or more values that should be pre-populated in the answer when initially rendering the questionnaire for user input.

property.name: item
property.description: Text, questions and other groups to be nested beneath a question or group.

resource.name: QuestionnaireResponse
resource.description: A structured set of questions and their answers. The questions are ordered and grouped into coherent subsets, corresponding to the structure of the grouping of the questionnaire being responded to.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this questionnaire response by the performer and/or other systems. These identifiers remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this questionnaire response. For example, a ServiceRequest seeking an intake assessment or a decision support recommendation to assess for post-partum depression.

property.name: partOf
property.description: A procedure or observation that this questionnaire was performed as part of the execution of. For example, the surgery a checklist was executed as part of.

property.name: questionnaire
property.description: The Questionnaire that defines and organizes the questions for which answers are being provided.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of the questionnaire response.

property.name: subject
property.description: The subject of the questionnaire response. This could be a patient, organization, practitioner, device, etc. This is who/what the answers apply to, but is not necessarily the source of information.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The Encounter during which this questionnaire response was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

property.name: authored
property.description: The date and/or time that this questionnaire response was last modified by the user - e.g. changing answers or revising status.

property.name: author
property.description: The individual or device that received the answers to the questions in the QuestionnaireResponse and recorded them in the system.

property.name: source
property.description: The individual or device that answered the questions about the subject.

property.name: item
property.description: A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided.

element.name: Item
element.description: A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided.

property.name: linkId
property.description: The item from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this item in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.

property.name: definition
property.description: A reference to an [ElementDefinition](elementdefinition.html) that provides the details for the item.

property.name: text
property.description: Text that is displayed above the contents of the group or as the text of the question being answered.

property.name: answer
property.description: The respondent's answer(s) to the question.

property.name: item
property.description: Sub-questions, sub-groups or display items nested beneath a group.

resource.name: RegulatedAuthorization
resource.description: Regulatory approval, clearance or licencing related to a regulated product, treatment, facility or activity that is cited in a guidance, regulation, rule or legislative act. An example is Market Authorization relating to a Medicinal Product.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifier for the authorization, typically assigned by the authorizing body.

property.name: subject
property.description: The product type, treatment, facility or activity that is being authorized.

property.name: type
property.description: Overall type of this authorization, for example drug marketing approval, orphan drug designation.

property.name: description
property.description: General textual supporting information.

property.name: region
property.description: The territory (e.g., country, jurisdiction etc.) in which the authorization has been granted.

property.name: status
property.description: The status that is authorised e.g. approved. Intermediate states and actions can be tracked with cases and applications.

property.name: statusDate
property.description: The date at which the current status was assigned.

property.name: validityPeriod
property.description: The time period in which the regulatory approval, clearance or licencing is in effect. As an example, a Marketing Authorization includes the date of authorization and/or an expiration date.

property.name: indication
property.description: Condition for which the use of the regulated product applies.

property.name: intendedUse
property.description: The intended use of the product, e.g. prevention, treatment, diagnosis.

property.name: basis
property.description: The legal or regulatory framework against which this authorization is granted, or other reasons for it.

property.name: holder
property.description: The organization that has been granted this authorization, by some authoritative body (the 'regulator').

property.name: regulator
property.description: The regulatory authority or authorizing body granting the authorization. For example, European Medicines Agency (EMA), Food and Drug Administration (FDA), Health Canada (HC), etc.

property.name: attachedDocument
property.description: Additional information or supporting documentation about the authorization.

property.name: case
property.description: The case or regulatory procedure for granting or amending a regulated authorization. An authorization is granted in response to submissions/applications by those seeking authorization. A case is the administrative process that deals with the application(s) that relate to this and assesses them. Note: This area is subject to ongoing review and the workgroup is seeking implementer feedback on its use (see link at bottom of page).

element.name: Case
element.description: The case or regulatory procedure for granting or amending a regulated authorization. An authorization is granted in response to submissions/applications by those seeking authorization. A case is the administrative process that deals with the application(s) that relate to this and assesses them. Note: This area is subject to ongoing review and the workgroup is seeking implementer feedback on its use (see link at bottom of page).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifier by which this case can be referenced.

property.name: type
property.description: The defining type of case.

property.name: status
property.description: The status associated with the case.

property.name: date
property.description: Relevant date for this case.

property.name: application
property.description: A regulatory submission from an organization to a regulator, as part of an assessing case. Multiple applications may occur over time, with more or different information to support or modify the submission or the authorization. The applications can be considered as steps within the longer running case or procedure for this authorization process.

resource.name: RelatedPerson
resource.description: Information about a person that is involved in a patient's health or the care for a patient, but who is not the target of healthcare, nor has a formal responsibility in the care process.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules

Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
