property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifier for a person within a particular scope.

property.name: active
property.description: Whether this related person record is in active use.

property.name: patient
property.description: The patient this person is related to.

property.name: relationship
property.description: The nature of the relationship between the related person and the patient.

property.name: name
property.description: A name associated with the person.

property.name: telecom
property.description: A contact detail for the person, e.g. a telephone number or an email address.

property.name: gender
property.description: Administrative Gender - the gender that the person is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.

property.name: birthDate
property.description: The date on which the related person was born.

property.name: address
property.description: Address where the related person can be contacted or visited.

property.name: photo
property.description: Image of the person.

property.name: period
property.description: The period of time during which this relationship is or was active. If there are no dates defined, then the interval is unknown.

property.name: communication
property.description: A language which may be used to communicate with the related person about the patient's health.

element.name: Communication
element.description: A language which may be used to communicate with the related person about the patient's health.

property.name: language
property.description: The ISO-639-1 alpha 2 code in lower case for the language, optionally followed by a hyphen and the ISO-3166-1 alpha 2 code for the region in upper case; e.g. "en" for English, or "en-US" for American English versus "en-AU" for Australian English.

property.name: preferred
property.description: Indicates whether or not the related person prefers this language (over other languages he or she masters up a certain level).

resource.name: RequestOrchestration
resource.description: A set of related requests that can be used to capture intended activities that have inter-dependencies such as "give this medication after that one".

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta

property.name: identifier
property.description: Allows a service to provide a unique, business identifier for the request.

property.name: instantiatesCanonical
property.description: A canonical URL referencing a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this request.

property.name: instantiatesUri
property.description: A URL referencing an externally defined protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this request.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this request.

property.name: replaces
property.description: Completed or terminated request(s) whose function is taken by this new request.

property.name: groupIdentifier
property.description: A shared identifier common to multiple independent Request instances that were activated/authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author. The presence of the same identifier on each request ties those requests together and may have business ramifications in terms of reporting of results, billing, etc. E.g. a requisition number shared by a set of lab tests ordered together, or a prescription number shared by all meds ordered at one time.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of the request. For request orchestrations, the status reflects the status of all the requests in the orchestration.

property.name: intent
property.description: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the request and where the request fits into the workflow chain.

property.name: priority
property.description: Indicates how quickly the request should be addressed with respect to other requests.

property.name: code
property.description: A code that identifies what the overall request orchestration is.

property.name: subject
property.description: The subject for which the request orchestration was created.

property.name: encounter
property.description: Describes the context of the request orchestration, if any.

property.name: authoredOn
property.description: Indicates when the request orchestration was created.

property.name: author
property.description: Provides a reference to the author of the request orchestration.

property.name: reason
property.description: Describes the reason for the request orchestration in coded or textual form.

property.name: goal
property.description: Goals that are intended to be achieved by following the requests in this RequestOrchestration.

property.name: note
property.description: Provides a mechanism to communicate additional information about the response.

property.name: action
property.description: The actions, if any, produced by the evaluation of the artifact.

element.name: Action
element.description: The actions, if any, produced by the evaluation of the artifact.

property.name: linkId
property.description: The linkId of the action from the PlanDefinition that corresponds to this action in the RequestOrchestration resource.

property.name: prefix
property.description: A user-visible prefix for the action. For example a section or item numbering such as 1. or A.

property.name: title
property.description: The title of the action displayed to a user.

property.name: description
property.description: A short description of the action used to provide a summary to display to the user.

property.name: textEquivalent
property.description: A text equivalent of the action to be performed. This provides a human-interpretable description of the action when the definition is consumed by a system that might not be capable of interpreting it dynamically.

property.name: priority
property.description: Indicates how quickly the action should be addressed with respect to other actions.

property.name: code
property.description: A code that provides meaning for the action or action group. For example, a section may have a LOINC code for a section of a documentation template.

property.name: documentation
property.description: Didactic or other informational resources associated with the action that can be provided to the CDS recipient. Information resources can include inline text commentary and links to web resources.

property.name: goal
property.description: Goals that are intended to be achieved by following the requests in this action.

property.name: condition
property.description: An expression that describes applicability criteria, or start/stop conditions for the action.

property.name: input
property.description: Defines input data requirements for the action.

property.name: output
property.description: Defines the outputs of the action, if any.

property.name: relatedAction
property.description: A relationship to another action such as "before" or "30-60 minutes after start of".

property.name: timing
property.description: An optional value describing when the action should be performed.

property.name: location
property.description: Identifies the facility where the action will occur; e.g. home, hospital, specific clinic, etc.

property.name: participant
property.description: The participant that should perform or be responsible for this action.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of action to perform (create, update, remove).

property.name: groupingBehavior
property.description: Defines the grouping behavior for the action and its children.

property.name: selectionBehavior
property.description: Defines the selection behavior for the action and its children.

property.name: requiredBehavior
property.description: Defines expectations around whether an action is required.

property.name: precheckBehavior
property.description: Defines whether the action should usually be preselected.

property.name: cardinalityBehavior
property.description: Defines whether the action can be selected multiple times.

property.name: resource
property.description: The resource that is the target of the action (e.g. CommunicationRequest).

property.name: definition
property.description: A reference to an ActivityDefinition that describes the action to be taken in detail, a PlanDefinition that describes a series of actions to be taken, a Questionnaire that should be filled out, a SpecimenDefinition describing a specimen to be collected, or an ObservationDefinition that specifies what observation should be captured.

property.name: transform
property.description: A reference to a StructureMap resource that defines a transform that can be executed to produce the intent resource using the ActivityDefinition instance as the input.

property.name: dynamicValue
property.description: Customizations that should be applied to the statically defined resource. For example, if the dosage of a medication must be computed based on the patient's weight, a customization would be used to specify an expression that calculated the weight, and the path on the resource that would contain the result.

property.name: action
property.description: Sub actions.

resource.name: Requirements
resource.description: The Requirements resource is used to describe an actor - a human or an application that plays a role in data exchange, and that may have obligations associated with the role the actor plays.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this Requirements when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this Requirements is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the Requirements is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this Requirements when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the Requirements when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the Requirements author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the Requirements. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the Requirements.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this Requirements. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this Requirements is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the Requirements was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the Requirements changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the Requirements.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the requirements.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate Requirements instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the Requirements is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this Requirements is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the Requirements and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the Requirements.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: derivedFrom
property.description: Another set of Requirements that this set of Requirements builds on and updates.

property.name: reference
property.description: A reference to another artifact that created this set of requirements. This could be a Profile, etc., or external regulation, or business requirements expressed elsewhere.

property.name: actor
property.description: An actor these requirements are in regard to.

property.name: statement
property.description: The actual statement of requirement, in markdown format.

element.name: Statement
element.description: The actual statement of requirement, in markdown format.

property.name: key
property.description: Key that identifies this statement (unique within this resource).

property.name: label
property.description: A short human usable label for this statement.

property.name: conformance
property.description: A short human usable label for this statement.

property.name: conditionality
property.description: This boolean flag is set to true of the text of the requirement is conditional on something e.g. it includes lanauage like 'if x then y'. This conditionality flag is introduced for purposes of filtering and colour highlighting etc.

property.name: requirement
property.description: The actual requirement for human consumption.

property.name: derivedFrom
property.description: Another statement on one of the requirements that this requirement clarifies or restricts.

property.name: parent
property.description: A larger requirement that this requirement helps to refine and enable.

property.name: satisfiedBy
property.description: A reference to another artifact that satisfies this requirement. This could be a Profile, extension, or an element in one of those, or a CapabilityStatement, OperationDefinition, SearchParameter, CodeSystem(/code), ValueSet, Libary etc.

property.name: reference
property.description: A reference to another artifact that created this requirement. This could be a Profile, etc., or external regulation, or business requirements expressed elsewhere.

property.name: source
property.description: Who asked for this statement to be a requirement. By default, it's assumed that the publisher knows who it is if it matters.

resource.name: ResearchStudy
resource.description: A scientific study of nature that sometimes includes processes involved in health and disease. For example, clinical trials are research studies that involve people. These studies may be related to new ways to screen, prevent, diagnose, and treat disease. They may also study certain outcomes and certain groups of people by looking at data collected in the past or future.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: url
property.description: Canonical identifier for this study resource, represented as a globally unique URI.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifiers assigned to this research study by the sponsor or other systems.

property.name: version
property.description: The business version for the study record.

property.name: name
property.description: Name for this study (computer friendly).

property.name: title
property.description: The human readable name of the research study.

property.name: label
property.description: Additional names for the study.

property.name: protocol
property.description: The set of steps expected to be performed as part of the execution of the study.

property.name: partOf
property.description: A larger research study of which this particular study is a component or step.

property.name: relatedArtifact
property.description: Citations, references, URLs and other related documents. When using relatedArtifact to share URLs, the relatedArtifact.type will often be set to one of "documentation" or "supported-with" and the URL value will often be in relatedArtifact.document.url but another possible location is relatedArtifact.resource when it is a canonical URL.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the ResearchStudy Resource was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the ResearchStudy Resource changes.

property.name: status
property.description: The publication state of the resource (not of the study).

property.name: primaryPurposeType
property.description: The type of study based upon the intent of the study activities. A classification of the intent of the study.

property.name: phase
property.description: The stage in the progression of a therapy from initial experimental use in humans in clinical trials to post-market evaluation.

property.name: studyDesign
property.description: Codes categorizing the type of study such as investigational vs. observational, type of blinding, type of randomization, safety vs. efficacy, etc.

property.name: focus
property.description: The medication(s), food(s), therapy(ies), device(s) or other concerns or interventions that the study is seeking to gain more information about.

property.name: condition
property.description: The condition that is the focus of the study. For example, In a study to examine risk factors for Lupus, might have as an inclusion criterion "healthy volunteer", but the target condition code would be a Lupus SNOMED code.

property.name: keyword
property.description: Key terms to aid in searching for or filtering the study.

property.name: region
property.description: A country, state or other area where the study is taking place rather than its precise geographic location or address.

property.name: descriptionSummary
property.description: A brief text for explaining the study.

property.name: description
property.description: A detailed and human-readable narrative of the study. E.g., study abstract.

property.name: period
property.description: Identifies the start date and the expected (or actual, depending on status) end date for the study.

property.name: site
property.description: A facility in which study activities are conducted.

property.name: note
property.description: Comments made about the study by the performer, subject or other participants.

property.name: classifier
property.description: Additional grouping mechanism or categorization of a research study. Example: FDA regulated device, FDA regulated drug, MPG Paragraph 23b (a German legal requirement), IRB-exempt, etc. Implementation Note: do not use the classifier element to support existing semantics that are already supported thru explicit elements in the resource.

property.name: associatedParty
property.description: Sponsors, collaborators, and other parties.

property.name: progressStatus
property.description: Status of study with time for that status.

property.name: whyStopped
property.description: A description and/or code explaining the premature termination of the study.

property.name: recruitment
property.description: Target or actual group of participants enrolled in study.

property.name: comparisonGroup
property.description: Describes an expected event or sequence of events for one of the subjects of a study. E.g. for a living subject: exposure to drug A, wash-out, exposure to drug B, wash-out, follow-up. E.g. for a stability study: {store sample from lot A at 25 degrees for 1 month}, {store sample from lot A at 40 degrees for 1 month}.

property.name: objective
property.description: A goal that the study is aiming to achieve in terms of a scientific question to be answered by the analysis of data collected during the study.

property.name: outcomeMeasure
property.description: An "outcome measure", "endpoint", "effect measure" or "measure of effect" is a specific measurement or observation used to quantify the effect of experimental variables on the participants in a study, or for observational studies, to describe patterns of diseases or traits or associations with exposures, risk factors or treatment.

property.name: result
property.description: Link to one or more sets of results generated by the study. Could also link to a research registry holding the results such as ClinicalTrials.gov.

element.name: Label
element.description: Additional names for the study.

property.name: type
property.description: Kind of name.

property.name: value
property.description: The name.

element.name: AssociatedParty
element.description: Sponsors, collaborators, and other parties.

property.name: name
property.description: Name of associated party.

property.name: role
property.description: Type of association.

property.name: period
property.description: Identifies the start date and the end date of the associated party in the role.

property.name: classifier
property.description: A categorization other than role for the associated party.

property.name: party
property.description: Individual or organization associated with study (use practitionerRole to specify their organisation).

element.name: ProgressStatus
element.description: Status of study with time for that status.

property.name: state
property.description: Label for status or state (e.g. recruitment status).

property.name: actual
property.description: An indication of whether or not the date is a known date when the state changed or will change. A value of true indicates a known date. A value of false indicates an estimated date.

property.name: period
property.description: Date range.

element.name: Recruitment
element.description: Target or actual group of participants enrolled in study.

property.name: targetNumber
property.description: Estimated total number of participants to be enrolled.

property.name: actualNumber
property.description: Actual total number of participants enrolled in study.

property.name: eligibility
property.description: Inclusion and exclusion criteria.

property.name: actualGroup
property.description: Group of participants who were enrolled in study.

element.name: ComparisonGroup
element.description: Describes an expected event or sequence of events for one of the subjects of a study. E.g. for a living subject: exposure to drug A, wash-out, exposure to drug B, wash-out, follow-up. E.g. for a stability study: {store sample from lot A at 25 degrees for 1 month}, {store sample from lot A at 40 degrees for 1 month}.

property.name: linkId
property.description: Allows the comparisonGroup for the study and the comparisonGroup for the subject to be linked easily.

property.name: name
property.description: Unique, human-readable label for this comparisonGroup of the study.

property.name: type
property.description: Categorization of study comparisonGroup, e.g. experimental, active comparator, placebo comparater.

property.name: description
property.description: A succinct description of the path through the study that would be followed by a subject adhering to this comparisonGroup.

property.name: intendedExposure
property.description: Interventions or exposures in this comparisonGroup or cohort.

property.name: observedGroup
property.description: Group of participants who were enrolled in study comparisonGroup.

element.name: Objective
element.description: A goal that the study is aiming to achieve in terms of a scientific question to be answered by the analysis of data collected during the study.

property.name: name
property.description: Unique, human-readable label for this objective of the study.

property.name: type
property.description: The kind of study objective.

property.name: description
property.description: Free text description of the objective of the study. This is what the study is trying to achieve rather than how it is going to achieve it (see ResearchStudy.description).

element.name: OutcomeMeasure
element.description: An "outcome measure", "endpoint", "effect measure" or "measure of effect" is a specific measurement or observation used to quantify the effect of experimental variables on the participants in a study, or for observational studies, to describe patterns of diseases or traits or associations with exposures, risk factors or treatment.

property.name: name
property.description: Label for the outcome.

property.name: type
property.description: The parameter or characteristic being assessed as one of the values by which the study is assessed.

property.name: description
property.description: Description of the outcome.

property.name: reference
property.description: Structured outcome definition.

resource.name: ResearchSubject
resource.description: A ResearchSubject is a participant or object which is the recipient of investigative activities in a research study.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifiers assigned to this research subject for a study.

property.name: status
property.description: The publication state of the resource (not of the subject).

property.name: progress
property.description: The current state (status) of the subject and resons for status change where appropriate.

property.name: period
property.description: The dates the subject began and ended their participation in the study.

property.name: study
property.description: Reference to the study the subject is participating in.

property.name: subject
property.description: The record of the person, animal or other entity involved in the study.

property.name: assignedComparisonGroup
property.description: The name of the arm in the study the subject is expected to follow as part of this study.

property.name: actualComparisonGroup
property.description: The name of the arm in the study the subject actually followed as part of this study.

property.name: consent
property.description: A record of the patient's informed agreement to participate in the study.

element.name: Progress
element.description: The current state (status) of the subject and resons for status change where appropriate.

property.name: type
property.description: Identifies the aspect of the subject's journey that the state refers to.

property.name: subjectState
property.description: The current state of the subject.

property.name: milestone
property.description: The milestones the subject has passed through.

property.name: reason
property.description: The reason for the state change. If coded it should follow the formal subject state model.

property.name: startDate
property.description: The date when the new status started.

property.name: endDate
property.description: The date when the state ended.

resource.name: RiskAssessment
resource.description: An assessment of the likely outcome(s) for a patient or other subject as well as the likelihood of each outcome.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifier assigned to the risk assessment.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A reference to the request that is fulfilled by this risk assessment.

property.name: parent
property.description: A reference to a resource that this risk assessment is part of, such as a Procedure.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the RiskAssessment, using the same statuses as an Observation.

property.name: method
property.description: The algorithm, process or mechanism used to evaluate the risk.

property.name: code
property.description: The type of the risk assessment performed.

property.name: subject
property.description: The patient or group the risk assessment applies to.

property.name: encounter
property.description: The encounter where the assessment was performed.

property.name: occurrence
property.description: The date (and possibly time) the risk assessment was performed.

property.name: condition
property.description: For assessments or prognosis specific to a particular condition, indicates the condition being assessed.

property.name: performer
property.description: The provider, patient, related person, or software application that performed the assessment.

property.name: reason
property.description: The reason the risk assessment was performed.

property.name: basis
property.description: Indicates the source data considered as part of the assessment (for example, FamilyHistory, Observations, Procedures, Conditions, etc.).

property.name: prediction
property.description: Describes the expected outcome for the subject.

property.name: mitigation
property.description: A description of the steps that might be taken to reduce the identified risk(s).

property.name: note
property.description: Additional comments about the risk assessment.

element.name: Prediction
element.description: Describes the expected outcome for the subject.

property.name: outcome
property.description: One of the potential outcomes for the patient (e.g. remission, death, a particular condition).

property.name: probability
property.description: Indicates how likely the outcome is (in the specified timeframe).

property.name: qualitativeRisk
property.description: Indicates how likely the outcome is (in the specified timeframe), expressed as a qualitative value (e.g. low, medium, or high).

property.name: relativeRisk
property.description: Indicates the risk for this particular subject (with their specific characteristics) divided by the risk of the population in general. (Numbers greater than 1 = higher risk than the population, numbers less than 1 = lower risk.).

property.name: when
property.description: Indicates the period of time or age range of the subject to which the specified probability applies.

property.name: rationale
property.description: Additional information explaining the basis for the prediction.

resource.name: Schedule
resource.description: A container for slots of time that may be available for booking appointments.

property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: identifier
property.description: External Ids for this item.

property.name: active
property.description: Whether this schedule record is in active use or should not be used (such as was entered in error).

property.name: serviceCategory
property.description: A broad categorization of the service that is to be performed during this appointment.

property.name: serviceType
property.description: The specific service that is to be performed during this appointment.

property.name: specialty
property.description: The specialty of a practitioner that would be required to perform the service requested in this appointment.

property.name: name
property.description: Further description of the schedule as it would be presented to a consumer while searching.

property.name: actor
property.description: Slots that reference this schedule resource provide the availability details to these referenced resource(s).

property.name: planningHorizon
property.description: The period of time that the slots that reference this Schedule resource cover (even if none exist). These cover the amount of time that an organization's planning horizon; the interval for which they are currently accepting appointments. This does not define a "template" for planning outside these dates.

property.name: comment
property.description: Comments on the availability to describe any extended information. Such as custom constraints on the slots that may be associated.

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this search parameter when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this search parameter is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the search parameter is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this search parameter when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the search parameter when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the search parameter author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the search parameter. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the search parameter.

property.name: derivedFrom
property.description: Where this search parameter is originally defined. If a derivedFrom is provided, then the details in the search parameter must be consistent with the definition from which it is defined. i.e. the parameter should have the same meaning, and (usually) the functionality should be a proper subset of the underlying search parameter.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this search parameter. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this search parameter is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the search parameter was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the search parameter changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual tresponsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the search parameter.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: And how it used.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate search parameter instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the search parameter is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this search parameter is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the search parameter and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the search parameter.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: code
property.description: The label that is recommended to be used in the URL or the parameter name in a parameters resource for this search parameter. In some cases, servers may need to use a different CapabilityStatement searchParam.name to differentiate between multiple SearchParameters that happen to have the same code.

property.name: base
property.description: The base resource type(s) that this search parameter can be used against.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of value that a search parameter may contain, and how the content is interpreted.

property.name: expression
property.description: A FHIRPath expression that returns a set of elements for the search parameter.

property.name: processingMode
property.description: How the search parameter relates to the set of elements returned by evaluating the expression query.

property.name: constraint
property.description: FHIRPath expression that defines/sets a complex constraint for when this SearchParameter is applicable.

property.name: target
property.description: Types of resource (if a resource is referenced).

property.name: multipleOr
property.description: Whether multiple values are allowed for each time the parameter exists. Values are separated by commas, and the parameter matches if any of the values match.

property.name: multipleAnd
property.description: Whether multiple parameters are allowed - e.g. more than one parameter with the same name. The search matches if all the parameters match.

property.name: comparator
property.description: Comparators supported for the search parameter.

property.name: modifier
property.description: A modifier supported for the search parameter.

property.name: chain
property.description: Contains the names of any search parameters which may be chained to the containing search parameter. Chained parameters may be added to search parameters of type reference and specify that resources will only be returned if they contain a reference to a resource which matches the chained parameter value. Values for this field should be drawn from SearchParameter.code for a parameter on the target resource type.

property.name: component
property.description: Used to define the parts of a composite search parameter.

element.name: Component
element.description: Used to define the parts of a composite search parameter.

property.name: definition
property.description: The definition of the search parameter that describes this part.

property.name: expression
property.description: A sub-expression that defines how to extract values for this component from the output of the main SearchParameter.expression.

resource.name: ServiceRequest
resource.description: A record of a request for service such as diagnostic investigations, treatments, or operations to be performed.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifiers assigned to this order instance by the orderer and/or the receiver and/or order fulfiller.

property.name: instantiatesCanonical
property.description: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this ServiceRequest.

property.name: instantiatesUri
property.description: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this ServiceRequest.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: Plan/proposal/order fulfilled by this request.

property.name: replaces
property.description: The request takes the place of the referenced completed or terminated request(s).

property.name: requisition
property.description: A shared identifier common to all service requests that were authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author, representing the composite or group identifier.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the order.

property.name: intent
property.description: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, an original order or a reflex order.

property.name: category
property.description: A code that classifies the service for searching, sorting and display purposes (e.g. "Surgical Procedure").

property.name: priority
property.description: Indicates how quickly the ServiceRequest should be addressed with respect to other requests.

property.name: doNotPerform
property.description: Set this to true if the record is saying that the service/procedure should NOT be performed.

property.name: code
property.description: A code or reference that identifies a particular service (i.e., procedure, diagnostic investigation, or panel of investigations) that have been requested.

property.name: orderDetail
property.description: Additional details and instructions about the how the services are to be delivered. For example, and order for a urinary catheter may have an order detail for an external or indwelling catheter, or an order for a bandage may require additional instructions specifying how the bandage should be applied.

property.name: quantity
property.description: An amount of service being requested which can be a quantity ( for example $1,500 home modification), a ratio ( for example, 20 half day visits per month), or a range (2.0 to 1.8 Gy per fraction).

property.name: subject
property.description: On whom or what the service is to be performed. This is usually a human patient, but can also be requested on animals, groups of humans or animals, devices such as dialysis machines, or even locations (typically for environmental scans).

property.name: focus
property.description: The actual focus of a service request when it is not the subject of record representing something or someone associated with the subject such as a spouse, parent, fetus, or donor. The focus of a service request could also be an existing condition, an intervention, the subject's diet, another service request on the subject, or a body structure such as tumor or implanted device.

property.name: encounter
property.description: An encounter that provides additional information about the healthcare context in which this request is made.

property.name: occurrence
property.description: The date/time at which the requested service should occur.

property.name: asNeeded
property.description: If a CodeableConcept is present, it indicates the pre-condition for performing the service. For example "pain", "on flare-up", etc.

property.name: authoredOn
property.description: When the request transitioned to being actionable.

property.name: requester
property.description: The individual who initiated the request and has responsibility for its activation.

property.name: performerType
property.description: Desired type of performer for doing the requested service.

property.name: performer
property.description: The desired performer for doing the requested service. For example, the surgeon, dermatopathologist, endoscopist, etc.

property.name: location
property.description: The preferred location(s) where the procedure should actually happen in coded or free text form. E.g. at home or nursing day care center.

property.name: reason
property.description: An explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in coded or textual form. This is often for billing purposes. May relate to the resources referred to in `supportingInfo`.

property.name: insurance
property.description: Insurance plans, coverage extensions, pre-authorizations and/or pre-determinations that may be needed for delivering the requested service.

property.name: supportingInfo
property.description: Additional clinical information about the patient or specimen that may influence the services or their interpretations. This information includes diagnosis, clinical findings and other observations. In laboratory ordering these are typically referred to as "ask at order entry questions (AOEs)". This includes observations explicitly requested by the producer (filler) to provide context or supporting information needed to complete the order. For example, reporting the amount of inspired oxygen for blood gas measurements.

property.name: specimen
property.description: One or more specimens that the laboratory procedure will use.

property.name: bodySite
property.description: Anatomic location where the procedure should be performed. This is the target site.

property.name: bodyStructure
property.description: Anatomic location where the procedure should be performed. This is the target site.

property.name: note
property.description: Any other notes and comments made about the service request. For example, internal billing notes.

property.name: patientInstruction
property.description: Instructions in terms that are understood by the patient or consumer.

property.name: relevantHistory
property.description: Key events in the history of the request.

element.name: OrderDetail
element.description: Additional details and instructions about the how the services are to be delivered. For example, and order for a urinary catheter may have an order detail for an external or indwelling catheter, or an order for a bandage may require additional instructions specifying how the bandage should be applied.

property.name: parameterFocus
property.description: Indicates the context of the order details by reference.

property.name: parameter
property.description: The parameter details for the service being requested.

element.name: PatientInstruction
element.description: Instructions in terms that are understood by the patient or consumer.

property.name: instruction
property.description: Instructions in terms that are understood by the patient or consumer.

resource.name: Slot
resource.description: A slot of time on a schedule that may be available for booking appointments.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: identifier
property.description: External Ids for this item.

property.name: serviceCategory
property.description: A broad categorization of the service that is to be performed during this appointment.

property.name: serviceType
property.description: The type of appointments that can be booked into this slot (ideally this would be an identifiable service - which is at a location, rather than the location itself). If provided then this overrides the value provided on the Schedule resource.

property.name: specialty
property.description: The specialty of a practitioner that would be required to perform the service requested in this appointment.

property.name: appointmentType
property.description: The style of appointment or patient that may be booked in the slot (not service type).

property.name: schedule
property.description: The schedule resource that this slot defines an interval of status information.

property.name: status
property.description: busy | free | busy-unavailable | busy-tentative | entered-in-error.

property.name: start
property.description: Date/Time that the slot is to begin.

property.name: end
property.description: Date/Time that the slot is to conclude.

property.name: overbooked
property.description: This slot has already been overbooked, appointments are unlikely to be accepted for this time.

property.name: comment
property.description: Comments on the slot to describe any extended information. Such as custom constraints on the slot.

resource.name: Specimen
resource.description: A sample to be used for analysis.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Id for specimen.

property.name: accessionIdentifier
property.description: The identifier assigned by the lab when accessioning specimen(s). This is not necessarily the same as the specimen identifier, depending on local lab procedures.

property.name: status
property.description: The availability of the specimen.

property.name: type
property.description: The kind of material that forms the specimen.

property.name: subject
property.description: Where the specimen came from. This may be from patient(s), from a location (e.g., the source of an environmental sample), or a sampling of a substance, a biologically-derived product, or a device.

property.name: receivedTime
property.description: Time when specimen is received by the testing laboratory for processing or testing.

property.name: parent
property.description: Reference to the parent (source) specimen which is used when the specimen was either derived from or a component of another specimen.

property.name: request
property.description: Details concerning a service request that required a specimen to be collected.

property.name: combined
property.description: This element signifies if the specimen is part of a group or pooled.

property.name: role
property.description: The role or reason for the specimen in the testing workflow.

property.name: feature
property.description: A physical feature or landmark on a specimen, highlighted for context by the collector of the specimen (e.g. surgeon), that identifies the type of feature as well as its meaning (e.g. the red ink indicating the resection margin of the right lobe of the excised prostate tissue or wire loop at radiologically suspected tumor location).

property.name: collection
property.description: Details concerning the specimen collection.

property.name: processing
property.description: Details concerning processing and processing steps for the specimen.

property.name: container
property.description: The container holding the specimen. The recursive nature of containers; i.e. blood in tube in tray in rack is not addressed here.

property.name: condition
property.description: A mode or state of being that describes the nature of the specimen.

property.name: note
property.description: To communicate any details or issues about the specimen or during the specimen collection. (for example: broken vial, sent with patient, frozen).

element.name: Feature
element.description: A physical feature or landmark on a specimen, highlighted for context by the collector of the specimen (e.g. surgeon), that identifies the type of feature as well as its meaning (e.g. the red ink indicating the resection margin of the right lobe of the excised prostate tissue or wire loop at radiologically suspected tumor location).

property.name: type
property.description: The landmark or feature being highlighted.

property.name: description
property.description: Description of the feature of the specimen.

element.name: Collection
element.description: Details concerning the specimen collection.

property.name: collector
property.description: Person who collected the specimen.

property.name: collected
property.description: Time when specimen was collected from subject - the physiologically relevant time.

property.name: duration
property.description: The span of time over which the collection of a specimen occurred.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The quantity of specimen collected; for instance the volume of a blood sample, or the physical measurement of an anatomic pathology sample.

property.name: method
property.description: A coded value specifying the technique that is used to perform the procedure.

property.name: device
property.description: A coded value specifying the technique that is used to perform the procedure.

property.name: procedure
property.description: The procedure event during which the specimen was collected (e.g. the surgery leading to the collection of a pathology sample).

property.name: bodySite
property.description: Anatomical location from which the specimen was collected (if subject is a patient). This is the target site. This element is not used for environmental specimens.

property.name: fastingStatus
property.description: Abstinence or reduction from some or all food, drink, or both, for a period of time prior to sample collection.

element.name: Processing
element.description: Details concerning processing and processing steps for the specimen.

property.name: description
property.description: Textual description of procedure.

property.name: method
property.description: A coded value specifying the method used to process the specimen.

property.name: additive
property.description: Material used in the processing step.

property.name: time
property.description: A record of the time or period when the specimen processing occurred. For example the time of sample fixation or the period of time the sample was in formalin.

element.name: Container
element.description: The container holding the specimen. The recursive nature of containers; i.e. blood in tube in tray in rack is not addressed here.

property.name: device
property.description: The device resource for the the container holding the specimen. If the container is in a holder then the referenced device will point to a parent device.

property.name: location
property.description: The location of the container holding the specimen.

property.name: specimenQuantity
property.description: The quantity of specimen in the container; may be volume, dimensions, or other appropriate measurements, depending on the specimen type.

resource.name: SpecimenDefinition
resource.description: A kind of specimen with associated set of requirements.

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URL that is used to identify this SpecimenDefinition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this SpecimenDefinition is (or will be) published. The URL SHOULD include the major version of the SpecimenDefinition. For more information see Technical and Business Versions.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A business identifier assigned to this SpecimenDefinition.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the SpecimenDefinition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the SpecimenDefinition author and is not expected to be globally unique.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the {{title}}. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the SpecimenDefinition.

property.name: derivedFromCanonical
property.description: The canonical URL pointing to another FHIR-defined SpecimenDefinition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this definition.

property.name: derivedFromUri
property.description: The URL pointing to an externally-defined type of specimen, guideline or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this definition.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of theSpecimenDefinition.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A flag to indicate that this SpecimenDefinition is not authored for genuine usage.

property.name: subject
property.description: A code or group definition that describes the intended subject from which this kind of specimen is to be collected.

property.name: date
property.description: For draft definitions, indicates the date of initial creation. For active definitions, represents the date of activation. For withdrawn definitions, indicates the date of withdrawal.

property.name: publisher
property.description: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the SpecimenDefinition. May also allow for contact.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the SpecimenDefinition from the consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These terms may be used to assist with indexing and searching of specimen definitions.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A jurisdiction in which the SpecimenDefinition is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explains why this SpecimeDefinition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: Copyright statement relating to the SpecimenDefinition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the SpecimenDefinition.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: approvalDate
property.description: The date on which the asset content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

property.name: lastReviewDate
property.description: The date on which the asset content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after that, but doesn't change the original approval date.

property.name: effectivePeriod
property.description: The period during which the SpecimenDefinition content was or is planned to be effective.

property.name: typeCollected
property.description: The kind of material to be collected.

property.name: patientPreparation
property.description: Preparation of the patient for specimen collection.

property.name: timeAspect
property.description: Time aspect of specimen collection (duration or offset).

property.name: collection
property.description: The action to be performed for collecting the specimen.

property.name: typeTested
property.description: Specimen conditioned in a container as expected by the testing laboratory.

element.name: TypeTested
element.description: Specimen conditioned in a container as expected by the testing laboratory.

property.name: isDerived
property.description: Primary of secondary specimen.

property.name: type
property.description: The kind of specimen conditioned for testing expected by lab.

property.name: preference
property.description: The preference for this type of conditioned specimen.

property.name: container
property.description: The specimen's container.

property.name: requirement
property.description: Requirements for delivery and special handling of this kind of conditioned specimen.

property.name: retentionTime
property.description: The usual time that a specimen of this kind is retained after the ordered tests are completed, for the purpose of additional testing.

property.name: singleUse
property.description: Specimen can be used by only one test or panel if the value is "true".

property.name: rejectionCriterion
property.description: Criterion for rejection of the specimen in its container by the laboratory.

property.name: handling
property.description: Set of instructions for preservation/transport of the specimen at a defined temperature interval, prior the testing process.

property.name: testingDestination
property.description: Where the specimen will be tested: e.g., lab, sector, device or any combination of these.

resource.name: StructureDefinition
resource.description: A definition of a FHIR structure. This resource is used to describe the underlying resources, data types defined in FHIR, and also for describing extensions and constraints on resources and data types.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this structure definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this structure definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the structure definition is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this structure definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the structure definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the structure definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. There is no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence, so authors are encouraged to populate the StructureDefinition.versionAlgorithm[x] element to enable comparisons. If there is no managed version available, authors can consider using ISO date/time syntax (e.g., '2023-01-01').

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the structure definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the structure definition.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this structure definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this structure definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the structure definition was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the structure definition changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the structure definition.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the structure definition from a consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate structure definition instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the structure definition is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this structure definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the structure definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the structure definition. The short copyright declaration (e.g. (c) '2015+ xyz organization' should be sent in the copyrightLabel element.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: keyword
property.description: (DEPRECATED) A set of key words or terms from external terminologies that may be used to assist with indexing and searching of templates nby describing the use of this structure definition, or the content it describes.

property.name: fhirVersion
property.description: The version of the FHIR specification on which this StructureDefinition is based - this is the formal version of the specification, without the revision number, e.g. [publication].[major].[minor], which is 4.6.0. for this version.

property.name: mapping
property.description: An external specification that the content is mapped to.

property.name: kind
property.description: Defines the kind of structure that this definition is describing.

property.name: abstract
property.description: Whether structure this definition describes is abstract or not - that is, whether the structure is not intended to be instantiated. For Resources and Data types, abstract types will never be exchanged between systems.

property.name: context
property.description: Identifies the types of resource or data type elements to which the extension can be applied. For more guidance on using the 'context' element, see the [defining extensions page](defining-extensions.html#context).

property.name: contextInvariant
property.description: A set of rules as FHIRPath Invariants about when the extension can be used (e.g. co-occurrence variants for the extension). All the rules must be true.

property.name: type
property.description: The type this structure describes. If the derivation kind is 'specialization' then this is the master definition for a type, and there is always one of these (a data type, an extension, a resource, including abstract ones). Otherwise the structure definition is a constraint on the stated type (and in this case, the type cannot be an abstract type). References are URLs that are relative to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition e.g. "string" is a reference to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/string. Absolute URLs are only allowed in logical models, where they are required.

property.name: baseDefinition
property.description: An absolute URI that is the base structure from which this type is derived, either by specialization or constraint.

property.name: derivation
property.description: How the type relates to the baseDefinition.

property.name: snapshot
property.description: A snapshot view is expressed in a standalone form that can be used and interpreted without considering the base StructureDefinition.

property.name: differential
property.description: A differential view is expressed relative to the base StructureDefinition - a statement of differences that it applies.

element.name: Mapping
element.description: An external specification that the content is mapped to.

property.name: identity
property.description: An Internal id that is used to identify this mapping set when specific mappings are made.

property.name: uri
property.description: An absolute URI that identifies the specification that this mapping is expressed to.

property.name: name
property.description: A name for the specification that is being mapped to.

property.name: comment
property.description: Comments about this mapping, including version notes, issues, scope limitations, and other important notes for usage.

element.name: Context
element.description: Identifies the types of resource or data type elements to which the extension can be applied. For more guidance on using the 'context' element, see the [defining extensions page](defining-extensions.html#context).

property.name: type
property.description: Defines how to interpret the expression that defines what the context of the extension is.

property.name: expression
property.description: An expression that defines where an extension can be used in resources.

element.name: Snapshot
element.description: A snapshot view is expressed in a standalone form that can be used and interpreted without considering the base StructureDefinition.

property.name: element
property.description: Captures constraints on each element within the resource.

element.name: Differential
element.description: A differential view is expressed relative to the base StructureDefinition - a statement of differences that it applies.

property.description: Captures constraints on each element within the resource.
