property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this code system when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the subscription.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the subscription, which marks the server state for managing the subscription.

property.name: topic
property.description: The reference to the subscription topic to be notified about.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details for a human to contact about the subscription. The primary use of this for system administrator troubleshooting.

property.name: end
property.description: The time for the server to turn the subscription off.

property.name: managingEntity
property.description: Entity with authorization to make subsequent revisions to the Subscription and also determines what data the subscription is authorized to disclose.

property.name: reason
property.description: A description of why this subscription is defined.

property.name: filterBy
property.description: The filter properties to be applied to narrow the subscription topic stream. When multiple filters are applied, evaluates to true if all the conditions applicable to that resource are met; otherwise it returns false (i.e., logical AND).

property.name: channelType
property.description: The type of channel to send notifications on.

property.name: endpoint
property.description: The url that describes the actual end-point to send notifications to.

property.name: parameter
property.description: Channel-dependent information to send as part of the notification (e.g., HTTP Headers).

property.name: heartbeatPeriod
property.description: If present, a 'heartbeat' notification (keep-alive) is sent via this channel with an interval period equal to this elements integer value in seconds. If not present, a heartbeat notification is not sent.

property.name: timeout
property.description: If present, the maximum amount of time a server will allow before failing a notification attempt.

property.name: contentType
property.description: The MIME type to send the payload in - e.g., `application/fhir+xml` or `application/fhir+json`. Note that: * clients may request notifications in a specific FHIR version by using the [FHIR Version Parameter](http.html#version-parameter) - e.g., `application/fhir+json; fhirVersion=4.0`. * additional MIME types can be allowed by channels - e.g., `text/plain` and `text/html` are defined by the Email channel.

property.name: content
property.description: How much of the resource content to deliver in the notification payload. The choices are an empty payload, only the resource id, or the full resource content.

property.name: maxCount
property.description: If present, the maximum number of events that will be included in a notification bundle. Note that this is not a strict limit on the number of entries in a bundle, as dependent resources can be included.

element.name: FilterBy
element.description: The filter properties to be applied to narrow the subscription topic stream. When multiple filters are applied, evaluates to true if all the conditions applicable to that resource are met; otherwise it returns false (i.e., logical AND).

property.name: resourceType
property.description: A resource listed in the `SubscriptionTopic` this `Subscription` references (`SubscriptionTopic.canFilterBy.resource`). This element can be used to differentiate filters for topics that include more than one resource type.

property.name: filterParameter
property.description: The filter as defined in the `SubscriptionTopic.canFilterBy.filterParameter` element.

property.name: comparator
property.description: Comparator applied to this filter parameter.

property.name: modifier
property.description: Modifier applied to this filter parameter.

property.name: value
property.description: The literal value or resource path as is legal in search - for example, `Patient/123` or `le1950`.

element.name: Parameter
element.description: Channel-dependent information to send as part of the notification (e.g., HTTP Headers).

property.name: name
property.description: Parameter name for information passed to the channel for notifications, for example in the case of a REST hook wanting to pass through an authorization header, the name would be Authorization.

property.name: value
property.description: Parameter value for information passed to the channel for notifications, for example in the case of a REST hook wanting to pass through an authorization header, the value would be `Bearer 0193...`.

property.description: Detailed information about events relevant to this subscription notification.

property.name: subscription
property.description: The reference to the Subscription which generated this notification.

property.name: topic
property.description: The reference to the SubscriptionTopic for the Subscription which generated this notification.

property.name: error
property.description: A record of errors that occurred when the server processed a notification.

element.name: NotificationEvent
element.description: Detailed information about events relevant to this subscription notification.

property.name: eventNumber
property.description: Either the sequential number of this event in this subscription context or a relative event number for this notification.

property.name: timestamp
property.description: The actual time this event occurred on the server.

property.name: focus
property.description: The focus of this event. While this will usually be a reference to the focus resource of the event, it MAY contain a reference to a non-FHIR object.

property.name: additionalContext
property.description: Additional context information for this event. Generally, this will contain references to additional resources included with the event (e.g., the Patient relevant to an Encounter), however it MAY refer to non-FHIR objects.

resource.name: SubscriptionTopic
resource.description: Describes a stream of resource state changes identified by trigger criteria and annotated with labels useful to filter projections from this topic.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this subscription topic when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this subscription topic is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the subscription topic is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this subscription topic by the performer and/or other systems. These identifiers remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the subscription topic when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the Topic author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions are orderable.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the subscription topic This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the subscription topic. For example, "admission".

property.name: derivedFrom
property.description: The canonical URL pointing to another FHIR-defined SubscriptionTopic that is adhered to in whole or in part by this SubscriptionTopic.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of the SubscriptionTopic.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A flag to indicate that this TopSubscriptionTopicic is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the subscription topic was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the subscription topic changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the SubscriptionTopic. May also allow for contact.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the Topic from the consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These terms may be used to assist with indexing and searching of code system definitions.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A jurisdiction in which the Topic is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explains why this Topic is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the SubscriptionTopic and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the SubscriptionTopic.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: approvalDate
property.description: The date on which the asset content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

property.name: lastReviewDate
property.description: The date on which the asset content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after that, but doesn't change the original approval date.

property.name: effectivePeriod
property.description: The period during which the SubscriptionTopic content was or is planned to be effective.

property.name: resourceTrigger
property.description: A definition of a resource-based event that triggers a notification based on the SubscriptionTopic. The criteria may be just a human readable description and/or a full FHIR search string or FHIRPath expression. Multiple triggers are considered OR joined (e.g., a resource update matching ANY of the definitions will trigger a notification).

property.name: eventTrigger
property.description: Event definition which can be used to trigger the SubscriptionTopic.

property.name: canFilterBy
property.description: List of properties by which Subscriptions on the SubscriptionTopic can be filtered. May be defined Search Parameters (e.g., Encounter.patient) or parameters defined within this SubscriptionTopic context (e.g., hub.event).

property.name: notificationShape
property.description: List of properties to describe the shape (e.g., resources) included in notifications from this Subscription Topic.

element.name: ResourceTrigger
element.description: A definition of a resource-based event that triggers a notification based on the SubscriptionTopic. The criteria may be just a human readable description and/or a full FHIR search string or FHIRPath expression. Multiple triggers are considered OR joined (e.g., a resource update matching ANY of the definitions will trigger a notification).

property.name: description
property.description: The human readable description of this resource trigger for the SubscriptionTopic - for example, "An Encounter enters the 'in-progress' state".

property.name: resource
property.description: URL of the Resource that is the type used in this resource trigger. Relative URLs are relative to the StructureDefinition root of the implemented FHIR version (e.g., http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition). For example, "Patient" maps to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Patient. For more information, see ElementDefinition.type.code.

property.name: supportedInteraction
property.description: The FHIR RESTful interaction which can be used to trigger a notification for the SubscriptionTopic. Multiple values are considered OR joined (e.g., CREATE or UPDATE). If not present, all supported interactions are assumed.

property.name: queryCriteria
property.description: The FHIR query based rules that the server should use to determine when to trigger a notification for this subscription topic.

property.name: fhirPathCriteria
property.description: The FHIRPath based rules that the server should use to determine when to trigger a notification for this topic.

element.name: EventTrigger
element.description: Event definition which can be used to trigger the SubscriptionTopic.

property.name: description
property.description: The human readable description of an event to trigger a notification for the SubscriptionTopic - for example, "Patient Admission, as defined in HL7v2 via message ADT^A01". Multiple values are considered OR joined (e.g., matching any single event listed).

property.name: event
property.description: A well-defined event which can be used to trigger notifications from the SubscriptionTopic.

property.name: resource
property.description: URL of the Resource that is the focus type used in this event trigger. Relative URLs are relative to the StructureDefinition root of the implemented FHIR version (e.g., http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition). For example, "Patient" maps to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Patient. For more information, see ElementDefinition.type.code.

element.name: CanFilterBy
element.description: List of properties by which Subscriptions on the SubscriptionTopic can be filtered. May be defined Search Parameters (e.g., Encounter.patient) or parameters defined within this SubscriptionTopic context (e.g., hub.event).

property.name: description
property.description: Description of how this filtering parameter is intended to be used.

property.name: resource
property.description: URL of the Resource that is the type used in this filter. This is the "focus" of the topic (or one of them if there are more than one). It will be the same, a generality, or a specificity of SubscriptionTopic.resourceTrigger.resource or SubscriptionTopic.eventTrigger.resource when they are present.

property.name: filterParameter
property.description: Either the canonical URL to a search parameter (like "http://hl7.org/fhir/SearchParameter/encounter-patient") or topic-defined parameter (like "hub.event") which is a label for the filter.

property.name: filterDefinition
property.description: Either the canonical URL to a search parameter (like "http://hl7.org/fhir/SearchParameter/encounter-patient") or the officially-defined URI for a shared filter concept (like "http://example.org/concepts/shared-common-event").

property.name: comparator
property.description: Comparators allowed for the filter parameter.

property.name: modifier
property.description: Modifiers allowed for the filter parameter.

element.name: NotificationShape
element.description: List of properties to describe the shape (e.g., resources) included in notifications from this Subscription Topic.

property.name: resource
property.description: URL of the Resource that is the type used in this shape. This is the 'focus' resource of the topic (or one of them if there are more than one) and the root resource for this shape definition. It will be the same, a generality, or a specificity of SubscriptionTopic.resourceTrigger.resource or SubscriptionTopic.eventTrigger.resource when they are present.

property.name: include
property.description: Search-style _include directives, rooted in the resource for this shape. Servers SHOULD include resources listed here, if they exist and the user is authorized to receive them. Clients SHOULD be prepared to receive these additional resources, but SHALL function properly without them.

property.name: revInclude
property.description: Search-style _revinclude directives, rooted in the resource for this shape. Servers SHOULD include resources listed here, if they exist and the user is authorized to receive them. Clients SHOULD be prepared to receive these additional resources, but SHALL function properly without them.

resource.name: Substance
resource.description: A homogeneous material with a definite composition.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Unique identifier for the substance. For an instance, an identifier associated with the package/container (usually a label affixed directly).

property.name: instance
property.description: A boolean to indicate if this an instance of a substance or a kind of one (a definition).

property.name: status
property.description: A code to indicate if the substance is actively used.

property.name: category
property.description: A code that classifies the general type of substance. This is used for searching, sorting and display purposes.

property.name: code
property.description: A code (or set of codes) that identify this substance.

property.name: description
property.description: A description of the substance - its appearance, handling requirements, and other usage notes.

property.name: expiry
property.description: When the substance is no longer valid to use. For some substances, a single arbitrary date is used for expiry.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The amount of the substance.

property.name: ingredient
property.description: A substance can be composed of other substances.

element.name: Ingredient
element.description: A substance can be composed of other substances.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The amount of the ingredient in the substance - a concentration ratio.

property.name: substance
property.description: Another substance that is a component of this substance.

resource.name: SubstanceDefinition
resource.description: The detailed description of a substance, typically at a level beyond what is used for prescribing.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifier by which this substance is known.

property.name: version
property.description: A business level version identifier of the substance.

property.name: status
property.description: Status of substance within the catalogue e.g. active, retired.

property.name: classification
property.description: A high level categorization, e.g. polymer or nucleic acid, or food, chemical, biological, or a lower level such as the general types of polymer (linear or branch chain) or type of impurity (process related or contaminant).

property.name: domain
property.description: If the substance applies to human or veterinary use.

property.name: grade
property.description: The quality standard, established benchmark, to which substance complies (e.g. USP/NF, Ph. Eur, JP, BP, Company Standard).

property.name: description
property.description: Textual description of the substance.

property.name: informationSource
property.description: Supporting literature.

property.name: note
property.description: Textual comment about the substance's catalogue or registry record.

property.name: manufacturer
property.description: The entity that creates, makes, produces or fabricates the substance. This is a set of potential manufacturers but is not necessarily comprehensive.

property.name: supplier
property.description: An entity that is the source for the substance. It may be different from the manufacturer. Supplier is synonymous to a distributor.

property.name: moiety
property.description: Moiety, for structural modifications.

property.name: characterization
property.description: General specifications for this substance.

property.name: property
property.description: General specifications for this substance.

property.name: referenceInformation
property.description: General information detailing this substance.

property.name: molecularWeight
property.description: The average mass of a molecule of a compound compared to 1/12 the mass of carbon 12 and calculated as the sum of the atomic weights of the constituent atoms.

property.name: structure
property.description: Structural information.

property.name: code
property.description: Codes associated with the substance.

property.name: name
property.description: Names applicable to this substance.

property.name: relationship
property.description: A link between this substance and another, with details of the relationship.

property.name: nucleicAcid
property.description: Data items specific to nucleic acids.

property.name: polymer
property.description: Data items specific to polymers.

property.name: protein
property.description: Data items specific to proteins.

property.name: sourceMaterial
property.description: Material or taxonomic/anatomical source for the substance.

element.name: Moiety
element.description: Moiety, for structural modifications.

property.name: role
property.description: Role that the moiety is playing.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifier by which this moiety substance is known.

property.name: name
property.description: Textual name for this moiety substance.

property.name: stereochemistry
property.description: Stereochemistry type.

property.name: opticalActivity
property.description: Optical activity type.

property.name: molecularFormula
property.description: Molecular formula for this moiety of this substance, typically using the Hill system.

property.name: amount
property.description: Quantitative value for this moiety.

property.name: measurementType
property.description: The measurement type of the quantitative value. In capturing the actual relative amounts of substances or molecular fragments it may be necessary to indicate whether the amount refers to, for example, a mole ratio or weight ratio.

element.name: Characterization
element.description: General specifications for this substance.

property.name: technique
property.description: The method used to elucidate the characterization of the drug substance. Example: HPLC.

property.name: form
property.description: Describes the nature of the chemical entity and explains, for instance, whether this is a base or a salt form.

property.name: description
property.description: The description or justification in support of the interpretation of the data file.

property.name: file
property.description: The data produced by the analytical instrument or a pictorial representation of that data. Examples: a JCAMP, JDX, or ADX file, or a chromatogram or spectrum analysis.

element.name: Property
element.description: General specifications for this substance.

property.name: type
property.description: A code expressing the type of property.

property.name: value
property.description: A value for the property.

element.name: MolecularWeight
element.description: The average mass of a molecule of a compound compared to 1/12 the mass of carbon 12 and calculated as the sum of the atomic weights of the constituent atoms.

property.name: method
property.description: The method by which the molecular weight was determined.

property.name: type
property.description: Type of molecular weight such as exact, average (also known as. number average), weight average.

property.name: amount
property.description: Used to capture quantitative values for a variety of elements. If only limits are given, the arithmetic mean would be the average. If only a single definite value for a given element is given, it would be captured in this field.

element.name: Structure
element.description: Structural information.

property.name: stereochemistry
property.description: Stereochemistry type.

property.name: opticalActivity
property.description: Optical activity type.

property.name: molecularFormula
property.description: An expression which states the number and type of atoms present in a molecule of a substance.

property.name: molecularFormulaByMoiety
property.description: Specified per moiety according to the Hill system, i.e. first C, then H, then alphabetical, each moiety separated by a dot.

property.name: molecularWeight
property.description: The molecular weight or weight range (for proteins, polymers or nucleic acids).

property.name: technique
property.description: The method used to elucidate the structure of the drug substance. Examples: X-ray, NMR, Peptide mapping, Ligand binding assay.

property.name: sourceDocument
property.description: The source of information about the structure.

property.name: representation
property.description: A depiction of the structure of the substance.

element.name: Code
element.description: Codes associated with the substance.

property.name: code
property.description: The specific code.

property.name: status
property.description: Status of the code assignment, for example 'provisional', 'approved'.

property.name: statusDate
property.description: The date at which the code status was changed as part of the terminology maintenance.

property.name: note
property.description: Any comment can be provided in this field, if necessary.

property.name: source
property.description: Supporting literature.

element.name: Name
element.description: Names applicable to this substance.

property.name: name
property.description: The actual name.

property.name: type
property.description: Name type, for example 'systematic', 'scientific, 'brand'.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the name, for example 'current', 'proposed'.

property.name: preferred
property.description: If this is the preferred name for this substance.

property.name: language
property.description: Human language that the name is written in.

property.name: domain
property.description: The use context of this name for example if there is a different name a drug active ingredient as opposed to a food colour additive.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: The jurisdiction where this name applies.

property.name: synonym
property.description: A synonym of this particular name, by which the substance is also known.

property.name: translation
property.description: A translation for this name into another human language.

property.name: official
property.description: Details of the official nature of this name.

property.name: source
property.description: Supporting literature.

element.name: Relationship
element.description: A link between this substance and another, with details of the relationship.

property.name: substanceDefinition
property.description: A pointer to another substance, as a resource or just a representational code.

property.name: type
property.description: For example "salt to parent", "active moiety", "starting material", "polymorph", "impurity of".

property.name: isDefining
property.description: For example where an enzyme strongly bonds with a particular substance, this is a defining relationship for that enzyme, out of several possible substance relationships.

property.name: amount
property.description: A numeric factor for the relationship, for instance to express that the salt of a substance has some percentage of the active substance in relation to some other.

property.name: ratioHighLimitAmount
property.description: For use when the numeric has an uncertain range.

property.name: comparator
property.description: An operator for the amount, for example "average", "approximately", "less than".

property.name: source
property.description: Supporting literature.

element.name: SourceMaterial
element.description: Material or taxonomic/anatomical source for the substance.

property.name: type
property.description: A classification that provides the origin of the raw material. Example: cat hair would be an Animal source type.

property.name: genus
property.description: The genus of an organism, typically referring to the Latin epithet of the genus element of the plant/animal scientific name.

property.name: species
property.description: The species of an organism, typically referring to the Latin epithet of the species of the plant/animal.

property.name: part
property.description: An anatomical origin of the source material within an organism.

property.name: countryOfOrigin
property.description: The country or countries where the material is harvested.

resource.name: SubstanceNucleicAcid
resource.description: Nucleic acids are defined by three distinct elements: the base, sugar and linkage. Individual substance/moiety IDs will be created for each of these elements. The nucleotide sequence will be always entered in the 5'-3' direction.

property.name: sequenceType
property.description: The type of the sequence shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: numberOfSubunits
property.description: The number of linear sequences of nucleotides linked through phosphodiester bonds shall be described. Subunits would be strands of nucleic acids that are tightly associated typically through Watson-Crick base pairing. NOTE: If not specified in the reference source, the assumption is that there is 1 subunit.

property.name: areaOfHybridisation
property.description: The area of hybridisation shall be described if applicable for double stranded RNA or DNA. The number associated with the subunit followed by the number associated to the residue shall be specified in increasing order. The underscore "" shall be used as separator as follows: "Subunitnumber Residue".

property.name: oligoNucleotideType
property.description: (TBC).

property.name: subunit
property.description: Subunits are listed in order of decreasing length; sequences of the same length will be ordered by molecular weight; subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated multiple times.

element.name: Subunit
element.description: Subunits are listed in order of decreasing length; sequences of the same length will be ordered by molecular weight; subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated multiple times.

property.name: subunit
property.description: Index of linear sequences of nucleic acids in order of decreasing length. Sequences of the same length will be ordered by molecular weight. Subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated and have sequential subscripts.

property.name: sequence
property.description: Actual nucleotide sequence notation from 5' to 3' end using standard single letter codes. In addition to the base sequence, sugar and type of phosphate or non-phosphate linkage should also be captured.

property.name: length
property.description: The length of the sequence shall be captured.

property.name: sequenceAttachment
property.description: (TBC).

property.name: fivePrime
property.description: The nucleotide present at the 5' terminal shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. Since the sequence is represented from the 5' to the 3' end, the 5' prime nucleotide is the letter at the first position in the sequence. A separate representation would be redundant.

property.name: threePrime
property.description: The nucleotide present at the 3' terminal shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. Since the sequence is represented from the 5' to the 3' end, the 5' prime nucleotide is the letter at the last position in the sequence. A separate representation would be redundant.

property.name: linkage
property.description: The linkages between sugar residues will also be captured.

property.name: sugar
property.description: 5.3.6.8.1 Sugar ID (Mandatory).

property.name: identifier
property.description: A business idenfier for this polymer, but typically this is handled by a SubstanceDefinition identifier.

property.name: class
property.description: Overall type of the polymer.

property.name: geometry
property.description: Polymer geometry, e.g. linear, branched, cross-linked, network or dendritic.

property.name: copolymerConnectivity
property.description: Descrtibes the copolymer sequence type (polymer connectivity).

property.name: modification
property.description: Todo - this is intended to connect to a repeating full modification structure, also used by Protein and Nucleic Acid . String is just a placeholder.

property.name: repeat
property.description: Specifies and quantifies the repeated units and their configuration.

element.name: MonomerSet
element.description: Todo.

property.name: ratioType
property.description: Captures the type of ratio to the entire polymer, e.g. Monomer/Polymer ratio, SRU/Polymer Ratio.

property.name: startingMaterial
property.description: The starting materials - monomer(s) used in the synthesis of the polymer.

element.name: Repeat
element.description: Specifies and quantifies the repeated units and their configuration.

property.name: averageMolecularFormula
property.description: A representation of an (average) molecular formula from a polymer.

property.name: repeatUnitAmountType
property.description: How the quantitative amount of Structural Repeat Units is captured (e.g. Exact, Numeric, Average).

property.name: repeatUnit
property.description: An SRU - Structural Repeat Unit.

resource.name: SubstanceProtein
resource.description: A SubstanceProtein is defined as a single unit of a linear amino acid sequence, or a combination of subunits that are either covalently linked or have a defined invariant stoichiometric relationship. This includes all synthetic, recombinant and purified SubstanceProteins of defined sequence, whether the use is therapeutic or prophylactic. This set of elements will be used to describe albumins, coagulation factors, cytokines, growth factors, peptide/SubstanceProtein hormones, enzymes, toxins, toxoids, recombinant vaccines, and immunomodulators.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta

property.name: sequenceType
property.description: The SubstanceProtein descriptive elements will only be used when a complete or partial amino acid sequence is available or derivable from a nucleic acid sequence.

property.name: numberOfSubunits
property.description: Number of linear sequences of amino acids linked through peptide bonds. The number of subunits constituting the SubstanceProtein shall be described. It is possible that the number of subunits can be variable.

property.name: disulfideLinkage
property.description: The disulphide bond between two cysteine residues either on the same subunit or on two different subunits shall be described. The position of the disulfide bonds in the SubstanceProtein shall be listed in increasing order of subunit number and position within subunit followed by the abbreviation of the amino acids involved. The disulfide linkage positions shall actually contain the amino acid Cysteine at the respective positions.

property.name: subunit
property.description: This subclause refers to the description of each subunit constituting the SubstanceProtein. A subunit is a linear sequence of amino acids linked through peptide bonds. The Subunit information shall be provided when the finished SubstanceProtein is a complex of multiple sequences; subunits are not used to delineate domains within a single sequence. Subunits are listed in order of decreasing length; sequences of the same length will be ordered by decreasing molecular weight; subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated multiple times.

element.name: Subunit
element.description: This subclause refers to the description of each subunit constituting the SubstanceProtein. A subunit is a linear sequence of amino acids linked through peptide bonds. The Subunit information shall be provided when the finished SubstanceProtein is a complex of multiple sequences; subunits are not used to delineate domains within a single sequence. Subunits are listed in order of decreasing length; sequences of the same length will be ordered by decreasing molecular weight; subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated multiple times.

property.name: subunit
property.description: Index of primary sequences of amino acids linked through peptide bonds in order of decreasing length. Sequences of the same length will be ordered by molecular weight. Subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated and have sequential subscripts.

property.name: sequence
property.description: The sequence information shall be provided enumerating the amino acids from N- to C-terminal end using standard single-letter amino acid codes. Uppercase shall be used for L-amino acids and lowercase for D-amino acids. Transcribed SubstanceProteins will always be described using the translated sequence; for synthetic peptide containing amino acids that are not represented with a single letter code an X should be used within the sequence. The modified amino acids will be distinguished by their position in the sequence.

property.name: length
property.description: Length of linear sequences of amino acids contained in the subunit.

property.name: sequenceAttachment
property.description: The sequence information shall be provided enumerating the amino acids from N- to C-terminal end using standard single-letter amino acid codes. Uppercase shall be used for L-amino acids and lowercase for D-amino acids. Transcribed SubstanceProteins will always be described using the translated sequence; for synthetic peptide containing amino acids that are not represented with a single letter code an X should be used within the sequence. The modified amino acids will be distinguished by their position in the sequence.

property.name: nTerminalModificationId
property.description: Unique identifier for molecular fragment modification based on the ISO 11238 Substance ID.

property.name: nTerminalModification
property.description: The name of the fragment modified at the N-terminal of the SubstanceProtein shall be specified.

property.name: cTerminalModificationId
property.description: Unique identifier for molecular fragment modification based on the ISO 11238 Substance ID.

property.name: cTerminalModification
property.description: The modification at the C-terminal shall be specified.

resource.name: SubstanceSourceMaterial
resource.description: Source material shall capture information on the taxonomic and anatomical origins as well as the fraction of a material that can result in or can be modified to form a substance. This set of data elements shall be used to define polymer substances isolated from biological matrices. Taxonomic and anatomical origins shall be described using a controlled vocabulary as required. This information is captured for naturally derived polymers ( . starch) and structurally diverse substances. For Organisms belonging to the Kingdom Plantae the Substance level defines the fresh material of a single species or infraspecies, the Herbal Drug and the Herbal preparation. For Herbal preparations, the fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level and additional information for herbal extracts will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. See for further explanation the Substance Class: Structurally Diverse and the herbal annex.

property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: sourceMaterialClass
property.description: General high level classification of the source material specific to the origin of the material.

property.name: sourceMaterialType
property.description: The type of the source material shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For vaccines, this subclause refers to the class of infectious agent.

property.name: sourceMaterialState
property.description: The state of the source material when extracted.

property.name: organismId
property.description: The unique identifier associated with the source material parent organism shall be specified.

property.name: organismName
property.description: The organism accepted Scientific name shall be provided based on the organism taxonomy.

property.name: parentSubstanceId
property.description: The parent of the herbal drug Ginkgo biloba, Leaf is the substance ID of the substance (fresh) of Ginkgo biloba L. or Ginkgo biloba L. (Whole plant).

property.name: parentSubstanceName
property.description: The parent substance of the Herbal Drug, or Herbal preparation.

property.name: countryOfOrigin
property.description: The country where the plant material is harvested or the countries where the plasma is sourced from as laid down in accordance with the Plasma Master File. For "Plasma-derived substances" the attribute country of origin provides information about the countries used for the manufacturing of the Cryopoor plama or Crioprecipitate.

property.name: geographicalLocation
property.description: The place/region where the plant is harvested or the places/regions where the animal source material has its habitat.

property.name: developmentStage
property.description: Stage of life for animals, plants, insects and microorganisms. This information shall be provided only when the substance is significantly different in these stages (e.g. foetal bovine serum).

property.name: fractionDescription
property.description: Many complex materials are fractions of parts of plants, animals, or minerals. Fraction elements are often necessary to define both Substances and Specified Group 1 Substances. For substances derived from Plants, fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level ( . Oils, Juices and Exudates). Additional information for Extracts, such as extraction solvent composition, will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. For plasma-derived products fraction information will be captured at the Substance and the Specified Substance Group 1 levels.

property.name: organism
property.description: This subclause describes the organism which the substance is derived from. For vaccines, the parent organism shall be specified based on these subclause elements. As an example, full taxonomy will be described for the Substance Name: ., Leaf.

property.name: partDescription
property.description: To do.

element.name: FractionDescription
element.description: Many complex materials are fractions of parts of plants, animals, or minerals. Fraction elements are often necessary to define both Substances and Specified Group 1 Substances. For substances derived from Plants, fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level ( . Oils, Juices and Exudates). Additional information for Extracts, such as extraction solvent composition, will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. For plasma-derived products fraction information will be captured at the Substance and the Specified Substance Group 1 levels.

property.name: fraction
property.description: This element is capturing information about the fraction of a plant part, or human plasma for fractionation.

property.name: materialType
property.description: The specific type of the material constituting the component. For Herbal preparations the particulars of the extracts (liquid/dry) is described in Specified Substance Group 1.

element.name: Organism
element.description: This subclause describes the organism which the substance is derived from. For vaccines, the parent organism shall be specified based on these subclause elements. As an example, full taxonomy will be described for the Substance Name: ., Leaf.

property.name: family
property.description: The family of an organism shall be specified.

property.name: genus
property.description: The genus of an organism shall be specified; refers to the Latin epithet of the genus element of the plant/animal scientific name; it is present in names for genera, species and infraspecies.

property.name: species
property.description: The species of an organism shall be specified; refers to the Latin epithet of the species of the plant/animal; it is present in names for species and infraspecies.

property.name: intraspecificType
property.description: The Intraspecific type of an organism shall be specified.

property.name: intraspecificDescription
property.description: The intraspecific description of an organism shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For Influenza Vaccine, the intraspecific description shall contain the syntax of the antigen in line with the WHO convention.

property.name: author
property.description: 4.9.13.6.1 Author type (Conditional).

property.name: hybrid
property.description: 4.9.13.8.1 Hybrid species maternal organism ID (Optional).

property.name: organismGeneral
property.description: 4.9.13.7.1 Kingdom (Conditional).

element.name: PartDescription
element.description: To do.

property.name: part
property.description: Entity of anatomical origin of source material within an organism.

property.name: partLocation
property.description: The detailed anatomic location when the part can be extracted from different anatomical locations of the organism. Multiple alternative locations may apply.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifier for the supply delivery event that is used to identify it across multiple disparate systems.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.

property.name: partOf
property.description: A larger event of which this particular event is a component or step.

property.name: status
property.description: A code specifying the state of the dispense event.

property.name: patient
property.description: A link to a resource representing the person whom the delivered item is for.

property.name: type
property.description: Indicates the type of supply being provided. Examples include: Medication, Device, Biologically Derived Product.

property.name: suppliedItem
property.description: The item that is being delivered or has been supplied.

property.name: occurrence
property.description: The date or time(s) the activity occurred.

property.name: supplier
property.description: The individual or organization responsible for supplying the delivery.

property.name: destination
property.description: Identification of the facility/location where the delivery was shipped to.

property.name: receiver
property.description: Identifies the individual or organization that received the delivery.

element.name: SuppliedItem
element.description: The item that is being delivered or has been supplied.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The amount of the item that has been supplied. Unit of measure may be included.

property.name: item
property.description: Identifies the medication, substance, device or biologically derived product being supplied. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the item or a code that identifies the item from a known list.

property.name: identifier
property.description: Business identifiers assigned to this SupplyRequest by the author and/or other systems. These identifiers remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

property.name: status
property.description: Status of the supply request.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: Plan/proposal/order fulfilled by this request.

property.name: category
property.description: Category of supply, e.g. central, non-stock, etc. This is used to support work flows associated with the supply process.

property.name: priority
property.description: Indicates how quickly this SupplyRequest should be addressed with respect to other requests.

property.name: deliverFor
property.description: The patient to whom the supply will be given or for whom they will be used.

property.name: item
property.description: The item that is requested to be supplied. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the item or a code that identifies the item from a known list.

property.name: quantity
property.description: The amount that is being ordered of the indicated item.

property.name: parameter
property.description: Specific parameters for the ordered item. For example, the size of the indicated item.

property.name: occurrence
property.description: When the request should be fulfilled.

property.name: authoredOn
property.description: When the request was made.

property.name: requester
property.description: The device, practitioner, etc. who initiated the request.

property.name: supplier
property.description: Who is intended to fulfill the request.

property.name: reason
property.description: The reason why the supply item was requested.

property.name: deliverFrom
property.description: Where the supply is expected to come from.

property.name: deliverTo
property.description: Where the supply is destined to go.

element.name: Parameter
element.description: Specific parameters for the ordered item. For example, the size of the indicated item.

property.name: code
property.description: A code or string that identifies the device detail being asserted.

property.name: value
property.description: The value of the device detail.

resource.name: Task
resource.description: A task to be performed.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: The business identifier for this task.

property.name: instantiatesCanonical
property.description: The URL pointing to a *FHIR*-defined protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Task.

property.name: instantiatesUri
property.description: The URL pointing to an *externally* maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Task.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: BasedOn refers to a higher-level authorization that triggered the creation of the task. It references a "request" resource such as a ServiceRequest, MedicationRequest, CarePlan, etc. which is distinct from the "request" resource the task is seeking to fulfill. This latter resource is referenced by focus. For example, based on a CarePlan (= basedOn), a task is created to fulfill a ServiceRequest ( = focus ) to collect a specimen from a patient.

property.name: groupIdentifier
property.description: A shared identifier common to multiple independent Task and Request instances that were activated/authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author. The presence of the same identifier on each request ties those requests together and may have business ramifications in terms of reporting of results, billing, etc. E.g. a requisition number shared by a set of lab tests ordered together, or a prescription number shared by all meds ordered at one time.

property.name: partOf
property.description: Task that this particular task is part of.

property.name: status
property.description: The current status of the task.

property.name: statusReason
property.description: An explanation as to why this task is held, failed, was refused, etc.

property.name: businessStatus
property.description: Contains business-specific nuances of the business state.

property.name: intent
property.description: Indicates the "level" of actionability associated with the Task, i.e. i+R[9]Cs this a proposed task, a planned task, an actionable task, etc.

property.name: priority
property.description: Indicates how quickly the Task should be addressed with respect to other requests.

property.name: doNotPerform
property.description: If true indicates that the Task is asking for the specified action to *not* occur.

property.name: code
property.description: A name or code (or both) briefly describing what the task involves.

property.name: description
property.description: A free-text description of what is to be performed.

property.name: focus
property.description: The request being fulfilled or the resource being manipulated (changed, suspended, etc.) by this task.

property.name: for
property.description: The entity who benefits from the performance of the service specified in the task (e.g., the patient).

property.name: encounter
property.description: The healthcare event (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this task was created.

property.name: requestedPeriod
property.description: Indicates the start and/or end of the period of time when completion of the task is desired to take place.

property.name: executionPeriod
property.description: Identifies the time action was first taken against the task (start) and/or the time final action was taken against the task prior to marking it as completed (end).

property.name: authoredOn
property.description: The date and time this task was created.

property.name: lastModified
property.description: The date and time of last modification to this task.

property.name: requester
property.description: The creator of the task.

property.name: requestedPerformer
property.description: The kind of participant or specific participant that should perform the task.

property.name: owner
property.description: Party responsible for managing task execution.

property.name: performer
property.description: The entity who performed the requested task.

property.name: location
property.description: Principal physical location where this task is performed.

property.name: reason
property.description: A description, code, or reference indicating why this task needs to be performed.

property.name: insurance
property.description: Insurance plans, coverage extensions, pre-authorizations and/or pre-determinations that may be relevant to the Task.

property.name: note
property.description: Free-text information captured about the task as it progresses.

property.name: relevantHistory
property.description: Links to Provenance records for past versions of this Task that identify key state transitions or updates that are likely to be relevant to a user looking at the current version of the task.

property.name: restriction
property.description: If the Task.focus is a request resource and the task is seeking fulfillment (i.e. is asking for the request to be actioned), this element identifies any limitations on what parts of the referenced request should be actioned.

property.name: input
property.description: Additional information that may be needed in the execution of the task.

property.name: output
property.description: Outputs produced by the Task.

element.name: Performer
element.description: The entity who performed the requested task.

property.name: function
property.description: A code or description of the performer of the task.

property.name: actor
property.description: The actor or entity who performed the task.

element.name: Restriction
element.description: If the Task.focus is a request resource and the task is seeking fulfillment (i.e. is asking for the request to be actioned), this element identifies any limitations on what parts of the referenced request should be actioned.

property.name: repetitions
property.description: Indicates the number of times the requested action should occur.

property.name: period
property.description: The time-period for which fulfillment is sought. This must fall within the overall time period authorized in the referenced request. E.g. ServiceRequest.occurance[x].

property.name: recipient
property.description: For requests that are targeted to more than one potential recipient/target, to identify who is fulfillment is sought for.

element.name: Input
element.description: Additional information that may be needed in the execution of the task.

property.name: type
property.description: A code or description indicating how the input is intended to be used as part of the task execution.

property.name: value
property.description: The value of the input parameter as a basic type.

element.name: Output
element.description: Outputs produced by the Task.

property.name: type
property.description: The name of the Output parameter.

property.name: value
property.description: The value of the Output parameter as a basic type.

resource.name: TerminologyCapabilities
resource.description: A TerminologyCapabilities resource documents a set of capabilities (behaviors) of a FHIR Terminology Server that may be used as a statement of actual server functionality or a statement of required or desired server implementation.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta

property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this terminology capabilities when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this terminology capabilities is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the terminology capabilities is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this terminology capabilities when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the terminology capabilities when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the terminology capabilities author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the terminology capabilities. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the terminology capabilities.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this terminology capabilities. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this terminology capabilities is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the terminology capabilities was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the terminology capabilities changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the terminology capabilities.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the terminology capabilities from a consumer's perspective. Typically, this is used when the capability statement describes a desired rather than an actual solution, for example as a formal expression of requirements as part of an RFP.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate terminology capabilities instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the terminology capabilities is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this terminology capabilities is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the terminology capabilities and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the terminology capabilities.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: kind
property.description: The way that this statement is intended to be used, to describe an actual running instance of software, a particular product (kind, not instance of software) or a class of implementation (e.g. a desired purchase).

property.name: software
property.description: Software that is covered by this terminology capability statement. It is used when the statement describes the capabilities of a particular software version, independent of an installation.

property.name: implementation
property.description: Identifies a specific implementation instance that is described by the terminology capability statement - i.e. a particular installation, rather than the capabilities of a software program.

property.name: lockedDate
property.description: Whether the server supports lockedDate.

property.name: codeSystem
property.description: Identifies a code system that is supported by the server. If there is a no code system URL, then this declares the general assumptions a client can make about support for any CodeSystem resource.

property.name: expansion
property.description: Information about the [ValueSet/$expand](valueset-operation-expand.html) operation.

property.name: codeSearch
property.description: The degree to which the server supports the code search parameter on ValueSet, if it is supported.

property.name: validateCode
property.description: Information about the [ValueSet/$validate-code](valueset-operation-validate-code.html) operation.

property.name: translation
property.description: Information about the [ConceptMap/$translate](conceptmap-operation-translate.html) operation.

property.name: closure
property.description: Whether the $closure operation is supported.

element.name: Software
element.description: Software that is covered by this terminology capability statement. It is used when the statement describes the capabilities of a particular software version, independent of an installation.

property.name: name
property.description: Name the software is known by.

property.name: version
property.description: The version identifier for the software covered by this statement.

element.name: Implementation
element.description: Identifies a specific implementation instance that is described by the terminology capability statement - i.e. a particular installation, rather than the capabilities of a software program.

property.name: description
property.description: Information about the specific installation that this terminology capability statement relates to.

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute base URL for the implementation.

element.name: CodeSystem
element.description: Identifies a code system that is supported by the server. If there is a no code system URL, then this declares the general assumptions a client can make about support for any CodeSystem resource.

property.name: uri
property.description: Canonical identifier for the code system, represented as a URI.

property.name: version
property.description: For the code system, a list of versions that are supported by the server.

property.name: content
property.description: The extent of the content of the code system (the concepts and codes it defines) are represented in this resource instance.

property.name: subsumption
property.description: True if subsumption is supported for this version of the code system.

element.name: Expansion
element.description: Information about the [ValueSet/$expand](valueset-operation-expand.html) operation.

property.name: hierarchical
property.description: Whether the server can return nested value sets.

property.name: paging
property.description: Whether the server supports paging on expansion.

property.name: incomplete
property.description: True if requests for incomplete expansions are allowed.

property.name: parameter
property.description: Supported expansion parameter.

property.name: textFilter
property.description: Documentation about text searching works.

element.name: ValidateCode
element.description: Information about the [ValueSet/$validate-code](valueset-operation-validate-code.html) operation.

property.name: translations
property.description: Whether translations are validated.

element.name: Translation
element.description: Information about the [ConceptMap/$translate](conceptmap-operation-translate.html) operation.

property.name: needsMap
property.description: Whether the client must identify the map.

element.name: Closure
element.description: Whether the $closure operation is supported.

property.name: translation
property.description: If cross-system closure is supported.

property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this test plan when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the test plan.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this test plan. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this test plan is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the test plan was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the test plan changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the test plan.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the test plan from a consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext

These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate test plan instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the test plan is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this test plan is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the test plan and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the test plan. The short copyright declaration (e.g. (c) '2015+ xyz organization' should be sent in the copyrightLabel element.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: category
property.description: The category of the Test Plan - can be acceptance, unit, performance, etc.

property.name: scope
property.description: What is being tested with this Test Plan - a conformance resource, or narrative criteria, or an external reference...

property.name: testTools
property.description: A description of test tools to be used in the test plan.

property.name: dependency
property.description: The required criteria to execute the test plan - e.g. preconditions, previous tests...

property.name: exitCriteria
property.description: The threshold or criteria for the test plan to be considered successfully executed - narrative.

property.name: testCase
property.description: The individual test cases that are part of this plan, when they they are made explicit.

element.name: Dependency
element.description: The required criteria to execute the test plan - e.g. preconditions, previous tests...

property.name: description
property.description: A textual description of the criterium - what is needed for the dependency to be considered met.

property.name: predecessor
property.description: Predecessor test plans - those that are expected to be successfully performed as a dependency for the execution of this test plan.

element.name: TestCase
element.description: The individual test cases that are part of this plan, when they they are made explicit.

property.name: sequence
property.description: Sequence of test case - an ordinal number that indicates the order for the present test case in the test plan.

property.name: scope
property.description: The scope or artifact covered by the case, when the individual test case is associated with a testable artifact.

property.name: dependency
property.description: The required criteria to execute the test case - e.g. preconditions, previous tests.

property.name: testRun
property.description: The actual test to be executed.

property.name: testData
property.description: The test data used in the test case.

property.name: assertion
property.description: The test assertions - the expectations of test results from the execution of the test case.
