property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifier for the TestReport assigned for external purposes outside the context of FHIR.

property.name: name
property.description: A free text natural language name identifying the executed TestReport.

property.name: status
property.description: The current state of this test report.

property.name: testScript
property.description: Ideally this is an absolute URL that is used to identify the version-specific TestScript that was executed, matching the `TestScript.url`.

property.name: result
property.description: The overall result from the execution of the TestScript.

property.name: score
property.description: The final score (percentage of tests passed) resulting from the execution of the TestScript.

property.name: tester
property.description: Name of the tester producing this report (Organization or individual).

property.name: issued
property.description: When the TestScript was executed and this TestReport was generated.

property.name: participant
property.description: A participant in the test execution, either the execution engine, a client, or a server.

property.name: setup
property.description: The results of the series of required setup operations before the tests were executed.

property.name: test
property.description: A test executed from the test script.

property.name: teardown
property.description: The results of the series of operations required to clean up after all the tests were executed (successfully or otherwise).

element.name: Participant
element.description: A participant in the test execution, either the execution engine, a client, or a server.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of participant.

property.name: uri
property.description: The uri of the participant. An absolute URL is preferred.

property.name: display
property.description: The display name of the participant.

element.name: Setup
element.description: The results of the series of required setup operations before the tests were executed.

property.name: action
property.description: Action would contain either an operation or an assertion.

element.name: Test
element.description: A test executed from the test script.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of this test used for tracking/logging purposes by test engines.

property.name: description
property.description: A short description of the test used by test engines for tracking and reporting purposes.

property.name: action
property.description: Action would contain either an operation or an assertion.

element.name: Teardown
element.description: The results of the series of operations required to clean up after all the tests were executed (successfully or otherwise).

property.name: action
property.description: The teardown action will only contain an operation.

resource.name: TestScript
resource.description: A structured set of tests against a FHIR server or client implementation to determine compliance against the FHIR specification.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta

property.name: language

The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this test script when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this test script is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the test script is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this test script when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the test script when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the test script author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the test script. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the test script.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this test script. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this test script is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the test script was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the test script changes.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the test script.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the test script from a consumer's perspective.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate test script instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the test script is intended to be used.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this test script is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the test script and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the test script.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: origin
property.description: An abstract server used in operations within this test script in the origin element.

property.name: destination
property.description: An abstract server used in operations within this test script in the destination element.

property.name: metadata
property.description: The required capability must exist and are assumed to function correctly on the FHIR server being tested.

property.name: scope
property.description: The scope indicates a conformance artifact that is tested by the test(s) within this test case and the expectation of the test outcome(s) as well as the intended test phase inclusion.

property.name: fixture
property.description: Fixture in the test script - by reference (uri). All fixtures are required for the test script to execute.

property.name: profile
property.description: Reference to the profile to be used for validation.

property.name: variable
property.description: Variable is set based either on element value in response body or on header field value in the response headers.

property.name: setup
property.description: A series of required setup operations before tests are executed.

property.name: test
property.description: A test in this script.

property.name: teardown
property.description: A series of operations required to clean up after all the tests are executed (successfully or otherwise).

element.name: Origin
element.description: An abstract server used in operations within this test script in the origin element.

property.name: index
property.description: Abstract name given to an origin server in this test script. The name is provided as a number starting at 1.

property.name: profile
property.description: The type of origin profile the test system supports.

property.name: url
property.description: The explicit url path of the origin server used in this test script.

element.name: Destination
element.description: An abstract server used in operations within this test script in the destination element.

property.name: index
property.description: Abstract name given to a destination server in this test script. The name is provided as a number starting at 1.

property.name: profile
property.description: The type of destination profile the test system supports.

property.name: url
property.description: The explicit url path of the destination server used in this test script.

element.name: Metadata
element.description: The required capability must exist and are assumed to function correctly on the FHIR server being tested.

property.name: link
property.description: A link to the FHIR specification that this test is covering.

property.name: capability
property.description: Capabilities that must exist and are assumed to function correctly on the FHIR server being tested.

element.name: Scope
element.description: The scope indicates a conformance artifact that is tested by the test(s) within this test case and the expectation of the test outcome(s) as well as the intended test phase inclusion.

property.name: artifact
property.description: The specific conformance artifact being tested. The canonical reference can be version-specific.

property.name: conformance
property.description: The expectation of whether the test must pass for the system to be considered conformant with the artifact: required - all tests are expected to pass, optional - all test are expected to pass but non-pass status may be allowed, strict - all tests are expected to pass and warnings are treated as a failure.

property.name: phase
property.description: The phase of testing for this artifact: unit - development / implementation phase, integration - internal system to system phase, production - live system to system phase (Note, this may involve pii/phi data).

element.name: Fixture
element.description: Fixture in the test script - by reference (uri). All fixtures are required for the test script to execute.

property.name: autocreate
property.description: Whether or not to implicitly create the fixture during setup. If true, the fixture is automatically created on each server being tested during setup, therefore no create operation is required for this fixture in the TestScript.setup section.

property.name: autodelete
property.description: Whether or not to implicitly delete the fixture during teardown. If true, the fixture is automatically deleted on each server being tested during teardown, therefore no delete operation is required for this fixture in the TestScript.teardown section.

property.name: resource
property.description: Reference to the resource (containing the contents of the resource needed for operations). This is allowed to be a Parameters resource.

element.name: Variable
element.description: Variable is set based either on element value in response body or on header field value in the response headers.

property.name: name
property.description: Descriptive name for this variable.

property.name: defaultValue
property.description: A default, hard-coded, or user-defined value for this variable.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the variable and its purpose.

property.name: expression
property.description: The FHIRPath expression for a specific value to evaluate against the fixture body. When variables are defined, only one of either expression, headerField or path must be specified.

property.name: headerField
property.description: Will be used to grab the HTTP header field value from the headers that sourceId is pointing to.

property.name: hint
property.description: Displayable text string with hint help information to the user when entering a default value.

property.name: path
property.description: XPath or JSONPath to evaluate against the fixture body. When variables are defined, only one of either expression, headerField or path must be specified.

property.name: sourceId
property.description: Fixture to evaluate the XPath/JSONPath expression or the headerField against within this variable.

element.name: Setup
element.description: A series of required setup operations before tests are executed.

property.name: action
property.description: Action would contain either an operation or an assertion.

element.name: Test
element.description: A test in this script.

property.name: name
property.description: The name of this test used for tracking/logging purposes by test engines.

property.name: description
property.description: A short description of the test used by test engines for tracking and reporting purposes.

property.name: action
property.description: Action would contain either an operation or an assertion.

element.name: Teardown
element.description: A series of operations required to clean up after all the tests are executed (successfully or otherwise).

property.name: action
property.description: The teardown action will only contain an operation.

resource.name: Transport
resource.description: Record of transport.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.name: contained
property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: identifier
property.description: Identifier for the transport event that is used to identify it across multiple disparate systems.

property.name: instantiatesCanonical
property.description: The URL pointing to a *FHIR*-defined protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Transport.

property.name: instantiatesUri
property.description: The URL pointing to an *externally* maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Transport.

property.name: basedOn
property.description: BasedOn refers to a higher-level authorization that triggered the creation of the transport. It references a "request" resource such as a ServiceRequest or Transport, which is distinct from the "request" resource the Transport is seeking to fulfill. This latter resource is referenced by FocusOn. For example, based on a ServiceRequest (= BasedOn), a transport is created to fulfill a procedureRequest ( = FocusOn ) to transport a specimen to the lab.

property.name: groupIdentifier
property.description: A shared identifier common to multiple independent Request instances that were activated/authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author. The presence of the same identifier on each request ties those requests together and may have business ramifications in terms of reporting of results, billing, etc. E.g. a requisition number shared by a set of lab tests ordered together, or a prescription number shared by all meds ordered at one time.

property.name: partOf
property.description: A larger event of which this particular event is a component or step.

property.name: status
property.description: A code specifying the state of the transport event.

property.name: statusReason
property.description: An explanation as to why this transport is held, failed, was refused, etc.

property.name: intent
property.description: Indicates the "level" of actionability associated with the Transport, i.e. i+R[9]Cs this a proposed transport, a planned transport, an actionable transport, etc.

property.name: priority
property.description: Indicates how quickly the Transport should be addressed with respect to other requests.

property.name: code
property.description: A name or code (or both) briefly describing what the transport involves.

property.name: description
property.description: A free-text description of what is to be performed.

property.name: focus
property.description: The request being actioned or the resource being manipulated by this transport.

property.name: for
property.description: The entity who benefits from the performance of the service specified in the transport (e.g., the patient).

property.name: encounter
property.description: The healthcare event (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this transport was created.

property.name: completionTime
property.description: Identifies the completion time of the event (the occurrence).

property.name: authoredOn
property.description: The date and time this transport was created.

property.name: lastModified
property.description: The date and time of last modification to this transport.

property.name: requester
property.description: The creator of the transport.

property.name: performerType
property.description: The kind of participant that should perform the transport.

property.name: owner
property.description: Individual organization or Device currently responsible for transport execution.

property.name: location
property.description: Principal physical location where this transport is performed.

property.name: insurance
property.description: Insurance plans, coverage extensions, pre-authorizations and/or pre-determinations that may be relevant to the Transport.

property.name: note
property.description: Free-text information captured about the transport as it progresses.

property.name: relevantHistory
property.description: Links to Provenance records for past versions of this Transport that identify key state transitions or updates that are likely to be relevant to a user looking at the current version of the transport.

property.name: restriction
property.description: If the Transport.focus is a request resource and the transport is seeking fulfillment (i.e. is asking for the request to be actioned), this element identifies any limitations on what parts of the referenced request should be actioned.

property.name: input
property.description: Additional information that may be needed in the execution of the transport.

property.name: output
property.description: Outputs produced by the Transport.

property.name: requestedLocation
property.description: The desired or final location for the transport.

property.name: currentLocation
property.description: The current location for the entity to be transported.

property.name: reason
property.description: A resource reference indicating why this transport needs to be performed.

property.name: history
property.description: The transport event prior to this one.

element.name: Restriction
element.description: If the Transport.focus is a request resource and the transport is seeking fulfillment (i.e. is asking for the request to be actioned), this element identifies any limitations on what parts of the referenced request should be actioned.

property.name: repetitions
property.description: Indicates the number of times the requested action should occur.

property.name: period
property.description: Over what time-period is fulfillment sought.

property.name: recipient
property.description: For requests that are targeted to more than one potential recipient/target, to identify who is fulfillment is sought for.

element.name: Input
element.description: Additional information that may be needed in the execution of the transport.

property.name: type
property.description: A code or description indicating how the input is intended to be used as part of the transport execution.

property.name: value
property.description: The value of the input parameter as a basic type.

element.name: Output
element.description: Outputs produced by the Transport.

property.name: type
property.description: The name of the Output parameter.

property.name: value
property.description: The value of the Output parameter as a basic type.

resource.name: ValueSet
resource.description: A ValueSet resource instance specifies a set of codes drawn from one or more code systems, intended for use in a particular context. Value sets link between [[[CodeSystem]]] definitions and their use in [coded elements](terminologies.html).

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: implicitRules
property.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

property.name: language
property.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

property.name: text
property.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

property.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.

Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: url
property.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this value set when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this value set is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the value set is stored on different servers.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this value set when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

property.name: version
property.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the value set when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the value set author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

property.name: versionAlgorithm
property.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which ValueSet is more current.

property.name: name
property.description: A natural language name identifying the value set. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

property.name: title
property.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the value set.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of this value set. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content. The status of the value set applies to the value set definition (ValueSet.compose) and the associated ValueSet metadata. Expansions do not have a state.

property.name: experimental
property.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this value set is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

property.name: date
property.description: The date (and optionally time) when the value set metadata or content logical definition (.compose) was created or revised.

property.name: publisher
property.description: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the value set.

property.name: contact
property.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

property.name: description
property.description: A free text natural language description of the value set from a consumer's perspective. The textual description specifies the span of meanings for concepts to be included within the Value Set Expansion, and also may specify the intended use and limitations of the Value Set.

property.name: useContext
property.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate value set instances.

property.name: jurisdiction
property.description: A legal or geographic region in which the value set is intended to be used.

property.name: immutable
property.description: If this is set to 'true', then no new versions of the content logical definition can be created. Note: Other metadata might still change.

property.name: purpose
property.description: Explanation of why this value set is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

property.name: copyright
property.description: A copyright statement relating to the value set and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the value set.

property.name: copyrightLabel
property.description: A short string (<50 characters), suitable for inclusion in a page footer that identifies the copyright holder, effective period, and optionally whether rights are resctricted. (e.g. 'All rights reserved', 'Some rights reserved').

property.name: approvalDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

property.name: lastReviewDate
property.description: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.

property.name: effectivePeriod
property.description: The period during which the ValueSet content was or is planned to be in active use.

property.name: topic
property.description: Descriptions related to the content of the ValueSet. Topics provide a high-level categorization as well as keywords for the ValueSet that can be useful for filtering and searching.

property.name: author
property.description: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the ValueSet.

property.name: editor
property.description: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the ValueSet.

property.name: reviewer
property.description: An individual or organization asserted by the publisher to be primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the ValueSet.

property.name: endorser
property.description: An individual or organization asserted by the publisher to be responsible for officially endorsing the ValueSet for use in some setting.

property.name: relatedArtifact
property.description: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, dependencies, bibliographic references, and predecessor and successor artifacts.

property.name: compose
property.description: A set of criteria that define the contents of the value set by including or excluding codes selected from the specified code system(s) that the value set draws from. This is also known as the Content Logical Definition (CLD).

property.name: expansion
property.description: A value set can also be "expanded", where the value set is turned into a simple collection of enumerated codes. This element holds the expansion, if it has been performed.

property.name: scope
property.description: Description of the semantic space the Value Set Expansion is intended to cover and should further clarify the text in ValueSet.description.

element.name: Compose
element.description: A set of criteria that define the contents of the value set by including or excluding codes selected from the specified code system(s) that the value set draws from. This is also known as the Content Logical Definition (CLD).

property.name: lockedDate
property.description: The Locked Date is the effective date that is used to determine the version of all referenced Code Systems and Value Set Definitions included in the compose that are not already tied to a specific version.

property.name: inactive
property.description: Whether inactive codes - codes that are not approved for current use - are in the value set. If inactive = true, inactive codes are to be included in the expansion, if inactive = false, the inactive codes will not be included in the expansion. If absent, the behavior is determined by the implementation, or by the applicable $expand parameters (but generally, inactive codes would be expected to be included).

property.name: include
property.description: Include one or more codes from a code system or other value set(s).

property.name: exclude
property.description: Exclude one or more codes from the value set based on code system filters and/or other value sets.

property.name: property
property.description: A property to return in the expansion, if the client doesn't ask for any particular properties. May be either a code from the code system definition (convenient) or a the formal URI that refers to the property. The special value '*' means all properties known to the server.

element.name: Expansion
element.description: A value set can also be "expanded", where the value set is turned into a simple collection of enumerated codes. This element holds the expansion, if it has been performed.

property.name: identifier
property.description: An identifier that uniquely identifies this expansion of the valueset, based on a unique combination of the provided parameters, the system default parameters, and the underlying system code system versions etc. Systems may re-use the same identifier as long as those factors remain the same, and the expansion is the same, but are not required to do so. This is a business identifier.

property.name: next
property.description: As per paging Search results, the next URLs are opaque to the client, have no dictated structure, and only the server understands them.

property.name: timestamp
property.description: The time at which the expansion was produced by the expanding system.

property.name: total
property.description: The total number of concepts in the expansion. If the number of concept nodes in this resource is less than the stated number, then the server can return more using the offset parameter.

property.name: offset
property.description: If paging is being used, the offset at which this resource starts. I.e. this resource is a partial view into the expansion. If paging is not being used, this element SHALL NOT be present.

property.name: parameter
property.description: A parameter that controlled the expansion process. These parameters may be used by users of expanded value sets to check whether the expansion is suitable for a particular purpose, or to pick the correct expansion.

property.name: property
property.description: A property defines an additional slot through which additional information can be provided about a concept.

property.name: contains
property.description: The codes that are contained in the value set expansion.

element.name: Scope
element.description: Description of the semantic space the Value Set Expansion is intended to cover and should further clarify the text in ValueSet.description.

property.name: inclusionCriteria
property.description: Criteria describing which concepts or codes should be included and why.

property.name: exclusionCriteria
property.description: Criteria describing which concepts or codes should be excluded and why.

resource.name: VerificationResult
resource.description: Describes validation requirements, source(s), status and dates for one or more elements.

property.name: id
property.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

property.name: meta
property.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

property.name: identifier
property.description: A unique identifier assigned to this vision prescription.

property.name: status
property.description: The status of the resource instance.

property.name: created
property.description: The date this resource was created.

property.name: patient
property.description: A resource reference to the person to whom the vision prescription applies.

property.name: encounter
property.description: A reference to a resource that identifies the particular occurrence of contact between patient and health care provider during which the prescription was issued.

property.name: dateWritten
property.description: The date (and perhaps time) when the prescription was written.

property.name: prescriber
property.description: The healthcare professional responsible for authorizing the prescription.

property.name: lensSpecification
property.description: Contain the details of the individual lens specifications and serves as the authorization for the fullfillment by certified professionals.

element.name: LensSpecification
element.description: Contain the details of the individual lens specifications and serves as the authorization for the fullfillment by certified professionals.

property.name: product
property.description: Identifies the type of vision correction product which is required for the patient.

property.name: eye
property.description: The eye for which the lens specification applies.

property.name: sphere
property.description: Lens power measured in dioptres (0.25 units).

property.name: cylinder
property.description: Power adjustment for astigmatism measured in dioptres (0.25 units).

property.name: axis
property.description: Adjustment for astigmatism measured in integer degrees.

property.name: prism
property.description: Allows for adjustment on two axis.

property.name: add
property.description: Power adjustment for multifocal lenses measured in dioptres (0.25 units).

property.name: power
property.description: Contact lens power measured in dioptres (0.25 units).

property.name: backCurve
property.description: Back curvature measured in millimetres.

property.name: diameter
property.description: Contact lens diameter measured in millimetres.

property.name: duration
property.description: The recommended maximum wear period for the lens.

property.name: color
property.description: Special color or pattern.

property.name: brand
property.description: Brand recommendations or restrictions.

property.name: note
property.description: Notes for special requirements such as coatings and lens materials.

element.name: Address
element.description: Address Type: An address expressed using postal conventions (as opposed to GPS or other location definition formats). This data type may be used to convey addresses for use in delivering mail as well as for visiting locations which might not be valid for mail delivery. There are a variety of postal address formats defined around the world. The ISO21090-codedString may be used to provide a coded representation of the contents of strings in an Address.

property.description: The purpose of this address.

property.name: type
property.description: Distinguishes between physical addresses (those you can visit) and mailing addresses (e.g. PO Boxes and care-of addresses). Most addresses are both.

property.name: text
property.description: Specifies the entire address as it should be displayed e.g. on a postal label. This may be provided instead of or as well as the specific parts.

property.name: line
property.description: This component contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction, P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information.

property.name: city
property.description: The name of the city, town, suburb, village or other community or delivery center.

property.name: district

property.description: Sub-unit of a country with limited sovereignty in a federally organized country. A code may be used if codes are in common use (e.g. US 2 letter state codes).

property.description: A postal code designating a region defined by the postal service.

property.name: country
property.description: Country - a nation as commonly understood or generally accepted.

property.name: period
property.description: Time period when address was/is in use.

property.description: Free text dosage instructions e.g. SIG.

property.name: additionalInstruction
property.description: Supplemental instructions to the patient on how to take the medication (e.g. "with meals" or"take half to one hour before food") or warnings for the patient about the medication (e.g. "may cause drowsiness" or "avoid exposure of skin to direct sunlight or sunlamps").

property.name: patientInstruction
property.description: Instructions in terms that are understood by the patient or consumer.

property.name: timing
property.description: When medication should be administered.

property.name: asNeeded
property.description: Indicates whether the Medication is only taken when needed within a specific dosing schedule (Boolean option).

property.name: asNeededFor
property.description: Indicates whether the Medication is only taken based on a precondition for taking the Medication (CodeableConcept).

property.name: site
property.description: Body site to administer to.

property.name: route
property.description: How drug should enter body.

property.name: method
property.description: Technique for administering medication.

property.name: doseAndRate
property.description: Depending on the resource,this is the amount of medication administered, to be administered or typical amount to be administered.

property.name: maxDosePerPeriod
property.description: Upper limit on medication per unit of time.

property.name: maxDosePerAdministration
property.description: Upper limit on medication per administration.

property.name: maxDosePerLifetime
property.description: Upper limit on medication per lifetime of the patient.

property.description: Where a Medicines Regulatory Agency has granted a marketing authorization for which specific provisions within a jurisdiction apply, the jurisdiction can be specified using an appropriate controlled terminology The controlled term and the controlled term identifier shall be specified.

property.name: status
property.description: This attribute provides information on the status of the marketing of the medicinal product See ISO/TS 20443 for more information and examples.

property.name: dateRange
property.description: The date when the Medicinal Product is placed on the market by the Marketing Authorization Holder (or where applicable, the manufacturer/distributor) in a country and/or jurisdiction shall be provided A complete date consisting of day, month and year shall be specified using the ISO 8601 date format NOTE "Placed on the market" refers to the release of the Medicinal Product into the distribution chain.

property.name: restoreDate
property.description: The date when the Medicinal Product is placed on the market by the Marketing Authorization Holder (or where applicable, the manufacturer/distributor) in a country and/or jurisdiction shall be provided A complete date consisting of day, month and year shall be specified using the ISO 8601 date format NOTE "Placed on the market" refers to the release of the Medicinal Product into the distribution chain.

property.name: reference
property.description: A reference to a location at which the other resource is found. The reference may be a relative reference, in which case it is relative to the service base URL, or an absolute URL that resolves to the location where the resource is found. The reference may be version specific or not. If the reference is not to a FHIR RESTful server, then it should be assumed to be version specific. Internal fragment references (start with '#') refer to contained resources.

property.name: type
property.description: The expected type of the target of the reference. If both Reference.type and Reference.reference are populated and Reference.reference is a FHIR URL, both SHALL be consistent. The type is the Canonical URL of Resource Definition that is the type this reference refers to. References are URLs that are relative to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ e.g. "Patient" is a reference to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Patient. Absolute URLs are only allowed for logical models (and can only be used in references in logical models, not resources).

property.name: identifier
property.description: An identifier for the target resource. This is used when there is no way to reference the other resource directly, either because the entity it represents is not available through a FHIR server, or because there is no way for the author of the resource to convert a known identifier to an actual location. There is no requirement that a Reference.identifier point to something that is actually exposed as a FHIR instance, but it SHALL point to a business concept that would be expected to be exposed as a FHIR instance, and that instance would need to be of a FHIR resource type allowed by the reference.

property.name: display
property.description: Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

property.name: classifier
property.description: Provides additional classifiers of the related artifact.

property.name: label
property.description: A short label that can be used to reference the citation from elsewhere in the containing artifact, such as a footnote index.

property.name: display
property.description: A brief description of the document or knowledge resource being referenced, suitable for display to a consumer.

property.name: citation
property.description: A bibliographic citation for the related artifact. This text SHOULD be formatted according to an accepted citation format.

property.name: document
property.description: The document being referenced, represented as an attachment. This is exclusive with the resource element.

property.name: resource
property.description: The related artifact, such as a library, value set, profile, or other knowledge resource.

property.name: resourceReference
