element.name: SampledData
element.description: SampledData Type: A series of measurements taken by a device, with upper and lower limits. There may be more than one dimension in the data.

property.name: id
property.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: origin
property.description: The base quantity that a measured value of zero represents. In addition, this provides the units of the entire measurement series.

property.name: interval
property.description: Amount of intervalUnits between samples, e.g. milliseconds for time-based sampling.

property.name: intervalUnit
property.description: The measurement unit in which the sample interval is expressed.

property.name: factor
property.description: A correction factor that is applied to the sampled data points before they are added to the origin.

property.name: lowerLimit
property.description: The lower limit of detection of the measured points. This is needed if any of the data points have the value "L" (lower than detection limit).

property.name: upperLimit
property.description: The upper limit of detection of the measured points. This is needed if any of the data points have the value "U" (higher than detection limit).

property.name: dimensions
property.description: The number of sample points at each time point. If this value is greater than one, then the dimensions will be interlaced - all the sample points for a point in time will be recorded at once.

property.name: codeMap
property.description: Reference to ConceptMap that defines the codes used in the data.

property.name: offsets
property.description: A series of data points which are decimal values separated by a single space (character u20). The units in which the offsets are expressed are found in intervalUnit. The absolute point at which the measurements begin SHALL be conveyed outside the scope of this datatype, e.g. Observation.effectiveDateTime for a timing offset.

property.name: data
property.description: A series of data points which are decimal values or codes separated by a single space (character u20). The special codes "E" (error), "L" (below detection limit) and "U" (above detection limit) are also defined for used in place of decimal values.

element.name: Signature
element.description: Signature Type: A signature along with supporting context. The signature may be a digital signature that is cryptographic in nature, or some other signature acceptable to the domain. This other signature may be as simple as a graphical image representing a hand-written signature, or a signature ceremony Different signature approaches have different utilities.

property.name: id
property.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: type
property.description: An indication of the reason that the entity signed this document. This may be explicitly included as part of the signature information and can be used when determining accountability for various actions concerning the document.

property.name: when
property.description: When the digital signature was signed.

property.name: who
property.description: A reference to an application-usable description of the identity that signed (e.g. the signature used their private key).

property.name: onBehalfOf
property.description: A reference to an application-usable description of the identity that is represented by the signature.

property.name: targetFormat
property.description: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the target resources signed by the signature.

property.name: sigFormat
property.description: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the signature. Important mime types are application/signature+xml for X ML DigSig, application/jose for JWS, and image/* for a graphical image of a signature, etc.

property.name: data
property.description: The base64 encoding of the Signature content. When signature is not recorded electronically this element would be empty.

element.name: Timing
element.description: Timing Type: Specifies an event that may occur multiple times. Timing schedules are used to record when things are planned, expected or requested to occur. The most common usage is in dosage instructions for medications. They are also used when planning care of various kinds, and may be used for reporting the schedule to which past regular activities were carried out.

property.name: id
property.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: modifierExtension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions. Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

property.name: event
property.description: Identifies specific times when the event occurs.

property.name: repeat
property.description: A set of rules that describe when the event is scheduled.

property.name: code
property.description: A code for the timing schedule (or just text in code.text). Some codes such as BID are ubiquitous, but many institutions define their own additional codes. If a code is provided, the code is understood to be a complete statement of whatever is specified in the structured timing data, and either the code or the data may be used to interpret the Timing, with the exception that .repeat.bounds still applies over the code (and is not contained in the code).

element.name: TriggerDefinition
element.description: TriggerDefinition Type: A description of a triggering event. Triggering events can be named events, data events, or periodic, as determined by the type element.

property.name: id
property.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of triggering event.

property.name: name
property.description: A formal name for the event. This may be an absolute URI that identifies the event formally (e.g. from a trigger registry), or a simple relative URI that identifies the event in a local context.

property.name: code
property.description: A code that identifies the event.

property.name: subscriptionTopic
property.description: A reference to a SubscriptionTopic resource that defines the event. If this element is provided, no other information about the trigger definition may be supplied.

property.name: timing
property.description: The timing of the event (if this is a periodic trigger).

property.name: data
property.description: The triggering data of the event (if this is a data trigger). If more than one data is requirement is specified, then all the data requirements must be true.

property.name: condition
property.description: A boolean-valued expression that is evaluated in the context of the container of the trigger definition and returns whether or not the trigger fires.

element.name: UsageContext
element.description: UsageContext Type: Specifies clinical/business/etc. metadata that can be used to retrieve, index and/or categorize an artifact. This metadata can either be specific to the applicable population (e.g., age category, DRG) or the specific context of care (e.g., venue, care setting, provider of care).

property.name: id
property.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: code
property.description: A code that identifies the type of context being specified by this usage context.

property.name: value
property.description: A value that defines the context specified in this context of use. The interpretation of the value is defined by the code.

element.name: VirtualServiceDetail
element.description: VirtualServiceDetail Type: Virtual Service Contact Details.

property.name: id
property.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

property.name: extension
property.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

property.name: channelType
property.description: The type of virtual service to connect to (i.e. Teams, Zoom, Specific VMR technology, WhatsApp).

property.name: address
property.description: What address or number needs to be used for a user to connect to the virtual service to join. The channelType informs as to which datatype is appropriate to use (requires knowledge of the specific type).

property.name: additionalInfo
property.description: Address to see alternative connection details.

property.name: maxParticipants
property.description: Maximum number of participants supported by the virtual service.

property.name: sessionKey
property.description: Session Key required by the virtual service.

codeset.name: DeviceUsageStatus
codeset.description: A coded concept indicating the current status of the Device Usage.

code.name: Active
code.description: The device is still being used.

code.name: Completed
code.description: The device is no longer being used.

code.name: Intended
code.description: The device may be used at some time in the future.

code.name: Stopped
code.description: Actions implied by the statement have been permanently halted, before all of them occurred.

code.name: On Hold
code.description: Actions implied by the statement have been temporarily halted, but are expected to continue later. May also be called "suspended".

codeset.name: SlicingRules
codeset.description: How slices are interpreted when evaluating an instance.

code.name: Closed
code.description: No additional content is allowed other than that described by the slices in this profile.

code.name: Open
code.description: Additional content is allowed anywhere in the list.

code.name: Open at End
code.description: Additional content is allowed, but only at the end of the list. Note that using this requires that the slices be ordered, which makes it hard to share uses. This should only be done where absolutely required.

codeset.name: RestfulCapabilityMode
codeset.description: The mode of a RESTful capability statement.

code.name: Client
code.description: The application acts as a client for this resource.

code.name: Server
code.description: The application acts as a server for this resource.

codeset.name: PackageMaterial
codeset.description: A material used in the construction of packages and their components.

code.name: Non-plasticised PolyVinyl Chloride / Unplasticised PolyVinyl Chloride
code.description: Non-plasticised PolyVinyl Chloride / Unplasticised PolyVinyl Chloride

codeset.name: EncounterStatus
codeset.description: Current state of the encounter.

code.name: Planned
code.description: The Encounter has not yet started.

code.name: In Progress
code.description: The Encounter has begun and the patient is present / the practitioner and the patient are meeting.

code.name: On Hold
code.description: The Encounter has begun, but is currently on hold, e.g. because the patient is temporarily on leave.

code.name: Discharged
code.description: The Encounter has been clinically completed, the patient has been discharged from the facility or the visit has ended, and the patient may have departed (refer to subjectStatus). While the encounter is in this status, administrative activities are usually performed, collating all required documentation and charge information before being released for billing, at which point the status will move to completed.

code.name: Cancelled
code.description: The Encounter has ended before it has begun.

code.name: Discontinued
code.description: The Encounter has started, but was not able to be completed. Further action may need to be performed, such as rescheduling appointments related to this encounter.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: This instance should not have been part of this patient's medical record.

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The encounter status is unknown. Note that "unknown" is a value of last resort and every attempt should be made to provide a meaningful value other than "unknown".

codeset.name: IngredientFunction
codeset.description: A classification of the ingredient identifying its precise purpose(s) in the drug product (beyond e.g. active/inactive).

codeset.name: LinkageType
codeset.description: Used to distinguish different roles a resource can play within a set of linked resources.

code.name: Source of Truth
code.description: The resource represents the "source of truth" (from the perspective of this Linkage resource) for the underlying event/condition/etc.

code.name: Alternate Record
code.description: The resource represents an alternative view of the underlying event/condition/etc. The resource may still be actively maintained, even though it is not considered to be the source of truth.

code.name: Historical/Obsolete Record
code.description: The resource represents an obsolete record of the underlying event/condition/etc. It is not expected to be actively maintained.

codeset.name: AdditionalMonitoring
codeset.description: Extra monitoring defined for a Medicinal Product.

codeset.name: ConstraintSeverity
codeset.description: SHALL applications comply with this constraint?

code.name: Error
code.description: If the constraint is violated, the resource is not conformant.

code.name: Warning
code.description: If the constraint is violated, the resource is conformant, but it is not necessarily following best practice.

codeset.name: AccountAggregate
codeset.description: Indicates who is expected to pay a part of the account balance.

code.name: Patient
code.description: This (aggregated) balance is expected to be paid by the Patient

code.name: Insurance
code.description: This (aggregated) balance is expected to be paid by Insurance coverage(s)

code.name: Total
code.description: There is no aggregation on this balance

codeset.name: ReportSectionType
codeset.description: Evidence Report Section Type.

code.name: Evidence Results for the intervention exposure only
code.description: Evidence Results for the intervention exposure only.

code.name: Evidence Results for comparison of Intervention and Control
code.description: Evidence Results for comparison of Intervention and Control.

code.name: Evidence Results for the control exposure only
code.description: Evidence Results for the control exposure only.

code.name: Evidence Variables actually observed
code.description: Evidence Variables as observed in the research data.

code.name: Evidence Variable in variable role Population
code.description: Evidence Variable in variable role Population.

code.name: Evidence Variable in variable role Exposure
code.description: Evidence Variable in variable role Exposure.

code.name: Evidence Variable in variable role Outcome (MeasuredVariable)
code.description: Evidence Variable in variable role Outcome (MeasuredVariable).

code.name: Efficacy-outcomes
code.description: Outcomes related to efficacy or potential benefits of interventions.

code.name: Harms outcomes
code.description: Outcomes related to adverse effects or potential harms of interventions.

code.name: Evidence Classifier section
code.description: This section is used for classifiers of the evidence.

code.name: Text Summary
code.description: Denotes a section specifying text summary for a report.

code.name: Summary of Body of Evidence Findings
code.description: Summary of Body of Evidence Findings.

code.name: Header
code.description: Denotes the header to use for a Text Summary or above a Table.

code.name: Row Headers
code.description: Denotes a section specifying row headers for a tabular report.

code.name: Column Header
code.description: Denotes the header to use for the column for a tabular report.

code.name: Column Headers
code.description: Denotes a section specifying column headers for a tabular report.

codeset.name: BeneficiaryRelationshipCodes
codeset.description: This value set includes the Patient to subscriber relationship codes.

code.name: Self
code.description: The patient is the subscriber (policy holder)

code.name: Spouse
code.description: The patient is the spouse or equivalent of the subscriber (policy holder)

code.name: Child
code.description: The patient is the child of the subscriber (policy holder)

code.name: Common Law Spouse
code.description: The patient is the common law spouse of the subscriber (policy holder)

code.name: Other
code.description: The patient has some other relationship, such as parent, to the subscriber (policy holder)

codeset.name: SupplyDeliverySupplyItemType
codeset.description: Status of the supply delivery.

code.name: Medication
code.description: Supply is a kind of medication.

code.name: Device
code.description: What is supplied (or requested) is a device.

code.name: Biologically Derived Product
code.description: Supply is a kind of biologically derived product.

codeset.name: SpecimenStatus
codeset.description: Codes providing the status/availability of a specimen.

code.name: Available
code.description: The physical specimen is present and in good condition.

code.name: Unavailable
code.description: There is no physical specimen because it is either lost, destroyed or consumed.

code.name: Unsatisfactory
code.description: The specimen cannot be used because of a quality issue such as a broken container, contamination, or too old.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The specimen was entered in error and therefore nullified.

codeset.name: ProductConfidentiality
codeset.description: Confidentiality rating, e.g. commercial sensitivity for a Medicinal Product.

codeset.name: TimingAbbreviation
codeset.description: Code for a known / defined timing pattern.

code.name: Continuous (frequency)
code.description: Service is provided continuously between start time and stop time.

codeset.name: UnitOfPresentation
codeset.description: The presentation type in which an administrable medicinal product is given to a patient.

codeset.name: GuidanceResponseStatus
codeset.description: The status of a guidance response.

code.name: Data Requested
code.description: The request was processed successfully, but more data may result in a more complete evaluation.

code.name: Data Required
code.description: The request was processed, but more data is required to complete the evaluation.

code.name: In Progress
code.description: The request is currently being processed.

code.name: Failure
code.description: The request was not processed successfully.

code.name: Entered In Error
code.description: The response was entered in error.

codeset.name: ActionParticipantFunction
codeset.description: The function performed by the participant for the action.

code.name: Performer
code.description: The participant is the performer of the action.

code.name: Author
code.description: The participant is the author of the result of the action.

code.name: Reviewer
code.description: The participant is reviewing the result of the action.

code.name: Witness
code.description: The participant is a witness to the action being performed.

codeset.name: SubstanceAmountType
codeset.description: The type of a numeric quantity measurement.

codeset.name: SubstanceRelationshipType
codeset.description: The relationship between two substance types.

codeset.name: ClaimProcessingCodes
codeset.description: This value set includes Claim Processing Outcome codes.

code.name: Queued
code.description: The Claim/Pre-authorization/Pre-determination has been received but processing has not begun.

code.name: Processing Complete
code.description: The processing has completed without errors

code.name: Error
code.description: One or more errors have been detected in the Claim

code.name: Partial Processing
code.description: No errors have been detected in the Claim and some of the adjudication has been performed.

codeset.name: MeasureGroupExample
codeset.description: Example Measure Groups for the Measure Resource.

codeset.name: ResearchStudyFocusType
codeset.description: Codes for the main intent of the study.

codeset.name: SortDirection
codeset.description: The possible sort directions, ascending or descending.

code.name: Ascending
code.description: Sort by the value ascending, so that lower values appear first.

code.name: Descending
code.description: Sort by the value descending, so that lower values appear last.

codeset.name: EvidenceCertaintyType
codeset.description: The aspect of quality, confidence, or certainty.

code.name: Overall certainty
code.description: Overall certainty of evidence (quality of evidence).

code.name: Inconsistency
code.description: concerns that findings are not similar enough to support certainty.

code.name: Publication bias
code.description: likelihood that what is published misrepresents what is available to publish.

code.name: Dose response gradient
code.description: higher certainty due to dose response relationship.

code.name: Plausible confounding
code.description: higher certainty due to risk of bias in opposite direction.

code.name: Large effect
code.description: higher certainty due to large effect size.

codeset.name: CitationArtifactClassifier
codeset.description: Citation artifact classifier

code.name: Audio file
code.description: The article cited is an audio file.

code.name: Book
code.description: Non-periodical written or printed works consisting of sheets of pages fastened or bound together within covers.

code.name: Clinical Decision Support Artifact
code.description: The artifact is used for decision support for healthcare decisions.

code.name: Common Share
code.description: Citation Resource containing value added data that is openly shared

code.name: Database
code.description: A structured file of information or a set of logically related data stored and retrieved using computer-based means.

code.name: Dataset
code.description: Works consisting of organized collections of data, which have been stored permanently in a formalized manner suitable for communication, interpretation, or processing.

code.name: Dataset Unpublished
code.description: An organized collection of data that is not stored permanently for communication.

code.name: Electronic
code.description: the journal is published in electronic format only

code.name: Electronic-eCollection
code.description: used for electronic-only journals that publish individual articles first and then later collect them into an "issue" date that is typically called an eCollection.

code.name: Electronic-Print
code.description: the journal is published first in electronic format followed by print (this value is currently used for just one journal, Nucleic Acids Research)

code.name: FHIR Resource
code.description: The article cited is a FHIR resource.

code.name: Image file
code.description: The article cited is an image file.

code.name: Interactive Form
code.description: A user interface that supports data entry and data display.

code.name: Machine code
code.description: The article cited is machine code.

code.name: Medline Base
code.description: Citation Resource containing only data from Medline

code.name: Prediction Model
code.description: A formula or expression used to calculate an outcome representing a predicted result.

code.name: Preprint
code.description: Scientific manuscript made available prior to PEER REVIEW.

code.name: Print
code.description: the journal is published in print format only

code.name: Print Electronic
code.description: the journal is published in both print and electronic format

code.name: Project Specific
code.description: Citation Resource containing value added data specific to a project

code.name: Protocol
code.description: The article cited is the protocol of an activity and not the results or findings.

code.name: PseudoCode
code.description: A non-executable, human-readable representation of software code.

code.name: Standard Specification
code.description: An explicit set of requirements for an item, material, component, system or service, often used to define a technical standard which is an established norm or requirement for a repeatable technical task.

code.name: Terminology
code.description: A structured set of codes and display values, which may be subtyped as a code system, value set, taxonomy, or ontology.

code.name: Video-Audio Media
code.description: Used with articles which include video files or clips, or for articles which are entirely video.

codeset.name: ActionPrecheckBehavior
codeset.description: Defines selection frequency behavior for an action or group.

code.name: Yes
code.description: An action with this behavior is one of the most frequent action that is, or should be, included by an end user, for the particular context in which the action occurs. The system displaying the action to the end user should consider "pre-checking" such an action as a convenience for the user.

code.name: No
code.description: An action with this behavior is one of the less frequent actions included by the end user, for the particular context in which the action occurs. The system displaying the actions to the end user would typically not "pre-check" such an action.

codeset.name: ExampleScenarioActorType
codeset.description: The type of actor - system or human.

code.name: System
code.description: A software application or other system

codeset.name: AccountBalanceTerm
codeset.description: Indicates the account balance's age

code.name: Current
code.description: This balance is the current balance

code.name: 30 day
code.description: This balance is outstanding over 30 days

code.name: 60 day
code.description: This balance is outstanding over 60 days

code.name: 90 day
code.description: This balance is outstanding over 90 days

code.name: 120 day
code.description: This balance is outstanding over 120 days

codeset.name: ResearchStudyPhase
codeset.description: Codes for the stage in the progression of a therapy from initial experimental use in humans in clinical trials to post-market evaluation.

code.name: N/A
code.description: Trials without phases (for example, studies of devices or behavioral interventions).

code.name: Early Phase 1
code.description: Designation for optional exploratory trials conducted in accordance with the United States Food and Drug Administration's (FDA) 2006 Guidance on Exploratory Investigational New Drug (IND) Studies. Formerly called Phase 0.

code.name: Phase 1
code.description: Includes initial studies to determine the metabolism and pharmacologic actions of drugs in humans, the side effects associated with increasing doses, and to gain early evidence of effectiveness; may include healthy participants and/or patients.

code.name: Phase 1/Phase 2
code.description: Trials that are a combination of phases 1 and 2.

code.name: Phase 2
code.description: Includes controlled clinical studies conducted to evaluate the effectiveness of the drug for a particular indication or indications in participants with the disease or condition under study and to determine the common short-term side effects and risks.

code.name: Phase 2/Phase 3
code.description: Trials that are a combination of phases 2 and 3.

code.name: Phase 3
code.description: Includes trials conducted after preliminary evidence suggesting effectiveness of the drug has been obtained, and are intended to gather additional information to evaluate the overall benefit-risk relationship of the drug.

code.name: Phase 4
code.description: Studies of FDA-approved drugs to delineate additional information including the drug's risks, benefits, and optimal use.

codeset.name: NarrativeStatus
codeset.description: The status of a resource narrative.

code.name: Generated
code.description: The contents of the narrative are entirely generated from the core elements in the content.

code.name: Extensions
code.description: The contents of the narrative are entirely generated from the core elements in the content and some of the content is generated from extensions. The narrative SHALL reflect the impact of all modifier extensions.

code.name: Additional
code.description: The contents of the narrative may contain additional information not found in the structured data. Note that there is no computable way to determine what the extra information is, other than by human inspection.

code.name: Empty
code.description: The contents of the narrative are some equivalent of "No human-readable text provided in this case".

codeset.name: DetectedIssueStatus
codeset.description: Indicates the status of the detected issue. This code system contains only status codes that are not already defined and used from the ObservationStatus code system.

code.name: Mitigated
code.description: Indicates the detected issue has been mitigated

codeset.name: ResearchStudyPartyRole
codeset.description: This is a ResearchStudy's party role.

codeset.name: RequestPriority
codeset.description: Identifies the level of importance to be assigned to actioning the request.

code.name: Urgent
code.description: The request should be actioned promptly - higher priority than routine.

code.name: ASAP
code.description: The request should be actioned as soon as possible - higher priority than urgent.

code.name: STAT
code.description: The request should be actioned immediately - highest possible priority. E.g. an emergency.

codeset.name: UDIEntryType
codeset.description: Codes to identify how UDI data was entered.

code.name: Barcode
code.description: a barcodescanner captured the data from the device label.

code.name: RFID
code.description: An RFID chip reader captured the data from the device label.

code.name: Manual
code.description: The data was read from the label by a person and manually entered. (e.g. via a keyboard).

code.name: Card
code.description: The data originated from a patient's implant card and was read by an operator.

code.name: Self Reported
code.description: The data originated from a patient source and was not directly scanned or read from a label or card.

code.name: Electronic Transmission
code.description: The UDI information was received electronically from the device through a communication protocol, such as the IEEE 11073 20601 version 4 exchange protocol over Bluetooth or USB.

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The method of data capture has not been determined.

codeset.name: EvidenceClassifier
codeset.description: Commonly used classifiers for evidence sets.

code.name: COVID-19 relevant (but not specific) article
code.description: Not about COVID-19 but relevant to COVID-19 management or understanding.

code.name: COVID-19 human data in population, exposure, or outcome
code.description: contains human COVID-19 disease in the research data as any variable (population, exposure or outcome).

code.name: Article includes original research
code.description: such as randomized trial, observational study.

code.name: Article includes synthesis of research
code.description: such as systematic review, meta-analysis, rapid review.

code.name: Article is neither research nor guideline
code.description: for things that are not research reports, research protocols or guidelines.

code.name: Article about diagnosis
code.description: about methods to distinguish having or not having a condition.

code.name: Article about prognosis or prediction
code.description: about predicting risk for something or risk factors for it.

code.name: Rated as yes, affirmative, positive, present, or include
code.description: Rated as yes, affirmative, positive, present, or include

code.name: Rated as no, negative, absent, or exclude
code.description: Rated as no, negative, absent, or exclude.

code.name: Not rated, not assessed
code.description: Neither rated as yes nor rated as no.

code.name: classified as other concept (not elsewhere classified)
code.description: classified as other concept (not elsewhere classified).

code.name: Preprint (not final publication)
code.description: Results presented in preprint (pre-final publication) form.

code.name: Baseline imbalances
code.description: Differences between groups at start of trial may confound or bias the findings.

codeset.name: ManufacturedDoseForm
codeset.description: Dose form for a medication, as manufactured (and before any mixing etc.), not necessarily ready for administration to the patient.

code.name: Powder for suspension for fish treatment
code.description: Powder for suspension for fish treatment

code.name: Concentrate for solution for fish treatment
code.description: Concentrate for solution for fish treatment

codeset.name: MedicationStatusCodes
codeset.description: Medication Status Codes

code.name: Active
code.description: The medication record is current and is appropriate for reference in new instances.

code.name: Inactive
code.description: The medication record is not current and is not is appropriate for reference in new instances.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The medication record was created erroneously and is not appropriated for reference in new instances.

codeset.name: CodeSystemContentMode
codeset.description: The extent of the content of the code system (the concepts and codes it defines) are represented in a code system resource.

code.name: Not Present
code.description: None of the concepts defined by the code system are included in the code system resource.

code.name: Example
code.description: A subset of the valid externally defined concepts are included in the code system resource. There is no specific purpose or documented intent other than for illustrative purposes.

code.name: Fragment
code.description: A subset of the code system concepts are included in the code system resource. This is a curated subset released for a specific purpose under the governance of the code system steward, and that the intent, bounds and consequences of the fragmentation are clearly defined in the fragment or the code system documentation. Fragments are also known as partitions.

code.name: Complete
code.description: All the concepts defined by the code system are included in the code system resource.

code.name: Supplement
code.description: The resource doesn't define any new concepts; it just provides additional designations and properties to another code system.

codeset.name: ContractScope
codeset.description: This CodeSystem contains FHIR-defined contract Expiration types.

codeset.name: ResearchStudyPartyOrganizationType
codeset.description: This is a ResearchStudy's party organization type.

codeset.name: SubstanceStructureTechnique
codeset.description: SubstanceStructureTechnique

codeset.name: InteractionType
codeset.description: A categorisation for an interaction between two substances.

codeset.name: CompartmentType
codeset.description: Which type a compartment definition describes.

code.name: Patient
code.description: The compartment definition is for the patient compartment.

code.name: Encounter
code.description: The compartment definition is for the encounter compartment.

code.name: RelatedPerson
code.description: The compartment definition is for the related-person compartment.

code.name: Practitioner
code.description: The compartment definition is for the practitioner compartment.

code.name: Device
code.description: The compartment definition is for the device compartment.

code.name: EpisodeOfCare
code.description: The compartment definition is for the episodeofcare compartment.

codeset.name: InventoryCountType
codeset.description: The type of count.

code.name: Snapshot
code.description: The inventory report is a current absolute snapshot, i.e. it represents the quantities at hand.

code.name: Difference
code.description: The inventory report is about the difference between a previous count and a current count, i.e. it represents the items that have been added/subtracted from inventory.

codeset.name: AccountBillingStatus
codeset.description: Indicates whether the account is available to be used for billing purposes.

code.name: Open
code.description: The account is open for charging transactions (account.status is active)

code.name: CareComplete/Not Billed
code.description: The account.status is still active and may have charges recorded against it (only for events in the servicePeriod), however the encounters associated are completed. (Also known as Discharged not billed) This BillingStatus is often not used in ongoing accounts. (account.status is active)

code.name: Billing
code.description: Indicates that all transactions are recorded and the finance system can perform the billing process, including preparing insurance claims, scrubbing charges, invoicing etc. During this time any new charges will not be included in the current billing run/cycle. (account.status is active)

code.name: Closed-Bad Debt
code.description: The balance of this debt has not been able to be recovered, and the organization has decided not to persue debt recovery. (account.status is in-active)

code.name: Closed-Voided
code.description: The account was not created in error, however the organization has decided that it will not be charging any transactions associated. (account.status is i n-active)

code.name: Closed-Completed
code.description: The account is closed and all charges are processed and accounted for. (account.status is i n-active)

code.name: Closed-Combined
code.description: This account has been merged into another account, all charged have been migrated. This account should no longer be used, and will not be billed. (account.status is i n-active)

codeset.name: AdministrativeGender
codeset.description: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes.

codeset.name: EvidenceCertaintyRating
codeset.description: The assessment of quality, confidence, or certainty.

code.name: present
code.description: possible reason for increasing quality rating was checked and found to be present.

code.name: absent
code.description: possible reason for increasing quality rating was checked and found to be absent.

codeset.name: QuestionnaireItemType
codeset.description: Distinguishes groups from questions and display text and indicates data type for questions.

code.name: Group
code.description: An item with no direct answer but should have at least one child item.

code.name: Display
code.description: Text for display that will not capture an answer or have child items.

code.name: Question
code.description: An item that defines a specific answer to be captured, and which may have child items. (the answer provided in the QuestionnaireResponse should be of the defined datatype).

codeset.name: StructureMapModelMode
codeset.description: How the referenced structure is used in this mapping.

code.name: Source Structure Definition
code.description: This structure describes an instance passed to the mapping engine that is used a source of data.

code.name: Queried Structure Definition
code.description: This structure describes an instance that the mapping engine may ask for that is used a source of data.

code.name: Target Structure Definition
code.description: This structure describes an instance passed to the mapping engine that is used a target of data.

code.name: Produced Structure Definition
code.description: This structure describes an instance that the mapping engine may ask to create that is used a target of data.

codeset.name: CapabilityStatementKind
codeset.description: How a capability statement is intended to be used.

code.name: Instance
code.description: The CapabilityStatement instance represents the present capabilities of a specific system instance. This is the kind returned by /metadata for a FHIR server end-point.

code.name: Capability
code.description: The CapabilityStatement instance represents the capabilities of a system or piece of software, independent of a particular installation.

code.name: Requirements
code.description: The CapabilityStatement instance represents a set of requirements for other systems to meet; e.g. as part of an implementation guide or 'request for proposal'.

codeset.name: SupplyRequestStatus
codeset.description: Status of the supply request.

code.name: Draft
code.description: The request has been created but is not yet complete or ready for action.

code.name: Active
code.description: The request is ready to be acted upon.

code.name: Suspended
code.description: The authorization/request to act has been temporarily withdrawn but is expected to resume in the future.

code.name: Cancelled
code.description: The authorization/request to act has been terminated prior to the full completion of the intended actions. No further activity should occur.

code.name: Completed
code.description: Activity against the request has been sufficiently completed to the satisfaction of the requester.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: This electronic record should never have existed, though it is possible that real-world decisions were based on it. (If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be "cancelled" rather than "entered-in-error".).

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The authoring/source system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this observation. Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, but the authoring/source system does not know which.

codeset.name: TriggerType
codeset.description: The type of trigger.

code.name: Named Event
code.description: The trigger occurs in response to a specific named event, and no other information about the trigger is specified. Named events are completely pre-coordinated, and the formal semantics of the trigger are not provided.

code.name: Periodic
code.description: The trigger occurs at a specific time or periodically as described by a timing or schedule. A periodic event cannot have any data elements, but may have a name assigned as a shorthand for the event.

code.name: Data Changed
code.description: The trigger occurs whenever data of a particular type is changed in any way, either added, modified, or removed.

code.name: Data Accessed
code.description: The trigger occurs whenever data of a particular type is accessed.

code.name: Data Access Ended
code.description: The trigger occurs whenever access to data of a particular type is completed.

codeset.name: TaskIntent
codeset.description: Distinguishes whether the task is a proposal, plan or full order.

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The intent is not known. When dealing with Task, it's not always known (or relevant) how the task was initiated - i.e. whether it was proposed, planned, ordered or just done spontaneously.

codeset.name: PackageType
codeset.description: A high level categorisation of a package.

codeset.name: TaskCode
codeset.description: Codes indicating the type of action that is expected to be performed

code.name: Activate/approve the focal resource
code.description: Take what actions are needed to transition the focus resource from 'draft' to 'active' or 'in-progress', as appropriate for the resource type. This may involve additing additional content, approval, validation, etc.

code.name: Fulfill the focal request
code.description: Act to perform the actions described in the focus request. This might result in a 'more assertive' request (order for a plan or proposal, filler order for a placer order), but is intend to eventually result in events. The degree of fulfillment requested might be limited by Task.restriction.

code.name: Instantiate the focal definition
code.description: Act to perform the actions defined in the focus definition resource (ActivityDefinition, PlanDefinition, Questionnaire, etc.) For PlanDefinition or ActivityDefinition, this might result in a 'more assertive' request (order for a plan or proposal, filler order for a placer order), but is intend to eventually result in events. For Questionnaire, this would result in a QuestionnaireResponse - and possibly resources constructed using data extracted from the response. The degree of fulfillment requested might be limited by Task.restriction.

code.name: Mark the focal resource as no longer active
code.description: Abort, cancel or withdraw the focal resource, as appropriate for the type of resource.

code.name: Replace the focal resource with the input resource
code.description: Replace the focal resource with the specified input resource

code.name: Change the focal resource
code.description: Update the focal resource of the owning system to reflect the content specified as the Task.focus

code.name: Suspend the focal resource
code.description: Transition the focal resource from 'active' or 'in-progress' to 'suspended'

code.name: Re-activate the focal resource
code.description: Transition the focal resource from 'suspended' to 'active' or 'in-progress' as appropriate for the resource type.

codeset.name: DocumentReferenceStatus
codeset.description: The status of the document reference.

code.name: Current
code.description: This is the current reference for this document.

code.name: Superseded
code.description: This reference has been superseded by another reference.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: This reference was created in error.

codeset.name: NameUse
codeset.description: The use of a human name.

code.name: Usual
code.description: Known as/conventional/the one you normally use.

code.name: Official
code.description: The formal name as registered in an official (government) registry, but which name might not be commonly used. May be called "legal name".

code.name: Temp
code.description: A temporary name. Name.period can provide more detailed information. This may also be used for temporary names assigned at birth or in emergency situations.

code.name: Nickname
code.description: A name that is used to address the person in an informal manner, but is not part of their formal or usual name.

code.name: Anonymous
code.description: Anonymous assigned name, alias, or pseudonym (used to protect a person's identity for privacy reasons).

code.name: Old
code.description: This name is no longer in use (or was never correct, but retained for records).

codeset.name: ContributorType
codeset.description: The type of contributor.

code.name: Author
code.description: An author of the content of the module.

code.name: Editor
code.description: An editor of the content of the module.

code.name: Reviewer
code.description: A reviewer of the content of the module.

code.name: Endorser
code.description: An endorser of the content of the module.

codeset.name: MedicationRequestStatusCodes
codeset.description: MedicationRequest Status Codes

code.name: Active
code.description: The request is 'actionable', but not all actions that are implied by it have occurred yet.

code.name: On Hold
code.description: Actions implied by the request are to be temporarily halted. The request might or might not be resumed. May also be called 'suspended'.

code.name: Ended
code.description: The request is no longer active and the subject should no longer be taking the medication.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The request was recorded against the wrong patient or for some reason should not have been recorded (e.g. wrong medication, wrong dose, etc.). Some of the actions that are implied by the medication request may have occurred. For example, the medication may have been dispensed and the patient may have taken some of the medication.

code.name: Draft
code.description: The request is not yet 'actionable', e.g. it is a work in progress, requires sign-off, verificationorneeds to be run through decision support process.

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The authoring/source system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this request. Note: This concept is not to be used for 'other' - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, but the authoring/source system does not know which.

codeset.name: AdministrableDoseForm
codeset.description: Dose form for a medication, in the form suitable for administering to the patient, after mixing, where necessary.

code.name: Powder for suspension for fish treatment
code.description: Powder for suspension for fish treatment

code.name: Concentrate for solution for fish treatment
code.description: Concentrate for solution for fish treatment

codeset.name: LocationCharacteristic
codeset.description: Example Set of Location Characteristics.

code.name: Wheelchair accessible
code.description: The location is accessible to thosre requiring wheelchair access

code.name: translation services available
code.description: The location has translation services available

code.name: oxygen/nitrogen available
code.description: The location has oxygen and nitrogen services available

code.name: negative pressure rooms available
code.description: The location has negative pressure rooms available

code.name: isolation ward
code.description: The location is or has an isolation ward

code.name: has ICU
code.description: The location is or has an intensive care unit

codeset.name: Kind
codeset.description: The nature of the Coverage details which convey who is paying potentially for health services.

code.name: Insurance
code.description: The Coverage provides the identifiers and card-level details of an insurance policy.

code.name: Self-pay
code.description: One or more persons and/or organizations are paying for the services rendered.

code.name: Other
code.description: Some other organization is paying for the service.

codeset.name: EvidenceVariableHandling
codeset.description: The handling of the variable in statistical analysis for exposures or outcomes (E.g. Dichotomous, Continuous, Descriptive).

code.name: continuous variable
code.description: A continuous variable is one for which, within the limits the variable ranges, any value is possible (from STATO http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/STATO_0000251).

code.name: dichotomous variable
code.description: A dichotomous variable is a categorical variable which is defined to have only 2 categories or possible values (from STATO http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/STATO_0000090).

code.name: ordinal variable
code.description: An ordinal variable is a categorical variable where the discrete possible values are ordered or correspond to an implicit ranking (from STATO http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/STATO_0000228).

code.name: polychotomous variable
code.description: A polychotomous variable is a categorical variable which is defined to have minimally 2 categories or possible values. (from STATO http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/STATO_0000087). Suggestion to limit code use to situations when neither dichotomous nor ordinal variables apply.

codeset.name: TransportCode
codeset.description: Codes indicating the type of action that is expected to be performed

codeset.description: The type of participant.

codeset.name: ActionCode
codeset.description: Provides examples of actions to be performed.

code.name: Send a message
code.description: The action indicates that a particular message should be sent to a participant in the process.

code.name: Collect information
code.description: The action indicates that information should be collected from a participant in the process.

code.name: Prescribe a medication
code.description: The action indicates that a particular medication should be prescribed to the patient.

code.name: Recommend an immunization
code.description: The action indicates that a particular immunization should be performed.

code.name: Order a service
code.description: The action indicates that a particular service should be provided.

code.name: Propose a diagnosis
code.description: The action indicates that a particular diagnosis should be proposed.

code.name: Record a detected issue
code.description: The action indicates that a particular detected issue should be recorded.

code.name: Record an inference
code.description: The action indicates that a particular inference should be recorded.

code.name: Report a flag
code.description: The action indicates that a particular flag should be reported.

code.description: The device is connected to the patient.

code.name: Disconnected
code.description: The device is no longer connected.

code.name: Failed
code.description: The device has failed to work, or continue to function.

code.name: placed
code.description: The device was placed in the patient.

code.name: Replaced
code.description: The device was updated with a new device or device part.

codeset.description: Contact type for a Medicinal Product.

code.name: Person/Company authorised for Communication during procedure
code.description: Person/Company authorised for Communication on behalf of the Applicant during the Procedure
