code.description: Person/Company authorised for Communication between MAH and Authorities after Authorization

codeset.name: FHIRSubstanceStatus
codeset.description: A code to indicate if the substance is actively used.

code.name: Active
code.description: The substance is considered for use or reference.

code.name: Inactive
code.description: The substance is considered for reference, but not for use.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The substance was entered in error.

codeset.name: LinkType
codeset.description: The type of link between this Patient resource and other Patient/RelatedPerson resource(s).

code.name: Replaced-by
code.description: The patient resource containing this link must no longer be used. The link points forward to another patient resource that must be used in lieu of the patient resource that contains this link.

code.name: Replaces
code.description: The patient resource containing this link is the current active patient record. The link points back to an inactive patient resource that has been merged into this resource, and should be consulted to retrieve additional referenced information.

code.name: Refer
code.description: The patient resource containing this link is in use and valid but not considered the main source of information about a patient. The link points forward to another patient resource that should be consulted to retrieve additional patient information.

code.name: See also
code.description: The patient resource containing this link is in use and valid, but points to another Patient or RelatedPerson resource that is known to contain data about the same person. Data in this resource might overlap or contradict information found in the other Patient/RelatedPerson resource. This link does not indicate any relative importance of the resources concerned, and both should be regarded as equally valid.

codeset.name: ProductIntendedUse
codeset.description: ProductIntendedUse

codeset.name: CompositionStatus
codeset.description: The workflow/clinical status of the composition.

code.name: Registered
code.description: The existence of the composition is registered, but there is nothing yet available.

code.name: Partial
code.description: This is a partial (e.g. initial, interim or preliminary) composition: data in the composition may be incomplete or unverified.

code.name: Final
code.description: This version of the composition is complete and verified by an appropriate person and no further work is planned. Any subsequent updates would be on a new version of the composition.

code.name: Amended
code.description: The composition content or the referenced resources have been modified (edited or added to) subsequent to being released as "final" and the composition is complete and verified by an authorized person.

code.name: Cancelled
code.description: The composition is unavailable because the measurement was not started or not completed (also sometimes called "aborted").

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The composition or document was originally created/issued in error, and this is an amendment that marks that the entire series should not be considered as valid.

code.name: Deprecated
code.description: This composition has been withdrawn or superseded and should no longer be used.

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The authoring/source system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this observation. Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, but the authoring/source system does not know which.

codeset.name: FHIRDeviceAssociationOperationStatus
codeset.description: The operational status of the device.

code.name: On
code.description: The device is working or switched on, i.e. active.

code.name: Off
code.description: The device is inactive, switched off, or deactivated.

code.name: Stand By
code.description: The device is in stand-by mode i.e. not actively working but not powered off.

code.name: Stand By
code.description: The device is defective or for maintenance and is not available or working.

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The operational status of the device has not been determined.

codeset.name: QuantityComparator
codeset.description: How the Quantity should be understood and represented.

code.name: Less than
code.description: The actual value is less than the given value.

code.name: Less or Equal to
code.description: The actual value is less than or equal to the given value.

code.name: Greater or Equal to
code.description: The actual value is greater than or equal to the given value.

code.name: Greater than
code.description: The actual value is greater than the given value.

code.name: Sufficient to achieve this total quantity
code.description: The actual value is sufficient for the total quantity to equal the given value.

codeset.name: PaymentIssuerTypeCodes
codeset.description: This value set contains codes for the type of payment issuers.

code.name: Patient
code.description: The patient or a party issuing payment on behalf of the patient.

code.name: Insurance
code.description: An insurer, or party acting on their behalf, which is making payment following a contract, direct or indirect, with the patient to pay for healthcare-related services.

codeset.name: ProductNameType
codeset.description: Type of a name for a Medicinal Product.

codeset.name: ContractDefinitionSubtype
codeset.description: This CodeSystem contains FHIR-defined contract definition subtypes.

codeset.name: TransportStatus
codeset.description: Status of transport.

code.name: Patient not available
code.description: The patient was not available for transport.

code.name: Specimen not available
code.description: The specimen was not available for transport.

code.name: Wrong request data
code.description: Wrong data in the transport request.

code.name: In route accident
code.description: An accident has occurred in route.

code.name: Request not acknowledged
code.description: The transport request was not acknowledged.

codeset.name: TransportIntent
codeset.description: Distinguishes whether the transport is a proposal, plan or full order.

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The intent is not known. When dealing with Transport, it's not always known (or relevant) how the transport was initiated - i.e. whether it was proposed, planned, ordered or just done spontaneously.

codeset.name: UndesirablEffectFrequency
codeset.description: A categorisation for a frequency of occurence of an undesirable effect.

codeset.name: CitedArtifactStatusType
codeset.description: Cited Artifact Status Type

code.name: Created
code.description: The content was originally constructed or composed.

code.name: Submitted
code.description: The content was sent to the publisher for consideration of publication.

code.name: Withdrawn
code.description: The content that was not published has been removed from consideration for publishing by the submitter.

code.name: Pre review
code.description: The content is awaiting assignment and delivery to reviewer(s).

code.name: Under review
code.description: The content is in a state of being reviewed.

code.name: Post review pre published
code.description: The content is in a state between the review(s) being completed and being published.

code.name: Rejected
code.description: The content that was not published has been removed from consideration for publishing by a publisher or editor.

code.name: Published early form
code.description: The content is published but future changes to the published version are expected.

code.name: Published final form
code.description: The content is published and further changes to the content are not expected.

code.name: Accepted
code.description: The content that was not published yet has been approved for publication by the publisher and/or editor.

code.name: Archived
code.description: The content is retired or considered no longer current but still available as part of the public record.

code.name: Retracted
code.description: The content that was published is removed from publication and should no longer be considered part of the public record.

code.name: Draft
code.description: The content is considered unfinished or incomplete and not representative of the current state desired by the content creator.

code.name: Active
code.description: The content is considered complete for its current state by the content creator.

code.name: Approved
code.description: The content has been approved for a state transition, with the focus of approval described in the text associated with this coding.

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The status of the content is not recorded in the metadata.

codeset.name: ExtensionContextType
codeset.description: How an extension context is interpreted.

code.name: FHIRPath
code.description: The context is all elements that match the FHIRPath query found in the expression.

code.name: Element ID
code.description: The context is any element that has an ElementDefinition.id that matches that found in the expression. This includes ElementDefinition Ids that have slicing identifiers. The full path for the element is [url]#[elementid]. If there is no #, the Element id is one defined in the base specification.

code.name: Extension URL
code.description: The context is a particular extension from a particular StructureDefinition, and the expression is just a uri that identifies the extension.

codeset.name: VirtualServiceType
codeset.description: Example codes for possible virtual service connection types.

code.name: Zoom web conferencing
code.description: the amount is the base price used for calculating the total price before applying surcharges, discount or taxes.

code.name: WhatsApp conference call
code.description: A conference call using the WhatsApp conference call service

codeset.name: GenomicStudyStatus
codeset.description: The status of the GenomicStudy.

code.name: Registered
code.description: The existence of the genomic study is registered, but there is nothing yet available.

code.name: Available
code.description: At least one instance has been associated with this genomic study.

code.name: Cancelled
code.description: The genomic study is unavailable because the genomic study was not started or not completed (also sometimes called "aborted").

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The genomic study has been withdrawn following a previous final release. This electronic record should never have existed, though it is possible that real-world decisions were based on it. (If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be "cancelled" rather than "entered-in-error".).

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this request. Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, it's just not known which one.

codeset.name: FHIRVersion
codeset.description: All published FHIR Versions.

codeset.name: AdditionalBindingPurposeCodes
codeset.description: Additional Binding Purpose

code.name: Maximum Binding
code.description: A required binding, for use when the binding strength is 'extensible' or 'preferred'

code.name: Minimum Binding
code.description: The minimum allowable value set - any conformant system SHALL support all these codes

code.name: Required Binding
code.description: This value set is used as a required binding (in addition to the base binding (not a replacement), usually in a particular usage context)

code.name: Conformance Binding
code.description: This value set is used as an extensible binding (in addition to the base binding (not a replacement), usually in a particular usage context)

code.name: Candidate Binding
code.description: This value set is a candidate to substitute for the overall conformance value set in some situations; usually these are defined in the documentation

code.name: Current Binding
code.description: New records are required to use this value set, but legacy records may use other codes. The definition of 'new record' is difficult, since systems often create new records based on pre-existing data. Usually 'current' bindings are mandated by an external authority that makes clear rules around this

code.name: Preferred Binding
code.description: This is the value set that is preferred in a given context (documentation should explain why)

code.name: UI Suggested Binding
code.description: This value set is provided for user look up in a given context. Typically, these valuesets only include a subset of codes relevant for input in a context

code.name: Starter Binding
code.description: This value set is a good set of codes to start with when designing your system

code.name: Component Binding
code.description: This value set is a component of the base value set. Usually this is called out so that documentation can be written about a portion of the value set

codeset.name: DetectedIssueSeverity
codeset.description: Indicates the potential degree of impact of the identified issue on the patient.

code.name: High
code.description: Indicates the issue may be life-threatening or has the potential to cause permanent injury.

code.name: Moderate
code.description: Indicates the issue may result in noticeable adverse consequences but is unlikely to be life-threatening or cause permanent injury.

code.name: Low
code.description: Indicates the issue may result in some adverse consequences but is unlikely to substantially affect the situation of the subject.

codeset.name: MedicationKnowledgeStatusCodes
codeset.description: MedicationKnowledge Status Codes

code.name: Active
code.description: The medication referred to by this MedicationKnowledge is in active use within the drug database or inventory system.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The medication referred to by this MedicationKnowledge was entered in error within the drug database or inventory system.

code.name: Inactive
code.description: The medication referred to by this MedicationKnowledge is not in active use within the drug database or inventory system.

codeset.name: FHIRDeviceStatus
codeset.description: The status of the Device record.

code.name: Active
code.description: The device record is current and is appropriate for reference in new instances.

code.name: Inactive
code.description: The device record is not current and is not appropriate for reference in new instances.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The device record is not current and is not appropriate for reference in new instances.

codeset.name: MedicationCostCategoryCodes
codeset.description: Medication Cost Category Codes

code.name: Band A
code.description: Tier A cost for this medication

code.name: Band B
code.description: Tier B cost for this medication

codeset.name: RegulatedAuthorizationBasis
codeset.description: RegulatedAuthorizationBasis

code.name: Traditional use registration for herbal medicinal product application
code.description: Traditional use registration for herbal medicinal product application

code.name: Known human blood/plasma derived ancillary medicinal substance
code.description: Known human blood/plasma derived ancillary medicinal substance

codeset.name: SubmitDataUpdateType
codeset.description: Concepts for how a measure report consumer and receiver coordinate data exchange updates. The choices are snapshot or incremental updates

code.name: Incremental
code.description: In contrast to the Snapshot Update, the FHIR Parameters resource used in a Submit Data or the Collect Data scenario contains only the new and updated DEQM and QI Core Profiles since the last transaction. If the Consumer supports incremental updates, the contents of the updated payload updates the previous payload data.

code.name: Snapshot
code.description: In contrast to the Incremental Update, the FHIR Parameters resource used in a Submit Data or the Collect Data scenario contains all the DEQM and QI Core Profiles for each transaction. If the Consumer supports snapshot updates, the contents of the updated payload entirely replaces the previous payload

codeset.name: TestReportResult
codeset.description: The reported execution result.

code.name: Pass
code.description: All test operations successfully passed all asserts.

code.name: Fail
code.description: One or more test operations failed one or more asserts.

code.name: Pending
code.description: One or more test operations is pending execution completion.

codeset.name: AuditEventAction
codeset.description: Indicator for type of action performed during the event that generated the event.

code.name: Create
code.description: Create a new database object, such as placing an order.

code.name: Read
code.description: Read data, such as to print or display to a doctor.

code.name: Update
code.description: Update data, such as revise patient information.

code.name: Delete
code.description: Delete items, such as a doctor master file record.

code.name: Execute
code.description: Perform a system or application function such as log-on, program execution or use of an object's method, or perform a query/search operation.

codeset.name: WarningType
codeset.description: Classification of warning type.

code.name: Get medical advice/attention if you feel unwell.
code.description: Get medical advice/attention if you feel unwell.

code.name: Specific treatment is urgent (see ... on this label).
code.description: Specific treatment is urgent (see ... on this label).

code.name: Remove/Take off immediately all contaminated clothing.
code.description: Remove/Take off immediately all contaminated clothing.

codeset.name: SpecimenRole
codeset.description: Codes providing the combined status of the specimen.

code.name: Blind Sample
code.description: Used to test the validity of the measurement process, where the composition of the sample is unknown except to the person submitting it.

code.name: Calibrator
code.description: Used for initial setting of calibration of the instrument.

code.name: Electronic QC
code.description: Used with manufactured reference providing signals that simulate QC results.

code.name: Filler Organization Proficiency
code.description: Specimen used for testing proficiency of the organization performing the testing (Filler).

code.name: Operator Proficiency
code.description: Specimen used for testing Operator Proficiency.

code.name: Control specimen
code.description: Used when specimen is the control specimen (either positive or negative).

code.name: Replicate (of patient sample as a control)
code.description: Used when a patient sample is re-run as a control for a repeat test.

codeset.name: SubscriptionNotificationType
codeset.description: The type of notification represented by the status message.

code.name: Handshake
code.description: The status was generated as part of the setup or verification of a communications channel.

code.name: Heartbeat
code.description: The status was generated to perform a heartbeat notification to the subscriber.

code.name: Event Notification
code.description: The status was generated for an event to the subscriber.

code.name: Query Status
code.description: The status was generated in response to a status query/request.

code.name: Query Event
code.description: The status was generated in response to an event query/request.

codeset.name: NamingSystemType
codeset.description: Identifies the purpose of the naming system.

code.name: Code System
code.description: The naming system is used to define concepts and symbols to represent those concepts; e.g. UCUM, LOINC, NDC code, local lab codes, etc.

code.name: Identifier
code.description: The naming system is used to manage identifiers (e.g. license numbers, order numbers, etc.).

code.name: Root
code.description: The naming system is used as the root for other identifiers and naming systems.

codeset.name: ActionCardinalityBehavior
codeset.description: Defines behavior for an action or a group for how many times that item may be repeated.

code.name: Single
code.description: The action may only be selected one time.

code.name: Multiple
code.description: The action may be selected multiple times.

codeset.name: DeviceUsageAdherenceCode
codeset.description: A coded concept indicating the usage of the device.

codeset.name: OperationParameterScope
codeset.description: Indicates that a parameter applies when the operation is being invoked at the specified level

code.name: Instance
code.description: This is a parameter that can be used at the instance level.

code.name: Type
code.description: This is a parameter that can be used at the type level.

code.name: System
code.description: This is a parameter that can be used at the system level.

codeset.name: AllergyIntoleranceCriticality
codeset.description: Estimate of the potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of a reaction to an identified substance.

code.name: Low Risk
code.description: Worst case result of a future exposure is not assessed to be life-threatening or having high potential for organ system failure.

code.name: High Risk
code.description: Worst case result of a future exposure is assessed to be life-threatening or having high potential for organ system failure.

code.name: Unable to Assess Risk
code.description: Unable to assess the worst case result of a future exposure.

codeset.name: CodeSystemHierarchyMeaning
codeset.description: The meaning of the hierarchy of concepts in a code system.

code.name: Grouped By
code.description: No particular relationship between the concepts can be assumed, except what can be determined by inspection of the definitions of the elements (possible reasons to use this: importing from a source where this is not defined, or where various parts of the hierarchy have different meanings).

code.name: Is-A
code.description: A hierarchy where the child concepts have an IS-A relationship with the parents - that is, all the properties of the parent are also true for its child concepts. Not that is-a is a property of the concepts, so additional subsumption relationships may be defined using properties.

code.name: Part Of
code.description: Child elements list the individual parts of a composite whole (e.g. body site).

code.name: Classified With
code.description: Child concepts in the hierarchy may have only one parent, and there is a presumption that the code system is a "closed world" meaning all things must be in the hierarchy. This results in concepts such as "not otherwise classified.".

codeset.name: CompositionAttestationMode
codeset.description: The way in which a person authenticated a composition.

code.name: Personal
code.description: The person authenticated the content in their personal capacity.

code.name: Professional
code.description: The person authenticated the content in their professional capacity.

code.name: Legal
code.description: The person authenticated the content and accepted legal responsibility for its content.

code.name: Official
code.description: The organization authenticated the content as consistent with their policies and procedures.

codeset.name: FHIRDeviceOperationMode
codeset.description: The operation mode of the device.

code.name: Normal
code.description: The device operates in a mode that supports the fulfillment of its clinical functions.

code.name: Demo
code.description: The device operates in a mode that is intended for demonstration purposes only. Arbitrary values are generated.

code.name: Service
code.description: The device operates in a mode that is intended for correcting a functional problem of the device only. Arbitrary values may be generated.

code.name: Maintenance
code.description: The device operates in a mode that is intended for preventative and/or scheduled maintenance purposes only.

code.name: Test
code.description: The device operates in a test mode that is not intended to be used for production/operational purposes.

codeset.name: BiologicallyDerivedProductCategory
codeset.description: Biologically Derived Product Category.

code.name: Organ
code.description: A collection of tissues joined in a structural unit to serve a common function.

code.name: Tissue
code.description: An ensemble of similar cells and their extracellular matrix from the same origin that together carry out a specific function.

codeset.name: PatientMedicineChangeTypes
codeset.description: Example Item Flags for the List Resource. In this case, these are the kind of flags that would be used on a medication list at the end of a consultation.

code.name: Unchanged
code.description: No change has been made to the status of this medicine item.

code.name: Changed
code.description: The medicine item has changed. The change may be described in an extension (not defined yet)

code.name: Cancelled
code.description: The prescription for this medicine item was cancelled by an authorized health care provider. The patient may be advised to complete the course of the prescribed medicine. This advice is a clinical decision made based on assessment of the patient's clinical condition.

code.name: Prescribed
code.description: A new medicine item has been prescribed

code.name: Ceased
code.description: Administration of this medication item that the patient is currently taking is stopped or recommended to be stopped (i.e. instructed to be ceased by a health care provider). This cessation is anticipated to be permanent. The Change Description should describe the reason for cessation. Example uses: the medication in question is considered ineffective or has caused serious adverse effects. This value applies both to the cessation of a medication that is prescribed by another healthcare provider or patient self-administration of OTC medicines.

code.name: Suspended
code.description: Administration of this medication item that the patient is currently taking is on hold, or instructed or recommended by a health care provider to be temporarily stopped, or subject to clinical review (i.e. the stop may be temporary or permanent depending on the outcome of clinical review), or temporarily suspended as a pre-requisite to certain surgical or diagnostic procedures.

codeset.name: DeviceRegulatoryIdentifierType
codeset.description: The type of regulatory identifier.

code.name: License
code.description: The identifier is a license number.

codeset.name: TaskStatus
codeset.description: The current status of the task.

code.name: Draft
code.description: The task is not yet ready to be acted upon.

code.name: Requested
code.description: The task is ready to be acted upon and action is sought.

code.name: Received
code.description: A potential performer has claimed ownership of the task and is evaluating whether to perform it.

code.name: Accepted
code.description: The potential performer has agreed to execute the task but has not yet started work.

code.name: Rejected
code.description: The potential performer who claimed ownership of the task has decided not to execute it prior to performing any action.

code.name: Ready
code.description: The task is ready to be performed, but no action has yet been taken. Used in place of requested/received/accepted/rejected when request assignment and acceptance is a given.

code.name: In Progress
code.description: The task has been started but is not yet complete.

code.name: On Hold
code.description: The task has been started but work has been paused.

code.name: Failed
code.description: The task was attempted but could not be completed due to some error.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The task should never have existed and is retained only because of the possibility it may have used.

codeset.name: DeviceDispenseStatusReasonCodes
codeset.description: DeviceDispense Status Reason Codes

code.name: Out of Stock
code.description: The device was not dispensed because it was not available.

code.name: Off market
code.description: The device was not dispensed because it is of-market - for example not authorized, withdrawn or recalled.

code.name: Contraindication
code.description: The device was not dispensed because a contraindication was found - for example pregnancy, allergy to a device component...

code.name: Incompatible device
code.description: The device was not dispensed because an incompatibility has been found with the device or between the device and other devices being used in the same context.

code.name: Order expired
code.description: The device was not dispensed because the order has expired or been invalidated.

code.name: Verbal order
code.description: The device not dispensed because there was a verbal order.

codeset.name: PublicationStatus
codeset.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

code.name: Draft
code.description: This resource is still under development and is not yet considered to be ready for normal use.

code.name: Active
code.description: This resource is ready for normal use.

code.name: Retired
code.description: This resource has been withdrawn or superseded and should no longer be used.

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The authoring system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this resource. Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, it's just not known which one.

codeset.name: ClaimProcessingCodes
codeset.description: This value set includes Claim Processing Outcome codes.

code.name: Queued
code.description: The Claim/Pre-authorization/Pre-determination has been received but processing has not begun.

code.name: Processing Complete
code.description: The processing has completed without errors

code.name: Error
code.description: One or more errors have been detected in the Claim

code.name: Partial Processing
code.description: No errors have been detected in the Claim and some of the adjudication has been performed.

codeset.name: MedicationIngredientStrengthCodes
codeset.description: Medication Ingredient Strength Codes

codeset.name: ImagingStudyStatus
codeset.description: The status of the ImagingStudy.

code.name: Registered
code.description: The existence of the imaging study is registered, but there is nothing yet available.

code.name: Available
code.description: At least one instance has been associated with this imaging study.

code.name: Cancelled
code.description: The imaging study is unavailable because the imaging study was not started or not completed (also sometimes called "aborted").

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The imaging study has been withdrawn following a previous final release. This electronic record should never have existed, though it is possible that real-world decisions were based on it. (If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be "cancelled" rather than "entered-in-error".).

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this request. Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, it's just not known which one.

codeset.name: ContractDefinitionType
codeset.description: This CodeSystem contains FHIR-defined contract definition types.

codeset.name: BiologicallyDerivedProductCodes
codeset.description: This code system is a subset of ISBT 128 Product Description Codes published by ICCBBA as a part of the ISBT 128 standard. These codes support characterization and classification of medical products of human origin inclusive of processing conditions such as additives, volumes and handling conditions.

code.name: HPC, APHERESIS|NS/XX/<=-120C|10% DMSO|Cryopreserved|Mobilized
code.description: HPC, Apheresis product, 10% DMSO, mobilized, cryopreserved at <=-120C

code.name: HPC, APHERESIS|NS/XX/<=-120C|5% DMSO|Cryopreserved|Mobilized
code.description: HPC, Apheresis product, 5% DMSO, mobilized, cryopreserved at <=-120C

code.name: HPC, APHERESIS|None/XX/refg|3rd Party Comp:Yes|Other Additives:Yes|Mobilized|CD34 enriched
code.description: HPC, Apheresis product, third party components added, other additives added, mobilized, CD34 enriched, stored at refrigeration temperatures

code.name: HPC, MARROW|NS/XX/rt|Plasma reduced
code.description: HPC, Marrow, plasma reduced, stored at room temperature

code.name: HPC, MARROW|NS/XX/<=-150C|10% DMSO|3rd Party Comp:Yes|Cryopreserved|RBC reduced
code.description: HPC, MARROW|NS/XX/<=-150C|10% DMSO|3rd Party Comp:Yes|Cryopreserved|RBC reduced

code.name: Apheresis RED BLOOD CELLS|ACD-A/XX/refg|Irradiated|1st container
code.description: RED BLOOD CELLS Apheresis product, ACD-A, Irradiated,1st container, stored at refrigeration temperatures

code.name: BONE, FEMUR|Frozen|Right|Radiation sterilization
code.description: BONE, FEMUR, Right, sterilized by radiation, stored at frozen temperatures

codeset.name: ObservationStatus
codeset.description: Codes providing the status of an observation.

code.name: Registered
code.description: The existence of the observation is registered, but there is no result yet available.

code.name: Preliminary
code.description: This is an initial or interim observation: data may be incomplete or unverified.

code.name: Final
code.description: The observation is complete and there are no further actions needed. Additional information such "released", "signed", etc. would be represented using [Provenance](provenance.html) which provides not only the act but also the actors and dates and other related data. These act states would be associated with an observation status of `preliminary` until they are all completed and then a status of `final` would be applied.

code.name: Amended
code.description: Subsequent to being Final, the observation has been modified subsequent. This includes updates/new information and corrections.

code.name: Cancelled
code.description: The observation is unavailable because the measurement was not started or not completed (also sometimes called "aborted").

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The observation has been withdrawn following previous final release. This electronic record should never have existed, though it is possible that real-world decisions were based on it. (If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be "cancelled" rather than "entered-in-error".).

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The authoring/source system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this observation. Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, but the authoring/source system does not know which.

codeset.name: QuestionnaireResponseStatus
codeset.description: Lifecycle status of the questionnaire response.

code.name: In Progress
code.description: This QuestionnaireResponse has been partially filled out with answers but changes or additions are still expected to be made to it.

code.name: Completed
code.description: This QuestionnaireResponse has been filled out with answers and the current content is regarded as definitive.

code.name: Amended
code.description: This QuestionnaireResponse has been filled out with answers, then marked as complete, yet changes or additions have been made to it afterwards.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: This QuestionnaireResponse was entered in error and voided.

code.name: Stopped
code.description: This QuestionnaireResponse has been partially filled out with answers but has been abandoned. No subsequent changes can be made.

codeset.name: ListStatus
codeset.description: The current state of the list.

code.name: Current
code.description: The list is considered to be an active part of the patient's record.

code.name: Retired
code.description: The list is "old" and should no longer be considered accurate or relevant.

code.name: Entered In Error
code.description: The list was never accurate. It is retained for medico-legal purposes only.

codeset.name: CodeSearchSupport
codeset.description: The degree to which the server supports the code search parameter on ValueSet, if it is supported.

code.name: In Compose
code.description: The search for code on ValueSet returns ValueSet resources where the code is included in the extensional definition of the ValueSet.

code.name: In Expansion
code.description: The search for code on ValueSet returns ValueSet resources where the code is contained in the ValueSet expansion.

code.name: In Compose Or Expansion
code.description: The search for code on ValueSet returns ValueSet resources where the code is included in the extensional definition or contained in the ValueSet expansion.

codeset.name: CitationClassificationType
codeset.description: Citation classification type

code.name: Citation Source
code.description: Citation repository where this citation was created or copied from

code.name: MEDLINE Citation Owner
code.description: The party responsible for creating and validating the MEDLINE citation

code.name: FEvIR Platform Use
code.description: Used for Citation sharing on the Fast Evidence Interoperability Resources (FEvIR) Platform

codeset.name: CitationSummaryStyle
codeset.description: The format for display of the citation.

code.name: Vancouver style
code.description: Citation style used by International Committee of Medical Journal Editors and maintained by US National Library of Medicine.

code.name: American Psychological Association 7th edition
code.description: APA 7th edition (October 2019) used by Education, Psychology and Sciences.

code.name: American Psychological Association 6th edition
code.description: APA 6th edition used by Education, Psychology and Sciences.

code.name: Modern Language Association 8th edition
code.description: MLA 8th edition used by the Humanities.

code.name: Cochrane Style
code.description: Used by Cochrane reviews, example: Huang, M, Tang T, Pang, P, Li, M, Ma R, Lu, J, et al. Treating COVID-19 with Chloroquine. J Mol Cell Biol 2020; 12(4):322-5.

code.name: Chicago Style Version 17 Author Date
code.description: Used by Business, History and the Fine Arts.

code.name: Chicago Style Version 17 Full note
code.description: Used by Business, History and the Fine Arts.

code.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
Computable Publishing
code.description: Citation style to report human-readable and/or machine-readable access paths, example: Alper BS, Dehnbostel J, Shahin K. 14-day mortality remdesivir vs placebo meta-analysis (ACTT-1, Wang et al, WHO SOLIDARITY). Fast Evidence Interoperability Resources (FEvIR) Platform, entry 55, version 4. Created 2020 Dec 17. Revised 2020 Dec 21. Accessed 2021 Mar 13. Computable resource at: https://fevir.net/resources/Evidence/55.

codeset.name: LocationMode
codeset.description: Indicates whether a resource instance represents a specific location or a class of locations.

code.name: Instance
code.description: The Location resource represents a specific instance of a location (e.g. Operating Theatre 1A).

code.name: Kind
code.description: The Location represents a class of locations (e.g. Any Operating Theatre) although this class of locations could be constrained within a specific boundary (such as organization, or parent location, address etc.).

codeset.name: PropertyRepresentation
codeset.description: How a property is represented when serialized.

code.name: XML Attribute
code.description: In XML, this property is represented as an attribute not an element.

code.name: XML Text
code.description: This element is represented using the XML text attribute (primitives only).

code.name: Type Attribute
code.description: The type of this element is indicated using xsi:type.

code.name: CDA Text Format
code.description: Use CDA narrative instead of XHTML.

code.name: XHTML
code.description: The property is represented using XHTML.

codeset.name: ConsentState
codeset.description: Indicates the state of the consent.

code.name: Pending
code.description: The consent is in development or awaiting use but is not yet intended to be acted upon.

code.name: Active
code.description: The consent is to be followed and enforced.

code.name: Inactive
code.description: The consent is terminated or replaced.

code.name: Abandoned
code.description: The consent development has been terminated prior to completion.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The consent was created wrongly (e.g. wrong patient) and should be ignored.

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The resource is in an indeterminate state.

codeset.name: GuidanceModuleCode
codeset.description: Example guidance module codes.

code.name: Opioid CDS
code.description: Clinical Decision Support for Opioid Prescribing.

code.name: ANC CDS
code.description: Clinical Decision Support for Antenatal Care.

codeset.name: TransportStatus
codeset.description: Status of transport.

code.name: Patient not available
code.description: The patient was not available for transport.

code.name: Specimen not available
code.description: The specimen was not available for transport.

code.name: Wrong request data
code.description: Wrong data in the transport request.

code.name: In route accident
code.description: An accident has occurred in route.

code.name: Request not acknowledged
code.description: The transport request was not acknowledged.

codeset.name: ContractStatus
codeset.description: This CodeSystem contains FHIR-defined contract status types. Each definition includes usage notes explaining the precedence order in contract lifecycle - i.e., while only some stages are required, the order in which they may occur is deterministic; and a map to comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes. It follows guidance about use of status codes in FHIR in [the Status Codes Grid](sc.html).

code.name: Amended
code.description: Contract is augmented with additional information to correct errors in a predecessor or to updated values in a predecessor. Usage: Contract altered within effective time. Precedence Order = 9. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: revised; replaced.

code.name: Appended
code.description: Contract is augmented with additional information that was missing from a predecessor Contract. Usage: Contract altered within effective time. Precedence Order = 9. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: updated, replaced.

code.name: Cancelled
code.description: Contract is terminated due to failure of the Grantor and/or the Grantee to fulfil one or more contract provisions. Usage: Abnormal contract termination. Precedence Order = 10. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: stopped; failed; aborted.

code.name: Disputed
code.description: Contract is pended to rectify failure of the Grantor or the Grantee to fulfil contract provision(s). E.g., Grantee complaint about Grantor's failure to comply with contract provisions. Usage: Contract pended. Precedence Order = 7. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: on hold; pended; suspended.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: Contract was created in error. No Precedence Order. Status may be applied to a Contract with any status.

code.name: Executable
code.description: Contract execution pending; may be executed when either the Grantor or the Grantee accepts the contract provisions by signing. I.e., where either the Grantor or the Grantee has signed, but not both. E.g., when an insurance applicant signs the insurers application, which references the policy.Usage: Optional first step of contract execution activity. May be skipped and contracting activity moves directly to executed state. Precedence Order = 3. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: draft; preliminary; planned; intended; active.

code.name: Executed
code.description: Contract is activated for period stipulated when both the Grantor and Grantee have signed it. Usage: Required state for normal completion of contracting activity. Precedence Order = 6. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: accepted; completed.

code.name: Negotiable
code.description: Contract execution is suspended while either or both the Grantor and Grantee propose and consider new or revised contract provisions. I.e., where the party which has not signed proposes changes to the terms. E .g., a life insurer declines to agree to the signed application because the life insurer has evidence that the applicant, who asserted to being younger or a non-smoker to get a lower premium rate - but offers instead to agree to a higher premium based on the applicants actual age or smoking status. Usage: Optional contract activity between executable and executed state. Precedence Order = 4. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: in progress; review; held.

code.name: Offered
code.description: Contract is a proposal by either the Grantor or the Grantee. Aka - A Contract hard copy or electronic 'template', 'form' or 'application'. E.g., health insurance application; consent directive form. Usage: Beginning of contract negotiation, which may have been completed as a precondition because used for 0..* contracts. Precedence Order = 2. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: requested; new.

code.name: Policy
code.description: Contract template is available as the basis for an application or offer by the Grantor or Grantee. E.g., health insurance policy; consent directive policy. Usage: Required initial contract activity, which may have been completed as a precondition because used for 0..* contracts. Precedence Order = 1. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: proposed; intended.

code.name: Rejected
code.description: Execution of the Contract is not completed because either or both the Grantor and Grantee decline to accept some or all of the contract provisions. Usage: Optional contract activity between executable and abnormal termination. Precedence Order = 5. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: stopped; cancelled.

code.name: Renewed
code.description: Beginning of a successor Contract at the termination of predecessor Contract lifecycle. Usage: Follows termination of a preceding Contract that has reached its expiry date. Precedence Order = 13. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: superseded.

code.name: Revoked
code.description: A Contract that is rescinded. May be required prior to replacing with an updated Contract. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: nullified.

code.name: Resolved
code.description: Contract is reactivated after being pended because of faulty execution. *E.g., competency of the signer(s), or where the policy is substantially different from and did not accompany the application/form so that the applicant could not compare them. Aka - ''reactivated''. Usage: Optional stage where a pended contract is reactivated. Precedence Order = 8. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: reactivated.

code.name: Terminated
code.description: Contract reaches its expiry date.It might or might not be renewed or renegotiated. Usage: Normal end of contract period. Precedence Order = 12. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: Obsoleted.

codeset.name: RequestIntent
codeset.description: Codes indicating the degree of authority/intentionality associated with a request.

code.name: Proposal
code.description: The request is a suggestion made by someone/something that does not have an intention to ensure it occurs and without providing an authorization to act.

code.name: Plan
code.description: The request represents an intention to ensure something occurs without providing an authorization for others to act.

code.name: Directive
code.description: The request represents a legally binding instruction authored by a Patient or RelatedPerson.

code.name: Order
code.description: The request represents a request/demand and authorization for action by the requestor.

code.name: Option
code.description: The request represents a component or option for a RequestOrchestration that establishes timing, conditionality and/or other constraints among a set of requests. Refer to [[[RequestOrchestration]]] for additional information on how this status is used.

codeset.name: Use
codeset.description: The purpose of the Claim: predetermination, preauthorization, claim.

code.name: Claim
code.description: The treatment is complete and this represents a Claim for the services.

code.name: Preauthorization
code.description: The treatment is proposed and this represents a Pre-authorization for the services.

code.name: Predetermination
code.description: The treatment is proposed and this represents a Pre-determination for the services.

codeset.name: GroupType
codeset.description: Types of resources that are part of group.

code.name: Practitioner
code.description: Group contains healthcare practitioner resources (Practitioner or PractitionerRole).

codeset.name: SubstanceWeightType
codeset.description: SubstanceWeightType

codeset.name: ClinicalUseDefinitionCategory
codeset.description: ClinicalUseDefinitionCategory

code.name: Effects on Ability to Drive and Use Machines
code.description: Effects on Ability to Drive and Use Machines

codeset.name: LocationStatus
codeset.description: Indicates whether the location is still in use.

code.name: Inactive
code.description: The location is no longer used.

codeset.name: AddressType
codeset.description: The type of an address (physical / postal).

code.name: Postal
code.description: Mailing addresses - PO Boxes and care-of addresses.

code.name: Physical
code.description: A physical address that can be visited.

code.name: Postal & Physical
code.description: An address that is both physical and postal.

codeset.name: ExplanationOfBenefitStatus
codeset.description: A code specifying the state of the resource instance.

code.name: Active
code.description: The resource instance is currently in-force.

code.name: Cancelled
code.description: The resource instance is withdrawn, rescinded or reversed.

code.name: Draft
code.description: A new resource instance the contents of which is not complete.

code.name: Entered In Error
code.description: The resource instance was entered in error.

codeset.name: FamilyHistoryStatus
codeset.description: A code that identifies the status of the family history record.

code.name: Partial
code.description: Some health information is known and captured, but not complete - see notes for details.

code.name: Completed
code.description: All available related health information is captured as of the date (and possibly time) when the family member history was taken.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: This instance should not have been part of this patient's medical record.

code.name: Health Unknown
code.description: Health information for this family member is unavailable/unknown.

codeset.name: FilterOperator
codeset.description: The kind of operation to perform as a part of a property based filter.

code.name: Equals
code.description: The specified property of the code equals the provided value.

code.name: Is A (by subsumption)
code.description: Includes all concept ids that have a transitive is-a relationship with the concept Id provided as the value, including the provided concept itself (include descendant codes and self).

code.name: Descendent Of (by subsumption)
code.description: Includes all concept ids that have a transitive is-a relationship with the concept Id provided as the value, excluding the provided concept itself (i.e. include descendant codes only).

code.name: Not (Is A) (by subsumption)
code.description: The specified property of the code does not have an is-a relationship with the provided value.

code.name: Regular Expression
code.description: The specified property of the code matches the regex specified in the provided value.

code.name: In Set
code.description: The specified property of the code is in the set of codes or concepts specified in the provided value (comma-separated list).

code.name: Not in Set
code.description: The specified property of the code is not in the set of codes or concepts specified in the provided value (comma-separated list).

code.name: Generalizes (by Subsumption)
code.description: Includes all concept ids that have a transitive is-a relationship from the concept Id provided as the value, including the provided concept itself (i.e. include ancestor codes and self).

code.name: Child Of
code.description: Only concepts with a direct hierarchical relationship to the index code and no other concepts. This does not include the index code in the output.

code.name: Descendent Leaf
code.description: Includes concept ids that have a transitive is-a relationship with the concept Id provided as the value, but which do not have any concept ids with transitive is-a relationships with themselves.

code.name: Exists
code.description: The specified property of the code has at least one value (if the specified value is true; if the specified value is false, then matches when the specified property of the code has no values).

codeset.name: IngredientRole
codeset.description: A classification of the ingredient identifying its purpose within the product, e.g. active, inactive.

code.name: Raw materials used in the manufacture of the product
code.description: Raw materials used in the manufacture of the product

codeset.name: ClaimProcessingCodes
codeset.description: This value set includes Claim Processing Outcome codes.

code.name: Queued
code.description: The Claim/Pre-authorization/Pre-determination has been received but processing has not begun.

code.name: Processing Complete
code.description: The processing has completed without errors

code.name: Error
code.description: One or more errors have been detected in the Claim

code.name: Partial Processing
code.description: No errors have been detected in the Claim and some of the adjudication has been performed.

codeset.name: RemittanceOutcome
codeset.description: The outcome of the processing.

code.name: Partial
code.description: No errors have been detected and some of the adjudication has been performed.

codeset.name: SlotStatus
codeset.description: The free/busy status of the slot.

code.name: Busy
code.description: Indicates that the time interval is busy because one or more events have been scheduled for that interval.

code.name: Free
code.description: Indicates that the time interval is free for scheduling.

code.name: Busy (Unavailable)
code.description: Indicates that the time interval is busy and that the interval cannot be scheduled.

code.name: Busy (Tentative)
code.description: Indicates that the time interval is busy because one or more events have been tentatively scheduled for that interval.

code.name: Entered in error
code.description: This instance should not have been part of this patient's medical record.

codeset.name: MedicationStatementStatusCodes
codeset.description: MedicationStatement Status Codes

code.name: Recorded
code.description: The action of recording the medication statement is finished.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: Some of the actions that are implied by the medication usage may have occurred. For example, the patient may have taken some of the medication. Clinical decision support systems should take this status into account.

code.name: Draft
code.description: The medication usage is draft or preliminary.

codeset.name: BiologicallyDerivedProductDispenseMatchStatus
codeset.description: Biologically derived product dispense - match status

code.name: Crossmatched
code.description: The product has been serologically or electronically crossmatched for the recipient

code.name: Selected
code.description: The product has been selected for the specific use of the recipient

code.name: Unmatched
code.description: No specific matching has been carried out

code.name: Least incompatible
code.description: The product has been selected through crossmatching as least incompatible

codeset.name: DeviceDefinitionRelationType
codeset.description: The type of relation between devices.

code.name: Replaces
code.description: The current device replaces the linked device.

code.name: Previous
code.description: The current device is a previous device and has been replaced by the linked device.

codeset.name: NamingSystemIdentifierType
codeset.description: Identifies the style of unique identifier used to identify a namespace.

code.name: UUID
code.description: A universally unique identifier of the form a5afddf4-e880-459b-876e-e4591b0acc11.

code.name: URI
code.description: A uniform resource identifier (ideally a URL - uniform resource locator); e.g. http://unitsofmeasure.org.

code.name: IRI stem
code.description: An IRI string that can be prepended to the code to obtain a concept IRI for RDF applications. This should be a valid, absolute IRI as defined in RFC 3987. See rdf.html#iri-stem for details on how this value may be used.

code.name: V2CSMNemonic
code.description: A short string published by HL7 for use in the V2 family of standsrds to idenfify a code system in the V12 coded data types CWE, CNE, and CF. The code values are also published by HL7 at http://www.hl7.org/Special/committees/vocab/table_0396/index.cfm

code.name: Other
code.description: Some other type of unique identifier; e.g. HL7-assigned reserved string such as LN for LOINC.

codeset.name: AllergyIntoleranceCategory
codeset.description: Category of an identified substance associated with allergies or intolerances.

code.name: Food
code.description: Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.

code.name: Medication
code.description: Substances administered to achieve a physiological effect.

code.name: Environment
code.description: Any substances that are encountered in the environment, including any substance not already classified as food, medication, or biologic.

code.name: Biologic
code.description: A preparation that is synthesized from living organisms or their products, especially a human or animal protein, such as a hormone or antitoxin, that is used as a diagnostic, preventive, or therapeutic agent. Examples of biologic medications include: vaccines; allergenic extracts, which are used for both diagnosis and treatment (for example, allergy shots); gene therapies; cellular therapies. There are other biologic products, such as tissues, which are not typically associated with allergies.

codeset.name: AccountStatus
codeset.description: Indicates whether the account is available to be used.

code.name: Active
code.description: This account is active and may be used.

code.name: Inactive
code.description: This account is inactive and should not be used to track financial information.

code.name: Entered in error
code.description: This instance should not have been part of this patient's medical record.

codeset.name: MedicationDispenseStatusCodes
codeset.description: Medication Dispense Status Codes

code.name: Preparation
code.description: The core event has not started yet, but some staging activities have begun (e.g. initial compounding or packaging of medication). Preparation stages may be tracked for billing purposes.

code.name: In Progress
code.description: The dispensed product is ready for pickup.

code.name: Cancelled
code.description: The dispensed product was not and will never be picked up by the patient.

code.name: On Hold
code.description: The dispense process is paused while waiting for an external event to reactivate the dispense. For example, new stock has arrived or the prescriber has called.

code.name: Completed
code.description: The dispensed product has been picked up.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The dispense was entered in error and therefore nullified.

code.name: Stopped
code.description: Actions implied by the dispense have been permanently halted, before all of them occurred.

code.name: Declined
code.description: The dispense was declined and not performed.

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The authoring system does not know which of the status values applies for this medication dispense. Note: this concept is not to be used for other - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, it's just now known which one.

codeset.name: OperationKind
codeset.description: Whether an operation is a normal operation or a query.

code.name: Operation
code.description: This operation is invoked as an operation.

code.name: Query
code.description: This operation is a named query, invoked using the search mechanism.

codeset.name: ContactPointUse
codeset.description: Use of contact point.

code.name: Home
code.description: A communication contact point at a home; attempted contacts for business purposes might intrude privacy and chances are one will contact family or other household members instead of the person one wishes to call. Typically used with urgent cases, or if no other contacts are available.

code.name: Work
code.description: An office contact point. First choice for business related contacts during business hours.

code.name: Temp
code.description: A temporary contact point. The period can provide more detailed information.

code.name: Old
code.description: This contact point is no longer in use (or was never correct, but retained for records).

code.name: Mobile
code.description: A telecommunication device that moves and stays with its owner. May have characteristics of all other use codes, suitable for urgent matters, not the first choice for routine business.

codeset.name: SubstanceNameType
codeset.description: SubstanceNameType

codeset.name: ActionReasonCode
codeset.description: Provides examples of reasons for actions to be performed.

code.name: Off pathway
code.description: The action should be performed because the patient was determined to be off pathway.

code.name: Risk assessment
code.description: The action should be performed based on a particular risk assessment.

code.name: Care gap detected
code.description: The action should be performed to address a detected care gap.

code.name: Drug-drug interaction
code.description: The action should be performed to address a detected potential drug-drug interaction.

code.name: Quality measure
code.description: The action should be performed to bring the patient's care in line with a quality measure.

codeset.name: ChargeItemStatus
codeset.description: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of a ChargeItem.

code.name: Planned
code.description: The charge item has been entered, but the charged service is not yet complete, so it shall not be billed yet but might be used in the context of pre-authorization.

code.name: Billable
code.description: The charge item is ready for billing.

code.name: Not billable
code.description: The charge item has been determined to be not billable (e.g. due to rules associated with the billing code).

code.name: Aborted
code.description: The processing of the charge was aborted.

code.name: Billed
code.description: The charge item has been billed (e.g. a billing engine has generated financial transactions by applying the associated ruled for the charge item to the context of the Encounter, and placed them into Claims/Invoices.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The charge item has been entered in error and should not be processed for billing.

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The authoring system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this charge item Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, it's just not known which one.

codeset.name: SearchComparator
codeset.description: What Search Comparator Codes are supported in search.

code.name: Equals
code.description: the value for the parameter in the resource is equal to the provided value.

code.name: Not Equals
code.description: the value for the parameter in the resource is not equal to the provided value.

code.name: Greater Than
code.description: the value for the parameter in the resource is greater than the provided value.

code.name: Less Than
code.description: the value for the parameter in the resource is less than the provided value.

code.name: Greater or Equals
code.description: the value for the parameter in the resource is greater or equal to the provided value.

code.name: Less of Equal
code.description: the value for the parameter in the resource is less or equal to the provided value.

code.name: Starts After
code.description: the value for the parameter in the resource starts after the provided value.

code.name: Ends Before
code.description: the value for the parameter in the resource ends before the provided value.

code.name: Approximately
code.description: the value for the parameter in the resource is approximately the same to the provided value.

codeset.name: ResearchStudyPrimaryPurposeType
codeset.description: Codes for the main intent of a research study.

code.name: Treatment
code.description: One or more interventions are being evaluated for treating a disease, syndrome, or condition.

code.name: Prevention
code.description: One or more interventions are being assessed for preventing the development of a specific disease or health condition.

code.name: Diagnostic
code.description: One or more interventions are being evaluated for identifying a disease or health condition.

code.name: Supportive Care
code.description: One or more interventions are evaluated for maximizing comfort, minimizing side effects, or mitigating against a decline in the participant's health or function.

code.name: Screening
code.description: One or more interventions are assessed or examined for identifying a condition, or risk factors for a condition, in people who are not yet known to have the condition or risk factor.

code.name: Health Services Research
code.description: One or more interventions for evaluating the delivery, processes, management, organization, or financing of healthcare.

code.name: Basic Science
code.description: One or more interventions for examining the basic mechanism of action (for example, physiology or biomechanics of an intervention).

code.name: Device Feasibility
code.description: An intervention of a device product is being evaluated to determine the feasibility of the product or to test a prototype device and not health outcomes. Such studies are conducted to confirm the design and operating specifications of a device before beginning a full clinical trial.

codeset.name: TypeDerivationRule
codeset.description: How a type relates to its baseDefinition.

code.name: Specialization
code.description: This definition defines a new type that adds additional elements and optionally additional rules to the base type.

code.name: Constraint
code.description: This definition adds additional rules to an existing concrete type.

codeset.name: GenomicStudyChangeType
codeset.description: The change type relevant to GenomicStudy analysis.

code.name: DNA change
code.description: Change that involves Deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) sequences.

code.name: RNA change
code.description: Change that involves Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) sequences.

code.name: Protein/amino Acids change
code.description: Change that involves Amino Acid (AA) or protein sequences.

code.name: Chromosomal changes
code.description: Change that involves number or strcture of chromosomes.

code.name: Copy number variations
code.description: Change that involves copy number variations among various genomes.

codeset.name: DocumentMode
codeset.description: Whether the application produces or consumes documents.

code.name: Producer
code.description: The application produces documents of the specified type.

code.name: Consumer
code.description: The application consumes documents of the specified type.

codeset.name: RegulatedAuthorizationCaseType
codeset.description: RegulatedAuthorizationCaseType

code.name: Review of a Suspension of MA
code.description: Review of a Suspension of MA

codeset.name: ResearchStudyObjectiveType
codeset.description: Codes for the kind of study objective.

code.name: Primary
code.description: The main question to be answered, and the one that drives any statistical planning for the study-e.g., calculation of the sample size to provide the appropriate power for statistical testing.

code.name: Secondary
code.description: Question to be answered in the study that is of lesser importance than the primary objective.

code.name: Exploratory
code.description: Exploratory questions to be answered in the study.

codeset.name: ActionGroupingBehavior
codeset.description: Defines organization behavior of a group.

code.name: Visual Group
code.description: Any group marked with this behavior should be displayed as a visual group to the end user.

code.name: Logical Group
code.description: A group with this behavior logically groups its sub-elements, and may be shown as a visual group to the end user, but it is not required to do so.

code.name: Sentence Group
code.description: A group of related alternative actions is a sentence group if the target referenced by the action is the same in all the actions and each action simply constitutes a different variation on how to specify the details for the target. For example, two actions that could be in a SentenceGroup are "aspirin, 500 mg, 2 times per day" and "aspirin, 300 mg, 3 times per day". In both cases, aspirin is the target referenced by the action, and the two actions represent different options for how aspirin might be ordered for the patient. Note that a SentenceGroup would almost always have an associated selection behavior of "AtMostOne", unless it's a required action, in which case, it would be "ExactlyOne".

codeset.name: AdverseEventActuality
codeset.description: Overall nature of the adverse event, e.g. real or potential.

code.name: Adverse Event
code.description: The adverse event actually happened regardless of whether anyone was affected or harmed.

codeset.name: SubscriptionPayloadContent
codeset.description: Codes to represent how much resource content to send in the notification payload.

code.name: Empty
code.description: No resource content is transacted in the notification payload.

code.name: Id-only
code.description: Only the resource id is transacted in the notification payload.

code.name: Full-resource
code.description: The entire resource is transacted in the notification payload.

codeset.name: ObservationDataType
codeset.description: Permitted data type for observation value.

code.name: CodeableConcept
code.description: A coded concept from a reference terminology and/or text.

code.name: Range
code.description: A set of values bounded by low and high.

code.name: Ratio
code.description: A ratio of two Quantity values - a numerator and a denominator.

code.name: SampledData
code.description: A series of measurements taken by a device.

code.name: time
code.description: A time during the day, in the format hh:mm:ss.

code.name: dateTime
code.description: A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month) as used in human communication.

code.name: Period
code.description: A time range defined by start and end date/time.

codeset.name: MedicationRequestIntentCodes
codeset.description: MedicationRequest Intent Codes

code.name: Proposal
code.description: The request is a suggestion made by someone/something that doesn't have an intention to ensure it occurs and without providing an authorization to act

code.name: Plan
code.description: The request represents an intention to ensure something occurs without providing an authorization for others to act.

code.name: Order
code.description: The request represents a request/demand and authorization for action

code.name: Option
code.description: The request represents a component or option for a RequestOrchestration that establishes timing, conditionality and/or other constraints among a set of requests.

codeset.name: EligibilityRequestPurpose
codeset.description: A code specifying the types of information being requested.

code.name: Coverage auth-requirements
code.description: The prior authorization requirements for the listed, or discovered if specified, converages for the categories of service and/or specifed biling codes are requested.

code.name: Coverage benefits
code.description: The plan benefits and optionally benefits consumed for the listed, or discovered if specified, converages are requested.

code.name: Coverage Discovery
code.description: The insurer is requested to report on any coverages which they are aware of in addition to any specifed.

code.name: Coverage Validation
code.description: A check that the specified coverages are in-force is requested.

codeset.name: AddressUse
codeset.description: The use of an address.

code.name: Home
code.description: A communication address at a home.

code.name: Work
code.description: An office address. First choice for business related contacts during business hours.

code.name: Temporary
code.description: A temporary address. The period can provide more detailed information.

code.name: Old / Incorrect
code.description: This address is no longer in use (or was never correct but retained for records).

code.name: Billing
code.description: An address to be used to send bills, invoices, receipts etc.

codeset.name: NoteType
codeset.description: The presentation types of notes.

code.name: Print (Form)
code.description: Print the note on the form.

code.name: Print (Operator)
code.description: Print the note for the operator.

codeset.name: SubstanceOpticalActivity
codeset.description: The optical rotation type of a substance.

codeset.name: GenomicStudyMethodType
codeset.description: The method type of the GenomicStudy analysis. These method types and relevant codes were pulled from [National Library of Medicine-Genetic Testing Registry](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gtr/) (NCBI-GTR) values of describing different testing methods on various levels: [major method category](https://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pub/GTR/standard_terms/Major_method_category.txt), [method category](https://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pub/GTR/standard_terms/Method_category.txt), and [primary methodology](https://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pub/GTR/standard_terms/Primary_test_methodology.txt)

codeset.name: MedDispenseAdminLocationCodes
codeset.description: Medication Dispense Administration Location Codes

code.name: Inpatient
code.description: Includes dispenses for medications to be administered or consumed in an inpatient or acute care setting.

code.name: Outpatient
code.description: Includes dispenses for medications to be administered or consumed in an outpatient setting (for example, Emergency Department, Outpatient Clinic, Outpatient Surgery, Doctor's office).

code.name: Community
code.description: Includes dispenses for medications to be administered or consumed by the patient in their home (this would include long term care or nursing homes, hospices, etc.).

codeset.name: EndpointStatus
codeset.description: The status of the endpoint.

code.name: Active
code.description: This endpoint is expected to be active and can be used.

code.name: Error
code.description: This endpoint has exceeded connectivity thresholds and is considered in an error state and should no longer be attempted to connect to until corrective action is taken.

code.name: Off
code.description: This endpoint is no longer to be used.

code.name: Entered in error
code.description: This instance should not have been part of this patient's medical record.

codeset.name: ResearchStudyArmType
codeset.description: Codes for the main intent of the study.

codeset.name: SequenceType
codeset.description: Type if a sequence -- DNA, RNA, or amino acid sequence.

codeset.name: CareTeamStatus
codeset.description: Indicates the status of the care team.

code.name: Proposed
code.description: The care team has been drafted and proposed, but not yet participating in the coordination and delivery of patient care.

code.name: Active
code.description: The care team is currently participating in the coordination and delivery of care.

code.name: Suspended
code.description: The care team is temporarily on hold or suspended and not participating in the coordination and delivery of care.

code.name: Inactive
code.description: The care team was, but is no longer, participating in the coordination and delivery of care.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The care team should have never existed.

codeset.name: ContactPointSystem
codeset.description: Telecommunications form for contact point.

code.name: Phone
code.description: The value is a telephone number used for voice calls. Use of full international numbers starting with + is recommended to enable automatic dialing support but not required.

code.name: Fax
code.description: The value is a fax machine. Use of full international numbers starting with + is recommended to enable automatic dialing support but not required.

code.name: Email
code.description: The value is an email address.

code.name: Pager
code.description: The value is a pager number. These may be local pager numbers that are only usable on a particular pager system.

code.name: URL
code.description: A contact that is not a phone, fax, pager or email address and is expressed as a URL. This is intended for various institutional or personal contacts including web sites, blogs, Skype, Twitter, Facebook, etc. Do not use for email addresses.

code.name: SMS
code.description: A contact that can be used for sending a sms message (e.g. mobile phones, some landlines).

code.name: Other
code.description: A contact that is not a phone, fax, page or email address and is not expressible as a URL. E.g. Internal mail address. This SHOULD NOT be used for contacts that are expressible as a URL (e.g. Skype, Twitter, Facebook, etc.) Extensions may be used to distinguish "other" contact types.

codeset.name: MedicationStatementAdherenceCodes
codeset.description: MedicationStatement Adherence Codes

code.name: Not Taking
code.description: The medication is not being taken.

code.name: Unknown
code.description: Whether the medication is being taken or not is not currently known.

codeset.name: DeviceProductionIdentifierInUDI
codeset.description: The production identifier(s) that are expected to appear in the UDI carrier.

code.name: Lot Number
code.description: The label includes the lot number.

code.name: Manufactured date
code.description: The label includes the manufacture date.

code.name: Serial Number
code.description: The label includes the serial number.

code.name: Expiration date
code.description: The label includes the expiration date.

code.name: Biological source
code.description: The label includes the biological source identifier.

code.name: Software Version
code.description: The label includes the software version.

codeset.name: MeasureReportType
codeset.description: The type of the measure report.

code.name: Individual
code.description: An individual report that provides information on the performance for a given measure with respect to a single subject.

code.name: Subject List
code.description: A subject list report that includes a listing of subjects that satisfied each population criteria in the measure.

code.name: Summary
code.description: A summary report that returns the number of members in each population criteria for the measure.

code.name: Data Exchange
code.description: A data exchange report that contains data-of-interest for the measure (i.e. data that is needed to calculate the measure)

codeset.name: MedicationDispenseStatusReasonCodes
codeset.description: Medication Dispense Status Reason Codes

code.name: Order Stopped
code.description: The order has been stopped by the prescriber but this fact has not necessarily captured electronically. Example: A verbal stop, a fax, etc.

code.name: Stale-dated Order
code.description: Order has not been fulfilled within a reasonable amount of time, and might not be current.

code.name: Incomplete data
