code.description: Data needed to safely act on the order which was expected to become available independent of the order is not yet available. Example: Lab results, diagnostic imaging, etc.

code.name: Product unavailable
code.description: Product not available or manufactured. Cannot supply.

code.name: Ethical/religious
code.description: The dispenser has ethical, religious or moral objections to fulfilling the order/dispensing the product.

code.name: Unable to provide care
code.description: Fulfiller not able to provide appropriate care associated with fulfilling the order. Example: Therapy requires ongoing monitoring by fulfiller and fulfiller will be ending practice, leaving town, unable to schedule necessary time, etc.

code.name: Try another treatment first
code.description: This therapy has been ordered as a backup to a preferred therapy. This order will be released when and if the preferred therapy is unsuccessful.

code.name: Prescription/Request requires clarification
code.description: Clarification is required before the order can be acted upon.

code.name: Drug level too high
code.description: The current level of the medication in the patient's system is too high. The medication is suspended to allow the level to subside to a safer level.

code.name: Admission to hospital
code.description: The patient has been admitted to a care facility and their community medications are suspended until hospital discharge.

code.name: Lab interference issues
code.description: The therapy would interfere with a planned lab test and the therapy is being withdrawn until the test is completed.

code.name: Patient not available
code.description: Patient not available for a period of time due to a scheduled therapy, leave of absence or other reason.

code.name: Patient is pregnant or breastfeeding
code.description: The patient is pregnant or breast feeding. The therapy will be resumed when the pregnancy is complete and the patient is no longer breastfeeding.

code.name: Allergy
code.description: The patient is believed to be allergic to a substance that is part of the therapy and the therapy is being temporarily withdrawn to confirm.

code.name: Drug interacts with another drug
code.description: The drug interacts with a short-term treatment that is more urgently required. This order will be resumed when the short-term treatment is complete.

code.name: Duplicate therapy
code.description: Another short-term co-occurring therapy fulfills the same purpose as this therapy. This therapy will be resumed when the co-occuring therapy is complete.

code.name: Suspected intolerance
code.description: The patient is believed to have an intolerance to a substance that is part of the therapy and the therapy is being temporarily withdrawn to confirm.

code.name: Patient scheduled for surgery
code.description: The drug is contraindicated for patients receiving surgery and the patient is scheduled to be admitted for surgery in the near future. The drug will be resumed when the patient has sufficiently recovered from the surgery.

code.name: Washout
code.description: The patient was previously receiving a medication contraindicated with the current medication. The current medication will remain on hold until the prior medication has been cleansed from their system.

code.name: Drug not available - out of stock
code.description: Drug out of stock. Cannot supply.

code.name: Drug not available - off market
code.description: Drug no longer marketed Cannot supply.

codeset.name: QuestionnaireAnswerConstraint
codeset.description: Codes that describe the types of constraints possible on a question item that has a list of permitted answers

code.name: Options only
code.description: Only values listed as answerOption or in the expansion of the answerValueSet are permitted

code.name: Options or 'type'
code.description: In addition to the values listed as answerOption or in the expansion of the answerValueSet, any other values that correspond to the specified item.type are permitted

code.name: Options or string
code.description: In addition to the values listed as answerOption or in the expansion of the answerValueSet, free-text strings are permitted. Answers will have a type of 'string'.

codeset.name: SearchModifierCode
codeset.description: A supported modifier for a search parameter.

code.name: Missing
code.description: The search parameter returns resources that have a value or not.

code.name: Exact
code.description: The search parameter returns resources that have a value that exactly matches the supplied parameter (the whole string, including casing and accents).

code.name: Contains
code.description: The search parameter returns resources that include the supplied parameter value anywhere within the field being searched.

code.name: Not
code.description: The search parameter returns resources that do not contain a match.

code.name: Text
code.description: The search parameter is processed as a string that searches text associated with the code/value - either CodeableConcept.text, Coding.display, Identifier.type.text, or Reference.display.

code.name: In
code.description: The search parameter is a URI (relative or absolute) that identifies a value set, and the search parameter tests whether the coding is in the specified value set.

code.name: Not In
code.description: The search parameter is a URI (relative or absolute) that identifies a value set, and the search parameter tests whether the coding is not in the specified value set.

code.name: Below
code.description: The search parameter tests whether the value in a resource is subsumed by the specified value (is-a, or hierarchical relationships).

code.name: Above
code.description: The search parameter tests whether the value in a resource subsumes the specified value (is-a, or hierarchical relationships).

code.name: Type
code.description: The search parameter only applies to the Resource Type specified as a modifier (e.g. the modifier is not actually :type, but :Patient etc.).

code.name: Identifier
code.description: The search parameter applies to the identifier on the resource, not the reference.

code.name: Of Type
code.description: The search parameter has the format system|code|value, where the system and code refer to an Identifier.type.coding.system and .code, and match if any of the type codes match. All 3 parts must be present.

code.name: Code Text
code.description: Tests whether the textual display value in a resource (e.g., CodeableConcept.text, Coding.display, or Reference.display) matches the supplied parameter value.

code.name: Text Advanced
code.description: Tests whether the value in a resource matches the supplied parameter value using advanced text handling that searches text associated with the code/value - e.g., CodeableConcept.text, Coding.display, or Identifier.type.text.

code.name: Iterate
code.description: The search parameter indicates an inclusion directive (_include, _revinclude) that is applied to an included resource instead of the matching resource.

codeset.name: InventoryReportStatus
codeset.description: The status of the InventoryReport.

code.name: Draft
code.description: The existence of the report is registered, but it is still without content or only some preliminary content.

code.name: Requested
code.description: The inventory report has been requested but there is no data available.

code.name: Active
code.description: This report is submitted as current.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The report has been withdrawn following a previous final release. This electronic record should never have existed, though it is possible that real-world decisions were based on it.

codeset.name: BiologicallyDerivedProductStatus
codeset.description: Biologically Derived Product Status.

code.name: Available
code.description: Product is currently available for use.

code.name: Unavailable
code.description: Product is not currently available for use.

codeset.name: BundleType
codeset.description: Indicates the purpose of a bundle - how it is intended to be used.

code.name: Document
code.description: The bundle is a document. The first resource is a Composition.

code.name: Message
code.description: The bundle is a message. The first resource is a MessageHeader.

code.name: Transaction
code.description: The bundle is a transaction - intended to be processed by a server as an atomic commit.

code.name: Transaction Response
code.description: The bundle is a transaction response. Because the response is a transaction response, the transaction has succeeded, and all responses are error free.

code.name: Batch
code.description: The bundle is a set of actions - intended to be processed by a server as a group of independent actions.

code.name: Batch Response
code.description: The bundle is a batch response. Note that as a batch, some responses may indicate failure and others success.

code.name: History List
code.description: The bundle is a list of resources from a history interaction on a server.

code.name: Search Results
code.description: The bundle is a list of resources returned as a result of a search/query interaction, operation, or message.

code.name: Collection
code.description: The bundle is a set of resources collected into a single package for ease of distribution that imposes no processing obligations or behavioral rules beyond persistence.

code.name: Subscription Notification
code.description: The bundle has been generated by a Subscription to communicate information to a client.

codeset.name: DiagnosticReportStatus
codeset.description: The status of the diagnostic report.

code.name: Registered
code.description: The existence of the report is registered, but there is nothing yet available.

code.name: Partial
code.description: This is a partial (e.g. initial, interim or preliminary) report: data in the report may be incomplete or unverified.

code.name: Final
code.description: The report is complete and verified by an authorized person.

code.name: Amended
code.description: Subsequent to being final, the report has been modified. This includes any change in the results, diagnosis, narrative text, or other content of a report that has been issued.

code.name: Cancelled
code.description: The report is unavailable because the measurement was not started or not completed (also sometimes called "aborted").

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The report has been withdrawn following a previous final release. This electronic record should never have existed, though it is possible that real-world decisions were based on it. (If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be "cancelled" rather than "entered-in-error".).

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The authoring/source system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this observation. Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, but the authoring/source system does not know which.

codeset.name: FlagStatus
codeset.description: Indicates whether this flag is active and needs to be displayed to a user, or whether it is no longer needed or was entered in error.

code.name: Active
code.description: A current flag that should be displayed to a user. A system may use the category to determine which user roles should view the flag.

code.name: Inactive
code.description: The flag no longer needs to be displayed.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The flag was added in error and should no longer be displayed.

codeset.name: AuditEventSeverity
codeset.description: The severity of the audit entry.

code.name: Emergency
code.description: System is unusable. e.g., This level should only be reported by infrastructure and should not be used by applications.

code.name: Alert
code.description: Notification should be sent to trigger action be taken. e.g., Loss of the primary network connection needing attention.

code.name: Critical
code.description: Critical conditions. e.g., A failure in the system's primary application that will reset automatically.

code.name: Error
code.description: Error conditions. e.g., An application has exceeded its file storage limit and attempts to write are failing.

code.name: Warning
code.description: Warning conditions. May indicate that an error will occur if action is not taken. e.g., A non-root file system has only 2GB remaining.

code.name: Notice
code.description: Notice messages. Normal but significant condition. Events that are unusual, but not error conditions.

code.name: Informational
code.description: Normal operational messages that require no action. e.g., An application has started, paused, or ended successfully.

code.name: Debug
code.description: Debug-level messages. Information useful to developers for debugging the application.

codeset.name: DatesEventTypeCodes
codeset.description: This value set includes sample Dates Event Type codes.

code.name: Card Issued
code.description: The date when an insurance card was issued.

code.name: Claim Received
code.description: The date when an insurer nreceived a claim, pre-authorization or predetermination.

code.name: Service Expected
code.description: The date or period on or during which the services are expected to be performed.

codeset.name: GenomicStudyType
codeset.description: The type relevant to GenomicStudy.

code.name: Alternative splicing detection
code.description: Identification of multiple different processed mRNA transcripts from the same DNA template

code.name: Chromatin conformation
code.description: Analysis of the spacial organization of chromatin within a cell

code.name: CNV detection
code.description: Detection of a change in the number of copies of a defined region of genomic DNA sequence resulting in structural variation when compared to the reference sequence

code.name: Epigenetic Alterations - histone modifications
code.description: Detection of biochemical modifications covalently bound to the N-terminal tail of a histone protein. These modifications may alter chromatin compaction and gene expression

code.name: Epigenetic Alterations -DNA methylation
code.description: Detection of the presence of an additional methyl group on a DNA nucleobase, which may alter gene transcription

code.name: Familial variant segregation
code.description: Determining if a variant identified in an individual is present in other family members

code.name: Functional variation detection
code.description: Detection of sequence variants which may alter gene expression or gene product function when compared to the reference sequence

code.name: Gene expression profiling
code.description: Measurement and characterization of activity from all gene products

code.name: Post-translational Modification Identification
code.description: Detection of biochemical modifications covalently bound to the amino acid monomers of a processed protein

code.name: SNP Detection
code.description: Determination of which nucleotide is base present at a known variable location of the genomic sequence

code.name: STR count
code.description: Quantification of the number of sequential microsatellite units in a repetitive sequence region

code.name: Structural variation detection
code.description: Detection of deletions, insertions, or rearrangements of DNA segments compared to the reference sequence

codeset.name: TitleType
codeset.description: Used to express the reason and specific aspect for the variant title, such as language and specific language.

code.name: Primary title
code.description: Main title for common use. The primary title used for representation if multiple titles exist.

code.name: Plain language title
code.description: Title using language common to lay public discourse.

code.name: Short title
code.description: Brief title (e.g. 'running title' or title used in page headers)

code.name: Different text in an earlier version
code.description: Alternative form of title in an earlier version such as epub ahead of print.

code.name: Different language
code.description: Additional form of title in a different language.

code.name: Different language derived from autotranslation
code.description: Machine translated form of title in a different language, language element codes the language into which it was translated by machine.

code.name: Different text for the same object with a different identifier
code.description: An alternative form of the title in two or more entries, e.g. in multiple medline entries

codeset.name: BiologicallyDerivedProductPropertyTypeCodes
codeset.description: Biologically Derived Product Property Type Code. This code system http://hl7.org/fhir/biologicallyderived-product-property-type-codes is a subset of the codes defined in http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/ib

codeset.name: ListMode
codeset.description: The processing mode that applies to this list.

code.name: Working List
code.description: This list is the master list, maintained in an ongoing fashion with regular updates as the real-world list it is tracking changes.

code.name: Snapshot List
code.description: This list was prepared as a snapshot. It should not be assumed to be current.

code.name: Change List
code.description: A point-in-time list that shows what changes have been made or recommended. E.g. a discharge medication list showing what was added and removed during an encounter.

codeset.name: EligibilityResponsePurpose
codeset.description: A code specifying the types of information being requested.

code.name: Coverage auth-requirements
code.description: The prior authorization requirements for the listed, or discovered if specified, converages for the categories of service and/or specifed biling codes are requested.

code.name: Coverage benefits
code.description: The plan benefits and optionally benefits consumed for the listed, or discovered if specified, converages are requested.

code.name: Coverage Discovery
code.description: The insurer is requested to report on any coverages which they are aware of in addition to any specifed.

code.name: Coverage Validation
code.description: A check that the specified coverages are in-force is requested.

codeset.name: ConditionQuestionnairePurpose
codeset.description: The use of a questionnaire.

code.name: Diff Diagnosis
code.description: A questionnaire that helps with diferential diagnosis.

code.name: Outcome
code.description: A questionnaire to check on outcomes for the patient.

codeset.name: InventoryItemStatus
codeset.description: InventoryItem Status Codes

code.name: Active
code.description: The item is active and can be referenced.

code.name: Inactive
code.description: The item is presently inactive - there may be references to it but the item is not expected to be used.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The item record was entered in error.

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The item status has not been determined.

codeset.name: ContractPublicationStatus
codeset.description: This CodeSystem contains FHIR-defined contract publication status types. Each definition includes usage notes explaining the precedence order in contract publication lifecycle - i.e., while only some stages are required, the order in which they may occur is deterministic.

code.name: Amended
code.description: Contract is augmented with additional information to correct errors in a predecessor or to updated values in a predecessor. Usage: Contract altered within effective time. Precedence Order = 9. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: revised; replaced.

code.name: Appended
code.description: Contract is augmented with additional information that was missing from a predecessor Contract. Usage: Contract altered within effective time. Precedence Order = 9. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: updated, replaced.

code.name: Cancelled
code.description: Contract is terminated due to failure of the Grantor and/or the Grantee to fulfil one or more contract provisions. Usage: Abnormal contract termination. Precedence Order = 10. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: stopped; failed; aborted.

code.name: Disputed
code.description: Contract is pended to rectify failure of the Grantor or the Grantee to fulfil contract provision(s). E.g., Grantee complaint about Grantor's failure to comply with contract provisions. Usage: Contract pended. Precedence Order = 7. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: on hold; pended; suspended.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: Contract was created in error. No Precedence Order. Status may be applied to a Contract with any status.

code.name: Executable
code.description: Contract execution pending; may be executed when either the Grantor or the Grantee accepts the contract provisions by signing. I.e., where either the Grantor or the Grantee has signed, but not both. E.g., when an insurance applicant signs the insurers application, which references the policy.Usage: Optional first step of contract execution activity. May be skipped and contracting activity moves directly to executed state. Precedence Order = 3. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: draft; preliminary; planned; intended; active.

code.name: Executed
code.description: Contract is activated for period stipulated when both the Grantor and Grantee have signed it. Usage: Required state for normal completion of contracting activity. Precedence Order = 6. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: accepted; completed.

code.name: Negotiable
code.description: Contract execution is suspended while either or both the Grantor and Grantee propose and consider new or revised contract provisions. I.e., where the party which has not signed proposes changes to the terms. E .g., a life insurer declines to agree to the signed application because the life insurer has evidence that the applicant, who asserted to being younger or a non-smoker to get a lower premium rate - but offers instead to agree to a higher premium based on the applicants actual age or smoking status. Usage: Optional contract activity between executable and executed state. Precedence Order = 4. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: in progress; review; held.

code.name: Offered
code.description: Contract is a proposal by either the Grantor or the Grantee. Aka - A Contract hard copy or electronic 'template', 'form' or 'application'. E.g., health insurance application; consent directive form. Usage: Beginning of contract negotiation, which may have been completed as a precondition because used for 0..* contracts. Precedence Order = 2. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: requested; new.

code.name: Policy
code.description: Contract template is available as the basis for an application or offer by the Grantor or Grantee. E.g., health insurance policy; consent directive policy. Usage: Required initial contract activity, which may have been completed as a precondition because used for 0..* contracts. Precedence Order = 1. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: proposed; intended.

code.name: Rejected
code.description: Execution of the Contract is not completed because either or both the Grantor and Grantee decline to accept some or all of the contract provisions. Usage: Optional contract activity between executable and abnormal termination. Precedence Order = 5. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: stopped; cancelled.

code.name: Renewed
code.description: Beginning of a successor Contract at the termination of predecessor Contract lifecycle. Usage: Follows termination of a preceding Contract that has reached its expiry date. Precedence Order = 13. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: superseded.

code.name: Revoked
code.description: A Contract that is rescinded. May be required prior to replacing with an updated Contract. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: nullified.

code.name: Resolved
code.description: Contract is reactivated after being pended because of faulty execution. *E.g., competency of the signer(s), or where the policy is substantially different from and did not accompany the application/form so that the applicant could not compare them. Aka - ''reactivated''. Usage: Optional stage where a pended contract is reactivated. Precedence Order = 8. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: reactivated.

code.name: Terminated
code.description: Contract reaches its expiry date.It might or might not be renewed or renegotiated. Usage: Normal end of contract period. Precedence Order = 12. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: Obsoleted.

codeset.name: ActionSelectionBehavior
codeset.description: Defines selection behavior of a group.

code.name: Any
code.description: Any number of the actions in the group may be chosen, from zero to all.

code.name: All
code.description: All the actions in the group must be selected as a single unit.

code.name: All Or None
code.description: All the actions in the group are meant to be chosen as a single unit: either all must be selected by the end user, or none may be selected.

code.name: Exactly One
code.description: The end user must choose one and only one of the selectable actions in the group. The user SHALL NOT choose none of the actions in the group.

code.name: At Most One
code.description: The end user may choose zero or at most one of the actions in the group.

code.name: One Or More
code.description: The end user must choose a minimum of one, and as many additional as desired.

codeset.name: AllergyIntoleranceType
codeset.description: Identification of the underlying physiological mechanism for a Reaction Risk.

code.name: Allergy
code.description: A propensity for hypersensitive reaction(s) to a substance. These reactions are most typically type I hypersensitivity, plus other "allergy-like" reactions, including pseudoallergy.

code.name: Intolerance
code.description: A propensity for adverse reactions to a substance that is judged to be not allergic or "allergy-like". These reactions are typically (but not necessarily) non-immune. They are to some degree idiosyncratic and/or patient-specific (i.e. are not a reaction that is expected to occur with most or all patients given similar circumstances).

codeset.name: EvidenceReportType
codeset.description: The kind of report, such as grouping of classifiers, search results, or human-compiled expression.

code.name: Classification
code.description: The report is primarily a listing of classifiers about the report subject.

code.name: Search Results
code.description: The report is a composition of results generated in response to a search query.

code.name: Resource Compilation
code.description: The report is a composition containing one or more FHIR resources in the content.

code.name: Structured Text
code.description: The report is a structured representation of text.

codeset.name: FormularyItemStatusCodes
codeset.description: FormularyItem Status Codes

code.name: Active
code.description: The service or product referred to by this FormularyItem is in active use within the drug database or inventory system.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The service or product referred to by this FormularyItem was entered in error within the drug database or inventory system.

code.name: Inactive
code.description: The service or product referred to by this FormularyItem is not in active use within the drug database or inventory system.

codeset.name: PropertyType
codeset.description: The type of a property value.

code.name: code (internal reference)
code.description: The property value is a code that identifies a concept defined in the code system.

code.name: Coding (external reference)
code.description: The property value is a code defined in an external code system. This may be used for translations, but is not the intent.

code.name: string
code.description: The property value is a string.

code.name: integer
code.description: The property value is an integer (often used to assign ranking values to concepts for supporting score assessments).

code.name: boolean
code.description: The property value is a boolean true | false.

code.name: dateTime
code.description: The property is a date or a date + time.

code.name: decimal
code.description: The property value is a decimal number.

codeset.name: IngredientManufacturerRole
codeset.description: The way in which this manufacturer is associated with the ingredient. For example whether it is a possible one (others allowed), or an exclusive authorized one for this ingredient. Note that this is not the manufacturing process role

code.name: Manufacturer is specifically allowed for this ingredient
code.description: Manufacturer is specifically allowed for this ingredient

code.name: Manufacturer is known to make this ingredient in general
code.description: Manufacturer is known to make this ingredient in general

code.name: Manufacturer actually makes this particular ingredient
code.description: Manufacturer actually makes this particular ingredient

codeset.name: StructureDefinitionKind
codeset.description: Defines the type of structure that a definition is describing.

code.name: Primitive Data Type
code.description: A primitive type that has a value and an extension. These can be used throughout complex datatype, Resource and extension definitions. Only the base specification can define primitive types.

code.name: Complex Data Type
code.description: A complex structure that defines a set of data elements that is suitable for use in 'resources'. The base specification defines a number of complex types, and other specifications can define additional types. These structures do not have a maintained identity.

code.name: Resource
code.description: A 'resource' - a directed acyclic graph of elements that aggregrates other types into an identifiable entity. The base FHIR resources are defined by the FHIR specification itself but other 'resources' can be defined in additional specifications (though these will not be recognized as 'resources' by the FHIR specification; i.e. they do not get end-points etc., or act as the targets of references in FHIR defined resources - though other specifications can treat them this way).

code.name: Logical
code.description: A pattern or a template that is not intended to be a real resource or complex type.

codeset.name: SubstanceWeightMethod
codeset.description: SubstanceWeightMethod

codeset.name: NutritionProductStatus
codeset.description: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of a product.

code.name: Inactive
code.description: The product is not expected or allowed to be used.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: This electronic record should never have existed, though it is possible that real-world decisions were based on it. (If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be "cancelled" rather than "entered-in-error".).

codeset.name: SupplyDeliveryStatus
codeset.description: Status of the supply delivery.

code.name: In Progress
code.description: Supply has been requested, but not delivered.

code.name: Entered In Error
code.description: This electronic record should never have existed, though it is possible that real-world decisions were based on it. (If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be "abandoned" rather than "entered-in-error".).

codeset.name: AllergyIntoleranceSeverity
codeset.description: Clinical assessment of the severity of a reaction event as a whole, potentially considering multiple different manifestations.

codeset.name: CitationStatusType
codeset.description: Citation status type

code.name: PubMed PublicationStatus of epublish
code.description: electronically published only, never published in print

code.name: PubMed PublicationStatus of aheadofprint
code.description: electronically published, but followed by print

codeset.name: SpecimenContainedPreference
codeset.description: Degree of preference of a type of conditioned specimen.

code.name: Preferred
code.description: This type of contained specimen is preferred to collect this kind of specimen.

code.name: Alternate
code.description: This type of conditioned specimen is an alternate.

codeset.name: DiscriminatorType
codeset.description: How an element value is interpreted when discrimination is evaluated.

code.name: Value
code.description: The slices have different values in the nominated element, as determined by the applicable fixed value, pattern, or required ValueSet binding.

code.name: Exists
code.description: The slices are differentiated by the presence or absence of the nominated element. There SHALL be no more than two slices. The slices are differentiated by the fact that one must have a max of 0 and the other must have a min of 1 (or more). The order in which the slices are declared doesn't matter.

code.name: Pattern
code.description: The slices have different values in the nominated element, as determined by the applicable fixed value, pattern, or required ValueSet binding. This has the same meaning as 'value' and is deprecated.

code.name: Type
code.description: The slices are differentiated by type of the nominated element.

code.name: Profile
code.description: The slices are differentiated by conformance of the nominated element to a specified profile. Note that if the path specifies .resolve() then the profile is the target profile on the reference. In this case, validation by the possible profiles is required to differentiate the slices.

code.name: Position
code.description: The slices are differentiated by their index. This is only possible if all but the last slice have min=max cardinality, and the (optional) last slice contains other undifferentiated elements.

codeset.name: AccountRelationship
codeset.description: Relationship between accounts

codeset.name: PackagingType
codeset.description: A type of packaging.

codeset.name: MedicinalProductPackageType
codeset.description: Types of medicinal product packs

codeset.name: DeviceMetricCalibrationState
codeset.description: Describes the state of a metric calibration.

code.name: Not Calibrated
code.description: The metric has not been calibrated.

code.name: Calibration Required
code.description: The metric needs to be calibrated.

code.name: Unspecified
code.description: The state of calibration of this metric is unspecified.

codeset.name: ReferenceVersionRules
codeset.description: Whether a reference needs to be version specific or version independent, or whether either can be used.

code.name: Either Specific or independent
code.description: The reference may be either version independent or version specific.

code.name: Version independent
code.description: The reference must be version independent.

code.name: Version Specific
code.description: The reference must be version specific.

codeset.name: BindingStrength
codeset.description: Indication of the degree of conformance expectations associated with a binding.

code.name: Required
code.description: To be conformant, the concept in this element SHALL be from the specified value set.

code.name: Extensible
code.description: To be conformant, the concept in this element SHALL be from the specified value set if any of the codes within the value set can apply to the concept being communicated. If the value set does not cover the concept (based on human review), alternate codings (or, data type allowing, text) may be included instead.

code.name: Preferred
code.description: Instances are encouraged to draw from the specified codes for interoperability purposes but are not required to do so to be considered conformant.

code.name: Example
code.description: Instances are not expected or even encouraged to draw from the specified value set. The value set merely provides examples of the types of concepts intended to be included.

codeset.name: ObservationReferenceRangeNormalValue
codeset.description: Codes that describe the normal value in the reference range.

code.name: Negative
code.description: The expected normal value for the observation is negative.

code.name: Absent
code.description: The expected normal value for the observation is absent.

codeset.name: OperationParameterUse
codeset.description: Whether an operation parameter is an input or an output parameter.

codeset.name: SubstanceStereochemistry
codeset.description: The stereochemistry type of a substance.

codeset.name: Status
codeset.description: The validation status of the target

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The VerificationResult record was created erroneously and is not appropriated for use.

codeset.name: AggregationMode
codeset.description: How resource references can be aggregated.

code.name: Contained
code.description: The reference is a local reference to a contained resource.

code.name: Referenced
code.description: The reference to a resource that has to be resolved externally to the resource that includes the reference.

codeset.name: MeasureReportStatus
codeset.description: The status of the measure report.

code.name: Complete
code.description: The report is complete and ready for use.

code.name: Pending
code.description: The report is currently being generated.

code.name: Error
code.description: An error occurred attempting to generate the report.

codeset.name: DeviceCorrectiveActionScope
codeset.description: The type of relation between devices.

code.name: Model
code.description: The corrective action was intended for all units of the same model.

code.name: Lot Numbers
code.description: The corrective action was intended for a specific batch of units identified by a lot number.

code.name: Serial Numbers
code.description: The corrective action was intended for an individual unit (or a set of units) individually identified by serial number.

codeset.name: DaysOfWeek
codeset.description: The days of the week.

codeset.name: PriceComponentType
codeset.description: Codes indicating the kind of the price component.

code.name: base price
code.description: the amount is the base price used for calculating the total price before applying surcharges, discount or taxes.

code.name: surcharge
code.description: the amount is a surcharge applied on the base price.

code.name: deduction
code.description: the amount is a deduction applied on the base price.

code.name: discount
code.description: the amount is a discount applied on the base price.

code.name: tax
code.description: the amount is the tax component of the total price.

code.name: informational
code.description: the amount is of informational character, it has not been applied in the calculation of the total price.

codeset.name: TestScriptScopePhaseType
codeset.description: The phase of testing for this artifact.

code.name: Integration
code.description: The internal system to system phase.

code.name: Production
code.description: The live system to system phase (Note, this may involve pii/phi data).

codeset.name: StudyDesign
codeset.description: This is a set of terms for study design characteristics.

code.name: Interventional research
code.description: A study design in which an independent variable (an exposure or intervention) is prospectively assigned or modified by the investigator to evaluate a response in the dependent variable (an effect or outcome).

code.name: Observational research
code.description: A study design in which the independent variables (exposures or interventions) are not prospectively assigned or modified by the investigator.

code.name: Comparative study design
code.description: A study design in which two or more groups are compared.

code.name: Non-comparative study design
code.description: A study design with no comparisons between groups with different exposures and no comparisons between groups with different outcomes.

code.name: Population-based design
code.description: A study design in which the unit of observation is a population or community.

code.name: Cross sectional data collection
code.description: A study design process in which data is collected at a single point in time.

code.name: Longitudinal data collection
code.description: A study design process in which data is collected at two or more points in time.

code.name: Primary data collection
code.description: A study design process in which the data are recorded and collected during the study for the purpose of the same study.

code.name: Real world data collection
code.description: A study design process in which the study data are obtained from a source of data collected during a routine process in the natural environment rather than using a process designed or controlled by the researcher.

code.name: Secondary data collection from prior research
code.description: A study design process in which the data are collected from data obtained during a different study than the current study.

code.name: Secondary data collection from a registry
code.description: A study design process in which the data are collected from a system organized to obtain and maintain uniform data for discovery and analysis, and this system is organized prior to the current study.

code.name: Multisite data collection
code.description: A study design process in which data are collected from two or more geographic locations.

code.name: Quantitative analysis
code.description: A study design process in which data are analyzed with mathematical or statistical methods and formulas.

code.name: Qualitative analysis
code.description: A study design process in which data are analyzed, without primary reliance on mathematical or statistical techniques, by coding and organizing data to provide interpretation or understanding of experiences or hypotheses.

code.name: Blinding of study participants
code.description: A study design process in which study participants are not informed of their intervention assignment.

code.name: Blinding of intervention providers
code.description: A study design process in which the people administering the intervention are not informed of the intervention assignment.

code.name: Blinding of outcome assessors
code.description: A study design process in which the people determining the outcome are not informed of the intervention assignment.

code.name: Blinding of data analysts
code.description: A study design process in which the people managing or processing the data and statistical analysis are not informed of the intervention assignment.

code.name: Allocation concealment
code.description: A study design process in which all parties influencing study enrollment and allocation to study groups are unaware of the group assignment for the study participant at the time of enrollment and allocation.

code.name: Multicentric
code.description: A study design feature in which two or more institutions are responsible for the conduct of the study.

code.name: Includes patient-reported outcome
code.description: A study design feature in which one or more outcomes are reported directly from the patient without interpretation by a clinician or researcher.

code.name: Includes patient-centered outcome
code.description: A study design feature in which one or more measures are outcomes that patients directly care about, i.e. outcomes that are directly related to patients' experience of their life.

code.name: Includes disease-oriented outcome
code.description: A study design feature in which one or more measures are outcomes that relate to a health or illness condition but are not outcomes which patients directly care about.

code.name: Includes process measure
code.description: A study design feature in which one or more outcomes are actions or behaviors of a healthcare professional or care team.

code.name: Study Goal
code.description: A study design feature specifying the intent of the study.

codeset.name: TriggeredBytype
codeset.description: Codes providing the triggeredBy type of observation.

code.name: Reflex
code.description: Performance of one or more other tests depending on the results of the initial test. This may include collection of additional specimen. While a new ServiceRequest is not required to perform the additional test, where it is still needed (e.g., requesting another laboratory to perform the reflex test), the Observation.basedOn would reference the new ServiceRequest that requested the additional test to be performed as well as the original ServiceRequest to reflect the one that provided the authorization.

code.name: Repeat (per policy)
code.description: Performance of the same test again with the same parameters/settings/solution.

code.name: Re-run (per policy)
code.description: Performance of the same test but with different parameters/settings/solution.

codeset.name: IssueType
codeset.description: A code that describes the type of issue.

code.name: Invalid Content
code.description: Content invalid against the specification or a profile.

code.name: Security Problem
code.description: An authentication/authorization/permissions issue of some kind.

code.name: Processing Failure
code.description: Processing issues. These are expected to be final e.g. there is no point resubmitting the same content unchanged.

code.name: Transient Issue
code.description: Transient processing issues. The system receiving the message may be able to resubmit the same content once an underlying issue is resolved.

code.name: Informational Note
code.description: A message unrelated to the processing success of the completed operation (examples of the latter include things like reminders of password expiry, system maintenance times, etc.).

codeset.name: RequestStatus
codeset.description: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of a request.

code.name: Draft
code.description: The request has been created but is not yet complete or ready for action.

code.name: Active
code.description: The request is in force and ready to be acted upon.

code.name: On Hold
code.description: The request (and any implicit authorization to act) has been temporarily withdrawn but is expected to resume in the future.

code.name: Revoked
code.description: The request (and any implicit authorization to act) has been terminated prior to the known full completion of the intended actions. No further activity should occur.

code.name: Completed
code.description: The activity described by the request has been fully performed. No further activity will occur.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: This request should never have existed and should be considered 'void'. (It is possible that real-world decisions were based on it. If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be "revoked" rather than "entered-in-error".).

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The authoring/source system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this request. Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, but the authoring/source system does not know which.

codeset.name: SubstanceForm
codeset.description: SubstanceForm

codeset.name: FHIRTypes
codeset.description: One of the types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

code.name: Base
code.description: Base Type: Base definition for all types defined in FHIR type system.

codeset.name: IdentifierUse
codeset.description: Identifies the purpose for this identifier, if known .

code.name: Usual
code.description: The identifier recommended for display and use in real-world interactions which should be used when such identifier is different from the "official" identifier.

code.name: Official
code.description: The identifier considered to be most trusted for the identification of this item. Sometimes also known as "primary" and "main". The determination of "official" is subjective and implementation guides often provide additional guidelines for use.

code.name: Secondary
code.description: An identifier that was assigned in secondary use - it serves to identify the object in a relative context, but cannot be consistently assigned to the same object again in a different context.

code.name: Old
code.description: The identifier id no longer considered valid, but may be relevant for search purposes. E.g. Changes to identifier schemes, account merges, etc.

codeset.name: RegulatedAuthorizationType
codeset.description: RegulatedAuthorizationType

codeset.name: PediatricUse
codeset.description: Suitability for age groups, in particular children.

code.name: Prepubertal children (2 years to onset of puberty)
code.description: Prepubertal children (2 years to onset of puberty)

code.name: Pubertal and postpubertal adolescents (onset of puberty to < 18 years)
code.description: Pubertal and postpubertal adolescents (onset of puberty to < 18 years)

codeset.name: DeviceUsageAdherenceReason
codeset.description: A coded concept indicating the reason for the usage of the device.

codeset.name: DeviceMetricOperationalStatus
codeset.description: Describes the operational status of the DeviceMetric.

code.name: On
code.description: The DeviceMetric is operating and will generate Observations.

code.name: Standby
code.description: The DeviceMetric is operating, but will not generate any Observations.

code.name: Entered In Error
code.description: The DeviceMetric was entered in error.

codeset.name: DeviceMetricCalibrationType
codeset.description: Describes the type of a metric calibration.

code.name: Unspecified
code.description: Metric calibration method has not been identified.

codeset.name: ConditionPreconditionType
codeset.description: Kind of precondition for the condition.

code.name: Sensitive
code.description: The observation is very sensitive for the condition, but may also indicate other conditions.

code.name: Specific
code.description: The observation is very specific for this condition, but not particularly sensitive.

codeset.name: DeviceNameType
codeset.description: The type of name the device is referred by.

code.name: Registered name
code.description: The term assigned to a medical device by the entity who registers or submits information about it to a jurisdiction or its databases. This may be considered the manufacturer assigned name (e.g., brand name assigned by the labeler or manufacturer in US, or device name assigned by the manufacturer in EU) and may also be synonymous with proprietary name or trade name of the device.

code.name: User Friendly name
code.description: The term that generically describes the device by a name as assigned by the manufacturer that is recognized by lay person. This common or generic name may be printed on the package it came in or some combination of that name with the model number, serial number, or other attribute that makes the name easy to understand for the user of that device. It is often exposed in communicating devices transport protocols. It is provided to help users identify the device when reported in discovery operations.

code.name: Patient Reported name
code.description: the term used by the patient associated with the device when describing the device, for example 'knee implant', when documented as a self-reported device.

codeset.name: InvoiceStatus
codeset.description: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of an Invoice.

code.name: draft
code.description: the invoice has been prepared but not yet finalized.

code.name: issued
code.description: the invoice has been finalized and sent to the recipient.

code.name: balanced
code.description: the invoice has been balaced / completely paid.

code.name: entered in error
code.description: the invoice was determined as entered in error before it was issued.

codeset.name: PermissionStatus
codeset.description: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of a product.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: Permission was entered in error and is not active.

codeset.name: TaskStatusReason
codeset.description: The current status reason of the task.

code.name: Missing
code.description: An item nessary for task completion is missing.

code.name: Misidentified
code.description: Something related to the task was misidentified.

code.name: Equipment-issue
code.description: A piece of equipment necessary for completion of the task is malfunctioning.

code.name: Environmental-issue
code.description: Something in the environment is preventing task completion.

code.name: Personnel-issue
code.description: Key personnel necessary for task completion are not present.

codeset.name: ConsentProvisionType
codeset.description: How a rule statement is applied, such as adding additional consent or removing consent.

code.name: Deny
code.description: Consent is denied for actions meeting these rules.

code.name: Permit
code.description: Consent is provided for actions meeting these rules.

codeset.name: LegalStatusOfSupply
codeset.description: The prescription supply types appropriate to a medicinal product

code.name: Medicinal product not subject to medical prescription
code.description: Medicinal product not subject to medical prescription

code.name: Medicinal product on medical prescription for renewable or non-renewable delivery
code.description: Medicinal product on medical prescription for renewable or non-renewable delivery

code.name: Medicinal product subject to restricted medical prescription
code.description: Medicinal product subject to restricted medical prescription

code.name: Medicinal product on medical prescription for non-renewable delivery
code.description: Medicinal product on medical prescription for non-renewable delivery

code.name: Medicinal product subject to medical prescription
code.description: Medicinal product subject to medical prescription

code.name: Medicinal product subject to special medical prescription
code.description: Medicinal product subject to special medical prescription

code.name: Medicinal product on medical prescription for renewable delivery
code.description: Medicinal product on medical prescription for renewable delivery

code.name: Medicinal product subject to special and restricted medical prescription
code.description: Medicinal product subject to special and restricted medical prescription

codeset.name: ResearchStudyClassifiers
codeset.description: Codes for use in ResearchStudy Resource. This resource (this entire set of content) is being used for active development of a ResearchStudyClassifiers CodeSystem for use for supporting multiple value sets in the FHIR ResearchStudy StructureDefinition.

code.name: FDA regulated drug
code.description: A medication regulated by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration.

code.name: FDA regulated device
code.description: A medical device regulated by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration.

code.name: MPG Paragraph 23b
code.description: Research regulated by a specific German legal requirement (Medizinproduktegesetz MPG Paragraph 23b).

code.name: IRB-exempt
code.description: Human subjects research that is excempt from oversight and monitoring by an institutional review board (IRB).

codeset.name: PaymentKindCodes
codeset.description: This value set contains codes for the type of workflow from which payments arise.

code.name: Deposit on Account
code.description: The payment or adjustment is to an indicated account not to a specific charge.

code.name: Periodic Payment
code.description: The payment is one of a set of previously agreed payments, for example in fullfilment of a payment plan.

code.name: Online Bill Payment
code.description: Payment, full or partial, of an invoice or statement provided to the payment issuer.

code.name: Kiosk Payment
code.description: Payment made at an authorized Kiosk.

codeset.name: ContractLegalState
codeset.description: This CodeSystem contains FHIR-defined contract status types. Each definition includes usage notes explaining the precedence order in contract lifecycle - i.e., while only some stages are required, the order in which they may occur is deterministic; and a map to comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes. It follows guidance about use of status codes in FHIR in the [Status Codes Grid](sc.html).

code.name: Amended
code.description: Contract is augmented with additional information to correct errors in a predecessor or to updated values in a predecessor. Usage: Contract altered within effective time. Precedence Order = 9. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: revised; replaced.

code.name: Appended
code.description: Contract is augmented with additional information that was missing from a predecessor Contract. Usage: Contract altered within effective time. Precedence Order = 9. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: updated, replaced.

code.name: Cancelled
code.description: Contract is terminated due to failure of the Grantor and/or the Grantee to fulfil one or more contract provisions. Usage: Abnormal contract termination. Precedence Order = 10. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: stopped; failed; aborted.

code.name: Disputed
code.description: Contract is pended to rectify failure of the Grantor or the Grantee to fulfil contract provision(s). E.g., Grantee complaint about Grantor's failure to comply with contract provisions. Usage: Contract pended. Precedence Order = 7. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: on hold; pended; suspended.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: Contract was created in error. No Precedence Order. Status may be applied to a Contract with any status.

code.name: Executable
code.description: Contract execution pending; may be executed when either the Grantor or the Grantee accepts the contract provisions by signing. I.e., where either the Grantor or the Grantee has signed, but not both. E.g., when an insurance applicant signs the insurers application, which references the policy.Usage: Optional first step of contract execution activity. May be skipped and contracting activity moves directly to executed state. Precedence Order = 3. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: draft; preliminary; planned; intended; active.

code.name: Executed
code.description: Contract is activated for period stipulated when both the Grantor and Grantee have signed it. Usage: Required state for normal completion of contracting activity. Precedence Order = 6. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: accepted; completed.

code.name: Negotiable
code.description: Contract execution is suspended while either or both the Grantor and Grantee propose and consider new or revised contract provisions. I.e., where the party which has not signed proposes changes to the terms. E .g., a life insurer declines to agree to the signed application because the life insurer has evidence that the applicant, who asserted to being younger or a non-smoker to get a lower premium rate - but offers instead to agree to a higher premium based on the applicants actual age or smoking status. Usage: Optional contract activity between executable and executed state. Precedence Order = 4. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: in progress; review; held.

code.name: Offered
code.description: Contract is a proposal by either the Grantor or the Grantee. Aka - A Contract hard copy or electronic 'template', 'form' or 'application'. E.g., health insurance application; consent directive form. Usage: Beginning of contract negotiation, which may have been completed as a precondition because used for 0..* contracts. Precedence Order = 2. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: requested; new.

code.name: Policy
code.description: Contract template is available as the basis for an application or offer by the Grantor or Grantee. E.g., health insurance policy; consent directive policy. Usage: Required initial contract activity, which may have been completed as a precondition because used for 0..* contracts. Precedence Order = 1. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: proposed; intended.

code.name: Rejected
code.description: Execution of the Contract is not completed because either or both the Grantor and Grantee decline to accept some or all of the contract provisions. Usage: Optional contract activity between executable and abnormal termination. Precedence Order = 5. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: stopped; cancelled.

code.name: Renewed
code.description: Beginning of a successor Contract at the termination of predecessor Contract lifecycle. Usage: Follows termination of a preceding Contract that has reached its expiry date. Precedence Order = 13. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: superseded.

code.name: Revoked
code.description: A Contract that is rescinded. May be required prior to replacing with an updated Contract. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: nullified.

code.name: Resolved
code.description: Contract is reactivated after being pended because of faulty execution. *E.g., competency of the signer(s), or where the policy is substantially different from and did not accompany the application/form so that the applicant could not compare them. Aka - ''reactivated''. Usage: Optional stage where a pended contract is reactivated. Precedence Order = 8. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: reactivated.

code.name: Terminated
code.description: Contract reaches its expiry date.It might or might not be renewed or renegotiated. Usage: Normal end of contract period. Precedence Order = 12. Comparable FHIR and v.3 status codes: Obsoleted.

codeset.name: FHIRDeviceAvailabilityStatus
codeset.description: The record status of the device.

codeset.name: BiologicallyDerivedProductDispense
codeset.description: BiologicallyDerivedProductDispense Status Codes

code.name: Preparation
code.description: The dispense process has started but not yet completed.

code.name: In Progress
code.description: The dispense process is in progress.

code.name: Allocated
code.description: The requested product has been allocated and is ready for transport.

code.name: Issued
code.description: The dispensed product has been picked up.

code.name: Unfulfilled
code.description: The dispense could not be completed.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The dispense was entered in error and therefore nullified.

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The authoring system does not know which of the status values applies for this dispense. Note: this concept is not to be used for other - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, it's just not known which one.

codeset.name: ReportRelationshipType
codeset.description: The type of relationship between reports.

code.name: Replaces
code.description: This document replaces or supersedes the target document.

code.name: Amends
code.description: This document notes corrections or changes to replace or supersede parts of the target document.

code.name: Appends
code.description: This document adds additional information to the target document.

code.name: Transforms
code.description: This document was generated by transforming the target document (eg format or language conversion).

codeset.name: EncounterLocationStatus
codeset.description: The status of the location.

code.name: Planned
code.description: The patient is planned to be moved to this location at some point in the future.

code.name: Active
code.description: The patient is currently at this location, or was between the period specified. A system may update these records when the patient leaves the location to either reserved, or completed.

code.name: Reserved
code.description: This location is held empty for this patient.

code.name: Completed
code.description: The patient was at this location during the period specified. Not to be used when the patient is currently at the location.

codeset.name: SubscriptionStatus
codeset.description: This codesystem defines a set of codes that can be used to filter Subscription triggers.

code.name: Requested
code.description: The client has requested the subscription, and the server has not yet set it up.

code.name: Error
code.description: The server has an error executing the notification.

code.name: Off
code.description: Too many errors have occurred or the subscription has expired.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: This subscription has been flagged as incorrect.

codeset.name: TestReportStatus
codeset.description: The current status of the test report.

code.name: In Progress
code.description: A test operations is currently executing.

code.name: Waiting
code.description: A test operation is waiting for an external client request.

code.name: Stopped
code.description: The test script execution was manually stopped.

code.name: Entered In Error
code.description: This test report was entered or created in error.

codeset.name: ActionRequiredBehavior
codeset.description: Defines expectations around whether an action or action group is required.

code.name: Must
code.description: An action with this behavior must be included in the actions processed by the end user; the end user SHALL NOT choose not to include this action.

code.name: Could
code.description: An action with this behavior may be included in the set of actions processed by the end user.

code.name: Must Unless Documented
code.description: An action with this behavior must be included in the set of actions processed by the end user, unless the end user provides documentation as to why the action was not included.

codeset.name: DeviceMetricCategory
codeset.description: Describes the category of the metric.

code.name: Measurement
code.description: Observations generated for this DeviceMetric are measured.

code.name: Setting
code.description: Observations generated for this DeviceMetric is a setting that will influence the behavior of the Device.

code.name: Calculation
code.description: Observations generated for this DeviceMetric are calculated.

code.name: Unspecified
code.description: The category of this DeviceMetric is unspecified.

codeset.name: MedicinalProductType
codeset.description: Overall defining type of this Medicinal Product.

codeset.name: SubstanceNameDomain
codeset.description: SubstanceNameDomain

codeset.name: ClaimProcessingOutcomeCodes
codeset.description: This value set includes Claim Processing Outcome codes.

code.name: Queued
code.description: The Claim/Pre-authorization/Pre-determination has been received but processing has not begun.

code.name: Processing Complete
code.description: The processing has completed without errors

code.name: Error
code.description: One or more errors have been detected in the Claim

code.name: Partial Processing
code.description: No errors have been detected in the Claim and some of the adjudication has been performed.

codeset.name: DeviceAssociation
codeset.description: DeviceAssociation Status Codes

code.name: Implanted
code.description: The device is implanted in the patient.

code.name: Explanted
code.description: The device is no longer implanted in the patient. Note that this is not the value to be used for devices that have never been implanted. In those cases, no value or a specific value can be used.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The association was entered in error and therefore nullified.

code.name: Attached
code.description: The device is attached to the patient but not implanted in the patient.

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The association status of the device has not been determined.

codeset.name: EnableWhenBehavior
codeset.description: Controls how multiple enableWhen values are interpreted - whether all or any must be true.

code.name: All
code.description: Enable the question when all the enableWhen criteria are satisfied.

code.name: Any
code.description: Enable the question when any of the enableWhen criteria are satisfied.

codeset.name: DeviceDispenseStatusCodes
codeset.description: DeviceDispense Status Codes

code.name: Preparation
code.description: The core event has not started yet, but some staging activities have begun (e.g. initial preparing of the device. Preparation stages may be tracked e.g. for planning, supply or billing purposes.

code.name: In Progress
code.description: The dispensed product is ready for pickup.

code.name: Cancelled
code.description: The dispensed product was not and will never be picked up by the patient.

code.name: On Hold
code.description: The dispense process is paused while waiting for an external event to reactivate the dispense. For example, new stock has arrived or the prescriber has called.

code.name: Completed
code.description: The dispensed product has been picked up.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The dispense was entered in error and therefore nullified.

code.name: Stopped
code.description: Actions implied by the dispense have been permanently halted, before all of them occurred.

code.name: Declined
code.description: The dispense was declined and not performed.

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The authoring system does not know which of the status values applies for this dispense. Note: this concept is not to be used for other - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, it's just now known which one.

codeset.name: IssueSeverity
codeset.description: How the issue affects the success of the action.

code.name: Fatal
code.description: The issue caused the action to fail and no further checking could be performed.

code.name: Error
code.description: The issue is sufficiently important to cause the action to fail.

code.name: Warning
code.description: The issue is not important enough to cause the action to fail but may cause it to be performed suboptimally or in a way that is not as desired.

code.name: Information
code.description: The issue has no relation to the degree of success of the action.

codeset.name: StructureMapGroupTypeMode
codeset.description: If this is the default rule set to apply for the source type, or this combination of types.

code.name: Default for Type Combination
code.description: This group is a default mapping group for the specified types and for the primary source type.

code.name: Default for type + combination
code.description: This group is a default mapping group for the specified types.

codeset.name: IdentityAssuranceLevel
codeset.description: The level of confidence that this link represents the same actual person, based on NIST Authentication Levels.

code.name: Level 1
code.description: Little or no confidence in the asserted identity's accuracy.

code.name: Level 2
code.description: Some confidence in the asserted identity's accuracy.

code.name: Level 3
code.description: High confidence in the asserted identity's accuracy.

code.name: Level 4
code.description: Very high confidence in the asserted identity's accuracy.

codeset.name: VisionEyes
codeset.description: A coded concept listing the eye codes.

codeset.name: ResponseType
codeset.description: The kind of response to a message.

code.name: OK
code.description: The message was accepted and processed without error.

code.name: Transient Error
code.description: Some internal unexpected error occurred - wait and try again. Note - this is usually used for things like database unavailable, which may be expected to resolve, though human intervention may be required.

code.name: Fatal Error
code.description: The message was rejected because of a problem with the content. There is no point in re-sending without change. The response narrative SHALL describe the issue.

codeset.name: FHIRDeviceCategory
codeset.description: The category of the device.

code.name: Active
code.description: Device where the operation depends on a source of energy.

code.name: communicating
code.description: Device communicates electronically to peer information systems or possibly another device.

code.name: Durable Medical Equipment
code.description: Equipment and supplies that provides therapeutic benefits to a patient.

code.name: Maintenance
code.description: Medical device intended for users in a non-medical setting.

code.name: Implantable
code.description: A device that is placed into a surgically or naturally formed cavity of the human body.

code.name: In vitro
code.description: Tests done on samples such as blood or tissue that have been taken from the human body.

code.name: Point of Care
code.description: a class of communicating devices that are used by medical providers for various purposes (e.g., monitoring, delivering or measuring).

code.name: Single Use
code.description: A device use on one individual during a single procedure.

code.name: Reusable
code.description: A device that healthcare providers can use to diagnose and treat one or more patients.

code.name: Software
code.description: A device that may include a software component or consist exclusively of software e.g. data transformer or converter, clinical support algorithms, clinical apps

codeset.name: SpecialMeasures
codeset.description: Extra measures defined for a Medicinal Product, such as requirement to conduct post-authorization studies.

codeset.name: ResearchStudyReasonStopped
codeset.description: Codes for why the study ended prematurely.

code.name: Accrual Goal Met
code.description: The study prematurely ended because the accrual goal was met.

code.name: Closed due to toxicity
code.description: The study prematurely ended due to toxicity.

code.name: Closed due to lack of study progress
code.description: The study prematurely ended due to lack of study progress.

code.name: Temporarily closed per study design
code.description: The study prematurely ended temporarily per study design.

codeset.name: SearchParamType
codeset.description: Data types allowed to be used for search parameters.

code.name: Number
code.description: Search parameter SHALL be a number (a whole number, or a decimal).

code.name: Date/DateTime
code.description: Search parameter is on a date/time. The date format is the standard XML format, though other formats may be supported.

code.name: String
code.description: Search parameter is a simple string, like a name part. Search is case-insensitive and accent-insensitive. May match just the start of a string. String parameters may contain spaces.

code.name: Token
code.description: Search parameter on a coded element or identifier. May be used to search through the text, display, code and code/codesystem (for codes) and label, system and key (for identifier). Its value is either a string or a pair of namespace and value, separated by a "|", depending on the modifier used.

code.name: Reference
code.description: A reference to another resource (Reference or canonical).

code.name: Composite
code.description: A composite search parameter that combines a search on two values together.

code.name: Quantity
code.description: A search parameter that searches on a quantity.

code.name: URI
code.description: A search parameter that searches on a URI (RFC 3986).

code.name: Special
code.description: Special logic applies to this parameter per the description of the search parameter.

codeset.name: AppointmentStatus
codeset.description: The free/busy status of an appointment.

code.name: Proposed
code.description: None of the participant(s) have finalized their acceptance of the appointment request, and the start/end time might not be set yet.

code.name: Pending
code.description: Some or all of the participant(s) have not finalized their acceptance of the appointment request.

code.name: Booked
code.description: All participant(s) have been considered and the appointment is confirmed to go ahead at the date/times specified.

code.name: Arrived
code.description: The patient/patients has/have arrived and is/are waiting to be seen.

code.name: Fulfilled
code.description: The planning stages of the appointment are now complete, the encounter resource will exist and will track further status changes. Note that an encounter may exist before the appointment status is fulfilled for many reasons.

code.name: No Show
code.description: Some or all of the participant(s) have not/did not appear for the appointment (usually the patient).

code.name: Entered in error
code.description: This instance should not have been part of this patient's medical record.

code.name: Checked In
code.description: When checked in, all pre-encounter administrative work is complete, and the encounter may begin. (where multiple patients are involved, they are all present).

code.name: Waitlisted
code.description: The appointment has been placed on a waitlist, to be scheduled/confirmed in the future when a slot/service is available. A specific time might or might not be pre-allocated.

codeset.name: EpisodeOfCareStatus
codeset.description: The status of the episode of care.

code.name: Planned
code.description: This episode of care is planned to start at the date specified in the period.start. During this status, an organization may perform assessments to determine if the patient is eligible to receive services, or be organizing to make resources available to provide care services.

code.name: Waitlist
code.description: This episode has been placed on a waitlist, pending the episode being made active (or cancelled).

code.name: Active
code.description: This episode of care is current.

code.name: On Hold
code.description: This episode of care is on hold; the organization has limited responsibility for the patient (such as while on respite).

code.name: Finished
code.description: This episode of care is finished and the organization is not expecting to be providing further care to the patient. Can also be known as "closed", "completed" or other similar terms.

code.name: Cancelled
code.description: The episode of care was cancelled, or withdrawn from service, often selected during the planned stage as the patient may have gone elsewhere, or the circumstances have changed and the organization is unable to provide the care. It indicates that services terminated outside the planned/expected workflow.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: This instance should not have been part of this patient's medical record.

codeset.name: ProductCrossReferenceType
codeset.description: Relationship to another Medicinal Product.

codeset.name: RelatedArtifactType
codeset.description: The type of relationship to the related artifact.

code.name: Documentation
code.description: Additional documentation for the knowledge resource. This would include additional instructions on usage as well as additional information on clinical context or appropriateness.

code.name: Justification
code.description: The target artifact is a summary of the justification for the knowledge resource including supporting evidence, relevant guidelines, or other clinically important information. This information is intended to provide a way to make the justification for the knowledge resource available to the consumer of interventions or results produced by the knowledge resource.

code.name: Citation
code.description: Bibliographic citation for papers, references, or other relevant material for the knowledge resource. This is intended to allow for citation of related material, but that was not necessarily specifically prepared in connection with this knowledge resource.

code.name: Predecessor
code.description: The previous version of the knowledge artifact, used to establish an ordering of versions of an artifact, independent of the status of each version.

code.name: Successor
code.description: The subsequent version of the knowledge artfact, used to establish an ordering of versions of an artifact, independent of the status of each version.

code.name: Derived From
code.description: This artifact is derived from the target artifact. This is intended to capture the relationship in which a particular knowledge resource is based on the content of another artifact, but is modified to capture either a different set of overall requirements, or a more specific set of requirements such as those involved in a particular institution or clinical setting. The artifact may be derived from one or more target artifacts.

code.name: Depends On
code.description: This artifact depends on the target artifact. There is a requirement to use the target artifact in the creation or interpretation of this artifact.

code.name: Composed Of
