code.description: This artifact is composed of the target artifact. This artifact is constructed with the target artifact as a component. The target artifact is a part of this artifact. (A dataset is composed of data.).

code.name: Part Of
code.description: This artifact is a part of the target artifact. The target artifact is composed of this artifact (and possibly other artifacts).

code.name: Amends
code.description: This artifact amends or changes the target artifact. This artifact adds additional information that is functionally expected to replace information in the target artifact. This artifact replaces a part but not all of the target artifact.

code.name: Amended With
code.description: This artifact is amended with or changed by the target artifact. There is information in this artifact that should be functionally replaced with information in the target artifact.

code.name: Appends
code.description: This artifact adds additional information to the target artifact. The additional information does not replace or change information in the target artifact.

code.name: Appended With
code.description: This artifact has additional information in the target artifact.

code.name: Cites
code.description: This artifact cites the target artifact. This may be a bibliographic citation for papers, references, or other relevant material for the knowledge resource. This is intended to allow for citation of related material, but that was not necessarily specifically prepared in connection with this knowledge resource.

code.name: Cited By
code.description: This artifact is cited by the target artifact.

code.name: Is Comment On
code.description: This artifact contains comments about the target artifact.

code.name: Has Comment In
code.description: This artifact has comments about it in the target artifact. The type of comments may be expressed in the targetClassifier element such as reply, review, editorial, feedback, solicited, unsolicited, structured, unstructured.

code.name: Contains
code.description: This artifact is a container in which the target artifact is contained. A container is a data structure whose instances are collections of other objects. (A database contains the dataset.).

code.name: Contained In
code.description: This artifact is contained in the target artifact. The target artifact is a data structure whose instances are collections of other objects.

code.name: Corrects
code.description: This artifact identifies errors and replacement content for the target artifact.

code.name: Correction In
code.description: This artifact has corrections to it in the target artifact. The target artifact identifies errors and replacement content for this artifact.

code.name: Replaces
code.description: This artifact replaces or supersedes the target artifact. The target artifact may be considered deprecated.

code.name: Replaced With
code.description: This artifact is replaced with or superseded by the target artifact. This artifact may be considered deprecated.

code.name: Retracts
code.description: This artifact retracts the target artifact. The content that was published in the target artifact should be considered removed from publication and should no longer be considered part of the public record.

code.name: Retracted By
code.description: This artifact is retracted by the target artifact. The content that was published in this artifact should be considered removed from publication and should no longer be considered part of the public record.

code.name: Signs
code.description: This artifact is a signature of the target artifact.

code.name: Similar To
code.description: This artifact has characteristics in common with the target artifact. This relationship may be used in systems to "deduplicate" knowledge artifacts from different sources, or in systems to show "similar items".

code.name: Supports
code.description: This artifact provides additional support for the target artifact. The type of support is not documentation as it does not describe, explain, or instruct regarding the target artifact.

code.name: Supported With
code.description: The target artifact contains additional information related to the knowledge artifact but is not documentation as the additional information does not describe, explain, or instruct regarding the knowledge artifact content or application. This could include an associated dataset.

code.name: Transforms
code.description: This artifact was generated by transforming the target artifact (e.g., format or language conversion). This is intended to capture the relationship in which a particular knowledge resource is based on the content of another artifact, but changes are only apparent in form and there is only one target artifact with the "transforms" relationship type.

code.name: Transformed Into
code.description: This artifact was transformed into the target artifact (e.g., by format or language conversion).

code.name: Transformed With
code.description: This artifact was generated by transforming a related artifact (e.g., format or language conversion), noted separately with the "transforms" relationship type. This transformation used the target artifact to inform the transformation. The target artifact may be a conversion script or translation guide.

code.name: Documents
code.description: This artifact provides additional documentation for the target artifact. This could include additional instructions on usage as well as additional information on clinical context or appropriateness.

code.name: Specification Of
code.description: The target artifact is a precise description of a concept in this artifact. This may be used when the RelatedArtifact datatype is used in elements contained in this artifact.

code.name: Created With
code.description: This artifact was created with the target artifact. The target artifact is a tool or support material used in the creation of the artifact, and not content that the artifact was derived from.

code.name: Cite As
code.description: The related artifact is the citation for this artifact.

codeset.name: MeasureSupplementalDataExample
codeset.description: Identifier supplemental data in a population for measuring purposes.

codeset.name: ImagingSelectionStatus
codeset.description: The status of the ImagingSelection.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The imaging selection has been withdrawn following a release. This electronic record should never have existed, though it is possible that real-world decisions were based on it. (If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be "cancelled" rather than "entered-in-error".).

code.name: Unknown
code.description: The system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this request. Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, it's just not known which one.

codeset.name: GoalLifecycleStatus
codeset.description: Codes that reflect the current state of a goal and whether the goal is still being targeted.

code.name: Proposed
code.description: A goal is proposed for this patient.

code.name: Planned
code.description: A goal is planned for this patient.

code.name: Accepted
code.description: A proposed goal was accepted or acknowledged.

code.name: Entered in Error
code.description: The goal was entered in error and voided.

codeset.name: FHIRDeviceSpecializationCategory
codeset.description: The kind of standards used by the device.

codeset.name: TestScriptScopeConformanceType
codeset.description: The expectation of whether the test must pass for the system to be considered conformant with the artifact.

code.name: Required
code.description: All tests are expected to pass. Warning statuses are permitted. This is the default value.

code.name: Optional
code.description: All tests are expected to pass but non-pass statuses may be allowed.

code.name: Strict
code.description: All tests are expected to pass. Warnings are treated as a failure.

codeset.name: ParticipationStatus
codeset.description: The Participation status of an appointment.

code.name: Accepted
code.description: The participant has accepted the appointment.

code.name: Declined
code.description: The participant has declined the appointment and will not participate in the appointment.

code.name: Tentative
code.description: The participant has tentatively accepted the appointment. This could be automatically created by a system and requires further processing before it can be accepted. There is no commitment that attendance will occur.

code.name: Needs Action
code.description: The participant needs to indicate if they accept the appointment by changing this status to one of the other statuses.

codeset.name: EventTiming
codeset.description: Real-world event relating to the schedule.

code.name: Morning
code.description: Event occurs during the morning. The exact time is unspecified and established by institution convention or patient interpretation.

code.name: Early Morning
code.description: Event occurs during the early morning. The exact time is unspecified and established by institution convention or patient interpretation.

code.name: Late Morning
code.description: Event occurs during the late morning. The exact time is unspecified and established by institution convention or patient interpretation.

code.name: Noon
code.description: Event occurs around 12:00pm. The exact time is unspecified and established by institution convention or patient interpretation.

code.name: Afternoon
code.description: Event occurs during the afternoon. The exact time is unspecified and established by institution convention or patient interpretation.

code.name: Early Afternoon
code.description: Event occurs during the early afternoon. The exact time is unspecified and established by institution convention or patient interpretation.

code.name: Late Afternoon
code.description: Event occurs during the late afternoon. The exact time is unspecified and established by institution convention or patient interpretation.

code.name: Evening
code.description: Event occurs during the evening. The exact time is unspecified and established by institution convention or patient interpretation.

code.name: Early Evening
code.description: Event occurs during the early evening. The exact time is unspecified and established by institution convention or patient interpretation.

code.name: Late Evening
code.description: Event occurs during the late evening. The exact time is unspecified and established by institution convention or patient interpretation.

code.name: Night
code.description: Event occurs during the night. The exact time is unspecified and established by institution convention or patient interpretation.

code.name: After Sleep
code.description: Event occurs [offset] after subject goes to sleep. The exact time is unspecified and established by institution convention or patient interpretation.

code.name: Immediate
code.description: Event occurs a single time (with no repetitions) as soon as possible after the scheduled or actual start of the overall event.

codeset.name: ClinicalUseDefinitionType
codeset.description: Overall defining type of this clinical use definition.

code.name: Indication
code.description: A reason for giving the medication.

code.name: Contraindication
code.description: A reason for not giving the medication.

code.name: Interaction
code.description: Interactions between the medication and other substances.

code.name: Undesirable Effect
code.description: Side effects or adverse effects associated with the medication.

code.name: Warning
code.description: A general warning or issue that is not specifically one of the other types.

codeset.name: BiologicallyDerivedProductDispenseOriginRelationship
codeset.description: Biologically derived product dispense - origin relationship

code.name: Autologous
code.description: The product was pre-donated by the recipient

code.name: Related
code.description: The product is from a blood relation of the recipient

code.name: Directed
code.description: The donor has been specifically selected to provide product for the recipient

code.name: Allogeneic
code.description: The donor and the recipient are unrelated

code.name: Xenogenic
code.description: The product is from a different species to the recipient

codeset.name: ObservationRangeCategory
codeset.description: Codes identifying the category of observation range.

code.name: reference range
code.description: Reference (Normal) Range for Ordinal and Continuous Observations.

code.name: critical range
code.description: Critical Range for Ordinal and Continuous Observations. Results outside this range are critical.

code.name: absolute range
code.description: Absolute Range for Ordinal and Continuous Observations. Results outside this range are not possible.

codeset.name: MessageSignificanceCategory
codeset.description: The impact of the content of a message.

code.name: Consequence
code.description: The message represents/requests a change that should not be processed more than once; e.g., making a booking for an appointment.

code.name: Currency
code.description: The message represents a response to query for current information. Retrospective processing is wrong and/or wasteful.

code.name: Notification
code.description: The content is not necessarily intended to be current, and it can be reprocessed, though there may be version issues created by processing old notifications.

codeset.name: ProvenanceEntityRole
codeset.description: How an entity was used in an activity.

code.name: Revision
code.description: An entity that is used by the activity to produce a new version of that entity.

code.name: Quotation
code.description: An entity that is copied in full or part by an agent that is not the author of the entity.

code.name: Source
code.description: An entity that is used as input to the activity that produced the target.

code.name: Instantiates
code.description: The record resulting from this event adheres to the protocol, guideline, order set or other definition represented by this entity.

code.name: Removal
code.description: An entity that is removed from accessibility, usually through the DELETE operator.

codeset.name: DocumentRelationshipType
codeset.description: The type of relationship between documents.

code.name: Replaces
code.description: This document logically replaces or supersedes the target document.

code.name: Transforms
code.description: This document was generated by transforming the target document (e.g. format or language conversion).

code.name: Signs
code.description: This document is a signature of the target document.

code.name: Appends
code.description: This document adds additional information to the target document.

code.name: Incorporates
code.description: This document embeds the content from the (source) target document.

code.name: Summarizes
code.description: This document summarizes the content from the (source) target document.

codeset.name: SearchProcessingModeType
codeset.description: How a search parameter relates to the set of elements returned by evaluating its expression query.

code.name: Normal
code.description: The search parameter is derived directly from the selected nodes based on the type definitions.

code.name: Phonetic
code.description: The search parameter is derived by a phonetic transform from the selected nodes.

code.name: Other
code.description: The interpretation of the xpath statement is unknown (and can't be automated).

codeset.name: SubstanceGrade
codeset.description: SubstanceGrade

code.name: USP/NF United States Pharmacopeia (USP) and the National Formulary (NF)
code.description: USP/NF United States Pharmacopeia (USP) and the National Formulary (NF)

codeset.name: MimeType
codeset.description: IANA MIME types (placeholder - use IANA registry)

codeset.name: Language
codeset.description: BCP 47 language codes (placeholder)

codeset.name: CurrencyCode
codeset.description: ISO 4217 currency codes (placeholder)

codeset.name: Units
codeset.description: UCUM units (placeholder)

codeset.name: ParameterUse
codeset.description: Operation parameter use

codeset.name: ExpressionLanguage
codeset.description: Expression languages

codeset.name: RelatedArtifactPublicationStatus
codeset.description: Publication status of related artifacts
